Computers do math . Electrical impulses can be switched on and off . Two states . A computer has , at its core , a cluster of transistors . Transistors are , in essence , little switches that allow current to flow through , or stop it from flowing through . If you place a whole bunch of transistors in rows , you can use them to do basic mathematics . When one turns on , another turns off ( for example ) . The more transistors you have , the more math you can do in a short time . So , a computer has millions of these little transistors , and the electrical current cycles rapidly through them . Computer programs give instructions about which transistors

get turned on and off to do the math necessary to get the desired result . Storing computer programs is typically done by writing those instructions magnetically on to metal platters ( the Hard Disk ) . The platters spin rapidly , and a set of little magnets on the read / write head of the drive are activated by the magnetic polarity of the platter beneath them . They send electrical impulses to a set of transistors that is set up in such a way as to temporarily store the instructions on their way to the main processing unit ( RAM ) . The instructions in the RAM are sent to the main processor , which does the main calculations , which , in turn , opens

the Hard Disk , etc . ) The details are sometimes enormously complicated , but at its root , the computer is just doing some math . It opens the flow of electricity from one part of the machine to another , at the right times . If you 'd like to know more about computers , and how they work , I recommend having a look at [ This video series ] ( URL_0 ) . The lecturer is very good , and he very clearly explains the fundamentals of computer science and computer programming .

And that

new API is Vulkan . Vulkan for example supports multicore CPUs ( basically non - existent back then , standard today ) , unlike OpenGL . It also tries to minimize the responsibility of graphic drivers , because drivers often greatly affected the performance of the program and the game developers did n't know which drivers their program would run on , they might have been buggy and it was all very messy - with Vulkan developers will have to write a little more code , but they 'll be able to optimize it very well , which means better and more stable performance for us users . Composers and works include Barbara Kolb , Pauline Oliveros ' Sound Patterns for chorus (1961), Norma Beecroft 's From Dreams of Brass for chorus (1963–1964), and Nancy Van de Vate .A very early example is the opening of Jean-Féry Rebel 's ballet Les Elémens (1737–38), where chaos is represented by a gradually cumulating orchestral cluster of all seven notes of the D minor scale (Henck 2004, pp. 52–54).A later example is the third movement of Ruth Crawford Seeger 's String Quartet 1931 (Nonesuch H-71280) while more recently Phill Niblock 's multiple drone based music serves as an example.The use of "chords approaching timbres" begins with Debussy and Edgard Varèse often carefully scored individual instrumental parts so that they would fuse into one ensemble timbre or sound mass (Erickson 1975, pp. 18 and 21).Other examples include European "textural" compositions of the fifties and sixties such as Krzysztof Penderecki 's Threnody to the Victims of Hiroshima (1959) and György Ligeti 's works featuring micropolyphony in works like Atmosphères (1961) and his Requiem (1963-65).Other composers with works using this technique include Henryk Górecki , Karel Husa , Witold Lutosławski , Kazimierz Serocki , and Steven Stucky .Sound mass techniques also appear in the music of George Crumb (Anon. n.d.).

An abstract data type (ADT) is a type of data structure that is defined by its behavior (what it can do) rather than its implementation (how it does it). This means that an ADT specifies a set of operations that can be performed on data, but it does not specify how those operations should be implemented.For example, a stack is an ADT because it is defined by the operations "push" (add an element to the top of the stack), "pop" (remove the element from the top of the stack), and "top" (return the element at the top of the stack). It doesn't matter how these operations are implemented (e.g. using an array or a linked list), as long as they behave according to the rules of the stack ADT.On the other hand, a statement like "int x = 5" is not an ADT because it does not specify any operations. It is simply a variable that holds a value.A linked list is not an ADT because it is a specific implementation of a data structure. It is a sequence of nodes, each containing a value and a reference to the next node in the sequence. A linked list is not defined by its behavior (the set of operations it supports), but rather by its implementation (how it stores and accesses data).

To summarize quickly the explainations given by mathen and Charko : mathen explained how , at a low level , voltages can be used to make the circuit behave in a logical manner . Charko then explained how electrical energy can be transformed into mechanical energy ( in his example , torque ) . Now , to answer you question on how electronics make things move a " certain way ( ie robots ) " , I will explain how feedback control of dynamic systems work . URL_1 In the above picture , taken from the wikipedia page on [ Control Theory ] ( URL_0 ) , you can see the basic setup of your robot 's brain . To most easily explain this , I will start

at the bottom box in the picture : the Sensor . The sensor is like the robot 's eyes . This is how the system interfaces with the world around it . This could be a velocity sensor ( in the case of your car 's cruise control ) , it could be a thermometer ( in the case of your home 's air conditioning system ) , or even cameras for your robot 's eyes . Now , sticking to the robot example , it gathers information about its environment through the sensors . That information is the " Measured output " . This information is then combined with the Reference . The reference is what the robot wants to do . So for example let 's

say that the robot wants to shoot a fleeing human with a lazer . The fleeing human is the reference at which the robot wants to point . It uses it sensor ( or eyes ) to look to see where it is pointing . It determines that it is looking 3 feet to the left of the human ( the reference ) . So ! Taking the Reference and subracting the " Measured output " of 3 ft , you get your " Measured Error " . The robot is now aware that it is aiming 3 ft to the left . So it takes that information and sends it to the Controller ( or brain ) . This is where the voltage manipulation described by Charko

happens . The input of " 3 ft to the left " does n't mean much to the robot 's cold - unfeeling brain , so that information has to be transformed into an input it can understand . The controller does this and outputs the " System input " . This " System input " is then sent to the body of the robot , ( aka the System ) . The system is the electrical motor that mathen described . This is where a certain amount of voltage ( electrical energy ) that was sent by the Controller is transformed into a torque ( mechanical energy ) to turn the robot . The turning of the robot is the " System output " . At this

the samples made by the sensor are very rapid , allowing the controller and system to make quick adjustments where the robot can quickly snap to what it is aiming for and actually track the reference . This is how missile tracking and interception is possible . By rapid sampling of the missile 's position , the system is able to constantly make adjustments and continue pointing at it .

Fire wiggles because the heat from the fire causes the air around it to rise, which can cause the flame to move and appear to wiggle.Imagine that you are holding a lit candle. The heat from the flame makes the air around it warmer, which means that it becomes less dense than the air around it. This causes the warmer, less dense air to rise, just like how a balloon filled with hot air will rise when you let it go.As the warm air rises, it creates a draft that can cause the flame to move and wiggle. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a measure of the average change in the prices paid by consumers for a basket of goods and services. It is reported by the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), which is a division of the Department of Labor. The BLS collects and analyzes data on the prices of a representative basket of goods and services that are consumed by households in the United States, and publishes the results in the form of the CPI. The CPI is released on a monthly basis and is widely used as a measure of inflation in the United States.

I 'm assuming this us a UK based question ? The word pub comes from the name public house . It originally meant a building that was open to the public to come and relax , socialise and most importantly consume alcohol . Noawadays the name public house means a building owned by a brewery , run by a tenant , for the sale and consumption of alcohol . In UK law you must have a license to sell alcohol , a license to have it consumed on your ( public commercial ) premises and another personal license to facilitate this sale . A pub in the UK is owned by the brewery . They have a tenant that buys the business within the building and then gets

to keep the profit made from the sale in exchange for meeting the brewery 's minimum sale requirements . They must buy beer from the brewery and if they do n't buy enough they will be kicked out and another tenant will be found . This leads to , in more recent times , more pubs shutting down due to the aggressive nature of breweries . However you can also have free houses ( woohoo ) which are owned and run by the same person . They are open to buy beer from wholesale shops at a much cheaper price than would otherwise be available through the brewery . This means freehouses generally are cheaper than pubs and can have a different clientele . A bar is normally

In 2001, Argentina experienced a severe economic crisis that had a significant impact on the banking sector. During the crisis, many banks in Argentina were forced to close or were nationalized by the government. The crisis was triggered by a number of factors, including a large budget deficit, high levels of public debt, and a lack of competitiveness in the global economy. The Argentine government implemented a series of measures to try to address the crisis, including devaluing the currency, defaulting on its debt, and implementing capital controls. The crisis had a severe impact on the economy, leading to high levels of inflation, unemployment, and poverty. It also had a major impact on the banking sector, with many banks being forced to close or being nationalized by the government.

There are a few reasons why people eat raw fish, but not raw meat from other animals. One reason is that raw fish is often prepared in a way that is safe to eat, while raw meat from other animals can contain harmful bacteria or parasites that can make you sick. Fish that is used for raw dishes like sushi and sashimi is carefully handled and prepared to reduce the risk of contamination. Another reason is that some types of fish, like tuna and salmon, contain a naturally occurring enzyme that helps to break down the proteins in the fish. This makes it easier for the body to digest the raw fish and reduces the risk of food poisoning. Finally, some people simply prefer the taste and texture of raw fish to that of raw meat from other animals. It is a matter of personal preference. It's important to note that not all fish is safe to eat raw, and it is important to handle and prepare raw fish properly to reduce the risk of food poisoning.

There are several reasons why people are interested in going to Mars. One reason is scientific curiosity. Scientists want to learn more about Mars and see if it is possible for humans to live there. They are also interested in finding out if there is or was life on Mars. Another reason is that Mars is a possible backup plan for humanity. If something were to happen to Earth, like a catastrophic event, it would be good to have another place where people could live. Mars is one of the most promising places in our solar system for this because it has a lot of resources, like water and a thin atmosphere. Finally, going to Mars is also an engineering challenge. It takes a lot of technology and planning to get people and equipment to Mars and keep them alive once they are there. By working on this challenge, we can learn more about how to explore space and develop new technologies that can be used for other purposes here on Earth.

It's completely normal to want to use a blanket, even when it's hot outside. The reason for this is that blankets serve a few different purposes that can make us feel more comfortable and help us sleep better. One reason people use blankets when it's hot is because they can help regulate our body temperature. Even though it may be hot outside, the air inside your bedroom may not be as warm, which can make you feel cold. A blanket can help keep you warm and comfortable by trapping your body heat and keeping it close to you. Another reason people use blankets is for comfort. Wrapping yourself in a cozy blanket can make you feel more secure and relaxed, which can help you fall asleep more easily. Finally, some people use blankets for the simple reason that they've always used them and have become accustomed to having one. It may just be a habit or part of their bedtime routine that helps them feel more at ease and ready for sleep. In short, there are many reasons why people use blankets, even when it's hot outside. Whether it's to regulate their body temperature, feel more comfortable, or simply out of habit, blankets can be an important part of getting a good night's sleep.

Fractional reserve banking and Ponzi schemes are two different financial systems or practices that have some similarities, but are also quite different in important ways.Fractional reserve banking is a system that banks use to manage deposits and loans. Under this system, banks are required to keep a certain percentage of their deposits on hand as reserves, while they can lend out the rest of the money to borrowers. For example, if a bank has $100 in deposits and is required to keep 10% as reserves, it can lend out $90 to borrowers. The idea behind fractional reserve banking is to allow banks to make more loans and earn more money from interest, while still being able to meet the demands of depositors who might want to withdraw their

the operator usually ends up disappearing with the remaining funds.So, while both fractional reserve banking and Ponzi schemes involve the use of other people's money to generate profits, fractional reserve banking is a legitimate and regulated financial system that is intended to be transparent and fair, while Ponzi schemes are fraudulent and deceitful, and are designed to take advantage of people's trust and greed.

President Obama cannot nominate himself to become a Supreme Court Justice. The President has the power to nominate people to be Justices of the Supreme Court, but the President cannot be a Justice at the same time. The President is not eligible to be a Justice because the Constitution says that Justices must be appointed by the President and confirmed by the Senate, and the President is not allowed to appoint themselves.After a President's term in office is over, they can do whatever they want, including becoming a Supreme Court Justice if they are nominated and confirmed by the Senate. However, it is very unusual for a former President to become a Justice because they are usually quite old by the time they leave office and Justices are expected to serve for many years.

Calculating and adjusting cost basis accurately is a daunting task, but there is a (paid) online tool, NetBasis, which will automatically calculate and adjust your cost basis.  It is used by brokerage firms and Fortune 500 companies and is available to the public.  Go to netbasis.com. All you need are the purchase and sale dates and shares of the stock or mutual fund and the system has the rest of the information, such as corporate actions (splits, spin-offs, etc), pricing, and dividends and it also will apply the appropriate IRS rules for inherited and gifted shares. The regulation also gives investors the option to choose calculation methods. Take a piece of paper , and hold it out horizontal a few feet above the ground . Now let it go . Where did it land ? Now try it again , trying to hold the piece of paper exactly the same way you did before . Did it land in the same place ? Chaos theory is the name for that . It means that the way the paper falls depends so sensitively to where and how you hold the paper , that you could hold it almost exactly the same place as you held it before , and it will still land in different places every time .

The price of a particular stock is determined by the supply and demand for that stock in the market. When more people want to buy a stock than sell it, the price will tend to rise. I see what you're asking, but there's actually a B in the musical alphabet! It's the second letter, coming after A. There's no E-flat either, but there is an E and a B-flat.In music, we use letters to name different notes. These notes are played on different instruments, like pianos, guitars, or violins, and they can also be sung. Just like in the alphabet, each letter has a specific sound. In music, these sounds are called pitches.So, when we talk about notes, we use the letters A, B, C, D, E, F, and G. These letters are used to represent different pitches. Sometimes, we add a symbol called a "sharp" or a "flat" after a letter to change the pitch a little bit. For example, if we add a sharp symbol to the letter A, it becomes A-sharp, which is a higher pitch than just A. If we add a flat symbol to the letter B, it becomes B-flat, which is a lower pitch than B.I hope that helps! Do you have any other questions about music?

Most modern money is what we call ' fiat currency ' , essentially , that piece of paper that says US$ 5 on it is worth US$ 5 because the US government says it does . If the US government collapses tomorrow , it 's no longer around to say that the US$ 5 note is anything more than a green piece of paper . The idea is that gold is a ' stable ' currency . If the US government collapsed tomorrow , you would n't be able to use US currency to pay for goods and services . However ! You could still trade for them in gold . The people trying to sell you gold are trying to trade on fear . They 're trying to trade on the -- frankly unfounded -- fear that regular currency will become ' worthless ' , and that you 're better off with the gold . Which -- of course -- you spotted the issue : If I 'm better off with the gold than the regular currency , why are you accepting regular currency for the gold ? You 're absolutely right . They 're just hoping that you 're too scared that the government will somehow fail to think about that too much .

In general, brokers execute trades on behalf of their clients. When a client places an order to buy or sell a security, the broker will typically send the order to an exchange or to other market makers in the over-the-counter (OTC) market to be filled. The broker's role is to facilitate the trade by connecting buyers and sellers and to execute the trade on the client's behalf.There are different ways that brokers can execute trades, depending on the type of asset being traded and the specific broker. Some brokers may execute trades directly on an exchange, while others may use alternative methods such as electronic communication networks (ECNs) or dark pools.In some cases, a broker may choose to execute a trade internally, without sending it to an exchange or other market maker. This is known as "internalization," and it can occur when the broker has a counterparty in-house who is willing to take the other side of the trade. Internalization can be beneficial for the broker, as it can reduce the cost of executing the trade and can allow the broker to earn a spread on the transaction. However, internalization may not always be in the best interests of the client, as it may result in the client paying a higher price for the security than they would have if the trade had been executed on an exchange.

Net neutrality is the idea that internet service providers (ISPs) should treat all internet traffic equally, without giving any special privileges to certain websites or services. It means that ISPs should not be able to block or slow down access to any particular websites or services, or charge more for access to some websites or services.Imagine that the internet is like a highway, and the websites and services you use online are like cars driving on that highway. Net neutrality is like a rule that says all the cars on the highway must be able to drive at the same speed, no matter where they're going or who is driving them.The idea behind net neutrality is to make sure that the internet is a level playing field, where everyone has equal access to the same information and opportunities. Without net neutrality, ISPs could potentially block or slow down access to certain websites or services, or charge more for access to those websites or services. This could limit people's ability to access the full range of information and opportunities available online, and give an unfair advantage to websites or services that can afford to pay for better access.

Mount Rushmore is a national memorial located in the Black Hills region of South Dakota, United States. The memorial features the carved faces of four former US presidents: George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Theodore Roosevelt, and Abraham Lincoln. The faces of the presidents are carved into the side of a mountain and are about 60 feet (18 meters) tall.The site is a popular tourist destination and attracts more than two million visitors each year. Visitors can take a guided tour of the site, which includes a walk up the Presidential Trail to the base of the mountain, where they can see the carved faces up close. The site also has an amphitheater, a museum, and a gift shop.The weather at Mount Rushmore can vary widely, with temperatures ranging from below freezing in the winter to over 100 degrees Fahrenheit (38 degrees Celsius) in the summer. It is generally cooler and less humid at Mount Rushmore than in many other parts of the United States.Overall, visiting Mount Rushmore is a unique and memorable experience. The carved faces of the presidents are a testament to the country's history and the site is a tribute to the ideals of democracy and freedom.

Vanguard's Target Retirement Funds are designed to be all-in-one investment solutions for investors who are saving for retirement and do not want to spend time actively managing their investments. These funds use a mix of stocks, bonds, and other investments to provide a diversified portfolio that is appropriate for a particular time horizon.The asset allocation for each Target Retirement Fund is based on the expected retirement date of the fund. For example, the Vanguard Target Retirement 2065 Fund is designed for investors who are planning to retire in 2065, and has a higher allocation to stocks (which have the potential for higher returns over the long term) because there is more time for the market to potentially recover from any short-term downturns. As the fund approaches the target retirement date, the allocation to stocks is gradually reduced and the allocation to bonds and other income-generating investments is increased to provide more stability and preserve capital.Vanguard uses a combination of in-house and external expertise to determine the optimal asset allocation for each Target Retirement Fund. This includes analyzing market conditions, economic trends, and other factors that may impact the performance of different asset classes. The asset allocation is periodically reviewed and may be adjusted as needed to ensure that it remains appropriate for the fund's target retirement date.

Muscular knots, also known as muscle spasms or muscle trigger points, are small, tight areas of muscle that can be painful when touched. They often feel like lumps or knots in the muscle.Muscular knots can form for a variety of reasons, including overuse, injury, or tension. For example, if you use a muscle too much or in an awkward position, it can become sore and develop knots. Similarly, if you have an injury or strain a muscle, knots can form as a result of the muscle healing. Stress and tension can also cause knots to form in the muscles.To prevent muscular knots, it's important to take care of your muscles by stretching regularly, getting enough rest, and using good posture when you're sitting or standing. You can also try massaging the knots to help them relax, or using heat or cold to reduce inflammation and soreness.It's not accurate to say that knots are made of blood, but good blood circulation can help to prevent knots from forming. When blood flows smoothly through the body, it brings oxygen and nutrients to the muscles, which can help them stay healthy and strong. If you have poor circulation, your muscles may be more prone to knots and other problems.In summary, muscular knots are small, tight areas of muscle that can be painful when touched. They can be caused by overuse, injury, tension, and other factors. To prevent knots, it's important to take care of your muscles and maintain good blood circulation.

A " loaded " term is a term that means one thing on its face , but carries a hidden meaning , because of how it is used . The term is " loaded " with extra meaning . For example , you could consider " madrasa " a loaded word . Its literal translation is " school " . That 's it . It just means school . However , because of its association with the Arabic language , and Islam , and the association that those things have with terrorism , " madrasa " is used to mean something like " Islamic indoctrination center . " Since " madrasa " is now loaded with this extra meaning , people think it 's a big deal that Obama attended a " madrasa " , when all it really means is that he attended a school .

Our nervous system is continuously bombarded with information that it uses to control the many processes that keep us alive and healthy and out of danger . For example , it receives information from sensors that measure oxygen and carbon dioxide to regulate breathing . The brain also handles sensory information so that we can see , hear , feel , taste , and smell and are able to respond to these sensations . When we sleep , the brain continues to process vital information ( for example , breathing is still controlled ) , but it ignores the information from the sensory organs . We are disengaged from our sensations . The information is still bombarding the nervous system , but brain centers actively filter the information . Essentially , the brain filters it out as it 's a function of the body .

Nails are small, hard, curved plates made of a protein called keratin that are found on the top of the fingers and toes of most mammals, including humans. They are made by cells in the skin called nail matrix cells, which produce keratin to form the nail.Nails serve several important purposes. They help protect the fingertips, which are sensitive and vulnerable to injury. They also provide grip and assist with tasks such as picking up small objects or typing on a keyboard.In animals, nails can also serve as weapons for defense or hunting. For example, a cat's claws can help it catch and kill prey, and a dog's nails can help it dig or defend itself.As for why humans don't have an external shell on their heads, it's because our heads are already protected by a hard structure called the skull. The skull is made up of several bones that fit together to form a protective casing around the brain and other important organs in the head. The skull also has openings, such as the nose and mouth, that allow us to breathe, see, hear, and communicate.

The winter solstice, which is the shortest day of the year in the Northern Hemisphere, does not always coincide with the start of a new year because different cultures and civilizations have chosen to start their calendars on different days for various reasons.For example, the ancient Roman calendar, which was used for many centuries, started its new year on the first of March, which was the beginning of the spring season. This was because the Romans believed that spring was a time of renewal and new beginnings.Other cultures and civilizations have chosen to start their calendars on different days as well. For example, the ancient Egyptians started their new year on the day when the Nile River began to flood, which was around the summer solstice. The Chinese calendar starts its new year on the second new moon after the winter solstice.So, while it might seem logical to start a new year on the shortest day of the year, different cultures and civilizations have chosen to start their calendars on different days based on their own traditions and beliefs.

When a drink tastes "dry," it means that it has little or no sweetness and a high level of acidity. This can be the case for both white wines and beers. The term "dry" is often used to describe white wines, particularly those made from certain types of grapes like Sauvignon Blanc or Chardonnay. These wines have a crisp, refreshing taste and tend to be less sweet than other white wines, like Moscato or Riesling. The term "dry" can also be used to describe certain types of beer, particularly those that are made with a higher proportion of hops. Hops are a type of flower that is used to give beer its bitter taste and aroma. Beers that are high in hops and low in malt (which adds sweetness to the beer) are often described as "dry," because they have a less sweet and more bitter flavor profile. The Hubble Space Telescope is able to take high resolution photos of nebulae and other celestial objects because it is equipped with powerful lenses and cameras that can capture a lot of detail. These lenses and cameras are able to gather light from distant objects, such as nebulae, and focus it onto a detector, which converts the light into an image.The images that the Hubble Space Telescope takes are often very detailed because the telescope is located above the Earth's atmosphere, which can cause distortion and blurriness in images taken from the ground. Without the interference of the Earth's atmosphere, the Hubble Space Telescope is able to take clear, crisp images of distant objects.Additionally, the Hubble Space Telescope has been designed to be able to focus on very small areas of the sky at a time, allowing it to capture highly detailed images of specific objects or regions. This is especially useful for studying nebulae, which are often vast clouds of gas and dust that can be difficult to see in great detail from the ground.

Moisturizer is just a veneer of oil you put on your skin so that your natural oil does n't rub off faster than it 's generated ( or to quickly replace oil you have just removed somehow ) . Theoretically you could use a stick of butter for the same effect . The three main ingredients in basically every moisturizer are : * Petroleum Jelly - Oily , waxy substance , the main workhorse * Glycerol - Hygroscopic liquid ( i.e. it sucks in moisture from the air and your skin , making it feel wet ) * Stearic acid - Surfactant / softening agent : gets the first two ingredients to spread and stick onto your skin Pretty much everything else is either substituting some of the Petroleum Jelly for a different type of oil that does exactly the same thing , fragrance , or naturopathic placebos like essence of gypsy wings .

I think most of the confusion on this topic comes from a mis - interpretation of that " conservation of momentum " thing we 're all told about in early science classes . If you conflate " speed " with " momentum " then going faster than the wind sounds a bit like a perpetual motion machine . The answer is that " speed " is not conserved , but " energy " is . Wind energy is n't that strong in a small area ( like your hand ) , but it 's huge when you catch a lot of it with a big sail . The bigger the sail , the more energy you can catch . The amount of energy you can catch can be

a lot greater than what it takes to move the boat the same speed . All of this is hopefully a " duh " so far . The key thing to remember is that energy comes from a DIFFERENCE between two areas . Heat flows from hot to cold , transferring energy . Voltage flows from high to ground , transferring energy . Wind is flowing across much slower ( or even still ) water . As long as something is moving relative to something else , and you build the right contraption in between the two , you can harness that energy . If the boat was , on the other hand , a leaf floating in the sky , then it 'd have no " difference

that with a bit of leverage at an angle , instead of electricity and propellers . As a last example , think of a sailplane ... a glider . It can fly forward far , far faster than the speed of the updrafts that ultimately give it its energy . If gravity was n't pulling it back down however , ( giving it a difference in speed / direction compared to the wind ) it would never be able to go faster than a balloon ( or a leaf . )

The speed of light is the fastest that any kind of information can travel. It is about 186,282 miles per second, or about 300 million meters per second. This is so fast that it is almost impossible to even imagine. If you were to try to drive a car at the speed of light, it would take you over 4 years to go just one light-year, which is the distance that light travels in one year. Now, when we talk about the speed of the Internet, we are talking about how fast information can travel from one computer to another through the Internet. The speed of the Internet depends on a lot of different factors, like the type of connection you have (such as a broadband or a fiber optic connection), how far the information has to travel, and how many other people are using the Internet at the same time. In general, the speed of the Internet is much slower than the speed of light. For example, if you have a broadband connection, the speed of your Internet might be around 25 megabits per second, which is much slower than the speed of light. However, even though the Internet is slower than the speed of light, it is still very fast and can transmit a lot of information very quickly.

A hangover is the result of drinking too much alcohol, which can cause a number of unpleasant symptoms such as a headache, nausea, and feeling tired. Alcohol is a diuretic, which means that it increases the amount of urine that your body produces. When you drink alcohol, your body tends to lose more fluids than it takes in, which can lead to dehydration.Even though beer contains water, it also contains alcohol, which can cause your body to lose more fluids than it takes in. So, even though beer may help to rehydrate your body to some extent, the overall effect of the alcohol can still lead to dehydration.It's important to remember to drink plenty of water while you're drinking alcohol, and to continue to drink water after you're finished drinking to help prevent dehydration. It's also a good idea to drink alcohol in moderation, as excessive alcohol consumption can lead to a range of negative health effects.

There are a variety of reasons why some Americans might not enroll in the Affordable Care Act, also known as Obamacare. There is nothing inherently "wrong" with taking money from your own business, as long as it is done in a legal and ethical manner. However, there are several things to consider when taking money out of your business.First, it's important to make sure that the business has enough cash on hand to meet its financial obligations, including paying bills, employees, and other expenses. If the business is not generating enough revenue to cover these expenses, taking money out of the business could put it in financial jeopardy.Second, you should consider the tax implications of taking money out of the business. Depending on the legal structure of your business and the amount of money you take out, you may be subject to taxes on the income you receive.Finally, you should consider the long-term sustainability of the business. If you are consistently taking large amounts of money out of the business, it may not have enough resources to invest in growth or expansion, which could limit its potential for success in the future.Overall, it's important to carefully consider the financial health of your business and the potential consequences of taking money out of it before making any decisions.

They will usually wear protective gear, such as gloves and masks, to prevent any diseases from spreading. The dead pigeon will then be collected and disposed of in a way that is safe for the environment and for people. It's a natural part of life, and it's important to respect and take care of all living things, even when they are no longer alive.

Communism is an economic and political ideology that seeks to create a classless, stateless society in which all property and wealth are owned and controlled collectively. In theory, this would allow for the fair distribution of resources and eliminate social and economic inequality. However, there are a number of reasons why communism has not been widely adopted and is often viewed negatively. One reason is that it can be difficult to implement in practice. For example, it can be challenging to determine how to fairly distribute resources, and some people may be more motivated to work hard if they have the opportunity to earn more money or own property. Another reason is that some communist regimes have been associated with authoritarianism and human rights abuses. In these cases, the government may use its power to suppress dissent and control the population, leading to widespread suffering and oppression. In short, while the idea of communism may be appealing in theory, it has often been difficult to put into practice in a way that is fair and just.

To answer the rest of the questions you asked , OP , there are many factors that affect the " sound " of a given dialect . Aside from the social factors that NobblyNobody and I mentioned , there are a number of linguistic factors as well . Most are rather complicated , but suffice it to say that languages are complex systems , and ( sound ) changes are often driven by how easily sounds are produced or perceived , or by relations among groups of sounds . For example , " th " sounds are relatively uncommon in the world 's languages ( and many English dialects do n't have them ) because they 're rather difficult to hear in noise . ' Chain shifts '

are an example of another , slightly more complicated process . Because vowels are naturally spread out ( in terms of where in the mouth they 're produced ) in a kind of equilibrium , sometimes relatively small changes can cause chain reactions leading to a reorganization of a language / dialect 's entire vowel system . A famous example of this is [ the Great Vowel Shift ] ( URL_0 ) , which happened during the Middle English period and is responsible for many of the odd spellings still found in English . Another , more current example , is what 's called the Northern Cities Chain Shift . This is the vowel shift that 's responsible for the distinctive sound that speakers from Chicago , Detroit

, etc . , have ( think about stereotypical pronunciations of words like " cat " and " Chicago " ) . Think of these chain shifts like big games of musical chairs , but with vowels . Here 's [ a YouTube clip from " Do You Speak American ? " with Bill Labov ] ( URL_1 ) , the founder of modern sociolinguistics , talking about the NCCS . As for American dialects being a " combination " of the dialects spoken by the original immigrants , in some sense , yes they are . Many features can still be traced back to founding populations , the Scots - Irish and people from southern England . This is called ' the Founder Effect ' . There

common features found among the founding groups . The linguistic lowest common denominator . This is why English in the western half of the US is not as distinct as English on the east coast of the US , or in England ( although it also has to due with the fact that the west coast was settled much more recently than the east ) .

This wo n't be an explanation , rather some information to explain some concepts and clear up misinformation . The threshold dose for lsd is around 20ug , micro dosing means taking an extremely low dose that is around but ABOVE the threshold dose - 25 - 35ug typically . As the name implies , the threshold dose is the dose required for any noticeable effects to be felt . The benefits and effects from such a low and barely threshold(1 ) dose can range from person to person , but typically will be no more than extremely minor cognitive ones at best(2 ) , or minor effects such as slight tingling sensation or very slightly more energy akin to what a coffee may do to some people

- lsd is a stimulant after all . The more typical effects of lsd do n't start to appear until you get to the 75 - 115ug~ dose range . Something to note is that there have been no studies on doses at such a small , barely threshold dose , and that any supposed effects or benefits will be purely anecdotal . That said , however , some of the major discoveries claimed to have been discovered thanks to the help of lsd have been typically low doses ( 50 - 75ug ) , but this is still a massively different experience to the typical micro dose . ( 1 ) Some things to note : lsd degrades rapidly with exposure to air and light , if

not stored properly a 100ug tab can be anywhere from 90ug down to 70 - 60ug , so 1/4 of a 100ug tab might be far below the 20ug threshold - a placebo effect at best . The laying of the tab may be fairly inconsistent also , resulting in 1/4 of a tab having very little or lots of the actual dose on the tab . Whether a 100ug tab , or even a 35ug tab , has the advertized amount of lsd on the tab depends on how the tab is manufactured and stored and how it is delivered , there are some harm reduction laboratories that can detect what substance is on a sample and how much of that substance exists - however this is

and the cognitive effects , such as lack of ability to concentrate properly , or enhanced mood , can be felt from a low as 50ug , meaning a typical micro dose , assuming not a higher dose than expected , will be so thoroughly below the typical effects of even a fairly low 50ug dose that you will , absolutely , not be tripping .

meet girls ( or sororities for meeting boys ) by holding parties , date nights and other functions . Finally , because the drinking age in America is 21 , most students ca n't go to bars for the first few years of college , so fraternities also function as social hubs in the same way that bars / clubs do once you reach the legal drinking age . Having said that , there are arguably a number of downsides to fraternities . They can perpetuate social stratification because current members of the fraternity pick the incoming members . Scales were built using the Mathematics of Ancient Greek Mathematician Pythagoras , who discovered the harmonic mean of 2 numbers . That enabled him to perform the first standardized study in the field of the theory of music . ( If I remember correctly , he used an exatonic scale ( meaning 6 notes where used ) ) . You do n't have to stick to a particular scale during a song . Lot 's of songs change scales , both in modern and in older western music . A scale basically divides a range of frequences with a certain way . That division is asymmetric most of the time ( for most historical scales ) , and that asymmetry is used to provide the " flavor " of sounds . Scales differ as to how many parts that division has , and how each one performs the division ( they are all asymetrical but which spaces are closer and which further apart ? ) . A random sequence of keys ca n't be a scale , per se , but you can apply that frequency division in a periodic manner to create one . It will sound awefull though , but you can write consistent music on it , if you are versed in music theory

Daylight Saving Time (DST) is a system that adjusts the time on clocks during certain parts of the year so that there is more daylight in the evenings. This is often done by moving the clock ahead by one hour for a certain period of time, and then moving it back again by one hour to return to standard time.In Queensland, Australia, Daylight Saving Time is not used because the state government decided that it was not beneficial for the state. There are a few reasons for this decision. One reason is that Queensland is located in the northern part of Australia and is closer to the equator, so the amount of daylight varies less throughout the year compared to states that are farther from the equator. This means that there is not as much of a need to adjust the clocks to make better use of the daylight.Another reason is that some people in Queensland felt that Daylight Saving Time caused problems, such as people feeling more tired because of the change in the clock, or businesses having to change their operating hours.So, to answer your question, Queensland does not use Daylight Saving Time because the state government decided that it was not necessary or beneficial for the state.

A cutter is a person who cuts materials such as fabric, paper, or metal into specific shapes or sizes using a variety of tools and techniques.In the context of fabric and clothing manufacturing, a cutter is responsible for marking and cutting fabric to the correct size and shape based on a pattern or design. This may involve using a variety of cutting tools such as scissors, rotary cutters, or laser cutters. The cutter must ensure that the cuts are precise and that the fabric is cut in a way that maximizes the use of the material and minimizes waste.In other contexts, a cutter may be responsible for cutting other materials such as paper, metal, or plastic using tools such as guillotines, shears, or saws.Overall, the main responsibilities of a cutter are to accurately measure and mark materials, select and use appropriate cutting tools, and make precise cuts in order to produce the desired finished product.

Developing a video game for multiple platforms typically involves creating a version of the game that can run on each platform, which often involves some amount of customization to account for differences between the platforms. For example, a game developer might create a version of the game that runs on Xbox One, a version that runs on PlayStation 4, and a version that runs on PC. Each of these versions may need to be tailored to work well on the specific hardware and software of each platform. To create these different versions, game developers might use specialized software tools and programming languages that are designed to work on specific platforms. For example, a game developer might use a tool like Unity or Unreal Engine to create a version of the game that can run on multiple platforms, including PC, console, and mobile devices. Overall, developing a game for multiple platforms can be a complex and time-consuming process, as it involves creating and testing multiple versions of the game to ensure that they all work well on the different platforms. However, it can also be a rewarding process, as it allows the game to reach a wider audience and potentially be played by more people.

A theater in the context of World War II refers to a geographical region in which military operations were conducted during the war. The war was fought in several theaters, including Europe, Africa, the Middle East, Southeast Asia, and the Pacific. Each theater had its own unique challenges and characteristics, and the war was fought differently in each one.The European Theater of Operations (ETO) was the main theater of the war in Europe, and it included the Western Front in France and Belgium, as well as the Eastern Front in Eastern Europe. The African Theater of Operations (ATO) was the theater of the war in Africa and the Middle East, and it included campaigns in North Africa, the Eastern Mediterranean, and the Middle East. The Southeast Asia Theater of Operations (SEATO) was the theater of the war in Southeast Asia, and it included campaigns in Burma, Malaya, and the Dutch East Indies. The Pacific Theater of Operations (PTO) was the theater of the war in the Pacific, and it included campaigns in the Pacific Islands, China, and Japan.

Soft computing is a field of study that focuses on the design and development of computational systems and algorithms that are inspired by, or mimic, human cognition, perception, and behavior. These systems and algorithms are often referred to as "soft" because they are designed to be flexible, adaptable, and tolerant of uncertainty, imprecision, and partial truth.Soft computing approaches differ from traditional "hard" computing approaches in that they are designed to handle complex, ill-defined, or poorly understood problems, as well as to process data that is noisy, incomplete, or uncertain. Soft computing techniques include a wide range of methods, including artificial neural networks, fuzzy logic, evolutionary algorithms, probabilistic reasoning, and machine learning, among others.Soft computing techniques are widely used in a variety of applications, including pattern recognition, data mining, image processing, natural language processing, and control systems, among others. They are particularly useful for tasks that involve dealing with incomplete or ambiguous information, or that require the ability to adapt and learn from experience.

Banks and pyramid schemes are very different things. Here's how they differ:Banks:A bank is a financial institution that provides a range of services, including accepting deposits, making loans, and allowing customers to open checking and savings accounts.Banks make money by charging interest on loans and by earning interest on the money they hold in deposits.Banks are regulated by government agencies to ensure that they operate safely and fairly.Pyramid schemes:A pyramid scheme is a fraudulent investment scheme that relies on constantly recruiting new members to bring in money.In a pyramid scheme, each person involved recruits others to join. Money made by the new members funnels up to the higher members.The scheme relies on an endless supply of new members to bring in money. Eventually, the scheme collapses because there aren't enough new members to support the pyramid.Pyramid schemes are illegal in many countries because they are inherently fraudulent and almost always result in losses for the majority of participants.I hope that helps clarify the difference between banks and pyramid schemes. Electrons and protons are both types of subatomic particles, and they have properties that allow them to behave in certain ways. Electrons are much lighter than protons and are also negatively charged, while protons are much heavier and are positively charged. When two particles have opposite charges, they tend to attract each other, while particles with the same charge tend to repel each other. Because the electrons in an atom are negatively charged and the protons in the nucleus are positively charged, the electrons are attracted to the nucleus. However, electrons don't just fall into the nucleus because they also have a property called "spin," which makes them behave like tiny magnets. This spin causes the electrons to sort of "orbit" around the nucleus, rather than falling into it. As for the protons in the nucleus, they do have a tendency to repel each other because they have the same positive charge. However, they are also held together by a force called the "strong nuclear force," which is a very strong force that acts between the protons and helps to keep them together in the nucleus. Despite these challenges, the Qing dynasty left a lasting legacy on Chinese culture and history.

Shows like South Park and Family Guy are able to make fun of famous people because of something called "parody." Parody is when something, like a TV show or a movie, imitates or makes fun of something else, like a person or an event, in a way that is meant to be humorous or satirical. In the United States, there is a law called the "fair use" doctrine that allows people to use someone else's work, like a person's name or likeness, for certain purposes, like parody, without getting permission from the person or paying them. This is because the law recognizes that parody can be a form of free speech and can be an important way for people to express their opinions or make social commentary. So, when South Park or Family Guy make fun of famous people, they are using their names and likenesses in a way that is meant to be humorous and is protected by the fair use doctrine. It's important to note, however, that the fair use doctrine is a complex legal concept and there are limits to what it allows. Whether something is considered fair use or not depends on a variety of factors, including the purpose of the use, the nature of the original work, and the amount of the original work that is used.

China owns a significant portion of the American national debt because the United States government has borrowed money from foreign countries, including China, to finance its operations and pay for various programs. When a country borrows money from another country, it agrees to pay back the borrowed amount plus interest at a later date. There are a few reasons why the United States has borrowed money from China. One reason is that the United States has run large budget deficits in recent years, meaning that the government has spent more money than it has taken in through taxes and other revenues. To make up the difference, the government has borrowed money from foreign countries, including China. Another reason is that the Chinese government has been willing to lend money to the United States at low interest rates, which makes it attractive for the United States to borrow from them. It is not necessarily strategic for China to own a large portion of the American national debt. Instead, it is a financial investment for China, which is looking to earn a return on its money by lending it to the United States and receiving interest payments in return.

Purchasing a property that already has tenants can be somewhat of a risk, as the financial stability and behavior of the tenants may affect the success of the investment. You may want to conduct thorough research on the financial stability and behavior of the tenants, as well as the overall condition of the property. It may also be helpful to seek the advice of a real estate professional or financial advisor.

A share buyback, also known as a stock buyback, is a way for a company to repurchase its own outstanding shares from the open market. The company typically does this to reduce the number of shares outstanding, which can increase the value of the remaining shares by lowering the supply. Share buybacks can also be used to return capital to shareholders, or to make strategic acquisitions.There are several ways that a company can execute a share buyback. One method is through an open market purchase, where the company buys back its shares on the open market through a broker. Another method is through a tender offer, where the company offers to buy back a specific number of shares at a predetermined price.Share buybacks can be funded through the company's cash reserves, or through the issuance of debt or additional shares. The specific details of a share buyback, including the number of shares to be repurchased, the price, and the funding source, are usually announced in a press release or Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) filing.It's important to note that share buybacks are not the same as dividend payments, which are a distribution of the company's profits to shareholders. Share buybacks can have a similar effect of returning capital to shareholders, but they do not involve the distribution of the company's profits.

Graduated brake lights are a good idea in theory, but they have not been widely adopted in production vehicles. One reason is that they would require additional wiring and bulbs, which would increase the complexity and cost of the vehicle. Another reason is that graduated brake lights might not provide a clear enough signal to other drivers about the severity of the braking. It can be difficult to accurately convey a gradient of braking intensity using just a few lights, and other drivers may not know how to interpret the different levels of lighting.Instead, most vehicles use a single brake light that is illuminated when the brakes are applied. This provides a clear and easy-to-understand signal to other drivers that the vehicle is slowing down. The brightness of the brake light can also be adjusted depending on the amount of braking force being applied, so there is some degree of graduated lighting already built into the system.

Porn sites, like any other websites, may display ads to generate revenue. These ads may come from various advertising networks, which act as intermediaries between websites and advertisers. Some of these advertisers may use tactics that are not ethical or legal, such as creating pop-up ads that contain malicious software (also known as malware) or attempting to trick people into clicking on ads by using misleading or deceptive tactics. Porn sites may not always be aware that the ads they are displaying contain malware or are using deceptive tactics. This can happen because the advertisers may use techniques to disguise their ads or because the porn sites may not have sufficient safeguards in place to detect and prevent the display of malicious or deceptive ads. It is not legal for companies to pay porn sites to display ads that contain malware or use deceptive tactics. The broad explanation is something like this : There 's a function , which we 'll call Zeta because that sounds cool and futuristic , that we first define by talking about sums . In particular , sums of things like 1/1 + 1/2 + 1/4 + 1/8 + 1/16 + 1/32 + ... , where each thing we 're adding is half as big as the last one . For a sum like this , we can say what happens if we add an infinite number of things - we get 2 ! Plain old boring 2 . So Zeta takes a number in , and puts a number out . And when we treat it like a sum of things , it take a positive number

in and puts a real number out . But this does n't work if we put a negative number in . If we try to put -1 into Zeta , it gives us 1 - 1 + 1 - 1 + 1 - ... , which never really decides what it wants to be . Is it 1 or is it 0 ? Luckily , there happens to be another way to define Zeta , so that it behaves like its normal summy self for positive numbers , but then continues to work smoothly into the negative numbers . And if we do that , and put -1 into Zeta , then we get 1/2 . So does that mean 1 - 1 + 1 - 1 +

1 - ... = 1/2 ? Well , yes and no . Under most normal arithmetic , we 're ok with saying that 1 + 1/2 + 1/4 + 1/8 + 1/16 + ... = 2 , just as we 're happy saying 0.999 ... = 9/10 + 9/100 + 9/1000 + ... = 1 - and trust me , mathematicians are fine with setting up the rules in such a way that the symbol " = " , when applied to infinite sums like this , really does give these answers . But under those rules , 1 - 1 + 1 - 1 + ... does n't equal anything . If it ca n't make up its mind what it wants to equal , we wo

n't force it to equal anything . However , we can use a different arithmetic , one that works just the same if we 're adding up finite numbers of things , and that still says that 1 + 1/2 + 1/4 + 1/8 + ... = 2 , but that says that where the old arithmetic * does n't * work , we 'll apply some jiggery - pokery to * make * it work , and that lines up with how our second version of Zeta behaves . So in a sense , we 're redefining what " = " means under this slightly different arithmetic ( computer programmers might say we 're " overloading " the equals operator ) . And this is fine ,

) . So is this new arithmetic useful ? Well , it 's not as useful as the old arithmetic for a bunch of reasons , but it does have its applications . However , it 's also a bit unethical to just go around stating " 1 - 1 + 1 - ... = 1/2 " and " 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + ... = -1/12 " without adding the disclaimer that you 're working in a different kind of arithmetic .

You will need to pay self-employment taxes on the income, which includes both the employer and employee portion of social security and Medicare taxes.If you are operating as a corporation or a limited liability company (LLC), your online store's income will be taxed at the business level. The business will need to pay taxes on its profits, and you will need to pay taxes on any salary or dividends you receive from the business.It is important to keep accurate records of your online store's income and expenses in order to properly report your financial gains and calculate your tax liability. A source of confusion might be that irony has several meanings . * * Situational irony * * seems to be the most commonly described here , and is also the most modern meaning . It 's when there 's a notable opposition between an outcome and expectations . Dktmom provided some good examples . * * Verbal irony * * is a more classic form of irony . It 's when the meaning of what you say is the opposite of the meaning of the words you used . Example : " what a nice weather " when it 's raining . * * Dramatic irony * * is another form of classic irony . It only occurs in stories ( movie , book , play ... ) It 's when the audience knows something that the characters do n't . Example : in Romeo and Juliet , Juliet takes a potion to simulate death , but Romeo does n't know it and really thinks her dead .

As a freelance worker in Germany, you may be required to pay Value Added Tax (VAT) on the services you provide to your clients. Whether or not you need to pay VAT depends on several factors, including the nature of your business, the location of your clients, and the type of services you provide.If you are providing services to clients within Germany, you will generally be required to charge VAT at the standard rate of 19%. If you are providing services to clients outside of Germany, you may be able to benefit from the "small business rule," which allows businesses with annual revenues of up to EUR 17,500 to be exempt from VAT. However, this exemption only applies if you are providing services to clients in other EU countries. If you are providing services to clients outside of the EU, you will generally be required to charge VAT at the standard rate.It is important to note that the rules surrounding VAT for freelance workers can be complex, and it is always a good idea to seek the advice of a tax professional if you have any questions or concerns.

A nuclear power plant works by using heat from nuclear reactions to create steam, which then turns a turbine to generate electricity.Inside the core of the nuclear power plant, there are special fuel rods made of a material called uranium. Uranium is a naturally-occurring element that can be mined from the earth. When the uranium is bombarded with neutrons, it splits into smaller atoms and releases a lot of energy in the form of heat.To control the nuclear reactions and make sure they don't get too hot, the power plant has a system of control rods. These rods are made of a material that absorbs neutrons, which helps to slow down the reactions. The control rods can be moved up and down to adjust the amount of neutrons being absorbed, which helps to control the heat being produced.To add fuel to the power plant, the operators will carefully load new fuel rods into the core. It's generally not a good idea to reboil water because it can lead to the concentration of contaminants. When water is boiled, impurities and minerals are left behind in the pan, and if the water is boiled again, these substances can become more concentrated. In addition, reboiling water can also cause the water to taste flat or stale. So it's best to just use fresh water if you need to boil it.

John Steinbeck was an American writer who is best known for his novels about the social and economic issues facing the working class in the United States during the 1930s and 1940s. He is most famous for his works "The Grapes of Wrath" and "Of Mice and Men." These novels, along with many of his other works, are characterized by their realistic portrayal of the lives of ordinary people and the struggles they faced during this period of economic hardship and social unrest. Steinbeck's writing was known for its strong social and political themes, as well as its compassionate portrayal of the human condition. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1962 for his contributions to literature.

A submarine doesn't float to the surface of the ocean because it is heavier than the water it is in. When something is placed in a liquid, it will either sink or float, depending on its density compared to the liquid. If an object is more dense than the liquid it is placed in, it will sink. If it is less dense, it will float.A submarine is made of metal, which is denser than water, so it sinks to the bottom of the ocean. The submarine is able to stay underwater by using buoyancy, which is the upward force that is exerted on an object when it is in a liquid. The submarine has ballast tanks that can be filled with water or emptied of water to help it control its buoyancy. When the tanks are filled with water, the submarine becomes denser and sinks. When the tanks are emptied of water, the submarine becomes less dense and floats upward.The pressure inside a submarine is not directly related to its buoyancy. The pressure inside a submarine is increased to help it withstand the pressure of the water outside, which gets stronger the deeper the submarine goes. The pressure inside a submarine is regulated by special pumps and valves, and the submarine has thick walls to keep the water out.

Computers speak in Binary , meaning 1 's and 0 's . I know that may seem tricky to imagine ... A language with two letters ? Try to imagine morse code . Without this language , computers ca n't work ! Anyways ... ! Imagine the machines we 're using to speak Binary are sand castles . The sand castles used to be HUGE . But over time we learned how to make the sand castles smaller and smaller to do the same job of speaking 1 's and 0 's . We 're making them so small that they are getting into problems . Like crumbling a little . That 's no good . So we want to make SMALLER sand castles . Well we need

to use something other than sand . Wait .. other than sand ? But we 've always used sand , right ? Well now we ca n't . We need something that can speak Binary but be really small . Now imagine your friend Adam has a string with a ball on the end , and he 's spinning it in circles around his body real fast . That little ball is moving everywhere in an orbit around him . Now turn off the lights in the room . Do n't worry , Adam will keep swinging the ball . Take your flashlight and shine it somewhere near Adam . The only time you can see the ball is when it swings into the light . Otherwise you

know it 's somewhere else . Great ! There are now only two things you know : When the ball is in the ONE PLACE with your light beam shining , or ANYWHERE ELSE THAT IS IN DARKNESS . The ball is either in the light , or not ! Does that sound familiar ? We can use that for 1 's and 0 's . The ball in the light can be 1 , and the ball not in the light can be 0 . Now we can use Adam to speak binary ! ( Obscene oversimplification ) Why is Adam so special ? Well Adam is tiny . Not tiny like you 're baby brother . VERY TINY . How tiny ? Pick up a grain

of sand . That sand is made up of a lot of Adams . How many ? About 30 thousand billion billion Adams . THATS A LOT of people ! All spinning a ball around them with a string . And each one of them able to speak Binary . This is so small ! ! ! ! And because they can speak Binary , we can use Adam to make computers . VERY small computers . The smaller the computer , the more computers you can put into things . Like how you can bring more toys with you on vaccation if they are smaller . More toys is ALWAYS better ! You could have a toy in your pocket ! A toy in your earing !

> How did it start ? Why did it start ? Like other Middle Eastern nations that were part of the Arab Spring , there was an undercurrent of discontent in the Syrian population that finally reached a boiling point . It started with relatively peaceful protests that the Assad regime responded to with violence . That escalated things really quickly and many members of the Syrian military defected to join opposition groups . Commence a civil war . > Who are the main combatants ? You have : * Assad 's regime which is backed by the Syrian military in addition to some other militia and paramilitary groups . * The opposition , comprised primarily of the Free Syrian Army and the Islamic Front . * The

Islamic State . * The Kurds , backed by the Peshmerga / YPG . * The Coalition Joint Task Force , comprised of Western nations who are more opposed to the Islamic State then they are allied with any other group . * Russia , Iran and Hezbollah who support the Assad regime . > Why is it so devastating ? Because it 's been a bloody stalemate reminiscent of World War I. Going back to who the combatants are , it 's a total clusterfuck of entangling alliances . The United States supports the Kurds , but the Kurds are at odds with Turkey ( a NATO ally ) and elements of the opposition groups . Russia supports Assad and is opposed to the Islamic State *

and * the opposition groups , while the United States is opposed to Assad and the Islamic State but not the opposition groups . The Assad regime has essentially decided it would rather let the opposition groups fight it out with the Islamic State , and many argue that Assad has given indirect support to IS . New York City is located in the Eastern Time Zone (ET) of the United States. The Eastern Time Zone is five hours behind Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). This means that when it is noon (12:00) in UTC, it is 7:00 AM in New York City.\r\rDuring Daylight Saving Time, the Eastern Time Zone observes Eastern Daylight Time (EDT), which is four hours behind UTC. This means that when it is noon (12:00) in UTC, it is 8:00 AM in New York City. Daylight Saving Time begins on the second Sunday of March and ends on the first Sunday of November in the United States.

Amusement rides have height restrictions for safety reasons. Different rides have different requirements, but the main reason for these restrictions is to make sure that people are tall enough to safely ride the ride. For example, if a ride involves going very fast or has lots of twists and turns, it might be unsafe for someone who is not tall enough to ride it. In these cases, the ride might have a minimum height requirement to make sure that riders are tall enough to hold on properly and stay safe during the ride. On the other hand, some rides might have a maximum height restriction to make sure that riders fit safely in the seats or restraints on the ride. If someone is too tall, they might not fit properly, which could be dangerous. Overall, the height restrictions on amusement rides are in place to keep people safe and make sure that they can enjoy the ride without any accidents or injuries.

A put option is a financial contract that gives the holder the right, but not the obligation, to sell a certain quantity of an underlying asset at a predetermined price (also known as the strike price) on or before a specified date (the expiration date). The person who sells the put option is known as the writer.The buyer of a put option is betting that the price of the underlying asset will decrease below the strike price before the expiration date. If the price does indeed fall below the strike price, the buyer can exercise the option, sell the underlying asset at the strike price, and make a profit.For example, suppose you buy a put option on a stock with a strike price of $50 and an expiration

put option.The writer of the put option, on the other hand, is betting that the price of the underlying asset will stay above the strike price. If the price stays above the strike price, the option will expire worthless and the writer will keep the premium as profit. If the price falls below the strike price, however, the writer will have to buy the underlying asset at the higher market price and sell it to the option holder at the lower strike price, resulting in a loss.

Cells have to follow certain rules in a healthy individual . For example , a particular cell may : 1 ) only survive if surrounded by cells like it , 2 ) only survive if one side is facing one environment , and another side is facing another environment , 3 ) obey an intercell signal to terminate , and 4 ) not try to increase the amount of blood supply in the area ( i.e. vascularize ) . To be a " cancer " a particular cell may need to break all of those rules ( and others ) . A benign tumor may just break , e.g. , # 2 on that list . So it will grow without regard to its orientation , but it will not grow away from its tissue type and it will obey signals from the body to terminate . Cancers often result from an accumulation of mutations . Each mutation may disable a different rule . When enough rules are broken , the cell can grow in parts of the body it has no business growing , and it can threaten the person 's life . A benign tumor is one that can either be on the path to danger ( precancerous ) or unlikely to ever become dangerous .

Vaccines are n't neccessarily made from dead bacteria . Some preparations are made from live attenuated microorganisms , meaning , weakened . And some are artificially made to mimic a microorganism 's characteristics . When we get our shots , the weakened or dead microorganism is introduced in our body . This triggers our immune system to fight these intruders ( antigens ) , the result of this battle is the increase of antibodies , our body 's own defense so that if we are exposed to these harmful microorganisms again , the antibodies would be able to recognize the intruders and defeat them once more . Ergo , immunity .

Frying ice cream is a fun and tasty way to enjoy this dessert! Here's how you can do it at home:First, you'll need some ice cream that's been frozen for at least a few hours. You can use any flavor you like, but vanilla works well.Next, you'll need some ingredients to make a batter for the ice cream. You'll need some flour, sugar, eggs, and milk. Mix these together in a bowl until they're well combined.Take the ice cream out of the freezer and shape it into balls using a spoon or an ice cream scoop. You can make the balls as big or small as you like.Dip the ice cream balls into the batter, making sure to coat them completely.Heat some oil in a deep fryer or a large pan until it's hot. You can test the temperature by sprinkling a little bit of flour into the oil. If it sizzles, the oil is ready.Carefully place the battered ice cream balls into the hot oil and fry them for about 1-2 minutes, or until the batter is golden brown.Remove the fried ice cream from the oil using a slotted spoon or tongs and place it on a plate lined with paper towels to soak up any excess oil.Serve the fried ice cream immediately, while it's still warm and gooey! You can top it with your favorite toppings, like sprinkles, chocolate sauce, or caramel.I hope that helps! Enjoy your fried ice cream!

It is difficult to determine the prevalence of "pass-through" health insurance as the term is not a commonly used one in the health insurance industry. However, I can provide some information about types of health insurance plans that may involve "pass-through" features.One type of health insurance plan that may involve "pass-through" features is a high deductible health plan (HDHP). HDHPs typically have lower premiums than other types of health insurance plans, but require individuals to pay a higher deductible before their insurance coverage begins. Some HDHPs may offer a "pass-through" feature, also known as a health savings account (HSA), which allows individuals to set aside pre-tax money to pay for out-of-pocket medical expenses.Another type of health insurance plan that may involve "pass-through" features is a self-insured plan. In a self-insured plan, an employer or other group pays for its employees' medical claims directly, rather than purchasing a traditional insurance policy. The employer or group may hire a third party administrator (TPA) to handle the claims process and may also purchase stop-loss insurance to protect against unusually high claims. The TPA may act as a "pass-through" entity, collecting premiums from the employer or group and paying claims on behalf of the covered individuals.It is worth noting that the term "pass-through" may be used in different contexts and may have different meanings depending on the specific circumstances. It is always a good idea to clarify the specific meaning of the term in the context in which it is being used.

The jury selection process, also known as "voir dire," is used to choose a group of people to serve as jurors in a particular trial. The purpose of the jury selection process is to ensure that the jury is fair and impartial, and to remove any individuals who might be biased or unable to make an objective decision based on the evidence presented in court.The idea behind a jury is that it is made up of a group of ordinary people who will listen to the evidence presented in court and make a decision based on what they have heard. This process is important because it helps to ensure that the justice system is fair and unbiased.While it is true that experienced lawyers and prosecutors may try to influence the selection of jurors during the voir dire process, this is not always the case. In some situations, the selection process may be random, with jurors being chosen from a pool of eligible individuals who have been selected by the court. In other cases, the selection process may be more structured, with lawyers and prosecutors using questions and other methods to determine whether or not a particular juror is suitable for the case.Overall, the jury selection process is designed to ensure that the jury is fair and unbiased, and to ensure that the justice system is as fair and unbiased as possible.
