You suppose the first ' question ' in our chain : how does the air get there in the first place . The usual candidates are medical procedures , though major injury to a blood vessel can have the same impact . Obviously , an injection is a medical procedure . Most medical procedures with a few exceptions involve the ' return ' side of the vascular system , ie the veins - which is by design , and has a lot of positive side effects for an AE . The effect

of an AE depends on where in the circulatory system it occurs . If , as we 've indicated , the embolism occurs in a vein , it will be transmitted to the heart - specifically the right Atrium . The air will then be passed by the pumping action of the atrium into the right ventricle . This is the first place where a serious problem can occur . If the quantity of air present is enough to displace a ' large volume of blood ' - about 100 mL - then the ventricle may become partially or totally obstructed , which would prevent the movement of blood in the body , and lead to death . If there is * not * enough air to occlude

the ventricle , the air will be pumped to the lungs where it has the potential to escape the body through the same process that all other blood gases do . If the AE begins in the arterial part of the vascular system , the problem can be much more serious as it can block the flow of blood to a major organ or system ( eg , the brain or heart ) . The reason this can occur in the arteries but not the veins is that the arteries only ' narrow ' in the direction of the flow of blood , and veins only ' widen . This is too large a topic for a simple explanation , but I 'll try . Computers understand only very simple instructions in machine language . Humans generally only understand very complex human languages like English . There needs to be some translation between human - language commands like " draw this picture on the screen " and the equivalent instructions in machine language . So , we have the concept of " programming languages " , like C++ or Java or what have you . These loosely resemble English and are fairly easy for a human to learn ( very simply syntax , very limited vocabulary , etc ) , but they are rigidly defined and therefore easy to translate into machine language . So , a human being learns a programming language and enters in a series of instructions . Then , the compiler comes along and translates that programming language into machine language that a computer can actually understand .

I would n't really agree with anyone saying the vocal muscles are " tight " in the morning . When you sleep you are : 1 . breathing in ( often dry ) air and not swallowing . 2 . you are not drinking water 3 . you are obviously not speaking . So these 3 things make your voice quite weak and normally lower in the morning . The first two contribute directly to dehydration , which means the vocal cords ca n't vibrate at their normal rate , making the voice " robotic " and gravelly . The third reason is that you are n't using the vocal cords or any muscles around them , and therefore there is no blood getting to them to make them function at 100 % . As a singer , when I wake up I drink a large glass of water , and warm up my voice within an hour so I can try to get my vocal cords to 100 % as early as possible in the day ! !

Retailers sell things for $19.99 instead of $20.00 because it makes the price seem lower to customers. It's a psychological trick called "charm pricing." People tend to perceive prices that end in .99 as being significantly lower than prices that end in whole numbers, even though the difference between the two prices is only one cent. So, by pricing an item at $19.99 instead of $20.00, a retailer can make the item seem more affordable and attractive to customers.

That is n't a reflex . It 's a habit . Comparing the two introduces some really interesting neuroscience topics that have to do with habituation and learning . A reflex is , broadly speaking , any response that happens * without * conscious thought . If you touch a hot stove , you 're gon na pull your hand back * before * the fact that you just touched a hot stove even gets to your brain . It happens entirely without your input . A habit , on the other hand , is kind of like a * learned reflex . * Things happen in the nervous system because chemical reactions propagate from one nerve cell to another , like a row of dominos falling over

. When an electrochemical reaction propagates from one neuron to another , a kind of feedback happens that ends up strengthening the connection between the two cells . That makes it easier for the same reaction to happen next time ; it takes less energy , basically , to knock the next domino over . That means when a " signal " ( it 's not really a signal in the sense you might be thinking , but that 's a useful metaphor ) propagates down a particular neuronal pathway just one time , it becomes * slightly easier * for a " signal " to propagate down that pathway the next time . Neuroscientists say " What fires together , wires together . " This is the

key to * all * learning . You know how you ca n't really learn something — a skill , or a fact you want to remember , or whatever — by just experiencing it once ? You have to practice a skill , or review a fact multiple times before it " sticks . " That 's because you have to stimulate those particular cells in that particular way a number of times before they " grow together " enough to make it easy for that signal to propagate . * Habituation * is the logical extreme of that process . It 's when you do something * consciously * enough times that it becomes unconscious . Like biting your fingernails , or tapping your foot .

UV radiation is a type of energy that comes from the sun. It can be harmful to living things, including humans, because it can damage the genetic material in our cells.When UV radiation hits a cell, it can cause changes or mutations in the DNA, which is the genetic material that carries all of the instructions for how our cells and bodies work. DNA is made up of long chains of molecules called nucleotides, and UV radiation can cause these molecules to break or change in some way.If the DNA in a cell is damaged, it can affect the way the cell functions and can even cause the cell to die. However, sometimes the DNA can repair itself after being damaged by UV radiation. Other times, the DNA is not able to repair itself and the mutation remains.Mutations can be beneficial, harmful, or have no effect at all on an organism. Some mutations can cause changes in the way an organism looks or behaves, while others can cause serious health problems.I hope this helps to explain how UV radiation can cause genetic mutations. Antibiotics are a type of medicine that are used to treat infections caused by bacteria. Bacteria can build up resistance to antibiotics over time because they are constantly reproducing and mutating. When a person takes antibiotics, it can kill off most of the bacteria, but some of the bacteria may be resistant to the medicine. These resistant bacteria can then multiply and spread, which can make it harder to treat infections in the future. Alcohol, bleach, and boiling are not used to treat infections in the same way as antibiotics. Alcohol and bleach can kill bacteria, but they also can be harmful to human cells. Boiling is a way to kill bacteria by using very high temperatures, but it is not a practical way to treat infections in the body. People are not worried about the development of a chlorine-resistant bacteria strain because chlorine is not typically used to treat infections. Chlorine is used to kill bacteria and other germs in water and other disinfecting products, but it is not used in the same way as antibiotics.

I think what the question was trying to get at is the difference between speed and velocity . Speed is how fast something is going , velocity is speed combined with the direction . So something can be going 50 mph north , and something else is going 50 mph south . They 're both going the same speed , but their velocities are opposite . If you imagine spinning something attached to a string , it might be maintaining the same speed , but the velocity of that object is constantly changing because it is n't traveling in the same direction . Acceleration is defined as change in velocity , so the object being spun must be accelerating ( changing velocity ) despite its speed remaining the same .

SATA power connectors are used to provide power to SATA hard drives and other devices. They are a type of electrical connector that is specifically designed to connect to SATA-compatible devices. SATA power connectors are typically found on power supplies and other power sources, and they are used to provide power to devices such as hard drives, optical drives, and solid-state drives.SATA power connectors are generally flat and rectangular in shape, with a series of pins arranged in a specific pattern. They are typically colored yellow to distinguish them from other types of power connectors. SATA power connectors are used in conjunction with SATA data connectors, which are used to transmit data between devices. Together, the SATA power and data connectors form the SATA interface, which is a standard for connecting storage devices to computers and other devices.SATA power connectors are designed to be easy to use and provide a secure connection. They are typically plugged into the device using a simple push-and-click motion, and they are designed to lock into place to prevent accidental disconnection. SATA power connectors are widely used in modern computer systems, and they are an important part of the infrastructure that allows computers to access and store data.

Rockets will typically have multiple " stages . " The first stage is a big rocket engine and burns long enough to escape the atmosphere . Normally , this first stage engine is then detached from the top part of the rocket carrying the payload , burning up in the atmosphere or crashing into the ocean . The next stage(s ) continues to burn to make the rocket go faster until it gets into orbit . Once it is in orbit , the payload can be put into orbit . This can be delivering astronauts or supplies to the International Space Station , placing satellites into orbit , or performing experiments . As mentioned , the first stage engines burn up in the atmosphere or crash into the

. This time they used a landing pad on land , making it easier to recover the first stage . This may be a catalyst for space travel , allowing relatively cheap launches into space . This allows companies to launch more satellites , scientists to run more experiments , and to put more people in space . Edit : Accuracy of launch costs

Marijuana, also known as cannabis, is classified as a Schedule I controlled substance in the United States because it is considered to have a high potential for abuse and no currently accepted medical use. The classification of a drug as a Schedule I controlled substance is based on the results of scientific and medical research, as well as other factors such as the drug's potential for dependence and the likelihood of it being diverted for non-medical use. There is evidence to suggest that marijuana may have some potential therapeutic benefits for certain medical conditions, such as chronic pain, nausea and vomiting associated with chemotherapy, and muscle spasms and spasticity associated with multiple sclerosis. However, more research is needed to fully understand the risks and benefits of using marijuana for medical purposes and to determine the most effective doses and methods of administration. It is important to note that the classification of a drug as a Schedule I controlled substance does not necessarily mean that it has no medical value. Rather, it means that the drug has a high potential for abuse and has not yet been fully studied and approved for medical use by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA). In some cases, drugs that are initially classified as Schedule I controlled substances may be reclassified if more research is conducted and it is determined that they have a medical use and a low potential for abuse.

A fuzzy control system is a type of control system that uses fuzzy logic to make decisions and determine the appropriate control actions. Fuzzy logic is a form of multi-valued logic that allows for the representation of uncertain or imprecise information. In a fuzzy control system, the control actions are determined by a set of rules that are defined using fuzzy logic.Fuzzy control systems are used in a wide range of applications, including control of industrial processes, robotics, and autonomous systems. They are particularly useful in situations where the system being controlled is complex or the relationships between the input variables and the output variables are not well understood.In a fuzzy control system, the input variables are first fuzzified, which means that they are translated into fuzzy sets. The fuzzy sets are then combined using the rules of fuzzy logic to determine the appropriate control action. The control action is then defuzzified, or translated back into a numerical value that can be used to control the system.Fuzzy control systems have several advantages over traditional control systems. They are easy to design and implement, and they are able to handle uncertainty and imprecision in the input and output variables. They are also able to adapt to changing conditions and can handle multiple input variables simultaneously. However, they may be less accurate than traditional control systems in certain situations.

Cold working makes the metal stronger and harder because it changes the structure of the metal at the atomic level.Hot working is a process where metal is shaped or formed at a temperature that is above its recrystallization temperature. There is no hard and fast rule about using a credit or debit card to pay for small amounts at the point-of-sale (POS). Some people prefer to use cash for small purchases because it is quick and easy, while others prefer to use a card because it is more convenient and offers certain benefits, such as the ability to track expenses and earn rewards. Ultimately, the decision of whether to use a card or cash for small purchases is a personal one and should be based on your own preferences and circumstances.There are a few things to consider when deciding whether to use a card or cash for small purchases. One is the cost of using a card. Some credit cards charge fees for transactions, such as foreign transaction fees or cash advance fees. If you are using a card that charges these types of fees, it might not be cost-effective to use it for small purchases.Another thing to consider is the merchant's preference. Some merchants may prefer to accept cash for small purchases because it reduces their need to process transactions and handle cash. In these cases, it might be considerate to pay with cash if you are able to do so.In general, it is always a good idea to be mindful of the cost and convenience of using a card versus cash, and to choose the payment method that works best for you and the merchant.

Great question! The reason planets don't travel around the sun in a perfect circle is because they are affected by the sun's gravity, which pulls them towards the sun. However, planets also have their own momentum, or movement, which causes them to keep moving in a straight line unless something else changes their direction. The combination of the sun's gravity and the planet's momentum causes the planet to follow an elliptical, or oval-shaped, orbit around the sun. This means that the planet is sometimes closer to the sun and sometimes farther away, just like you described. I hope that helps! Do you have any other questions about planets or the solar system?

El Al, like most airlines, uses a dynamic currency exchange rate that is based on the current market exchange rate for the currencies involved in the transaction. The exchange rate that El Al uses for a particular transaction may be different from the exchange rate that is quoted by banks or currency exchange services, as it is based on the rate that is available to El Al at the time the transaction is processed. It is not uncommon for exchange rates to fluctuate over time, so the exchange rate that El Al uses for a particular transaction may be different from the exchange rate that is used for other transactions, even if they are completed around the same time.

So to start off , cancer is the uncontrolled growth of cells in the body . There 's a lot more to it than that , but invariably all types of cancer can be described in that way . It 's also important that you understand that the body is made up of millions of different types of cells . These cells have specific function and are what make your organs different from eachother - I.e the reason your kidneys and heart do n't do the same thing is because the cells in the two organs are vastly different and have very specific functions . Despite these vast differences many types of the cells begin at the same point and are stimulated to change into specific types of

cells by the environment they are in . This growth occurs continuously as cells are not perfect and do eventually break down and need replacing - hence the body either stimulates the death of the aging and progressively failing cell or it fails and is replaced by a new cell with ( hopefully ) the same function . Given the enormous amount of cellular growth required to maintain normal function and the fact that this process is not perfect there are mistakes made and these mistakes can generally cause a loss of , gain of or change of function . These mutations occur normally and are managed by the body in a number of different ways by the body - some immune cells are tasked with recognising abnormal

or malfunctioning cells and inducing their death . Beyond this , growth of cells does not normally occur without specific messenger chemicals being secreted locally ( locally being important here as these chemicals are incredibly specific and essentially guide the cells growth from it 's precursor to the highly specialised cell it is destined to become ) , there are anti - growth signals that prevent excessive growth and there also exists a number of mechanical like mechanisms that prevent cells from growing too large or outside of their normal limits . Cancers that do grow rapidly also use a lot more energy as a result and thus require their own blood supply to grow beyond a certain limit . In short , there 's a massive number

of ways the body stops individual mutations and cells from becoming cancers that can metastasize or spread to the rest of the body . Cancer is the result of what is essentially a " perfect storm " of cumulative mutations that allow the cell to continue growing and/or reproducing beyond normal constraints . These mutations do not always cause cancer if they occur on their own - for example , a mutation that allows cells to avoid immune recognition will not , on it 's own , result in a cancerous growth . Instead , you need mutations that together allow the cell to avoid immune recognition , allow it to grow unchecked by either produce it 's own growth stimulating chemicals or be able to grow without

genetic mutations that make them more susceptible to subsequent mutations - e.g mutations in the cellular machinery that prevent excessive growth or genetic disorders that inhibit immune function and so forth . When you breathe heavily in cold weather, the cold air can irritate the lining of your throat, causing it to feel sore or burn. This is especially likely if the air is dry, as dry air can further irritate the throat. To help prevent this from happening, you can try the following things: 1. Wear a scarf or other face covering over your mouth and nose when you go jogging in cold weather. This will help warm the air before you breathe it in. 2. Stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water before and after your jog. This will help keep your throat moist, which can reduce irritation. 3. Try to breathe through your nose instead of your mouth. Your nose has tiny hairs called cilia that help filter out irritants, so breathing through your nose can help protect your throat. 4. Take breaks to warm up and drink something warm, like tea or broth. This can help soothe your throat and keep it from getting too dry or irritated. 5. If your throat is already feeling sore, you can try sucking on a throat lozenge or drinking something warm with honey to help soothe the irritation.

Christianity and Judaism are two separate religions that have a shared history. Both religions believe in the same God and trace their spiritual ancestry back to Abraham, but they have different beliefs and practices. Jesus was a Jewish man who lived during the time of the Roman Empire. He taught that God's love and salvation were available to all people, not just the Jews, and many of his followers were not Jewish. As Christianity spread throughout the world, it began to develop its own traditions and practices that were distinct from those of Judaism. Over time, many Christians came to celebrate the life and teachings of Jesus, rather than the Jewish holidays. While some Christians may still observe certain Jewish holidays as a way of honoring their shared history, most Christian holidays and traditions are based on the life and teachings of Jesus and are not the same as Jewish holidays.

Patents are not inherently a bad thing , just when they are granted too easily for very trivial " inventions " , like in the US system at present . There is no debate over whether patents are good or bad in Europe because the rules are stricter and patents are not granted for obvious things ( and software patents are not granted at all in many places , either ) . A very large proportion of the patents being exploited by patent trolls in the US would never have been granted under a stricter system . So in Europe , for example , they still work they way they 're supposed to , which is to ensure that if a company / individual makes a massive investment in figuring out a new or better way to do something , they 'll be able to recoup that investment and not have everybody else free - ride on their hard work .

The Reps I have heard from mention it is the video game mentally of spray all day and all the soldiers that are coming back after toting thirty round mags . The hoarders are the old guys that already have five thousand rounds , but because they think that ammo may run dry have to buy more anytime they see it . This group seams to be getting saturated now and are now tapering off . The last group are the good ' ol capitalists that go around and buy every bit they can . King Henry VIII of England had six wives during his lifetime. They were:Catherine of Aragon, who was married to Henry VIII from 1509 to 1533. She was the daughter of King Ferdinand II of Aragon and Queen Isabella I of Castile, and was Henry's first wife. Catherine was unable to provide Henry with a male heir, and their marriage ended in divorce.Anne Boleyn, who was married to Henry VIII from 1533 to 1536. She was the daughter of Sir Thomas Boleyn and his wife, Lady Elizabeth Howard. Anne was the mother of Elizabeth I, who later became Queen of England. Anne was accused of adultery, incest, and plotting to kill the king, and was executed in 1536.Jane Seymour, who was married to Henry VIII from 1536 to 1537.

was annulled after he claimed that he was not physically attracted to her.Catherine Howard, who was married to Henry VIII from 1540 to 1542. She was the daughter of Lord Edmund Howard and his wife, Joyce Culpeper. Catherine was accused of adultery and executed in 1542.Catherine Parr, who was married to Henry VIII from 1543 to 1547. She was the daughter of Sir Thomas Parr and his wife, Maud Green. Catherine was the last of Henry's wives and outlived him, dying in 1548.Henry VIII is perhaps best known for his tumultuous personal life and his desire to have a male heir, which ultimately led to the English Reformation and the Church of England breaking away from the Roman Catholic Church.

Scientists use the International System of Units (SI) for measurements, including weight. The standard unit of weight in the SI system is the kilogram (kg). A kilogram is a unit of mass, which is a measure of how much matter is in an object. Mass is different from weight, which is a measure of the force of gravity on an object. The weight of an object depends on the mass of the object and the strength of the gravitational field it is in.For example, the weight of an object that has a mass of 1 kilogram on Earth is about 9.8 newtons (N). The weight of the same object on the Moon, where the gravitational field is weaker, would be about 1.6 N.So to compare the weight of an object on different planets or in different gravitational fields, scientists use the unit of mass, which is the kilogram. This allows them to compare the amount of matter in different objects, regardless of the strength of the gravitational field they are in.

I think it goes without saying that government is n't really anything like personal debt but it might help put things in perspective using a more familiar idea we can grasp . Part of the problem with the perception of our debt being a big problem is that the numbers are big . Mind bogglingly big . Scary big . Our debt is roughly $ 17,000,000,000,000 . And , yes , that is a big number . But let me show you another number : $ 17,000,000,000,000 . Why , yes . That is the same number . $ 17,000,000,000,000 also happens to be our Gross Domestic Product or GDP , which is what our country produces in a year . Think of the GDP as our annual

salary as a country . Now if you met a person who made $ 170,000 a year ( a much easier number to get your head around ) and that person was in debt to the tune of $ 170,000 say with a house a couple of credit cards and that person always paid all of his bills all the time , most people would say that person has very good credit and is n't at risk of going bankrupt and would likely be a particularly good candidate if they decided to get another loan . And so long as their income grows proportionally with their debt and they keep paying their bills , they 'll continue to be a safe bet to continue to receive loans .

In other words , if their debt rose to $ 200,000 , that 'd be okay if their income was also in the neighborhood of $ 200,000 . Now what you want to know is : Can the debt ever be repaid ? And the simple answer is , " yes , but you would n't really want to " . Keeping our house metaphor in tact for the time being , if we wanted to get out of debt , we could pay less for the stuff we use and use the difference to pay down our debt . But there 's a problem : What do we cut ? Food ? Medicine ? Clothing ? Home Security ? Everything we 're spending money on we more

or less need . Sure , we could nibble around the edges and find a few dollars here and there , but not enough to make a really big difference . Going back to our full scale US debt , it sounds good to say you 're going to cut our $ 10 million budget for ketchup research or $ 6 million in pork for a courthouse in Milwaukee , but that 's like saying you 're going to pay off your mortgage by rummaging around for spare change in your couch . When trillions are on the table , millions wo n't cut it and billions will barely touch it . Which is n't to say it 's impossible . Just about 20 years ago the Clinton

administration had a plan to pay down the national debt by raising taxes and cutting spending . According to that plan , we would have paid off the national debt by the far off future year of 2011 . Unfortunately , when we went to war in Afghanistan and Iraq in 2002 and 2003 , that added expense sidelined the debt repayment and ballooned our debt . And then in 2008 and 2009 the financial crisis happened and various stimulus packages and tax relief packages meant our debt ballooned again . It 's really been a lousy decade for debt and deficit . But have no fear : Should we do the obvious yet politically suicidal thing of raising taxes and cutting spending we can get our debt

under control again ( until the next big crisis , at least ) . But we do n't want to pay it off , mostly because a lot of our debt is n't owned by foreign countries : it 's owned by people like you and me in the form of government bonds . ( Basically you buy XX in IOUs from the government and they 'll pay you back XX plus interest after a given amount of time and these are generally seen as safe but low(er ) return parts of many investment portfolios for individuals and businesses . ) If the government is debt free , that means there are no bonds to invest in , which is n't very good for the economy . In nature .. the plants eventually die and their nutrients go back to the soil . Even fallen leaves and such get broken down and any nutrients in them go back to the soil . After many years you will find that plants naturally " rotate " themselves as certain species can no longer live on that soil .. but another type can and will start to grow . Some plants have deep roots ( dandelions ) that bring up nutrients from deeper than many shallow rooted plants ( lawn grass ) . In the past people did n't know about fertilizing the soil and societies collapsed when populations got to large and the crops were no longer nutritious ( this happened in central America to the Aztecs - their population kept growing but the food they were producing was less and less nutritious because the land was depleted of nutrients so they ate but were starving themselves to death at the same time ) . Mostly remember in nature we have slugs , worms , maggots , fungus , bacteria , and all sorts of things whose " job " it is to break down dead things to return them to the soil to become nutrients .

The elevator algorithm is actually pretty important in computer science . It is pretty simple to understand though . When called , the elevator will prioritize the calls that are in his way , then it goes the other way . If the elevator is going up , it will continue to go up until there 's no one left calling it in the up direction or until it reaches maximum floor . Then it goes down with the same logic .

Ad blocking software, also known as "ad blockers," are tools that block or remove advertisements from being displayed on a webpage. Ad blockers can be installed on a computer or mobile device, and they work by blocking requests to servers that serve ads, or by hiding ad content from being displayed on a webpage. Ad blockers can be effective at blocking unwanted ads, but they can also have unintended consequences, such as reducing the revenue of websites that rely on advertising to support their content. Hulu, like many other websites and online services, relies on advertising to support its content. If users are able to block ads from being displayed on Hulu, it could significantly reduce the revenue that Hulu is able to generate. To get around ad blockers, Hulu and other websites have used a variety of tactics, including detecting when ad blockers are being used and asking users to disable them in order to view content. While it may be frustrating to see ads while using the internet, it's important to remember that advertisements are one of the primary ways that websites and online services are able to generate revenue and offer their content for free or at a reduced cost. Without advertising, it is likely that many websites and services would not be able to exist in their current form.

Animals in the wild can get drunk , and there are a few very amusing videos of drunk apes , drunk elephants , drunk giraffes and so on . They get drunk by eating slightly rotten fruit : old enough for the fermentation process to have started . Early humans , of course , will have done the same , but also developed the capacity to start looking for ways to induce the process deliberately , instead of waiting for the fruit to start rotting of its own accord . Over time , and with a lot of trial and error -- and often , quite likely , just plain luck -- they stumble over little tricks to make the process more efficient and to improve the taste . Over time , all these little discoveries add up . And at some point , natural philosophers and , later , scientists , start asking questions like : " But why does doing this result in that ? " In other words , the practice came first . The explanations came later .

force of gravity is stronger than the force of the Earth's spin, called the centrifugal force. Silent letters are letters that are not pronounced in a word, even though they are written in the word. These letters are sometimes used to indicate the origin of a word or to help distinguish between words that are spelled similarly but have different meanings. For example, the "k" in "knife" is silent because it helps distinguish the word from "nife," which is not a word. The "g" in "gnome" is silent because it helps indicate that the word comes from a French word, "gnome."In some cases, silent letters can be confusing for people learning a new language because they don't follow the usual patterns for pronunciation. However, they are an important part of the history and evolution of language and can help us understand where words come from and how they have changed over time.

The lateral aperture (also known as the lateral fissure or lateral sulcus) is a deep groove that runs horizontally along the brain, separating the frontal lobe from the parietal lobe. The median aperture (also known as the longitudinal fissure) is a deep groove that runs vertically through the brain, dividing it into the left and right hemispheres. These apertures are important landmarks in the brain and are used to help identify and locate different brain regions and structures.

The amendments in the US most often refers to the amendments to the US constitution and not to any other laws . When the constitution were first signed there were a lot of problems with it . These problems were discovered one by one and addressed in the amendments . Machine ethics (or machine morality, computational morality, or computational ethics) is a part of the ethics of artificial intelligence concerned with adding or ensuring moral behaviors of man-made machines that use artificial intelligence, otherwise known as artificial intelligent agents. Machine ethics differs from other ethical fields related to engineering and technology.  Machine ethics should not be confused with computer ethics, which focuses on human use of computers. It should also be distinguished from the philosophy of technology, which concerns itself with the grander social effects of technology.

The main disadvantage is that interest rates are higher for the interest-only loan. It's higher risk to the bank, since the principal outstanding is higher for longer.  According to the New York Times, "Interest rates are usually an eighth- to a half-percentage point higher than on fully amortized jumbo loans." They're also tougher to qualify for, and fewer lenders offer them, again due to the risk to the bank. Since you can always put extra towards the principal, strictly speaking, these are the only  downsides. The upside, of course, is that you can make a lower payment each month. The question is what are you doing with this? If this is the only way you can afford the payments, there's a good chance the house is too expensive for you. You're not building equity in the home, and you have the risk of being underwater if the house price goes down. If you're using the money for other things, or you have variable income, it might be a different story. For the former, reinvesting in a business you own might be a reason, if you're cognizant of the risks. For the latter, salespeople on commission, or financial industry types who get most of their income in bonuses, can benefit from the flexibility.

A "junk bond" is one that pays a high yield UP FRONT because there is a good chance that it could default. Nebulae are colorful because they contain different types of gases and dust that emit and absorb light in different ways. The colors we see in pictures of nebulae are produced by the interaction of this light with the gases and dust in the nebulae.Hydrogen is indeed a transparent gas, but when it is ionized (meaning that it has lost or gained electrons), it can emit light. This is because the ionized hydrogen atoms can produce light when they return to their normal state. The light that is produced by ionized hydrogen atoms is called hydrogen-alpha light, and it is red in color. This is why many nebulae, which often contain ionized hydrogen, appear red in color.Nebulae can also contain other types of gases, such as oxygen and nitrogen, which can emit light of different colors when they are ionized. For example, oxygen can emit light that is green or blue in color, while nitrogen can emit light that is blue or violet in color. The combination of these different colors of light can produce the stunningly beautiful colors that we see in pictures of nebulae.

Battleships became obsolete because of technological advancements and changing naval warfare tactics and combat scenarios . With the development of long range radar and accurate missile systems , the battleship 's large caliber guns became outdated and a hindrance to modern naval combat . Could the battleship 's guns be made to fire at a greater range ? Yes , however you still generally would need to fire more rounds than missiles to disable an enemy vessel . Missiles took away the need for large storage space of rounds / powder . The reduced storage allowed smaller faster ships to be made , that are just as deadly , if not more so . Generally now , the key to strong naval warfare is detection and range .

Large naval guns required you to position your ship closer to threats , compared with missile paired with radar guidance . Naval shore bombardment is now done with aircraft and tomahawk cruise missiles . Both allow the ships to stay far off shore , which is much safer . Tanks operate on different battlefield . If you send in just a battalion of tanks and men , generally they will be firing on targets that are seen and not over the horizon . On land , you ca n't shoot out a radar signal hundreds of miles ( hills and other obstacles restrict it ) and ground targets are not easily picked up because of those obstructions . Tanks could switch to just missiles , however you 're

still generally firing on something that is seen and is in range of your main turret . So why not go the cheaper route and use the turret and have just a couple missiles on stand by for larger targets and threats . The tanks tactics have changed since tanks were initially used long ago , however they have not changed as drastic as sea warfare . There is still a high need for a large mobile armored gun for land warfare . And as an add in , naval gunfire is not obsolete in itself . The Navy still does Naval Surface Fire Support ( i.e. gunfire offshore onto land based targets ) . However , those missions are not a common occurrence because once the ship

can operate that close to shore safely , generally the fight will have moved deeper inland and out of the large guns ' range ( 10 - 15 miles ) . You do n't have large opposed amphibious landings like back in WWII nowadays . Lastly , something that is currently in development and would probably lead to more naval gunfire again is the rail gun . It provides a longer range , ~100 nautical miles , and the added benefit of not having to have powder charges stored on board to launch the projectile . The rail gun could bring the navy ship to a somewhat similar situation to the tank . You have an enemy that you can ' see ' ( with radar / eyes

Tropical regions are located around the Earth's equator and are characterized by high temperatures and high levels of humidity. These areas are typically home to a diverse array of plant and animal life and are known for their lush, tropical rainforests. The tropical zone is divided into three main regions: the tropical rainforest, the tropical savanna, and the tropical monsoon.The tropical rainforest is a region that receives a high amount of rainfall throughout the year, typically at least 250 cm (98 inches). The rainforest is home to a wide variety of plant and animal life, including many species of birds, insects, reptiles, and mammals.The tropical savanna is a region that receives less rainfall than the tropical rainforest, typically between 50 and 150 cm (20-60 inches) per year. The savanna is characterized by grasslands and scattered trees, and is home to many species of grassland animals such as antelopes, zebras, and giraffes.The tropical monsoon region is a region that experiences a wet and dry season. During the wet season, the region receives heavy rainfall, while during the dry season, rainfall is much lighter. The tropical monsoon region is characterized by grasslands, forests, and wetlands, and is home to many species of birds, reptiles, and mammals.Tropical regions are found in many parts of the world, including South America, Africa, Southeast Asia, and parts of the Caribbean.

The back of a car tends to collect more dirt than the front of a car because it is usually closer to the ground and therefore more likely to come into contact with dirt, dust, and debris that gets kicked up by the car's tires as it is driving. This is especially true if you frequently drive on dirt roads or through areas with a lot of construction or dust. Additionally, the back of a car may not be as visible to you as the front, so you may not notice the dirt as much and therefore not clean it as frequently. It's also possible that the front of your car has a grille or other protective feature that helps to deflect some of the dirt and debris, while the back does not. Overall, the back of a car tends to collect more dirt because it is more exposed to the elements and tends to be less visible to the driver.

The operation of the nerve endings in the skin is not clearly understood , but itching appears to be associated with the * * sense of pain * * , * since persons who can no longer feel pain , for whatever reason , usually do n't itch anymore either * . In this respect itching is analogous to tickling , which is thought to be related to the * * sense of pressure * * . Other areas on the skin usually are relatively insensitive . Itch points appear to be associated with concentrations of fine free nerve endings . It 's known that in some cases the nervous system has different mechanisms for conducting sensory impressions of varying intensity , such as light and firm pressure , and there is speculation that * * itching may be a watered - down sense of pain * * , designed to detect extremely faint stimuli . In the NFL , individual games are more influential to begin with . An MLB season has 162 games , an NHL season has 82 games , and an NFL season has 16 games . This means that proportionally , a regular season football game has the equivalent effect of a baseball team playing 10 games or a hockey team playing 5 games . In a league where a bad game or two can easily be the difference between winning a division and being eliminated from getting into the playoffs , it 's not a huge change to have must - win games in the postseason . Also , there 's the issue of player safety . You can play other sports on consecutive days if you want . Football , though , has constant hitting between players , leading to many injuries . You need a week off between games . If you implemented long playoff series , you 'd wind up with a longer postseason than regular season . You 'd also probably get more injuries . There have been recent efforts to add 2 games to the season , but that plan is not getting much support from the players ' union due to safety reasons .

Imagine a cat . You 're probably imagining a little furry thing with four legs and a tail . Why ? Well , you 've seen a lot of things in your life that have been described to you as " cat . " You now have a general concept of what a cat is : it 's furry , has four legs , has a certain body shape , and behaves in a certain way . Without realizing it , your brain has performed a very difficult task : averaging all the cats you 've seen into a general understanding of " cat . " This particular brain function is impaired in the autistic . An extremely autistic person does not know what a " cat "

is . At first they thought it was any small furry creature with four legs , but then they met their neighbor 's Yorkie which was described to them as a " dog , " and they had to start all over figuring out what a cat is . One major consequence of this cognitive impairment is a different approach to memory . When you see a cat , you will remember just a few details : * my aunt has a tabby cat . * An autistic person ca n't compress the memory down to broad terms such as * tabby cat , * so instead they remember every detail of the animal . An autistic person will be able to tell you the details of every

social interaction , an autistic person will not tease out patterns such as * if I am nice to people , they will be nice to me * or * people do not like it when I hit them . * The causes of autism are not well understood . The leading theory is that a child must * first * be genetically predisposed to autism , and * then * it must be " unlocked " in the developmental stages in some way . But that 's just a theory -- we do n't really know for sure . Source : I 'm dating a neuroscientist who reads about autism a lot and tells me about it .

Sometimes when you are extremely tired, you may experience a sudden burst of energy, also known as a "second wind." This can happen because your body is trying to find ways to stay awake and alert, even when you are feeling very tired. One possible reason for this is that your body releases certain chemicals, such as adrenaline, that can give you a burst of energy. Adrenaline is a hormone that is produced by the body in response to stress or excitement. When it is released, it can make you feel more alert and energized. Another possible reason is that your body may try to conserve energy when you are feeling tired. For example, you may start to move more slowly and take shorter steps, which can help to conserve energy. This can make you feel more tired initially, but as your body adjusts to this new level of energy expenditure, you may start to feel more energized. Overall, the "second wind" phenomenon is a normal response of the body to tiredness or fatigue. It is not uncommon for people to experience a sudden burst of energy when they are feeling very tired, and this can be a helpful way for the body to stay alert and awake when it needs to.

Keyboard and mouse controls are generally considered to be superior to dual-joystick controllers for first-person shooters because they offer more precision and faster movement. With a keyboard and mouse, you can move your character around more smoothly and make quicker, more precise shots. Imagine you're playing a game where you have to aim and shoot at targets. If you're using a dual-joystick controller, you might have to move one joystick to aim and another joystick to move. This can be a little bit slow and clunky, especially if you're trying to aim quickly. On the other hand, if you're using a keyboard and mouse, you can use the mouse to aim and the keyboard to move. The mouse is much more precise than a joystick, so you can aim more accurately. And because your fingers are already positioned on the keyboard, it's faster to move around with the keyboard than it is to use a joystick. Overall, keyboard and mouse controls offer a more intuitive and precise way to play first-person shooter games, which is why they are often the preferred choice among serious gamers.

The universe is much older than 13.3 billion years, and light from distant objects takes time to travel to us. When we look at objects in the universe, we are seeing them as they were in the past, because it takes time for the light to reach us. For example, if you look at a star that is 100 light-years away, you are seeing it as it was 100 years ago, because it took 100 years for the light from that star to reach us. Similarly, if you look at a galaxy that is 30 billion light-years away, you are seeing it as it was 30 billion years ago, because it took 30 billion years for the light from that galaxy to reach us. So, even though the universe is not infinitely old, we can still see objects that are very far away and very old, because it takes time for the light from those objects to reach us.

A garbled circuit is a method for securely computing a function on two or more inputs in a way that preserves the privacy of the inputs. It is a technique for secure multi-party computation, which is the process of allowing two or more parties to jointly compute a function over their inputs while keeping those inputs private.In a garbled circuit, each input is first encrypted using a randomly generated key. The encrypted inputs, or "garbled inputs," are then passed through a series of gates, which are essentially simple Boolean functions that take one or more inputs and produce an output based on those inputs. The gates are constructed in such a way that the output of the function can be computed without revealing the inputs to any of the parties involved.For example, suppose Alice and Bob want to compute the AND function on two inputs, but they do not want to reveal their inputs to each other. Using a garbled circuit, Alice and Bob can each encrypt their inputs and pass the encrypted inputs through the AND gate. The output of the AND gate will be the result of the AND function on the two inputs, but neither Alice nor Bob will be able to see the inputs or the output.Garbled circuits have several important applications, including secure multi-party computation, secure voting systems, and privacy-preserving data analysis. They are also a key component of many cryptographic protocols, including secure computation protocols and zero-knowledge proofs.

Constipation is a common issue in infants and young children, and it can be caused by a variety of factors such as a change in diet, lack of physical activity, or underlying medical conditions. If your 18-month-old child is experiencing constipation, here are a few things you can try:Encourage your child to drink plenty of fluids, especially water. Water can help to soften stools and make them easier to pass.Offer your child foods that are high in fiber, such as fruits, vegetables, and whole grains. These can help to bulk up the stools and make them easier to pass.Encourage your child to be physically active. Exercise can help to stimulate the bowel and promote regular bowel movements.If your child is formula-fed, you may want to try a different type of formula. Some formulas can be constipating, while others may be easier on the digestive system.Talk to your child's healthcare provider about using a gentle stool softener or other medication to help alleviate constipation.It's important to note that if your child is experiencing severe constipation, prolonged abdominal pain, or bloody stools, you should contact their healthcare provider right away.

is exactly the same as the physics for why most things " float " . As long as you break the surface and overcome the surface tension you can float if you * displace * a greater mass of water than your total mass . So yes , ships are massive , but they are mostly hollow . Like a giant bowl , they push water away as they sink . The more they sink , the more water they push away . Eventually the amount of water pushed away has a greater mass than the entire bowl so the bowl floats .

Avoiding left turns can save gas because it reduces the amount of time that a vehicle spends idling, which is when the engine is running but the vehicle is not moving. When a vehicle is stopped at an intersection waiting to make a left turn, it is often necessary to wait for oncoming traffic to pass before the turn can be made. This can take a significant amount of time, especially if the intersection is busy. During this time, the vehicle's engine is running but the vehicle is not moving, which can be inefficient from a fuel consumption standpoint.By avoiding left turns and instead making right turns or using alternative routes, a vehicle can potentially spend less time idling and more time moving, which can help to save fuel. This is especially true for large vehicles like UPS delivery trucks, which may be more fuel-efficient when they are moving rather than stopped.It's important to note that there are many factors that can affect a vehicle's fuel efficiency, and avoiding left turns may not always result in significant fuel savings. However, in certain situations, such as when driving in a heavily congested area, it can be an effective strategy for reducing fuel consumption.

Latino and Latin America are terms that refer to the people and countries in the Americas that are influenced by the culture and language of Latin Europe, particularly Spain. The word "Latino" refers to people from Latin America, while "Latin America" refers to the region that includes all the countries in the Americas that speak a Romance language, which are languages that developed from Latin.Latin is an ancient language that was spoken by the Romans in ancient Rome and other parts of the Roman Empire. The Romans were a powerful civilization that ruled much of Europe, Africa, and the Middle East, and they spread their language and culture throughout the regions that they conquered.After the fall of the Roman Empire, Latin continued to be spoken and studied as a classical language, and it became the basis for many modern Romance languages, including Spanish, French, Italian, and Portuguese. These languages are called Romance languages because they developed from the Latin spoken by the Romans, and they are spoken in many parts of Europe and Latin America.So, to sum it up, Latino and Latin America are terms that refer to people and countries in the Americas that are influenced by the culture and language of Latin Europe, particularly Spain, and these terms are based on the fact that the language and culture of Latin Europe, particularly the language Latin, has had a significant influence on the region.

The first bit you have to understand is the impact of encryption . The purpose of encryption is : an encrypted message can be shared with anyone , but only decrypted and read by the sender and receiver . In order for this to make sense , * both endpoints must be trusted * . This is important . It does n't matter if you encrypt a message if you 're sending it to someone that will repost the decrypted message and share the contents . A proxy is a server that browses on your behalf . Normally , when I browse the web , my web browser sends a request to , say , URL_0 , and URL_0 sends back a response to my browser . URL_0

now knows some things about me such as my IP address . With a proxy , my browser sends my request to the proxy , the proxy sends it to URL_0 , URL_0 replies to the proxy , and the proxy forwards the response back to my browser . Now URL_0 knows the proxy IP instead of me . Significantly , though , the proxy knows my IP * as well as * the site I was going to . I 'm basically putting all my trust in that proxy to not log or otherwise advertise my browsing . Considering a large number of " anonymous " proxies on the web are run by governments , this probably is n't such a great deal for me , particularly

since proxy browsing typically slows down my connection because of all the extra chatter it requires . So if you use a proxy , make sure you research it and make sure that you 're using one that has the effect you 're after . This is where Tor comes in . Tor is an onion proxy based on the two concepts above . An onion proxy is so named because it has many layers , like an onion , meaning that the proxy I talk to talks to another proxy , and maybe another , and maybe another , etc , until after some " relay chain " of proxying the request is sent to the destination and then the response is forwarded back . The response

must be forwarded back through the same chain , or there 's no way the packets can make it back to me without the endpoint knowing my IP ( to send via a different route , the endpoint would have to put in the destination , me , which presumably it does n't have ) . With a normal onion proxy , we still have a problem . Each proxy knows the IP of where the request came from , it knows the proxy it 's sending to , and moreover , it knows the ultimately destination . All it has to do is look in the packet to see that I 'm trying to get to URL_0 . Tor solves this problem by using encryption . Let

's say I want to browse URL_0 without anyone being able to know it 's me , using a relay chain with 2 proxies . I 'm A , URL_0 is C , and the proxies are 1 and 2 ( in order from me to URL_0 ) . My request goes : A-1 - 2 - C. Here 's where encryption comes in : if I encrypt the destination of my request ( URL_0 ) so that only 2 can decrypt it , I can pass the request through 1 without 1 knowing where it 's going ; even though 1 knows my IP , it does n't know what I 'm browsing for . 1 forwards the request to 2 , and now 2 decrypts the

to me . To frustrate this , Tor inserts an extra node , making the chain : A-1 - 2 - 3 - C. With this extra step , all reasonable possibility of being able to put together the entire chain , in principle , it nearly impossible . ( There are still a lot of mistakes that can be made that allow sophisticated observers to put it together , but Tor avoids making those mistakes . )

In general economic theory, there are always two markets created based on a need for a good; a spot market (where people who need something now can go outbid other people who need the same thing), and a futures market (where people who know they will need something later can agree to buy it for a pre-approved price, even if the good in question doesn't exist yet, like a grain crop). Options exist as a natural extension of the futures market. In a traditional future, you're obligated, by buying the contract, to execute it, for good or ill. If it turns out that you could have gotten a lower price when buying, or a higher price when selling, that's tough; you gave up the ability to say no

in return for knowing, a month or three months or even a year in advance, the price you'll get to buy or sell this good that you know you need. Futures thus give both sides the ability to plan based on a known price, but that's their only risk-reduction mechanism. Enter the option. You're the Coors Brewing Company, and you want to buy 50 tons of barley grain for delivery in December in order to brew up for the Super Bowl and other assorted sports parties. A co-op bellies up to close the deal. But, since you're Coors, you compete on price with Budweiser and Miller, and if you end up paying more than the grain's really worth, perhaps because of a mild wet fall and a bumper

back out of the contract.  Like any insurance premium, the option price is nominally based on an outwardly simple formula: the probability of Coors "exercising" their option, times the losses the co-op would incur if that happened. Long-term, if these two figures are accurate, the co-op will break even by offering this price and Coors either taking the contract or exercising the option. However, coming up with accurate predictions of these two figures, such that the co-op (or anyone offering such a position) would indeed break even at least, is the stuff that keeps actuaries in business (and awake at night).

Before talking about it , first we have to define the word Electricity . If we do n't , everyone will get confused because they 're all using a different definition . That 's the main problem with your book . They do n't have a clear , narrow , scientific definition . But their problem is system - wide in education . Pick up most any grade school textbook and it will suffer from the same confusion . When we say " electricity , " exactly what are we referring to ? Do n't ask " what is Electricity ? " Instead ask " what does that word ' Electricity ' really mean ? " In particular , what is the scientific definition ? The SI and

the physicists define the quantity " electricity " as being electric charge . We measure electricity in Coulombs , so we 'd say that an electron carries a small quantity of electricity . A generator does n't really produce excess power . It produces the amount of power that is required by the load . Let ’s look at a simple definition of a generator . A generator takes mechanical , physical or potential energy , and transforms it into electrical energy . Whether its wind , hydro , or a simple gas gennie , it changes one form of energy into electrical potential . Ok , with that out of the way . Let 's say you have a generator rated for 10 megawatts ( MW ) . That means this generator can output safely , and continuously up to 10MW , and provide power of a range from 0MW(no load ) to 10MW(full load ) . The amount of

MW produced is actually load dependent . If your load only requires 5MW , your generator is not going to provide more than 5MW , but you still have the ability to provide up to 10MW . So , there 's really no wasted output per se , but there 's the capability of generating up to 10MW . If number crunching and formulas are your thing . Power = Volts x Amps . If it 's not , just keep in mind , voltage is regulated as it would n't be good for equipment if you had huge fluctuating voltages , so therefore current ( Amps ) is linearly proportional to your load requirements . As load goes up , amps goes up , and therefore the

force at which you are required to turn your generator goes up . This goes back to the mechanical energy into electrical energy point I made earlier . If load goes down , you throttle back whatever is running your generator . If it 's hydro , you 're lowering the head gate , decreasing the amount of water pushing your turbine . If it 's a gas gennie , the governor is throttling back your fuel output . ( Wind is different , since you ca n't control the wind . You just end up shutting down units rather than throttling . ) I really try not to look at generator in terms of speed , as that must be kept consistent to keep the 60Hz frequency

Itch follows the same neural tracts as pain ( which are separate from vibratory , fine discrimination , and proprioceptive sensation tracts ) but it is n't pain because pain causes a recoil reflex , whereas itch causes a scratch reflex . Largely , the stimulus to itch is histamine release and detection by neurons , but there are other stimuli . Interestingly , mast cells , which are white blood cells in your skin ( and responsible for a lot of allergy - related stuff ) degranulate and release histamine when stimulated . They can be stimulated by allergens ( like in drug reactions , atopic dermatitis , hives , poison ivy , etc ) or other stuff ( like hot water in the shower ) . Once they release the histamine , the nerves pick it up and you process it as itch .

There are several reasons why people in different parts of the United States may have similar accents or dialects. First, language tends to evolve and change over time, and people who live in close proximity to one another are more likely to influence each other's way of speaking. This means that if two people live near each other and interact frequently, they may begin to adopt similar ways of speaking. Second, people who move to a new place may adopt the accent or dialect of the people they live and interact with. This is especially true for people who move to a new place during their formative years, when they are still learning how to speak. Finally, media and technology have made it easier for people to hear and learn about different accents and dialects from all over the country. This means that someone who grows up in the Midwest may be exposed to the way people speak in the Northeast or West Coast, and vice versa. Overall, there are many factors that contribute to the similarities in accents and dialects that we see in different parts of the United States.

The Double Jeopardy Clause is a part of the Fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution. It states that no person shall "be subject for the same offense to be twice put in jeopardy of life or limb." This means that if someone is acquitted (found not guilty) of a crime, they cannot be tried again for the same crime. The Double Jeopardy Clause is designed to protect people from being subjected to the stress and expense of multiple trials for the same crime. It also helps to prevent the government from using its power to try to punish someone over and over again until it gets the result it wants. However, there are some exceptions to the Double Jeopardy Clause. For example, if new evidence is discovered that was not available at the time of the original trial, it may be possible to bring someone to trial again for the same crime. Additionally, the Double Jeopardy Clause does not apply in cases where the crime was committed in different states or in cases where the person was tried in both a state court and a federal court.

In general, weapons can be banned from war if they are considered to be inhumane or excessively destructive. This can happen through international treaties, which are agreements between different countries that outline rules for how wars should be fought. For example, the Geneva Conventions are a set of international treaties that contain rules about the treatment of prisoners of war, the medical care of wounded soldiers, and the use of certain weapons. One way that weapons can be banned is if they cause unnecessary suffering or injury to people. For example, poison gas, which is a type of chemical weapon, has been banned from use in war because it can cause severe burns and respiratory problems, and can be very painful for those who are exposed to it. Similarly, certain types of land mines, which are hidden explosive devices that are buried in the ground, have been banned because they can continue to cause harm and injury long after a conflict has ended. Another way that weapons can be banned is if they are considered to be too destructive or uncontrollable. For example, nuclear weapons, which are extremely powerful bombs that use atomic reactions to create a massive explosion, have been banned from use in many parts of the world because they can cause widespread destruction and death. Overall, the goal of banning certain weapons is to try to make wars less destructive and to protect civilians and other non-combatants from unnecessary harm.

Biology graduate powers .. Go ! I guess the quick answer to your question is yes for saltwater , no for fresh water . The longer version goes like this . All life on earth has to deal with the problem of regulating the amount of water they need to survive . For most animals this involves having to find ways to take in water or conserve what has already been taken in . Humans do this by drinking free water ( ie . liquid water from a river , lake , faucet , etc . ) when our brain signals that we need more . Other organisms , like desert mammals , have very limited access to free water . They have developed interesting and complex mechanisms

to preserve the precious water that they get from eating plants or other animals that contain water . Both camels and kangaroo rats , for instance , have extremely long nasal passages that absorb water from exhaled air . Both of these animals are incapable of fogging up a mirror , interestingly . They also have an extremely long loop of Henle . This is a part of the kidney that is largely responsible for reabsorption of water from the substance that will become urine . You can usually tell how difficult water regulation is for a given organism by how long the loop of Henle is ( assuming they have kidneys that function similar to ours ) . To take this all back to fish , who

live in water , we also have to look at the transportation of water in systems . Water always wants to move from an area where is is more concentrated to an area where it is less concentrated in an attempt to " balance " itself . Saltwater fish constantly have the problem of water wanting to exit their bodies ( usually through the gills ) and go back into the sea as the ocean water is less concentrated then their body water is . Interestingly , if you look at marine fish and mammal kidneys they have loop of Henle lengths comparable or longer than animals living in deserts . So saltwater fish " drink " seawater just to get the water molecules into their bodies ,

salts , etc . ) Freshwater fish have the exact opposite problem . There bodies are constantly up taking way more water than they need . As a result , they have almost no noticeable loop of Henle and they excrete a ton of dilute urine all the time . If they did n't , they risk becoming so inundated with water that the electrolytes that they need to function become so diluted that they die , effectively , of water poisoning . This is called hyponatremia , and it can happen to other animals as well , but is most common in animals that live in , or spend a large amount of time in , freshwater .

A database directive is a command or instruction that is used to specify the behavior of a database management system (DBMS) or to define the structure of a database. Database directives can be used to create and modify database objects such as tables, views, and indices, and to specify the relationships between these objects. They can also be used to control the access and security of the database, and to specify the behavior of the DBMS when executing queries or transactions.Database directives are usually written in a specialized language called a database query language, which is designed specifically for interacting with databases. Some examples of database query languages include Structured Query Language (SQL), which is commonly used with relational databases, and NoSQL, which is used with non-relational databases.Database directives are an important aspect of database management and are used extensively in the development and maintenance of database systems. They allow developers and database administrators to control the behavior and structure of the database, and to ensure that the data is stored and accessed efficiently and securely.

While it's true that type O-negative blood can be given to anyone in a pinch, it's still best to give patients blood that is as similar as possible to their own. This is because our bodies are better able to accept blood that is similar to our own, and it can help reduce the risk of complications. For example, if a person with type A blood is given type B blood, their body may recognize the B blood as being "foreign" and try to attack it. This can cause the person to have a reaction, which can be very serious and even life-threatening. On the other hand, if a person with type A blood is given type A blood, their body is more likely to accept it and not have a reaction. So while type O blood is a "universal donor" because it can be given to anyone, it's still best to give blood that is as close a match as possible to the patient's own blood type to help reduce the risk of complications.

Overall, Singapore has been successful because it has a strong foundation of education, efficiency, trade, infrastructure, and innovation, which has helped it to become a modern and prosperous country.

When in contact with an allergen ( something that can trigger an allergic reaction ) your inmune cells release histamine . Histamine triggers some nasty effects like inflamation and bronchoconstriction by binding to certain receptors in the cell walls called Hisatmine receptors . Antihistaminics work by either blocking the receptor to prevent histamine from binding to it or by binding to the receptor in a way that triggers the opposite effect of histamine ( thereby , reverting the effects ) . Drowsiness is caused because certain antihistaminics ( called 1 ° gen antihistaminics ) will trespass the blood - brain barrier ( a filtering mechanism that blocks the passage of a lot of substances from the bloodstream to the brain ) . In the brain , 1 ° gen antihistaminics depress the nervous system . 2 ° Gen antihistaminics like loratadine wo n't trespass the blood - brain barrier and therefore wo n't make you sleepy .

Bayesian inference is a method of statistical inference in which Bayes' theorem is used to update the probability for a hypothesis as more evidence or information becomes available. Bayesian inference is an important technique in statistics, and especially in mathematical statistics. Bayesian updating is particularly important in the dynamic analysis of a sequence of data. Bayesian inference has found application in a wide range of activities, including science, engineering, philosophy, medicine, sport, and law. In the philosophy of decision theory, Bayesian inference is closely related to subjective probability, often called "Bayesian probability".

Keeping things ELI5 as much as possible : C4 has energy stored in the form of chemical bonds . Those bonds release energy in the form of heat when they are broken , in addition to converting the solid C4 into a gas ( which takes up a lot more space ) . If this happens all at once ( or at least very quickly ) , you get what you would define as an explosion : Lots of heat and pressure in a single small point , which expands very quickly as a shockwave . If this happens slowly , it 's more like a traditional fire : Heat and gas separate off of the burning mass at a rate ( which is actually controlled by how quickly the substrate heats up in the presence of its own fire ) . C4 does not require oxygen to burn so as it heats up the fire intensity will increase . So to answer your question , you have to understand that there are two ways to break the bonds in C4 . A significant impact ( ~~a bullet~~ apparently probably not a bullet , but definitely a priming charge ) will do the trick , and so will heat . The heat permeates the C4 slowly , resulting in a fire . The shockwave from a priming charge however permeates the entire mass very quickly , releasing all the bonds at once : Boom .

Yes, that is generally the idea behind vaccinations. Vaccines are designed to help protect people from getting sick with certain diseases. When a large percentage of a population is vaccinated against a particular disease, it creates what is known as "herd immunity." This means that even people who are not vaccinated are less likely to get sick with that disease because there is a smaller pool of people who could potentially transmit the disease to them. However, even if someone is vaccinated, it is still possible for them to get sick with a disease if they are exposed to it. For example, some vaccines are not 100% effective, and some people may not be able to get certain vaccines due to medical reasons. In these cases, people who are vaccinated may still be at some risk of getting sick with a disease, especially if they are exposed to it. So, in short, getting vaccinated can help protect not only yourself, but also people around you, including those who are not vaccinated. This is especially important for people who are at higher risk of severe illness or complications from a particular disease, such as young children, older adults, and people with certain underlying health conditions.

In computer science, beam search is a heuristic search algorithm that explores a graph by expanding the most promising node in a limited set. Beam search is an optimization of best-first search that reduces its memory requirements. Best-first search is a graph search which orders all partial solutions (states) according to some heuristic. But in beam search, only a predetermined number of best partial solutions are kept as candidates. It is thus a greedy algorithm.The term "beam search" was coined by Raj Reddy of Carnegie Mellon University in 1977.

Meta-learning, also known as learning to learn, refers to the ability of a machine learning model to adapt to new tasks or environments quickly, using knowledge and experience from previous tasks.In the context of computer science, meta-learning involves training a model on a large number of tasks, such that it can learn to learn and adapt to new tasks more efficiently. This is typically done by training the model on a set of related tasks, and then fine-tuning it on a new task using only a few examples.Meta-learning can be used to improve the performance of machine learning models in a variety of applications, including robotics, natural language processing, and computer vision. It has the potential to greatly reduce the amount of data and computation required to learn new tasks, making it a promising approach for building intelligent systems that can adapt and learn in real-world environments.

If it helps you to think about it, long is equivalent to betting for the upside and short is equivalent to betting for the downside. If you are long on options, then you expect the value of such options to increase.  If you are long an option, then you own the option.  If you are short an option, then generally you sold the option.  Someone who is short a call (sometimes called the writer or occasionally the issuer) has sold a call option to someone who is now long a call. Buying a call option that will increase in value is itself a form of investment, just as it's investment to buy stock or other instruments hoping they will appreciate in value.  An option's

the asset may not appreciate to the point that the call option will pay off. In the conceptual sense, a share of stock is a particular right to the profits and assets of a corporation, both in form of dividends and in liquidation.  An option is a particular right to the the share of stock.  It's just a further way to formalize and subdivide the various property rights that exist in a corporation.  If you can buy a piece of paper with particular rights to corporate profits and assets, then you can buy another piece of paper with particular rights to the former piece of paper.

The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) is a trade agreement between the United States, Canada, and Mexico that was implemented in 1994. It aims to reduce barriers to trade and investment among the three countries, such as tariffs on imported goods and restrictions on foreign ownership of businesses. The goal of NAFTA is to increase economic growth and competitiveness by fostering closer economic ties between the three countries. It has been successful in achieving this goal, as trade among the three countries has increased significantly since the agreement went into effect. However, it has also been the subject of controversy and criticism, as some people believe that it has led to job losses and other negative consequences in some sectors of the economy.
