To calculate the value of a bond that is priced to yield a certain percentage, you can use the following formula:Bond price = Face value / (1 + Yield/n)^(n*t)Where:Face value: the principal amount of the bond, also known as the par value or maturity valueYield: the percentage yield of the bond, also known as the coupon raten: the number of times per year that the bond pays interest (usually annually for a bond with a fixed coupon rate, or semi-annually for a bond with a floating coupon rate)t: the time in years until the bond maturesFor example, let's say you have a bond with a face value of $1000, a yield of 5%, and a maturity of 10 years. The bond pays interest semi-annually, so n = 2. The value of the bond would be:Bond price = $1000 / (1 + 5%/2)^(2*10) = $838.67Keep in mind that the value of a bond can change over time as interest rates fluctuate and the bond gets closer to maturity. As such, the value of a bond is typically quoted as a percentage of its face value, rather than as an absolute dollar amount.

The Renaissance was a time of great cultural and intellectual flourishing, and the English language was heavily influenced by Latin and Greek, as well as by the languages of France and Italy. As a result, Renaissance English is characterized by a large number of borrowed words, many of which are still in use today. It is also characterized by a more complex and varied syntax, as writers and scholars of the time sought to express their ideas in a more sophisticated and nuanced way. Some examples of writers who used Renaissance English include William Shakespeare, John Milton, and Francis Bacon.

Gravity is a force that attracts objects with mass towards each other. It is the force that keeps us on the ground, and it is also the force that holds the planets and stars in place in the universe.Gravity is often referred to as both the "strongest" and the "weakest" force in the universe because it can act over very large distances, but its strength can also vary depending on the mass of the objects it is acting on.Here's how it works: The strength of the gravitational force between two objects is directly proportional to the mass of the objects and inversely proportional to the distance between them. This means that the more massive an object is, the stronger the gravitational force it exerts. For example, the gravitational force between the Earth and the Moon is stronger than the gravitational force between two small objects like a feather and a hammer.However, the strength of the gravitational force also decreases as the distance between the objects increases. This means that the gravitational force between two objects becomes weaker as they get farther apart.So, gravity is considered both the "strongest" and the "weakest" force in the universe because it can act over large distances, but its strength can vary depending on the mass of the objects and the distance between them.

Accents in Britain can vary for a number of reasons. One reason is that different parts of the country have a long history of being isolated from each other. This means that people in different parts of the country have had less contact with each other, which has allowed their accents to develop differently over time. Another reason is that different parts of the country have been influenced by different languages and cultures. For example, some parts of Britain have been influenced by Celtic languages, while others have been influenced by languages spoken by invaders such as the Vikings or the Normans. These influences can also contribute to the development of different accents. Finally, people's accents can be influenced by the people they spend time with and the media they consume. This is why you may notice that some people have accents that are similar to the people they grew up with or the TV shows and movies they watch. Overall, the many different accents in Britain are a result of a combination of history, geography, and cultural influences.

Heavy vehicles pull far more weight for a given engine power than cars , and their engines give the most usable torque at a very narrow rev range ( around 300 - 500 rpm ) . The weight means you 'll want to ideally never leave that small rev range , so you need many gears for efficient pulling and to be able to optimize your revs for fuel efficiency when cruising . When you 're not pulling a heavy load , you can easily skip over two to three gears with each shift . The gear ratios are also vastly different . First gear on a heavy truck is so low you can literally slip your foot off the clutch and get going smoothly with no load

are also not permitted to go past 80 kmh in the EU and are governed to a maximum of 90 kmh , so top gear has the engine spinning at its most fuel efficient rev range at those speeds ( 1100 - 1500 rpm ) . Ungoverned , a truck would only go 120 - 150 kmh before it hit redline at top gear . By comparison , a car needs a decent bit of clutch slipping to get going in first gear which is good for 40 - 70 kmh , and can obviously reach far higher top speeds which are n't restricted by the gearbox , but by the engine not providing enough power to overcome air resistance past the vehicle 's top speed .

String theory and quantum loop theory are two different theoretical frameworks that scientists use to try to understand the fundamental nature of the universe.String theory is a theoretical framework that attempts to explain the fundamental nature of the universe in terms of tiny, vibrating strings. These strings are thought to be extremely small, much smaller than atoms, and they vibrate at different frequencies, which gives rise to the various particles and forces that make up the universe.Quantum loop theory, on the other hand, is a theoretical framework that attempts to explain the fundamental nature of the universe in terms of loops, or paths, that particles can take through space and time. In this theory, these loops are thought to be made up of fundamental building blocks called

theory is based on the idea of one-dimensional strings, while quantum loop theory is based on the idea of two-dimensional loops. Another key difference is that string theory is based on the idea of a single, unified theory that can explain all the forces and particles in the universe, while quantum loop theory is based on the idea of multiple, interconnected theories.It's worth noting that both of these theories are still very much in the realm of speculation and are not yet fully understood or proven. However, they represent some of the most promising candidates for a "theory of everything" - a single, unified theory that can explain all the fundamental forces and particles in the universe.

Google Voice Search is a feature of Google that allows users to use voice commands to search the internet, access information on their device, and perform various tasks. For example, you can say "Ok Google, what's the weather today?" and Google Voice Search will display or speak the current weather forecast for your location.Google Voice Search is available on a variety of devices, including smartphones, tablets, and computers, as long as they have access to the internet and the Google app or Google Chrome browser. It is also available on smart home devices such as Google Home and Nest Hub, which are specifically designed to be controlled by voice commands. To use Google Voice Search, you need to have a Google account and have the feature enabled on your device.

In the UK , for people in employment , we pay about 12 % of our income in National Insurance . Our employers pay another 13.8 % contribution . This pool of money goes to pay for healthcare for all . Actually , it 's not really that straightforward as National Insurance pays for a bunch of things like the state pension and other benefits and the majority of the cost of the National Health Service actually comes from general taxation . Regardless of where the money actually comes from , we all pay into a big pot and get healthcare when we need it . The level of care you receive is n't based on an ability to pay . You earn more , you pay more

in tax , but you receive the same level of care regardless . There are some exceptions - not everything is free at the point of need . We pay a flat fee for all prescriptions and a lot of dentistry is privatised these days . You can opt to pay for private treatment . You still have to pay for the NHS ( you ca n't opt out ) and virtually all complex ( ergo expensive ) treatment is conducted by the NHS . The advantage of this single - payer system is that the one big health provider has immense buying power so benefits from economies of scale . As the only game in town , pharmaceutical companies and even individual doctors , can not sell

their products and services to the highest bidder , they either trade with the NHS or do n't deal at all . The disadvantage of this system is that you ca n't really jump the queue by paying more ( okay , you can to an extent but not really for anything substantive ) so , if you 're in that financial position you might not favour such a system . Furthermore , policy decisions are taken in the best interests of users overall . This can mean that some very expensive treatments are n't purchased by the NHS as it 's determined in a cost / benefit analysis to be an inefficient use of finite resources . Think of the Federal Reserve literally as the economy 's heart . The Fed controls the circulation of the money supply - eventually it all passes through the Fed . When times are tough the Fed increases blood pressure by printing more money ( more blood ) and circulating it around . If the economy starts hyperventilating and overheating from too much growth the Fed will reduce blood pressure by taking money out of circulation . The Fed introduces money by buying bonds , reducing interest rates , and reducing the reserve ratio banks are required to have on hand in cash . The Fed can also " print " money by making new loans , sometimes for huge amounts , to institutions either for free or extremely cheaply . It reduces the money supply by selling bonds , increasing interest rates , and increasing the reserve ratio . This is a delicate process and can lead to inflation if too much money is introduced too quickly or when it is not needed . If too much money is taken OUT of the economy , or if it is taken out too quickly , it could backfire and cause recession and deflation .

When you have boogers in your nose, you can't smell them because they are inside your body. Your nose is connected to your brain by a part of your nervous system called the olfactory nerve, which is responsible for your sense of smell. When you breathe in through your nose, the olfactory nerve sends a message to your brain that tells you what you are smelling. However, if something is inside your body, like boogers in your nose, the olfactory nerve cannot detect it because it is not in the air that you are breathing in. That's why you can't smell boogers in your nose.

An artificial neuron is a mathematical function conceived as a model of biological neurons, a neural network. Artificial neurons are elementary units in an artificial neural network. The artificial neuron receives one or more inputs (representing excitatory postsynaptic potentials and inhibitory postsynaptic potentials at neural dendrites) and sums them to produce an output (or activation, representing a neuron's action potential which is transmitted along its axon). Usually each input is separately weighted, and the sum is passed through a non-linear function known as an activation function or transfer function[clarification needed]. The transfer functions usually have a sigmoid shape, but they may also take the form of other non-linear functions, piecewise linear functions, or step functions. They are also often  monotonically increasing, continuous, differentiable and bounded. Non-monotonic, unbounded and oscillating activation functions with multiple zeros that outperform sigmoidal and ReLU like activation functions on many tasks have also been recently explored. The thresholding function has inspired building logic gates referred to as threshold logic; applicable to building logic circuits resembling brain processing. For example, new devices such as memristors have been extensively used to develop such logic in recent times.The artificial neuron transfer function should not be confused with a linear system's transfer function.Artificial neurons can also refer to artificial cells in neuromorphic engineering (see below) that are similar to natural physical neurons.

Sure! Schrödinger's cat is a thought experiment that was created by a scientist named Erwin Schrödinger in the 1930s. It's a way of trying to understand some weird and confusing things about the way the world works at a very small scale, like the atoms and particles that make up everything around us. Here's how the thought experiment goes: Imagine you have a cat in a box, and there's also a bottle of poison inside the box. The poison is set up in such a way that there's a 50% chance it will break open and kill the cat, and a 50% chance it won't. You close the box, and you don't know whether the poison broke open or not. Now, according to the rules of the thought

kind of like a coin flip: while the coin is in the air, it's both heads and tails at the same time. It's only when you catch it and see which side is up that it becomes either heads or tails. This thought experiment is used to help explain some strange things that happen in the world of physics, like how particles can be in two places at once, or how they can spin both clockwise and counterclockwise at the same time. It's a way of trying to understand the weird and wacky things that happen at the very small scale, and it's a way of trying to make sense of some things that might seem impossible or confusing to us.

Sure! An operating system is a special kind of software that helps manage all the other software and hardware on a computer. It makes sure everything works together and communicates with each other. Linux is a type of operating system, just like Windows and Mac OS. One of the main differences between Linux and the other two is that Linux is "open source." This means that the source code (the instructions that tell the computer what to do) is available for anyone to view, use, and modify. This means that lots of different people and organizations can contribute to the development of Linux, and it can be customized for many different purposes. There are also many other types of operating systems in addition to Windows, Mac OS, and Linux. Some of these are designed for use on specific types of devices, like smartphones, tablets, or gaming consoles. Others are used for special purposes, like running servers or controlling industrial equipment.

When you use a fan, it doesn't actually make the air warmer. Instead, it makes the air feel warmer by increasing the airflow over your skin. When the air is moving, it can more easily carry away heat from your body, which makes you feel cooler. This is why using a fan can be helpful on a hot day. However, if the air coming from the fan is already cool, it will still feel cool when it reaches your skin, even if the fan is blowing.

Orange juice is often kept in the refrigerated case near the milk at the supermarket because it is a perishable product that can spoil if it is not kept cold. This is especially true for orange juice that is not made with preservatives, as it can go bad more quickly at room temperature. On the other hand, apple, grape, cranberry, tomato, and other types of juice are often made with preservatives that help to extend their shelf life. As a result, these types of juice can be kept on a shelf at room temperature without spoiling as quickly. It's also worth noting that orange juice is a popular breakfast drink and is often consumed chilled, so it makes sense to store it in a place where it can be easily accessed and kept cold. Other types of juice, on the other hand, may be consumed at any time of day and may not need to be kept as cold, so they can be stored on a shelf in the middle of the store.

A ZIP file is a way to compress and store a large number of files in a single place. Imagine you have a folder full of different kinds of files: pictures, documents, videos, etc. It might take up a lot of space on your computer, and it might be hard to send to someone else through email or upload to a website.A ZIP file is like a special kind of folder that can hold all of these files, but it takes up much less space on your computer and is easier to send to others. When you create a ZIP file, your computer looks at all of the files you want to include and figures out ways to make them smaller. It might remove extra spaces or other unnecessary information, or it might use a special kind of code to represent the data in a more efficient way. When you open the ZIP file, your computer can read the code and use it to recreate the original files.ZIP files are useful because they allow you to store and share a large number of files without taking up too much space or taking too long to send. They are also convenient because you can put all of your files in a single place and then easily send them to someone else or move them to another computer.

When a pigeon dies, it is usually taken away by other animals, such as birds of prey or rats, or it may be cleaned up by humans. In cities, there are often workers whose job is to remove dead animals from the streets. So, while it may seem like there are a lot of pigeons in a place like New York City, the population is constantly changing as some pigeons die and new ones are born to replace them.

Finland is able to provide free university education to its citizens because the government has made it a priority and has allocated sufficient funding to cover the costs. In order to fund this and other public services, Finland has relatively high taxes compared to some other countries. However, the Finnish government believes that providing free education and other public services is worth the cost because it helps to create a more educated and skilled workforce, which can lead to economic growth and a better quality of life for everyone in the long run. So, in a way, the Finnish government is investing in its citizens by providing them with free education. This investment is paid for through taxes, which are collected from people and businesses in Finland. By collecting these taxes, the government is able to fund the services and programs that it thinks are important for the country, such as education, healthcare, and social services. It's also important to note that free university education is just one aspect of the Finnish education system, which is consistently ranked as one of the best in the world. In Finland, education is highly valued and is seen as a right for all citizens, not just a privilege for those who can afford it. This commitment to education is reflected in the country's investment in its education system, which includes not just universities but also schools, teacher training, and other programs.

There is no specific "gun show loophole" in federal law that allows individuals to purchase guns without undergoing a background check. Federal law requires licensed firearms dealers, which includes those who sell guns at gun shows, to conduct background checks on all gun sales, including those that occur at gun shows.However, some states have laws that allow unlicensed individuals (people who are not licensed firearms dealers) to sell guns without conducting a background check. This means that in those states, it is possible for someone to purchase a gun from an unlicensed seller at a gun show (or elsewhere) without undergoing a background check. This is sometimes referred to as the "gun show loophole."It's important to note that this is not a loophole in the strict sense of the word, as it is not an unintended gap or weakness in the law. Rather, it is a result of the fact that federal law does not require unlicensed individuals to conduct background checks when selling guns.I hope this helps to clarify things. Paying for college has always been a challenge for many people, and it's true that taking out loans and accumulating debt has become more common in recent years. There are a few reasons for this.First, the cost of college has increased significantly in the past few decades. This means that even if people are able to save some money for college, it may not be enough to cover the full cost.Second, many people are not able to get enough financial aid to cover the cost of college. Financial aid can include grants (money that you don't have to pay back) and scholarships (money that you earn by doing something well, like getting good grades or playing a sport). In the past, it was easier for people to get financial aid, but now there is more competition for these resources.Finally, many people are unable to pay for college outright, either because they don't have the money saved up or because they don't have a high enough income to cover the cost. In these cases, taking out loans can be a way to pay for college, but it can also mean that people have to pay back a lot of money after they graduate.Overall, paying for college has always been a challenge, but it has become more difficult in recent years due to the increasing cost of college and the limited availability of financial aid.

So there 's two questions here : encryption and hashes . I 'll explain them both . If I tell you that a number divided by 12 has a remainder of 7 , you ca n't know for sure that the original number was 31 even though you know exactly what I did to get the answer . That 's because modulo ( getting the remainder of a division problem ) is a one - way function : there 's no way to get the original from the result . Hashes are all one - way functions . But unlike modulo division , the formula is so complex that we do n't know a way to find answers other than guess - and - check , and instead of twelve possible answers , there are something like 13407807929942597099574024998205846127479365820592393377723561443721764030073546976801874298166903427690031858186486050853753882811946569946433649006084096 possible answers , so checking different things to see if they give you the right hash is not feasible unless you have a few centuries . If someone does find a faster way to find solutions for a hash , we consider the hash " broken " and we switch to using a different algorithm- this happened to MD5 , for example . In the case of actual encryption , which is designed to be decrypted at some point , there 's a missing secret number from the formula that you need to do the decryption .

It can be helpful to hire a certified public accountant (CPA) to handle your small business taxes, especially if you are new to running a business or if you are unsure about how to file your taxes. An S corporation is a type of business structure that offers pass-through taxation, meaning that the business itself does not pay taxes on its income. Instead, the profits and losses of the business are passed through to the shareholders, who report this income on their personal tax returns. As a result, the shareholders are responsible for paying taxes on their share of the company's income.In an S corporation, the business must distribute its profits to the shareholders in the form of distributions. These distributions are not considered to be salary or wages, and they are not subject to employment taxes. However, shareholders may still be required to pay taxes on the distributions they receive, depending on their tax bracket and the amount of the distribution.It's important to note that S corporations are required to distribute profits fairly among the shareholders, based on their ownership stake in the company. This means that shareholders cannot choose to take larger distributions than their fair share, nor can they choose to receive no distribution at all if the company is profitable.If you are a shareholder in an S corporation and have questions about distributions, it's a good idea to consult with a tax professional or an attorney who can provide guidance on your specific situation.

There are actually several reasons why it might take several days to transfer money from one bank to another, even though the transfer is done electronically.First, when you initiate a bank transfer, your bank has to send a message to the other bank to let them know that they should expect a transfer of money. This message has to be sent through a network of banks and other financial institutions, which can take some time.Second, even though the transfer is done electronically, the banks still have to make sure that everything is correct and that the right amount of money is being transferred. This can involve checking with the person who is sending the money to make sure that they actually authorized the transfer, and it can also involve checking with the person who is receiving the money to make sure that they are expecting it.Finally, some banks have their own rules and procedures for handling electronic transfers, and these can sometimes add a little bit of extra time to the process.Overall, it's not really that the electronic transfer process is antiquated, it's just that there are a lot of steps that have to be followed to make sure that everything is done safely and correctly.

There 's no really profound difference . In both cases your browser requests data from a server . We usually call it " browsing " when the browser just shows you the content on the screen and then throws it away , and " downloading " when instead it saves it to a permanent file on the computer . Well , more or less , because the words are not used consistently . Like , for example , a lot of people in this discussion are using the word " download " to mean just a * transfer * of data over the network , regardless of whether it 's written to a file . Others are using the word " save " to include not just files that the user knows about , but also the browser cache — a set of files temporary that the browser creates behind the scenes so that it does n't have to request the same content over and over from the same server . Neither of those is either right or wrong ; the terminology for these things is n't super - standard , and the people who understand the details of how things work have no problem figuring out what is meant from context .

Canceling a stock order generally does not have a significant effect on the stock or the market. When an investor places an order to buy or sell a stock, the order is typically entered into a system that matches buyers and sellers. If the order is not immediately matched with another party, it may be placed on a waiting list. If the investor decides to cancel the order before it is executed, the order is simply removed from the waiting list and has no further impact on the market.In general, the effect of an individual stock order on the market is minimal, as the market is influenced by a wide range of factors such as economic conditions, company performance, and market trends. The overall supply and demand for a particular stock can have a more significant impact on its price.It's important to note that canceling a stock order can have financial consequences for the investor, as some brokerage firms may charge fees for canceling orders. It's always a good idea to carefully consider the implications of canceling a stock order before doing so.

Cancer is difficult to cure because it is caused by cells in the body that are growing and dividing in an abnormal way. These abnormal cells can spread to other parts of the body and form tumors, which can be hard to remove completely. Cancer can also be difficult to treat because it can come in many different forms and can affect different parts of the body. This means that different types of cancer may require different treatments. Another reason cancer is difficult to cure is because it can be hard for the body's immune system to recognize and attack cancer cells. This is because cancer cells can sometimes hide from the immune system or trick the immune system into thinking they are normal cells. Despite these challenges, researchers and doctors are constantly working to find new and better ways to treat cancer. They are making progress all the time, and many people with cancer are able to live long and healthy lives with the help of treatments like chemotherapy, radiation, and surgery. It's hard to say whether cancer will be cured in your lifetime, but it is possible that scientists and doctors will continue to make progress in finding new and better ways to treat and prevent cancer.

Someone has to hand out cash to the seller. Even if no physical money changes hands (and I've bought a house; I can tell you a LOT of money changes hands at closing in at least the form of a personal check), and regardless of exactly how the bank accounts for the actual disbursement of the loan, the net result is that the buyer has cash that they give the seller, and are now in debt to the bank for least that amount (but, they now have a house). Now, the bank probably didn't have that money just sitting in its vault. Money sitting in a vault is money that is not making more money for the bank; therefore most banks keep only fractionally more than the percentage

of deposit balances that they are required to keep by the Feds. There are also restrictions on what depositors' money can be spent on, and loans are not one of them; the model of taking in money in savings accounts and then loaning it out is what caused the savings and loan collapse in the 80s. So, to get the money, it turns to investors; the bank sells bonds, putting itself in debt to bond holders, then takes that money and loans it out at a higher rate, covering the interest on the bond and making itself a tidy profit for its own shareholders. Banks lose money on defaults in two ways. First, they lose all future interest payments that would have been made on the loan. Technically,

this isn't "revenue" until the interest is calculated for each month and "accrues" on the loan; therefore, it doesn't show on the balance sheet one way or the other. However, the holders of those bonds will expect a return, and the banks no longer have the mortgage payment to cover the coupon payments that they themselves have to pay bondholders, creating cash flow problems. The second, and far more real and damaging, way that banks lose money on a foreclosure is the loss of collateral value. A bank virtually never offers an unsecured "signature loan" for a house (certainly not at the advertised 3-4% interest rates). They want something to back up the loan, so if you disappear off the face of the earth they have a clear

claim to something that can help them recover their money. Usually, that's the house itself; if you default, they get the house from you and sell it to recover their money. Now, a major cause of foreclosure is economic downturn, like the one we had in 2009 and are still recovering from. When the economy goes in the crapper, a lot of things we generally consider "stores of value" lose that value, because the value of the whatzit (any whatzit, really) is based on what someone else would pay to have it. When fewer people are looking to buy that whatzit, demand drops, bringing prices with it. Homes and real estate are one of the real big-ticket items subject to this loss of value; when the average Joe

doesn't know whether he'll have a job tomorrow, he doesn't go house-hunting. This average Joe may even be looking to sell an extra parcel of land or an income property for cash, increasing supply, further decreasing prices. Economic downturn can often increase crime and decrease local government spending on upkeep of public lands (as well as homeowners' upkeep of their own property). By the "broken window" effect, this makes the neighborhood even less desirable in a vicious cycle. What made this current recession a double-whammy for mortgage lenders is that it was caused, in large part, by a housing bubble; cheap money for houses made housing prices balloon rapidly, and then when the money became more expensive (such as in sub-prime ARMs), a lot of those loans, which

should never have been signed off on by either side, went belly-up. Between the loss of home value (a lot of which will likely turn out to be permanent; that's the problem with a bubble, things never recover to their peak) and the adjustment of interest rates on mortgages to terms that will actually pay off the loan, many homeowners found themselves so far underwater (and sinking fast) that the best financial move for them was to walk away from the whole thing and try again in seven years. Now the bank's in a quandary. They have this loan they'll never see repaid in cash, and they have this home that's worth maybe 75% of the mortgage's outstanding balance (if they're lucky; some homes in extremely "distressed" areas

like Detroit are currently trading for 30-40% of what they sold for just before the bubble burst). Multiply that by, say, 100,000 distressed homes with similar declines in value, and you're talking about tens of billions of dollars in losses. On top of that, the guarantor (basically the bank's insurance company against these types of losses) is now in financial trouble themselves, because they took on so many contracts for debt that turned out to be bad (AIG, Fannie/Freddie); they may very well declare bankruptcy and leave the bank holding the bag. Even if the guarantor remains solvent (as they did thanks to generous taxpayer bailouts), the bank's swap contract with the guarantor usually requires them to sell the house, thus realizing the loss between what they paid

and what they finally got back, before the guarantor will pay out. But nobody's buying houses anymore, because prices are on their way down; the only people who'd buy a house now versus a year from now (or two or three years) are the people who have no choice, and if you have no choice you're probably in a financial situation that would mean you'd never be approved for the loan anyway. In order to get rid of them, the bank has to sell them at auction for pennies on the dollar. That further increases the supply of cheap homes and further drives down prices, making even the nicer homes the bank's willing to keep on the books worth less (there's a reason these distresed homes were called

"toxic assets"; they're poisonous to the banks whether they keep or sell them). Meanwhile, all this price depression is now affecting the people who did everything right; even people who bought their homes years before the bubble even formed are watching years of equity-building go down the crapper. That's to say nothing of the people with prime credit who bought at just the wrong time, when the bubble was at its peak. Even without an adjusting ARM to contend with, these guys are still facing the fact that they paid top dollar for a house that likely will not be worth its purchase price again in their lifetime. Even with a fixed mortgage rate, they'll be underwater, effectively losing their entire payment to the bank as if it

nervous; if people who did everything right are considering the hell of foreclosure and bankruptcy to be preferable to their current state of affairs, the bank's main threat keeping people in their homes is hollow. That makes them very reluctant to sign new mortgages, because the risk of default is now much less certain. Now people who do want houses in this market can't buy them, further reducing demand, further decreasing prices... You get the idea. That's the housing collapse in a nutshell, and what banks and our free market have been working through for the past five years, with only the glimmer of a turnaround picking up home sales.

Steering a rocket and steering a car are different for many reasons , but a big one is that the steering surface of a car is the front wheels , while steering a rocket happens with the ~~fins~~ engines , which are at the back . All corrections start from the back and correct it more than the front , which falls in line with getting pushed . Just like it takes practice to drive a RWD car without skidding in the rain , it takes some practice to control a rocket , but the shape is aerodynamically very stable . Generally, you can only deduct business expenses that are necessary and ordinary for your trade or business. In other words, the expenses must be common and accepted in your industry and you must have incurred them in order to earn income from your business.If you are required to purchase certain equipment or supplies as a condition of your employment, and your employer does not reimburse you for these expenses, you may be able to claim a deduction for these items. However, you must be able to show that the equipment or supplies are used exclusively for your business and are not for personal use.You may be able to claim a deduction for the cost of work-related equipment and supplies on your tax return by using Form 2106 (Employee

deduction for the portion of the expenses that is not reimbursed by your employer. If your employer reimburses you for the cost of the equipment or supplies, you cannot claim a deduction for the amount that was reimbursed.It's also worth noting that there are limits on the amount of unreimbursed business expenses that you can claim as a deduction. These limits are based on the amount of your adjusted gross income and the type of expenses you are claiming.I recommend consulting with a tax professional or reviewing the instructions for Form 2106 or Form 2106-EZ for more information about how to claim a deduction for unreimbursed business expenses.

These types of computers usually have two or more CPUs, which are the "brains" of the computer that handle all of the calculations and processes that the computer needs to do.However, multi-CPU desktop PCs are not as common in the consumer market, because most people do not need the extra power and performance that these types of computers offer. Instead, most people are happy with a single CPU that is fast enough to handle the tasks they need to do, such as browsing the internet, watching movies, and playing games.Additionally, multi-CPU desktop PCs tend to be more expensive than single-CPU computers, so they may not be as popular with consumers who are looking for a more budget-friendly option.

Sure! Most people have a dominant hand, which is the hand they use more naturally and comfortably for tasks like writing, throwing a ball, and picking up objects. It's thought that having a dominant hand helps us be more efficient at certain tasks, because our brains are better at controlling and coordinating the movements of the hand we use most often. As for why the right hand is more commonly dominant, it's not really clear. Some researchers think it might be because the left side of our brains, which controls the movements of our right hand, is usually responsible for things like language and logic, which are important for tasks that require fine motor skills. Other researchers think it might be because our ancestors used their right hand more often for tasks like hunting and tool-making, which helped their brains develop better control over the right hand. Ultimately, it's not completely understood why some people are right-handed and others are left-handed, or why one hand is more dominant than the other. But what we do know is that it's not uncommon for people to have a dominant hand, and it doesn't really matter which hand it is as long as they're comfortable using it.

Pricing is normally a function of supply and demand . In this case , the supply is the amount of available drivers in a given area , and the demand is the amount of people who need rides in the same area . Under normal conditions , the amount of available drivers willing to work for the standard price exceeds the amount of passengers looking for rides at the standard price , so riders who are looking for rides are able to be matched with an available driver . Sometimes , there are more passengers looking for rides at the standard price than there are drivers willing to pick up passengers for that standard price . That means there are long delays and people are n't necessarily able to get where they want to go for the price they 're willing to pay . To combat that , Uber creates surge pricing . The surge pricing does two things : First , it encourages more drivers to come out and drive ; more people are willing to accept rides if they get paid more to do it . Second , it makes fewer passengers look for rides ; more people will find other alternatives to Uber if the prices are higher . By increasing supply and decreasing demand , surge prices make it so that there are enough drivers willing to meet the demands of all of the passengers who are willing to pay the price it takes to get a ride .

The Turing test, originally called the imitation game by Alan Turing in 1950, is a test of a machine's ability to exhibit intelligent behaviour equivalent to, or indistinguishable from, that of a human. Turing proposed that a human evaluator would judge natural language conversations between a human and a machine designed to generate human-like responses. The evaluator would be aware that one of the two partners in conversation was a machine, and all participants would be separated from one another. The conversation would be limited to a text-only channel, such as a computer keyboard and screen, so the result would not depend on the machine's ability to render words as speech. Hairs on different parts of your body grow to different lengths because they are in different stages of the hair growth cycle. The hair growth cycle is made up of three stages: the anagen phase, the catagen phase, and the telogen phase.The anagen phase is the active growth phase, during which the hair follicle (the structure that grows the hair) is actively producing new cells that push the hair shaft (the part of the hair that you can see) upward. The anagen phase lasts for different lengths of time depending on the location of the hair. For example, the anagen phase for hair on your head can last for several years, while the anagen phase for hair on your arms and legs lasts for only a few months.The

A "circle jerk" is a term used to describe a situation in which a group of people engage in self-congratulatory or self-promotional behavior, often to the exclusion of others. The term is often used to describe online discussions or communities in which people only talk about themselves or their own interests, rather than engaging in meaningful conversation or debate.For example, if a group of people on a forum or subreddit only post about their own accomplishments or ideas, and do not engage with others or listen to other perspectives, it could be described as a "circle jerk." I do n't believe there are any molecular changes - just mixing . The pigments in the yellow paint absorb all visible wavelengths except for those around about yellow , which are reflected back to you . The pigments in the blue paint absorb all visible wavelengths except for those around about blue , which are reflected back to you . When you mix the two together , between the two of them , there are some wavelengths which both pigments will reflect back at you . This is the intersection of those wavelengths reflected by one of the paints and those reflected by the other paint . The frequencies which will be reflected back are those which come between yellow and blue in the spectrum - i.e. green . All other wavelengths will be absorbed by either the pigments in one paint or the pigments in the other .

There are a few different ways that companies can structure their initial offerings (IPOs) to make equity available to all investors. One option is to structure the IPO as a "democratic" or "inclusive" offering, in which all investors, regardless of their size or wealth, are able to participate on an equal footing.One example of an inclusive IPO is the recent offering by online retailer Slice Technologies, which used a lottery system to give all interested investors an equal chance to participate in the IPO. In this case, Slice made 100% of the shares in the company available to the public through the IPO, rather than reserving a portion of the shares for institutional investors or other insiders.Another option is to structure the IPO as a "dutch auction," in

a pro-rata basis. This can help ensure that the IPO is more widely available to a broad range of investors, rather than just being concentrated in the hands of a few large institutions.It's worth noting that these types of inclusive or democratic IPOs are relatively rare, and most companies choose to structure their offerings in a more traditional way, with a portion of the shares being reserved for institutional investors or other insiders. However, these alternative structures do offer an opportunity for individual investors to participate in the IPO process on an equal footing with larger institutions.

He is making homeomorphic , irreducible trees with ten nodes . It 's actually not a particularly difficult problem . Here is the simple explanation . These are trees . A tree is made of nodes connected together with something called ' edges ' , but I will call them lines . Trees have the property that they ca n't link back on them selves to make a loop , so triangles , squares , etc are all out . It has to only branch , although these ' trees ' can branch from any direction . These trees need to be irreducible , which is a fancy way of saying that no node can be connected with exactly two lines . They also need to be homeomorphic , which fairly simply means that the direction and length of the lines does n't really matter , so if you just flip one around , it is n't a brand new tree , it is just a different way of drawing the same tree . The problem which took them ' two years to solve ' was to find all of the possible configurations which follow these rules with ten nodes . By the way , there happen to be ten solutions .

There are a lot of reasons for this . One is that it 's not just cities that were target . Missile bases , airfields , bridges , power plants , bunkers , SAM sites ... there are lots of potential targets , depending on your targeting philosophy . The other is about reliability and accuracy . The US Titan II missile had a 9 megaton warhead , and had a circular error probable ( CEP ) of 900 m. That means it had a 50 % chance of landing within 900 m ( 1 X CEP ) of its target , 43 % chance of landing within 1800 m ( 2 X CEP ) , and 7 % chance of landing with 2100 m ( 3 X

CEP ) . Let 's imagine , just for kicks , that this weapon would work correctly 100 % of the time . If you needed 200 psi of blast pressure to destroy a point - sized target ( e.g. , something very small relative to 9 megatons ) , the chance that any given Titan II you launch will put that much blast pressure on the target is about 73 % ( this is the " single shot kill probability " or SSKP ) . That 's not too bad , but what if the target is _ important _ . How many nukes , then , do you need to launch to get that up to basically 100 % ? The math works out to two

Titan IIs . OK , what if the blast pressure we need is 1000 psi , for , say , a hardened , underground silo ? Your SSKP drops to 54 % . That 's a lot lower , but you still only need 2 missiles to get your total probability of kill up to about 100 % . These numbers can change a lot for weapons with different yields ( high yield makes it harder to miss ) , different accuracy ( higher accuracy means you can use lower yields ) , different assumptions about reliability ( in the above calculations , we assumed that 100 % of the Titan IIs we fire will actually behave as expected — if we drop that number to , say

, 90 % , then the probabilities of kill go down ) , and different assumptions about the target ( it gets more complicated if you need to put that amount of pressure down on a larger area , esp . for high pressures and low yields ) . The result is that it 's very easy to have targets that need 4 or 5 nukes per target to guarantee total destruction . ( If your requirements for total destruction are lower — e.g. 80 % probability — then the number of nukes decreases . ) Which is just to say — the assumption of " one nuke , one target " is wrong . Typically the assumption is that for some targets , many nukes would be

weapons , meant to be used against tanks and troops and bombers in the battlefield , not on " strategic " targets like cities or bases or whatever . So those have their own targeting considerations . [ Here 's a quick graph I made ] ( URL_0 ) showing US and Soviet strategic vs. tactical nuke warheads — the US certainly had a crap ton of strategic weapons ( over 10,000 from 1964 until 1991 ) , but those huge points of the stockpile were because of the bonkers - levels of tactical weapons ( +20,000 ) that they had . Ditto the Soviets .

A dredge is a machine that is used to remove sediment, such as sand, mud, and other materials, from the bottom of bodies of water. There are several different types of dredges, but most work by using a suction or pumping action to remove the sediment and deposit it in a separate area.One common type of dredge is a suction dredge, which uses a large hose to suck up the sediment and water from the bottom of a body of water. The hose is connected to a pump, which pumps the water and sediment through a series of pipes and into a hopper or barge. The sediment is then separated from the water and disposed of in a designated area, while the water is returned to the body

easier to remove. The suction system then sucks up the sediment and pumps it through a series of pipes and into a hopper or barge.There are also other types of dredges, such as trailing suction hopper dredges, which use a large hopper or barge to hold the sediment as it is being removed, and bucket dredges, which use a series of buckets to scoop up the sediment and deposit it into a hopper or barge.Overall, the basic principle of a dredge is to use a mechanical system to remove sediment from the bottom of a body of water and deposit it in a separate location.

In order to calculate your percentile for a test you need to know more information than just your score and the average . Say , for example , 100 people take a test . It 's possible that everyone gets a 50 and you get a 75 . That would put the test average at about 50 and you would be the 100th percentile , since you got the highest score . It 's also possible that one person gets a 0 % , the next gets a 1 % , the next gets a 2 % , etc . In this example , if you get a 75 , you 're only in the 75th percentile . You also need a piece of information called the standard deviation , which is a measure of how spread out the scores are . If it 's a really common test you might be able to look up standard deviations from previous years , but it would still only let you estimate your percentile . The only way to accurately calculate your percentile is to have every single test score , which is information only the body that issued the test has .

Area 51 is / was a military base in southern Nevada where the military tests / tested its latest and greatest military technology . Planes like the SR-71 Blackbird and B2 Stealth Bomber were tested here , before anyone had ever seen anything like these planes . Because of this , people would occasionally catch a glimpse of some new tech like this flying in the air , and be unable to identify what it was ( Unidentified Flying Object ) . Because the military was n't about to tell people what they were looking at ( Top Secret ) they made really bad / lazy lies about what these sightings were of ( weather balloons , swamp gas etc . ) . Because of how bad or boring these lies tended to be , many people assumed they were covering up aliens . The most famous event being the Roswell , New Mexico crash in 1947 . The government says it was a top secret surveillance balloon for Project Mogul meant for early detection of Soviet ballistic missiles . People instead preferred to believe it was an alien crash that the government covered up .

When you bite your nails and swallow them, they will pass through your digestive system just like any other food or drink that you consume. However, nails are not a source of nutrition, and they do not provide any benefits to your body. In fact, swallowing nails can be harmful to your health. Your digestive system is a series of organs that work together to break down the food you eat and absorb the nutrients your body needs. As the nails move through your digestive system, they can cause problems by scratching and irritating the lining of your digestive tract. This can lead to pain, discomfort, and even bleeding. Eating a lot of fiber, on the other hand, is good for your digestive health. Fiber is a type of carbohydrate that your body can't digest. It passes through your digestive system largely unchanged and helps to add bulk to your stool, making it easier to pass. This can help to prevent constipation and keep your digestive system running smoothly. So, while nails do pass through your digestive system just like any other food, they are not a healthy or beneficial thing to eat. It's important to take care of your nails and keep them trimmed to avoid the temptation to bite them.

Trailing 12-month total returns, or TTM returns, are the returns of an investment over the past 12 months. This measure is used to give an idea of how an investment has performed over a longer period of time, rather than just looking at its performance over a short period such as the past month or week. TTM returns are often used to assess the performance of mutual funds, exchange-traded funds (ETFs), and other types of investment products. To calculate TTM returns, you would take the current price of the investment and subtract the price from one year ago, then divide that number by the price from one year ago. The result is expressed as a percentage. For example, if an investment has a TTM return of 10%, it means that it has gained 10% in value over the past 12 months.

Former presidents are offered a state funeral , along with some other public officials . There 's a lot of tradition but relatively little legally defined protocol ; a lot depends on the wishes of the family . Generally there is a funeral procession in Washington , the body lies in state at the Capitol for people to pay their respects , and there is a funeral service usually at the Washington National Cathedral attended by government officials and foreign dignitaries , and maybe more services elsewhere . Then they are interred whey they or their family wish . In the olden days there would be a funeral train but nowadays it can be done in a single day . Most presidents choose to be buried at their Presidential Library or at Arlington National Cemetery if they 're eligible . Like I said , a lot of this is up to the individual and their family . Richard Nixon declined a state funeral when he died in 1994 .

Very simple version : Basically , nuclear material can self - sustain a reaction as long as it has sufficient mass and neutrons to start the reaction . Inside the bomb are groups of nuclear material , each group is not enough to self - sustain a reaction . When the bomb is detonated , chemical explosives compress the nuclear material together , which causes it to go " critical " and a chain reaction begins , rapidly releasing energy . The bomb contains a " neutron generator " element , which is exposed when the chemical charges are detonated . This is fuel for starting the reaction . ---- The simplest nuclear bomb can be made using a sphere of nuclear reactive material , formed around a neutron generator . A " plug " is taken out of the sphere , and placed into a barrel(like a gun ) . When the bomb reaches the proper height , the " plug " is fired back into the sphere , causing it to become a critical mass .

' Storing data ' really involves flipping some bits to be specifically 0 or 1 in some code that translates to what you mean . But those bits were already 0 or 1 before you did that , and they 're surrounded by other 0s and 1s , so to actually know where you wrote your stuff you store that information in an index . When you want to delete it , all that really means is deleting the index entry . The 0s and 1s are n't changed ... there 's no need , because the index entry is gone so you know you can rearrange them later if you want without messing up anything , and there 's nothing to gain by changing them right away

This is possible with special software , particularly if you want to just rewrite the information on the whole drive or similar . There 's some ( possibly negligible ) possibility that the changed bits could still be detected with sufficiently good tools as in the actual hardware they 'd look a little different to bits that had n't recently been modified , but this is at best a tiny effect that you can remove anyway by flipping them back and forth some more .

Entropy is the disorder of a system . The universe is moving toward more disorder , or entropy . What does " disorder " mean ? Well , chemical reactions that take place without any energy create more entropy , or chaos . For example , when you mix baking soda and vinegar , you do n't have to stir the mixture , or heat it , or even shake it , it just starts fizzing up and carries out the reaction . This reaction increases entropy . What used to be two orderly substances , the solid baking soda and the liquid vinegar , is now all over the place , broken into multiple parts of gas and liquid , and generally more chaotic . little computer inside of it that runs the programs you give it. Now, let's say you want to write a program for the robot that will tell you whether any other program you give it will run forever or if it will eventually stop. The Halting Problem asks whether this is possible.The answer is that it is not possible. This might seem strange, but it's because there are some programs that will run forever and some that will stop, but there is no way to know for sure which ones will do which without actually running them. This is called the Halting Problem, and it is an important concept in computer science because it helps us understand the limits of what computers can and cannot do.

America is a melting pot . It is not merely a collection of English settlers . Many of the more unique features of American English can be traced back to pronunciations made by people who did not have English as a first language . Most famous is probably the influence of Yiddish on the New York City accent , but across the US the non - English speakers impacted the way English was spoken . In addition , there was already at that time significant variations in English pronunciation on the British Isles . West End Londoners ( often the pronunciation we most readily associate with British English ) were not a grouping that was greatly represented among immigrants . Most immigrants came from poorer areas , such as Ireland and Scotland . This has also left a mark on the pronunciation of American English .

It is actually quite difficult to replicate the organ that allows fish to breathe underwater because it is a complex system that involves many different parts working together. The organ that allows fish to breathe underwater is called the gills, and it is located on the side of the fish's head. The gills are made up of thin, delicate tissue that is filled with tiny blood vessels. When water passes over the gills, the thin tissue and blood vessels allow oxygen from the water to be absorbed into the fish's bloodstream. Creating a device that can simulate this process and provide oxygen from water would require a lot of technological advancements and a thorough understanding of how the fish's gills work. Scientists and engineers are constantly working on ways to develop new technologies and devices that can help humans breathe underwater, but it is a challenging task. For example, some researchers are developing special masks that use a process called "rebreathing" to recycle the air that a person exhales and convert it into oxygen that can be used again. These types of devices are still in the early stages of development and are not yet widely available.

Pulmonary hypertension is a type of high blood pressure that affects the arteries in the lungs and the right side of the heart. It is a serious and often life-threatening condition that can lead to heart failure if left untreated.Symptoms of pulmonary hypertension may include shortness of breath, fatigue, chest pain, and dizziness. The cause of pulmonary hypertension is often unknown, but it can be caused by a variety of factors including underlying lung conditions, certain medications, and other medical conditions such as heart disease or sickle cell anemia.Treatment for pulmonary hypertension may include medications, oxygen therapy, and lifestyle changes. In some cases, surgery may be necessary. It is important to work closely with a healthcare team to manage the condition and prevent complications.

They can watch the game and see what is happening on the court, and they can also communicate with their teammates and coaches during timeouts and other breaks in the action.Overall, sitting on the bench in street clothes allows injured players to stay connected to their team and be a part of the game, even if they are unable to play.

Chemotherapy is a type of medical treatment that uses drugs to kill cancer cells. It can be a good option for treating cancer because it can help to shrink or slow down the growth of the cancer. This can give people more time to live and can also help to reduce symptoms caused by the cancer.However, chemotherapy can also have some side effects. Because the drugs used in chemotherapy are very powerful and can kill healthy cells as well as cancer cells, people who receive chemotherapy may experience side effects like nausea, vomiting, hair loss, and a decreased ability to fight off infections. These side effects can be unpleasant and may affect a person's quality of life.In the future, it is possible that researchers will develop more targeted and less toxic treatments for cancer that have fewer side effects. This is why some people may think that chemotherapy is something that future generations will wonder about. However, chemotherapy is still an important treatment option for many people with cancer and has helped many people to live longer and feel better.

When you sell a stock short, you borrow shares of the stock from someone else and sell them on the market. You then hope that the price of the stock will fall so that you can buy it back at a lower price and return the borrowed shares to the lender, making a profit in the process. However, if the price of the stock goes up instead, you may need to buy it back at a higher price, resulting in a loss.In this case, it seems that the price of TSLA has gone up, resulting in a loss for you. If you have borrowed the shares of TSLA from Schwab or another broker, it is possible that the broker is charging you interest on the money you received for selling the shares short. This is because you have essentially borrowed money from the broker in order to sell TSLA short, and the broker is entitled to charge interest on the borrowed funds.It is important to note that the terms and conditions for short selling and borrowing shares may vary depending on the broker and the specific circumstances of the trade. It is always a good idea to carefully review the terms and conditions of any trade before entering into it, and to consult with a financial professional if you have any questions or concerns.

I am not aware of any evidence of any western governments tracking ' illegal ' downloads . Most file - sharing is not ' illegal ' in the sense of committing a crime that harms society in general ( such as theft or assault ) . But it does breach copyright laws . Breach of copyright is a * tort * , a civil crime in which an individual who is wronged can sue for damages . In order to sue for damages , evidence that meets certain standards must be acquired . Large trade organisations , copyright enforcement groups and smaller security firms seeking to earn a quick buck monitor file - sharing downloads in order to obtain the details of participants .

Cosplay is also often done at events like conventions, where people come together to show off their costumes and meet others who are interested in the same things as them.

This comes up every once in a while , but there 's surprisingly little understanding of it . There are a few causes of the stability we feel when riding a bicycle . 1 ) Gyroscopic forces . Big wheels act as a gyroscope , and if you 've ever played with a child 's top , you know that spinning objects tend to remain fairly stable , and resist changes to the direction they are spinning in . However , you can build a bicycle with tiny wheels , and in particular , a second set of wheels spinning backwards , cancelling out the gyroscopic effects . And that bike would be perfectly stable . 2 ) Trail is another factor bike designers take into account when

talking about stability . Basically , trail is the measurement between the point the fork of the bike is pointing at on the ground , and the point where the tire actually touches the ground . With the tire touching the ground behind where the fork is pointing , the front wheel acts like a caster ( like the wheels on the front of a shopping cart ) . It tends to straighten out when moving forward . However , again , this is n't the full story . You can design a bike that has little to no trail , and that bike could still be perfectly stable . 3 ) Steering dynamics are probably the biggest reason , as far as we can tell . All

and the force on the tires . ) It 's not perfect , try riding with no hands , it 's quite easy to get out of control if you 're not careful , but as far as we can tell , this is the one crucial element for a stable bike . The Magna Carta was a document that was signed in England in the year 1215. It was an agreement between the king of England, King John, and a group of powerful noblemen. The Magna Carta was important because it established some basic rights and freedoms for the people of England. It said that the king could not just do whatever he wanted, and that he had to follow certain rules. Some of the things that the Magna Carta established were the right to a fair trial, the right to be protected from unjust punishment, and the right to own property. It also said that the king had to listen to the advice of a group of important people called "barons" when making decisions about how to run the country. The Magna Carta was signed by King John and a group of nobles. It has had a very big impact on history because it helped to establish the idea that even kings and queens have to follow the law, and that the people have certain rights that the government must respect. This idea has influenced the way that many countries around the world are governed today.

There are several ways you can potentially get a down payment for your next home:Savings: You can save up cash over time to use as a down payment. This can take some time, but it is a good option if you have the financial means to do so.Selling assets: If you have assets such as stocks, a car, or other valuable items, you can sell them to help raise the funds for a down payment.Borrowing: You may be able to borrow money from family or friends to use as a down payment. Alternatively, you could consider taking out a personal loan or using a credit card to cover the down payment.Using your current home as the down payment: It is possible to use the equity in your current home as a down payment on your next home. This is often done through a process called a "cash-out refinance." Essentially, you refinance your current mortgage and borrow more than the balance owed on the loan. The difference can then be used as the down payment on your next home.Keep in mind that using your current home as a down payment on your next home can be risky, as it requires you to take on more debt and leaves you with less equity in your current home. It is important to carefully consider all of your options and to work with a financial advisor or mortgage lender to determine the best course of action for your specific situation.

Turning on the air conditioning in your car does not cause the engine to use more gas. However, using the air conditioning does put an additional load on the engine, which can cause it to use more fuel.Here's how it works: when you turn on the air conditioning in your car, the air conditioning compressor kicks in and starts compressing the refrigerant gas. This process requires a lot of energy, and the engine has to work harder to power the compressor. As a result, the engine uses more fuel to produce the extra power needed to run the compressor.So, while turning on the air conditioning itself doesn't directly cause the engine to use more gas, the extra work that the engine has to do to power the air conditioning compressor does result in slightly lower fuel efficiency. However, this effect is usually small and most people won't notice a significant difference in their gas mileage when they use the air conditioning.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) is a stock market index that tracks the performance of 30 large publicly traded companies listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) and the NASDAQ. The DJIA is calculated using a "price-weighted" methodology, which means that the level of the index is determined by the sum of the prices of the component stocks, divided by a divisor. The divisor is adjusted in the event of certain corporate actions, such as stock splits or mergers, to ensure that the index level reflects the true market value of the component stocks.The price-weighting methodology used in the DJIA has the effect of giving higher weight to stocks with higher prices. The use of microchips in credit cards, also known as chip-and-pin or EMV (Europay, Mastercard, and Visa) cards, began as a way to improve security for card payments. Before chip-and-pin cards, credit cards only had a magnetic stripe on the back, which could be easily copied by fraudsters to create fake cards. Chip-and-pin cards, on the other hand, use a small computer chip embedded in the card to create a unique code for each transaction. This makes it much harder for fraudsters to create fake cards or make unauthorized transactions, because they would need to recreate the chip as well as steal the card.The idea of using microchips in credit cards originated in Europe in the 1990s, and the technology was gradually adopted by other countries around the world. In the United States, chip-and-pin cards were introduced in the mid-2010s, after the major credit card companies (Visa, Mastercard, American Express, etc.) decided to adopt the technology and set standards for how it would be used. The change to chip-and-pin cards was not mandatory, but many retailers and banks began to adopt the technology in order to reduce the risk of fraud and protect their customers.As for why chip-and-pin cards might be slower to use than traditional magnetic stripe cards, it's likely because the chip requires a little more time to process the transaction. However, the added security provided by the chip is generally seen as worth the slight delay.

Most people in the Netherlands speak Dutch as their first language, and it is the language that is used in schools, government, and the media. Some people in the Netherlands also speak other languages as a second or third language, such as English, German, French, Spanish, or Arabic.

Great question! It might be helpful to think about volume in a different way. Imagine a container, like a box or a jar. The container has space inside of it that can be filled with things like beans, water, or air. The space inside the container is the volume. Now, let's think about the lines and points that make up the container. The lines and points don't have any volume themselves, but they form the shape of the container. The shape of the container is what allows it to hold something inside of it, and that something is the volume. So even though the lines and points don't have volume themselves, they can help create a shape that has volume. Does that make sense?

First , there are many , many chemicals which react to light . Some change their shape , some produce an electric charge , some heat up , some go through a chemical reaction or become a catalyst for chemical reactions , etc . and reproduce better than near - identical cells that did n't . Over time , some multi - celled organisms started bunching these light - sensitive cells together and giving them structure , connecting them to nerve cells , creating lenses to focus the light , using chemicals that are sensitive to specific wavelengths instead of all light , etc . After a few billion years of trial and error and species thriving and competing and going extinct , you get eyes .

When you feel the urge to urinate, your body is sending a signal to your brain that your bladder is full and needs to be emptied. The bladder is a muscular sac in your pelvis that stores urine until it is ready to be expelled from the body. When you stand at the toilet and try to urinate, your brain sends a signal to the muscles in your pelvic area to relax, including the muscles that control the bladder. At the same time, the muscles in the wall of your bladder contract, pushing the urine out through the urethra (the tube that carries urine out of the body). Sometimes, when you try to urinate, the muscles in your pelvic area may not fully relax, or the muscles in

Color blindness, also known as color vision deficiency, is a condition that affects how people see colors. People with color blindness have difficulty seeing certain colors or distinguishing between certain colors, such as red and green or blue and yellow. This is because their eyes do not have certain types of cells called cones that help us see different colors. Most people have three types of cones in their eyes that help them see different colors. These cones are sensitive to red, green, and blue light. When light enters the eye, it passes through the lens and hits the retina, which is a layer of cells at the back of the eye. The retina has millions of light-sensitive cells called rods and cones. The rods help us see in low light and the cones help us see colors. In people with color blindness, one or more of these cone types is not working properly, so they have difficulty seeing certain colors. For example, if someone is red-green colorblind, it means that their red and green cones are not working correctly. This can make it hard for them to tell the difference between red and green, or to see certain shades of these colors. I hope that helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

That way a programmer could look through the lines of instructions that the system was running at the time of the crash and find the actual error . A kernel memory dump would be the same concept except that it would dump all of the info that the kernel had stored in RAM at the time ( since RAM is volatile and you 'd lose the data on reboot or loss of power ) . For 99.9 % of the population it would be meaningless gibberish but for the guys who develop the O / S , it 's like a road map to an error .

There are normally three key factors that define different kinds of loans, these factors affect the risk that the lender takes on and so the interest rate. The interest rate on any loan is linked to market interest rates; the lender shouldn't be able to receive a higher rate of interest for lending the money at no risk, and the level of risk that the lender believes the borrower to have. The three features of a particular loan are: These reduce the risk of complete or total non-payment (default) of the principal or any missed interest payments. Taken in order: Amortising Here some of the monthly payment pays a proportion of the underlying principal of the loan. This reduces the amount outstanding and so reduces the capacity for

default on the full principal as part of the principal has already been paid. Security In a secured loan there is an asset such as a car, house, boat, gold, shares etc. that has a value on resale that is held against the loan. The lender may repossess the security if the borrower defaults and recover their money that way. This also acts as a "stick" using the loss of property to convince the borrower that it is better to keep paying the interest. The future value of the security will be taken into account when deciding how much this reduces the interest rate. Guarantor A guarantor to a loan guarantees that the borrower will repay the loan and interest in full and, if the borrower does not

will give a different interest rate premium. This is mostly for business reasons, and the shape of their loan book, that are too tedious to go through here. All in all the different types of loan give flexibility at the cost of a different interest rate. If you don't want the chance of your car being repossessed you don't take a secured loan, if you have a family member who can help and doesn't mind taking on your risk take a guaranteed loan.

It was one of the 12 amendments that were proposed to the states at that time, but it was not ratified until 1992, more than 200 years later. The 27th Amendment, also known as the Congressional Pay Amendment, prohibits Congress from giving itself a pay raise or decreasing its pay during the current term of office. It states that any change in congressional pay must take effect only after the next general election.

Black Friday is a day when many retailers offer special sales and discounts to help kick off the holiday shopping season. It's called Black Friday because it's typically the day when retailers start to "turn a profit," or go "into the black," after being "in the red" (meaning they've been losing money) for most of the year. While it's true that Black Friday can be a very profitable day for retailers, there are a few reasons why they might not offer special deals and discounts more often than once a year: 1. Limited supply: Many retailers have a limited supply of the items they are discounting on Black Friday. If they offered the same discounts more frequently, they might run out of stock or be unable to make

the items they will be discounting. If they offered discounts more frequently, they might not have enough time to plan and prepare. Overall, Black Friday is a way for retailers to drive traffic to their stores and websites, and generate a lot of revenue in a short period of time. However, it's just one part of their overall business strategy and they have to consider a variety of factors when deciding how and when to offer special deals and discounts.
