The phenomenon you 're hearing as a siren changes pitches while passing you at high speed is called the Doppler effect . Think of sound as a bunch of waves , because it is , and when a sound - emitting object is traveling quickly towards you , those waves are more smushed together , creating a higher pitch . After the object ( a siren , train , whatever ) passes you , it 's now moving at a high rate of speed away from you , and the sound waves that hit your ears are more spread out , resulting in a lower pitch .

Protein folding is a natural process that happens inside cells , so scientists are really interested in it , because if they can understand everything that happens during protein folding , they get a much better view of how our body works in general . The problem is that protein folding is really really really complex . The best that we can do for now is computer simulations of it , which of course are very hard to compute and require lots of computer power to do . Folding@home is the best solution to this problem where they need lots of computer power , but do n't have a supercomputer running full time to help . The people who run the project divide the big problem into many smaller sub - problems , and distribute it to many voluntary participants . When you take part in it , your computer receives one of these problems to crack , and does it . Then it sends the solution back . The more people participating , the more little pieces of the puzzle are solved , and the closer the scientists are to having a better understanding of how protein folding works .

When two mirrors face each other, the light that is reflected back and forth between the mirrors creates an infinite number of reflections. As the light bounces back and forth, it becomes weaker and weaker, causing the image to become dimmer and less clear. Additionally, the light waves that are being reflected between the mirrors can become slightly distorted, which can cause the colors in the image to shift and appear tinted. In the case of the cat picture you provided, the green tint is likely caused by the light reflecting off the mirrors and becoming distorted as it travels back and forth between the mirrors.

Finding the Subject Zero can also help experts track the origins of the virus or disease and determine where it came from. This information can be used to develop treatments and possibly a cure. In the case of HIV, it is difficult to find the Subject Zero because HIV has been around for a long time and has affected many people. Additionally, HIV is transmitted through certain bodily fluids, so it can be difficult to determine how someone was infected and who might have infected them. Even though we haven't been able to find the Subject Zero for HIV, researchers and doctors have still been able to develop treatments that can help people with HIV live longer, healthier lives.

Telomeres are extra bits of dna attached to the main DNA in every cell . When a cell replicates itself a small bit of the telomere is used each time . Thus a cell can replicate itself only a certain number of times . Once the telomere runs out the cell can no longer replicate . Certain cells do not need telomeres ; like cancer cells and stem cells . They will never stop replicating . And it is also theorised that one of the reasons that cloned animals die early is because the cell used to clone them has a short telomere since the cell has already replicated many times over in the donor animal . And basically the cloned animal starts of with a shortened telomere .

A stock split is where a company 's stock price is cut in half and those who hold shares get double what they had . So say I have 100 shares of a stock at $ 100 / share . After a stock split , I now have 200 shares at $ 50 / share The total value of my holdings did not change at all . So why do stock splits happen ? Before the split , the smallest unit of value you could buy or sell of the company was $ 100 , which can be unwieldly . Now that stocks are $ 50 a share , trade can happen more fluidly . If a very successful company 's stock never split , it might be worth thousands of dollars a share in the long term ... making trading it very cumbersome .

When you delete a file on a computer, it doesn't actually disappear right away. Instead, the computer just marks the space that the file was using as available for new data to be written to it. The file's contents are still there on the hard drive, but the computer doesn't know how to find it anymore.There are ways to recover deleted files, but it's not always easy. It's often possible to use special software to scan the hard drive and find the deleted file's data. However, the longer you wait and the more you use the computer, the harder it becomes to recover the deleted file, because the computer may have already written new data over the old data.To truly make information irrecoverable, you would need to completely destroy the hard drive. This could be done by physically smashing it, melting it, or using strong magnets to erase the data. However, these methods would also destroy the hard drive, so it wouldn't be usable anymore.

Human blood and animal blood are made up of many of the same substances, such as water, proteins, and minerals. However, there are some differences between the two. One of the main differences is the type of cells that are found in the blood. Human blood contains red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets. These cells help to transport oxygen, fight off infections, and help with blood clotting. Animal blood also contains these types of cells, but the exact types and numbers of cells can vary depending on the species of animal. Another difference between human and animal blood is the presence of certain proteins and antibodies. These proteins and antibodies help to protect the body from infections and diseases. Humans and animals have different immune systems, so their blood will have different proteins and antibodies to protect against different types of infections and diseases. Because of these differences, it is not safe to use animal blood as a substitute for human blood in medical procedures, such as blood transfusions. It is important to use the correct type of blood for each person to ensure that their body is able to properly use and benefit from the blood.

> There is a lot of confusion as to why a president could win a Nobel Peace Prize into their first year in office . It is especially confusing when there are so many people around the world who are dying for peace , and have arguably made a greater impact . > * * Contrary to popular belief , Obama was * not * awarded the Prize due to him being elected as a black president and people getting " caught up in the moment " . It had a lot to do with what he * said * and * did * leading up to October 2009 . We must look at the Norwegian Nobel Committee 's reasons in order to understand why he won .

* * > The Norwegian Nobel Committee says that they gave him the prize * * " for his extraordinary efforts to strengthen international diplomacy and cooperation between peoples . " * * What are they referring to here ? It takes several months for Nobel Committee Members to write up a report to nominate and select someone for the Prize . Obama gave a very important speech to Egyptians ( called " A New Beginning " ) in June 2009 at Cairo University . He was selected in October 2009 . So the Cairo speech had a lot to do with what they refer as " international diplomacy and cooperation between peoples " . > How did " A New Beginning " foster international diplomacy and cooperation

? After 9/11 and the prolonged Iraq War , one of the most hostile relationships in politics was between the United States and the Arab World . The Israel / Palestine issue is one of the most difficult problems to solve . Egypt is the largest Arab country , and seen as the centre of the Arab world and influential in the outcome of Israel / Palestine peace . So Obama shot for the stars . He went to Egypt to try to ease US - Arab tensions , and kick off a strong Israel / Palestine peace process . > But there 's more ! In the past , American presidents have used very strong , unapologetic language , like that of President George W. Bush .

In " A New Beginning " , Obama did n't do that . His speech was one of mutual respect , something an American president has n't done in a long , long time . > He also quoted from the Quran ! But so what ! What does that mean anyway ? Well , the concept of recognition is crucial toward building trust . By quoting from the Quran , Obama is implying that he * recognizes * Islam and respects it . Respect is the first step toward peace as it opens up diplomacy . > The Norwegian Nobel Committee also said that Obama 's * * " vision of and work for a world without nuclear weapons " * * was a reason . This

is not particularly important because a lot of presidents have talked about reducing nuclear stockpiles internationally . Particularly , in 1991 , there was a treaty called START which started this process . The Nobel Committee saw that Obama was taking this * even further * . He started writing and talking about a new START treaty to reduce nuclear weapons even before his " A New Beginning " speech in June , so the Nobel Committee had a lot of time to consider it . If Obama let the last treaty expire in 2012 , more nuclear weapons would spread around the world . Although he criticized Iran here , he was sure to be fair . And his efforts to be fair were astounding : he

admitted that the United States overthrew a democratically elected leader in 1953 , which was very fair . The Nobel Prize committee saw this as him being the " bigger man " about the problem . > Also , the Norwegian Nobel Committee said he got the prize because as a result of his speech , * * " democracy and human rights are to be strengthened " * * . Obama talked a lot in Cairo about human rights , religious freedom , and the rights of women in his speech . And in Hosni Mubarak 's front door step as well ! That takes nerve . Did his speech have an impact on the Arab Spring ? Certainly . The Egyptian youth were listening to this

speech . They wanted democracy before Obama came in , but Obama 's speech gave them support . Obama did n't create the Arab Spring by any means , but it helped a little and set the tone in the Arab world : an American supports and respects Muslims , so how bad could democracy be ? The Norwegian Nobel Committee certainly did n't predict that this would lead to the Arab Spring , but as a group of politicians and students of international relations and political science , they sure understand the impacts that such a speech could have . The Norwegian Nobel Committee also felt that Obama is helping the USA play " a more constructive role in meeting the great climatic challenges the world is

confronting " . There is very little evidence of Obama addressing climate change in time of the October 2009 decision , but by September , Obama proposed new regulations on industry polluters to curb emissions -- something George W. Bush would n't have done , or did n't do . He strengthened the EPA . > Although not directly mentioned by the Committee , Obama also launched the debate on better healthcare in 2009 , and talked strongly about closing Guantanamo Bay and ending the Iraq War . > Herein lies the problem of giving the award to Obama for many people . Before ending the Iraqi war , the war was scaled up . Indefinite detentions were scaled up by 2012 , not retracted . And the

Obama administration took up a smaller role on renewing the Kyoto Protocol than many had expected . Although Obama did * * a lot more for global diplomacy and democracy by October 2009 than many presidents in their entire term * * ( which the Norwegian Nobel Committee noticed ) , in retrospect of three years , a lot of this has been undone by drone strikes , the relative failures of the Copenhagen summit on climate change , and the passing of the National Defence Authorization Act . This is why people like to wait before awarding a Nobel Prize , and why there was criticism . > * * TL;DR : The fact that he 's black and liberal usually overshadows Obama 's achievements up to

October 2009 , when he was selected . The truth is that he has done a lot of good in the international community through his speech in Cairo , ratcheting up the reductions of US / Russia nuclear stockpiles , and scaling up emissions regulations through the EPA . A lot of other Peace Prize winners did a lot more in earning their Peace Prize , but some others have done a lot less than Obama to earn their 's . * * > * * EDIT :* * People will inevitably want an analysis on the individual views and biases of those individuals on the Norwegian Nobel Committee . This does n't mean much because it 's speculative , and the Committee members have no reason to

lie in their original report , but lets take a look . > * * Chairperson Thorbjørn Jagland * * is a politician for the Norwegian Labour Party . If he had it his way , the EU would 've beat out Obama . > * * Deputy Chairperson Kaci Kullmann Five * * is a politician for the Norwegian Conservative Party . This is an ELI5 answer , so some details are left out and there are lots of simplifications . At the atomic level , pressure is atoms smacking into other atoms at speed , and bouncing off . Think of the Pressure as the sum of all the forces causing all the rebounds over an area divided by the area . Temperature is proportional to the velocity squared of the atoms as they move around so if you double the average speed , you quadruple the temperature . At the atomic level , the notion of friction really does n't exist , that 's really a macro concept that is usually due to many macro phenomena ( high points of one surface cutting grooves in other surfaces ,

adhesive forces , elastic deformation , etc . Actually friction is a tremendously complicated subject , but that 's OT ) which do n't really apply to individual atoms . At the atomic level there are only 4 forces ( gravitational , electromagnetic , strong nuclear and weak nuclear ) , and the rebounds are caused by the electromagnetic force . So take a bunch of slow moving atoms spread over space , attracted to each other due to their combined mass and gravity , think of them falling downhill to each other , picking up speed . As they go from a wide area to a much smaller area , they go faster and faster , and there are a lot more of them in a tiny

more fusions , and so on . As you might imagine , it takes enormous speed , and huge collision forces to get atoms to actually fuse , because their inclination is to repel each other . For all this to happen you need a truly enormous amount of particles . For instance , the Sun is as massive as 333,000 earths , so they have a whole mess of particles . In fact the Sun has been converting Hydrogen to Helium at a rate of around 600 Million tons of Hydrogen per second for billions of years now .

The instinct to writhe or squirm during intense pain or pleasure is likely related to the body's natural response to try to protect itself or cope with the sensations it is experiencing. When we are in pain, for example, our bodies may automatically try to move or shift in an effort to find a position that is more comfortable or to get away from the source of the pain. Similarly, during pleasure, our bodies may naturally respond by moving or writhing as a way to enhance or intensify the sensation. This can be seen in many different animals as well, and is thought to be an evolutionary adaptation that helps us to survive and thrive in the face of different stimuli.

The process for getting a drug approved by the FDA is complex and can take many years. Before a drug can be sold to the public, it must go through clinical trials to show that it is safe and effective. Even if a drug is effective at treating a particular condition, it may still have side effects. The goal of the FDA is to ensure that the benefits of a drug outweigh the risks, and that the drug is properly labeled with information about its known side effects. While it is true that some drugs can have serious side effects, it is also important to remember that many drugs have saved and improved the lives of millions of people.

Giant pandas are found in the mountains of central China, in the provinces of Sichuan, Shaanxi, and Gansu. They are native to a small region in the Sichuan Basin, which is located in the southwestern part of the country. Giant pandas are typically found at elevations ranging from 5,000 to 11,000 feet above sea level in areas with dense bamboo forests. They are mostly found in the Minshan and Qionglai mountain ranges, as well as in the Wanglang Nature Reserve and the Wolong National Nature Reserve.

Lawrence Joshua Chamberlain was a Union Army officer during the American Civil War. He is best known for his leadership at the Battle of Gettysburg, where he commanded a regiment of soldiers in the Union Army's Army of the Potomac.Chamberlain was born in Brewer, Maine, and graduated from Bowdoin College in 1852. He later became a professor at the college, but when the Civil War broke out, he left his academic career to join the Union Army. He was initially commissioned as a lieutenant colonel and eventually rose to the rank of brigadier general.At the Battle of Gettysburg, Chamberlain and his men played a crucial role in defending the Union Army's left flank on the first day of the battle. On the second day, Chamberlain led his regiment in a charge against Confederate forces, which helped to secure a Union victory at the battle. For his bravery and leadership at Gettysburg, Chamberlain was awarded the Medal of Honor.After the war, Chamberlain returned to his academic career, serving as the president of Bowdoin College for several years. He died in 1914 at the age of 85.

In Ontario, Canada, you may need to register as self-employed if you carry on a business. According to the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA), you are considered self-employed if you operate a business on your own, either as a sole proprietorship or as a partner in a partnership.If you are self-employed, you will need to register with the CRA as a business and obtain a business number. You will also need to file your business income and expenses on your personal tax return. In addition, you will need to pay taxes on your business income and may need to pay quarterly installments of your estimated tax.There are a few exceptions to this rule. If you earn income from hobbies or other occasional activities, you may not need to register as self-employed. However, if you earn more than $5,000 per year from your hobby or occasional activity, you will need to report this income on your tax return.It is important to note that the rules for registering as self-employed and for reporting business income and expenses can vary depending on the type of business you operate and your specific circumstances. If you are unsure whether you need to register as self-employed or have questions about your tax obligations as a self-employed individual, you should consult with a tax professional or the CRA for more information.

Cats purr by vibrating the muscles in their larynx (voice box) while they inhale and exhale. It is believed that cats purr as a means of communication, and they may do so when they are feeling content or when they are in need of comfort. Some experts believe that the vibrations produced by purring may have a soothing effect on the cat, helping it to relax and feel calm.Purring can also occur when a cat is in pain or distress, so it is not always a sign that a cat is feeling happy or content. However, in most cases, a cat's purring is a sign that it is feeling relaxed and comfortable.There are several theories about how and why cats purr, but the exact mechanism is not fully understood. Some experts believe that the muscles in the larynx are able to produce vibrations due to a special structure called the "pulsatile hyoid," which is a small, flexible bone located in the throat. Other experts believe that the muscles in the larynx are able to produce vibrations due to a special structure called the "cricoid cartilage," which is a small, flexible cartilage located in the throat. Regardless of the mechanism, it is clear that cats are able to produce a wide range of vocalizations, including purring, meowing, and yowling, in order to communicate with humans and other animals.

Another person asked a question about summarizing the whole Israeli - Palestinian conflict on ELI5 , so I 'm just going to copy and paste my response . Enjoy : There 's a region of the world now known as Israel and Palestine . At one point is was controlled by Jews and at another by the Arabs , with lots of intermediate controllers along the way ( Byzantines , Alexander the Great 's empire , etc . ) . In 1948 , the British , who had been the previous rulers of this region , along with a UN Partition Plan and Israel 's own declaration of independence effectively gave Jews control of a part of this region called Israel ( smaller than modern Israel ) .

The Palestinians got control over the other land in the region . ( Please note that there are some historians who will contend that there really was no major distinction between Palestinians and other Arabs until 1967 , but I 'm not going to go into further detail about that whole issue . ) OK , so it 's 1948 and each side gets land . Simple , right ? Of course not . Right after Israel was created , various Arab countries and Israel began fighting . The main issues behind this 1948 war were that the Arabs viewed Israelis as invaders and also that the disputed region could be taken over by neighboring countries . ( There was a realistic possiblity that if Israel was destroyed

, Gaza would go to Egypt and the West Bank to Jordan . ) Israel won the war and took over land previously belonging to Palestinians . So , Israel won . Fighting 's over right ? Of course not . In 1967 , Egypt and Israel were afraid of the other initiating war . Israel eventually fired upon the Egyptian military , sparking war . Long story short , Israel won , and took a lot of land from their neighbors , including parts of Palestinian territories . Israel also got the Sinai Peninsula . Sizewise , the conquests were bigger than the original size of Israel . 1973 : Arabs launch a surprise attack on Israel . Israel defends itself effectively , though it eventually agrees

to give up Sinai Peninsula . Intifadas ( 1987 - 1993 and early 2000s ): Palestinians undergo periods of intense resistance movements . Along the way , there 's just been a ton of violence on both sides . Israel has had its military bulldoze some Palestinian homes . Israel built a fence between the Israeli - Palestinian border , despite problems related to the fences location . Crossing the border is seen as intrusive by Palestinians wishing to cross the border or who live near the border ( though it has stopped some bombers ) . Also , whenver there is fighting , Israelis tend to kill more Palestinians than the other way around . Israel also has settlements in areas that appear to belong to the

Israelis , Palestinians , and other Arab countries all have done a terrible job with this issue . ) Also , both sides are concerned about being attacked by the other . All of these issues are , of course , made worse by religious claims to the same piece of land and viewing one 's own side as on a mission from god and the others as evil . * * TL : DR :* * This really long post only scratches the surface of what 's going on . Essentially , there has been a ton of past conflict and there are a lot of different issues that need to be resolved .

Short answer : videos use better compression techniques than GIFs . GIF was originally designed as a still image format , with the animation capability kind of shoehorned in later . Video uses compression techniques that were designed specifically for video . This means the file size of a GIF is much bigger than an equivalent video ( often 5x to 10x bigger ) , so it takes much longer to download . Long answer : Think of a GIF like a flipbook . It 's a series of still pictures that when played quickly , look like a video . You need to download each one of those still pictures . Each frame is compressed , but little is done to take advantage of the fact that

one frame is probably very similar to the next frame ( there are some minor optimizations done though -- for instance if the background of a frame does n't change at all from one frame to the next , that background wo n't be sent to you every time ) . Video uses much better compression techniques . Each frame is compressed like in a GIF , but frames are also compared to the one before and the one after . Just like in a GIF , if the background does n't change it wo n't be sent to you every time . But there are also more clever things that can be done -- say a car is moving from left to right in your video .

Video compressors will basically say " hey that car that was over there in the last frame , just move it to the right 5 pixels " . So you take the image of the car you already have , shift it to the right , and that 's your next frame . GIF ca n't do this . Since a lot of video consists of smooth motion similar to this , videos compress very well . This is called [ motion compensation ] ( URL_0 ) . There are a number of other issues at play here too : * The compression technology used by GIF is far older than modern video compression , so that the compression achieved by each individual frame is better with modern

Computer viruses are programs that are designed to spread from one computer to another and disrupt the normal functioning of computer systems. Some people create computer viruses with the intention of causing harm or mischief, while others do it as a form of protest or to draw attention to a particular issue. In some cases, people may create viruses for personal gain, such as to steal sensitive information or to extort money from people. It is difficult to say why exactly people create viruses, as the motivations can vary. Some people may do it for the challenge or because they enjoy the feeling of power it gives them. Others may do it out of anger or revenge, or to cause harm to specific individuals or organizations. Regardless of the reasons, creating and distributing computer viruses is generally considered to be a harmful and illegal activity, as it can cause significant damage to computer systems and disrupt the normal functioning of the internet. It is important to be cautious when using the internet and to take steps to protect your computer from viruses.

Race and gender are two different things, and people's experiences of them can be very different. Gender is about who a person feels like they are inside, and it can be different from the sex they were assigned at birth. Race is about a person's physical characteristics, like the color of their skin, the shape of their eyes, and the texture of their hair. These characteristics are often inherited from a person's parents, and they cannot be changed. People can choose to identify with a different gender than the one they were assigned at birth, but they cannot choose to be a different race because it is not something that they can change.

Bullets are deadly because they are small and fast-moving objects that can cause a lot of damage when they hit a person's body. When a bullet hits a person, it can cause serious injury or death by damaging vital organs, breaking bones, and causing bleeding. The speed of a bullet is what makes it so dangerous. A bullet can travel at speeds of up to 1,500 feet per second, which is faster than the speed of sound. When a bullet hits a person's body, the force of the impact can be devastating, especially if it hits a vital organ like the heart or brain. So even though a bullet may be small, it can do a lot of damage because of its speed and the force of the impact. That's why it is important to be careful when handling guns and to make sure that they are used safely.

Fantasy American football is a game in which participants act as the general manager of a virtual football team. These teams are composed of real NFL players, and the participants compete against one another based on the statistical performance of those players in actual NFL games.The goal of fantasy football is to score more points than your opponents. Points are typically scored by touchdowns, field goals, and extra points scored by the players on your team, as well as by yardage gained and other statistical achievements.To participate in a fantasy football league, you typically need to draft a team of players and then make strategic decisions throughout the season about which players to start and which to bench. You may also need to make trades with other participants in order to improve your team's performance. The participant whose team performs the best over the course of the season is usually crowned the winner.

It's generally not a good idea to base your business decisions solely on the corporate tax rate of a particular country. Instead, you should consider a range of factors, such as the overall business environment, the availability of skilled labor, access to markets, and the cost of doing business.That being said, some countries do have lower corporate tax rates than others. For example, as of 2021, the corporate tax rate in the United Arab Emirates is 0%, while the rate in Hong Kong is 16.5%. However, it's important to note that these countries may have other requirements or restrictions that could impact your business.It's also worth noting that many countries have tax treaties with one another that can affect the rate of tax that a business pays. For example, if your business is based in one country but generates income in another, you may be able to take advantage of a tax treaty to reduce your overall tax burden.Ultimately, the best country for you to set up your business will depend on your specific needs and circumstances. It's a good idea to consult with a professional, such as a lawyer or an accountant, to help you make the right decision for your business.

Through evolution . Darwin did n't come up with that idea , he came up with natural selection to explain how it happened . The idea of evolution has been around for thousands of years . Darwin 's own grandfather studied evolution . Before Darwin the main idea to explain evolution was Larmarckism . Lamarack thought that organisms were more likely to pass on traits if they used them , and thus would develop new traits by trying to do something that they did n't have the trait to do , or was n't developed enough , and thus would also lose traits through not using them . It was quite advanced but mostly wrong , even though some of it is making a comeback today in current evolutionary theory .

Professional mathematician , here ! > I feel like surely mathematicians have discovered just about everything we can do with math by now . Heavens , no ! What you learn in school as mathematics is actually just a small * subset * ( and many say a very * boring * subset ) of what mathematics is generally . There are branches of mathematics that deal with things like studying the properties of prime numbers ( which is * one * element of a field called number theory , and is studied from a variety of different perspectives ) , or with understanding the behavior and structure of surfaces as you stretch or fold or manipulate them ( part of topology ) , or with understanding how

the solutions to certain polynomial equations can lead to beautiful links between geometry and algebra and even topology ( one aspect of algebraic geometry ) , or with understanding arrangement of objects that meet certain requirements of symmetry ( design theory , which is a subfield of combinatorics ) . In each of these fields , there are plenty of open questions . Some of them are technical and intricate-- you would need some serious background to understand the question itself . But some of the questions are easy to understand , but still a real * bitch * to answer . For instance , there 's the [ Collatz Conjecture ] ( URL_0 ) , which is straightforward enough as a problem ( do all positive integers

eventually settle into the 4 - 2 - 1 pattern ? ) . We do n't have a solution for the problem , and our toolkit for going after this sort of problem is n't very well - developed . It 's likely to remain an open problem for a while . Trick is , mathematics is the study of relationships and interconnections of ideas . Those ideas are often very carefully defined , but that care and precision allows mathematicians to bring a variety of tools to bear on those ideas . And ideas are ... well , ideas are everywhere . Somebody wondered what would happen if you brought mathematical ideas to bear on the Rubik 's cube . Or Sudoku . At a big math

sound higher. As the ambulance passes by you and moves away, the sound waves it is emitting are stretched out, which makes the pitch of the siren sound lower. There are many different Christian denominations, which can be confusing for people who are not familiar with Christianity. Here is a brief explanation of some of the main denominations and what distinguishes them: Roman Catholicism: This is the largest and oldest denomination of Christianity. Catholics believe in the Pope as the leader of the church and follow the teachings of the Bible, as well as the traditions and practices of the Catholic Church. Protestantism: Protestantism is a broad term that refers to a number of denominations that separated from the Roman Catholic Church during the Protestant Reformation in the 16th century. Protestant denominations include Methodists, Baptists, Presbyterians, and Lutherans, among others. Protestants generally believe in salvation through faith in Jesus and follow the teachings of the Bible. Orthodox

which they believe is another testament of Jesus Christ. Seventh-day Adventism: This denomination is a branch of Protestantism that was founded in the 19th century. Adventists follow the teachings of the Bible and believe in the second coming of Jesus. They also observe the seventh day of the week (Saturday) as a day of worship. Pentecostalism: This is a movement within Christianity that emphasizes the role of the Holy Spirit and the importance of spiritual gifts such as speaking in tongues and healing. A, E, I, O, and U are called vowels because they represent certain sounds that we make when we speak. When you say the letter "A," for example, you open your mouth and say a short, "ah" sound. When you say the letter "E," you make a longer, "eh" sound. When you say the letter "I," you say a short, "ih" sound. When you say the letter "O," you say a long, "oh" sound. And when you say the letter "U," you say a short, "uh" sound. Vowels are important because they help us make the words we use when we talk.

TOR, or The Onion Router, is a network that allows users to browse the internet anonymously by routing their traffic through multiple layers of servers, or "nodes," before it reaches its destination. This makes it difficult for anyone to trace the traffic back to the original user. However, TOR is not completely foolproof, and there are ways that an attacker could potentially deanonymize a victim using the TOR network. One way this could happen is if the attacker is able to compromise a node in the TOR network and monitor the traffic passing through it. If the victim is using a vulnerable device or operating system, the attacker may be able to exploit a security flaw to reveal the victim's IP address or other identifying information. Another way an attacker could potentially deanonymize a victim using TOR is by setting up a "fake" node on the TOR network and enticing the victim to connect to it. The attacker could then monitor the victim's traffic and potentially reveal their identity. It's important to remember that while TOR can help protect your anonymity online, it is not a guarantee of complete anonymity. It's always a good idea to use caution and take steps to secure your device and protect your personal information when using the internet, whether you're using TOR or not.

The prevailing view is that the states do not have the legal right to secede . The reasoning is this : The [ Articles of Confederation ] ( URL_0 ) , which were the governing rules of the United States before the Constitution existed , declared the Union to be " perpetual " - i.e. everlasting . The Articles of Confederation were replaced by the Constitution , and the Constitution does n't say anything like " perpetual " . However , it does say that its purpose ( in part ) is to make the Union more perfect . And the Articles of Confederation were not " the Union " ; the fact that they were replaced as the operating rules of the Union does not imply that

the perpetual Union was replaced along with them . In fact the Articles themselves , along with saying * the Union * is perpetual , say that the Articles can be replaced . Lincoln claimed " the Union " actually predates even the Articles of Confederation . He said : > The Union is much older than the Constitution . It was formed , in fact , by the Articles of Association in 1774 . It was matured and continued by the Declaration of Independence in 1776 . It was further matured , and the faith of all the then thirteen States expressly plighted and engaged that it should be perpetual , by the Articles of Confederation in 1778 . And finally , in 1787 , one of

the country , the Constitution was ordained " to form a more perfect Union . " It is difficult to convey the idea of indissoluble unity more clearly than by these words . What can be indissoluble if a perpetual Union , made more perfect , is not ? There has since been nothing contradicting that , and although there are of course people who want their state to secede , there has n't been any serious legal headway of any sort along those lines .

Some good answers here ; I just wanted to add that this evidentiary privilege belongs to and is intended to benefit the * client . * So s / he decides whether or not to waive the privilege in a given case . An attorney can not disclose protected communication / information without the client 's consent , regardless of whether he thinks its in his client 's interest , whether he thinks his client 's actions are morally reprehensible , etc . The only time an attorney can breach confidentiality is if his client has told him that he is going to commit a crime or hurt someone . The dimensions of this exception are very nuanced , and vary from state to state . Also , attorney client privilege persists even * after * the attorney - client relationship has ended . It can also arise * before * the attorney - client relationship starts , if a prospective client tells something to an attorney in the course of trying to secure legal counsel .

Motorcycle speedway is a type of motorcycle racing that is held on a flat oval track with steeply banked turns. The track surface is typically made of shale or clay, and the bikes used in speedway racing have no brakes and a single gear.Races, or "heats," typically consist of four riders competing over four laps of the track. The objective is to finish in first place in each heat, with the overall winner being the rider who accumulates the most points over the course of the event.Speedway racing is popular in countries such as the United Kingdom, Australia, and Poland, and is often held in front of large crowds at outdoor venues. It is also known as "grass track racing" in some countries.

There is a white paper on "The weekend effect of equity options" it is a good paper and shows that (for the most part) option values do lose money from Friday to Monday. Which makes sense because it is getting closer to expiration. Of course this not something that can be counted on 100%.  If there is some bad news and the stock opens down on a Monday the puts would have increased and the calls decreased in value. Article Summary (from the authors): "We find that returns on options on individual equities display markedly lower returns over weekends (Friday close to Monday close) relative to any other day of the week. These patterns are observed both in unhedged and delta-hedged positions, indicating that the effect is

interest that could drive the effect. We also find little evidence that weekend returns are driven by higher levels of risk over the weekend.  "The effect is particularly strong over expiration weekends, and it is also present to a lesser degree over mid-week holidays. Finally, the effect is stronger when the TED spread and market volatility are high, which we interpret as providing support for a limits to arbitrage explanation for the persistence of the effect." - Christopher S. Jones & Joshua Shemes You can read more about this at this link for Memphis.edu

Sometimes , it 's only a few people that get captured at a time . During capture , they 've probably had the shit beaten out of them which really reduces their will to try fighting again . Other times , the slaves are kept split up so they ca n't organize a revolt . It 's hard to start revolting when there 's only 5 of you in one place . In the earliest days of American slavery , they tried to keep slaves from the same parts of Africa separated . If the slaves ca n't talk to each other , it 's harder for them to plan a revolt . Even with all that , however - [ slave rebelions ] ( URL_0 ) have taken place in pretty much every society that 's had widespread slavery . They might not have been successful , but people will inevitably try .

If you don't have a lot of credit lines or a strong credit history, it may be more difficult to qualify for a traditional mortgage loan. However, there are still options that may be available to you. Here are a few options to consider:FHA loans: These loans are backed by the Federal Housing Administration and are available to borrowers with lower credit scores and down payments as low as 3.5%.VA loans: These loans are available to military veterans and their families and do not require a down payment.USDA loans: These loans are available to borrowers in rural areas and do not require a down payment.Non-traditional lenders: There are also non-traditional lenders, such as online lenders and community banks, that may be more willing to work with borrowers who have lower credit scores or less established credit histories.It's important to keep in mind that even if you are able to qualify for a loan with less than perfect credit, you may end up paying a higher interest rate. It may be worth working on improving your credit score before applying for a mortgage to get a better rate. This can include paying your bills on time, reducing your debt, and improving your debt-to-income ratio.

Most electronic devices, including cell phones, use lithium-ion batteries, which have a built-in mechanism for keeping track of their charge level. Inside the battery, there are tiny electrical components called "charge coulometers" that keep track of the amount of charge going in and out of the battery. When the battery is being charged, the coulometers measure the amount of charge going into the battery and store this information. When the battery is being used to power the device, the coulometers measure the amount of charge being used and update the stored information accordingly. The device's battery meter then uses this stored information to display the current charge level on the device's screen. So, the battery doesn't actually "put off" more energy when it is full. Instead, it is the coulometers inside the battery that keep track of the charge level and let the device know how much battery life is left.

To claim HST compensation on your personal income tax return in Ontario, you will need to file a tax return with the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA). Here's a general overview of the process:Gather your documentation: You will need to have your documentation ready, including any receipts or invoices that show the HST you paid. You may also need to provide proof of any credits or rebates you received.Determine your eligibility: To claim HST compensation on your personal tax return, you must meet certain criteria. For example, you must be a resident of Ontario on December 31st of the tax year, and you must have paid HST on eligible expenses.Calculate your claim: To calculate your claim, you will need to add up all of the HST you paid on eligible expenses during the tax year. You will then need to subtract any credits or rebates you received.Claim the HST on your tax return: When you file your tax return, you will need to enter the amount of HST you paid and the amount of credits or rebates you received. You will then be able to claim the HST as a tax credit on your return.Submit your return: Once you have completed your tax return, you will need to submit it to the CRA. You can do this online or by mailing in a paper copy.If you have any further questions about claiming HST compensation on your personal income tax return in Ontario, you may want to contact the CRA or a tax professional for additional assistance.

Well . Hm . Let 's see . Five . Right . So . Get a big sheet of paper and mark an X in the middle . That 's the origin , or point zero . Now , from this X you can draw arrows . You pick a direction and a length and just draw your arrow . These arrows are called * vectors * . Now , you can multiply an arrow with a number by making it longer or shorter , or even pointing it in the opposite direction ( as long as you do n't turn it around some strange angle ) . You can also add two arrows together . How ? Simple . Draw one arrow . Then draw another one

. Move the second arrow so that it starts where the first arrow ended . Then draw a new arrow from the X to the end of the second arrow . That new arrow is the sum of the two other ones . ( Try it , it 's very easy to do . ) Now , let 's talk about functions . These are mathematical machines that eat arrows and make new ones . If you feed it a certain arrow it spits out some other arrow . This function is not random . If you give it the same arrow twice , it will spit out the same arrow twice , too . There are very many possible functions . Now , a very important type

of function is called the * linear * functions . They have these two properties : 1 . If you multiply an arrow with a number and feed that to the function , the result will be the same as if you fed the first arrow to the function , and multiplied afterward . 2 . If you add two arrows and feed the result into your function , you will end up with the same as if you fed both original arrows into the function and then summed the results instead . Phew . So , even with these very stringent requirements , the amount of linear functions is still very large . Now , draw an arrow pointing straight right ( call it Righty ) and

one pointing straight up ( call it Uppy ) . Then draw any other random arrow . If you pick two numbers , multiply them with Righty and Uppy and then sum the arrows you get , you get a new arrow . Now , * * no matter what random arrow you just drew , there are two numbers that will make Righty and Uppy sum to that arrow . * * This is extremely important . It means that every arrow can be boiled down to just Righty and Uppy ! Now , take a linear function ( Bob ) and assume that we know what happens to Righty and Uppy if we feed them to Bob . Then , we know what happens to *

* any other arrow too * * ! Why ? Just find those numbers you need to multiply with , then feed Righty and Uppy to Bob , multiply with the numbers you have and sum ! Because of 1 and 2 above , this must work ! So all we have to know about Bob is what happens to Righty and Uppy . Righty and Uppy are called a * basis * , and our knowledge of what happens if we feed them to Bob is called a * representation of Bob in that basis * . We do n't have to choose Righty and Uppy , we can choose any other two arrows . They do n't even have to be the same length , or

have a right angle between them . If we just know how Bob works on Righty and Uppy , we know everything about Bob . Now , if we 're not terribly unlucky , Bob will have two * eigenvectors * with * eigenvalues * . An eigenvector is an arrow which , if we feed it to Bob , will come out somewhat longer or shorter , but still pointing in the same direction . That is , the arrow has been multiplied with a number . That number is called the * eigenvalue * . Every eigenvector has an eigenvalue . Now , like I said , assume Bob has two eigenvectors . Call these Victor and Vicki . Like Righty and Uppy , we can

Secular humanism is a philosophy that emphasizes the value and agency of human beings, individually and collectively, and generally prefers critical thinking and evidence (rationalism and empiricism) over acceptance of dogma or superstition. It is a naturalistic philosophy, meaning that it does not posit the existence of supernatural entities or forces.Agnosticism is the belief that it is not possible to know whether or not a god or gods exist. An agnostic person may believe that it is not possible to know whether or not a god or gods exist, or they may simply be unsure about the existence of a god or gods.Atheism is the belief that there is no god or gods. An atheist does not believe in the existence of a god or gods.So, secular humanism is a philosophy that focuses on the value and agency of human beings, and it does not posit the existence of supernatural entities or forces. Agnosticism is the belief that it is not possible to know whether or not a god or gods exist, while atheism is the belief that there is no god or gods.

Sure! When you write a program in a language like Java or C#, the code you write is like a set of instructions for the computer. But the computer can't understand those instructions directly, because it can only understand a specific set of low-level instructions that are built into the hardware of the computer.So, in order for your code to be understood by the computer, it needs to be translated into the low-level instructions that the computer can understand. This process is called "compiling" the code.When you compile your code, a special program called a "compiler" reads through your code and translates it into the low-level instructions that the computer can understand. These low-level instructions are usually called "machine code" or "assembly code."Once the code is translated into machine code, it can be run on the computer. The computer will read through the machine code instructions one by one and execute them, carrying out the tasks that you specified in your code.I hope that helps! Because there is strength in numbers . Most people would never be able to save enough to cover the costs if they actually get sick or hurt . So you get together with a bunch of other people and you all pool your money together and use that shared pot of money to pay the expenses if one of you getting sick or injured . For example , Jimmy pays $ 100 per month insurance premium , now he could take the $ 100 per month and put it in a savings account to pay medical expenses if he gets sick . A couple years later , Jimmy blows out his knee playing pick up basketball and has to have $ 40,000 surgery . Unless Jimmy has been putting $ 100 a month away for 33 years , he ca n't afford to pay for that surgery . Alright , so first we have to explain what the Libor is . Libor is short for " London Interbank Offered Rate , " and all that really means is " the interest rate banks charge each other when they lend one another money . " It 's a super important number because , even though it was n't originally designed to be , it 's come to reflect how much faith banks have in the stability of banking system as a whole -- and therefore it reflects on the interest rates everybody on earth can get . See , one of the most lucrative ways to make money in high finance is to do what is essentially fast and furious lending for huge sums of money .

So let 's say you 're Barclayss and I 'm Deutsche Bank . At the end of the day , you call me up and say " hey , you need any money this afternoon ? " and I say " yeah , I could use $ 20 million , that way I can make a couple of extra loans today . " You say to yourself " hmm ... Deutsche Bank is a pretty safe investment , so I 'm pretty sure I 'll get that money back " and you offer me an interest rate of 1%--meaning that I 'll repay you your $ 20 million plus 1 % . ( The actual lending is more complicated than that , but let 's strip it down

for our purposes . ) The way the Libor is calculated is literally with a survey that is sent out to the major banks in London with a couple of questions that basically all ask " on a normal day , how much interest would you charge one of your fellow banks if they required a loan of $ X ? " The group that sends these surveys out ( I believe there are 18 banks who receive them ) then does some calculations and comes up with what the " average rate " is . That rate is the Libor . Go back to our example for a second -- the one where you decided to give me a 1 % interest rate on that loan to

Deutsche Bank . The whole point of having a Libor is to simplify what would otherwise be a super complicated calculation in your head . Rather than you needing to see Deutsche Bank 's balance sheet every single time they come to you for money , you can look to the Libor rate -- let 's say on this particular day the Libor is at 0.95%--and you can be reasonably certain that that interest rate is fair and will sufficiently cover your liabilities . After all , the Libor is based on the stability of the banking system . But , and here 's where the scandal came in , sometimes it might be beneficial to have a higher or a lower Libor rate . Not so much

for the types of inter - bank lendings we were talking about a little bit ago , but for other transactions that use the Libor rate . And it turns out , because the Libor has such a broad , powerful , meaning , the Libor is used for EVERYTHING . And I mean EVERYTHING . Every imaginable loan -- whether in London or in Djibouti , is pegged in some capacity to the Libor rate . If you dig through your mortgage paperwork , you 'll find that even the loan you took out on your house here in the US is tied to the Libor . Let 's do another quick example . Say the city of Baltimore got a $ 10 billion grant from the

US federal government for ... whatever . Roads . They ca n't build $ 10 billion worth of roads overnight -- it could take YEARS to use all that money -- so why not put it to work ? Baltimore hires Deutsche Bank to manage the money until it needs it . Now , Deutsche Bank knows that $ 10 billion is a pretty hefty chunk of change , and they can get a 5 % return on it , so they give Baltimore a contract that offers 2 % interest above the Libor rate ( so basically 2.95 % ) . Now , what if Deutsche Bank could lower the Libor , just while Baltimore was in the process of signing ? Not much , of course

-- just enough to lower it to , say , 0.93 % . Because Baltimore 's investment was so huge , just those two - hundredths of a percentage points in difference is enough to make the bank $ 2,000,000 ! So what Deutsche Bank might do is call up Barclays and say , " hey , nudge the Libor down a bit ! " And remember -- all the Libor is is a survey ! it 's one person 's job to fill it out at each bank , so if you know his / her phone number or email address you can affect the whole Libor rate -- the lending rates for the entire world . And that 's basically what 's been going on .

is this : after this case is over and done with , the question is going to be what happens to Libor and whether huge investors like Baltimore can reclaim some of the money that they were " cheated " by this interest rate rigging . That tiny change made two million dollars worth of difference with just a $ 10 billion investment ; but there are nearly * * $ 400 trillion * * worth of loans out there right now that are pegged to the Libor . If Libor was compromised , * almost everyone on earth * is paying either too much , or getting too little , in interest .

In addition to what the other commenters have said , there are reasons for the blood - brain barrier that do n't have to do with disease . It does n't just keep disease out of the brain , it keeps the blood , and most things in the blood , out of the brain . That 's important , because the chemistry of your blood can change significantly and you do n't want that affecting your brain . You know how women who are pregnant or PMSing get " hormonal " and have personality changes ? Hormones penetrate the blood - brain barrier . Imagine if other chemicals in your blood did too : you 'd have a different personality based on what you ate for lunch that day . Eat a burger - suddenly you 're an asshole . Eat spaghetti - suddenly you 're really sad . That sort of thing . Even worse , what about the other parts of your brain ? Not just your personality , but your sensory areas and motor control and all that . You 'd get high , or go into a coma , depending on what you ate for lunch . In other words , you need your blood - brain barrier where it is , to keep your brain functioning the way it 's supposed to . Your blood - brain barrier is what keeps you you .

Its all in the brain . Why certain people feel more ticklish than others has got more to do with your brain than anything else . There are certain parts of the brain which control your reaction to a tickle . Its the same part of your brain which contrlos one 's reaction a cut or bruise , impending danger , etc . Generally speaking , people who react more to external stimulus are more ticklish . which is why women feel more ticklish than most men , children are more ticklish than adults and so on . Person who does not like to be touched will generally feel more ticklish than others . We ca n't tickle ourselves because our brain is controlling both , the movement of our fingers and our reaction to it . To feel ticklish the touch and movement has to be unpredicteable by our brain . More unpredictable the tickle , more tickish you will be . Which is why a blindfolded person will feel more ticklish . There are some more factors also . Like , the sensation can be greater if tickled by someone of the opposite sex , or less if when you are tired , and so on .

Ayn Rand was a Russian-American writer and philosopher who lived from 1905 to 1982. She is best known for her novels "The Fountainhead" and "Atlas Shrugged," which both explore the theme of individualism and the value of the individual.Rand believed that the individual is the most important unit of society, and that the pursuit of one's own happiness and well-being is the most important goal in life. She argued that people should be free to pursue their own interests and goals, and that the government should not be involved in controlling people's lives or telling them what to do.Rand also believed in the concept of "rational egoism," which means that it is rational for people to act in their own self-interest, as long as they do not harm others in the process. She argued that people should be free to produce, trade, and consume as they see fit, and that capitalism is the best economic system because it allows people to do this.Overall, Rand's philosophy promotes individual freedom and self-interest, and argues that they are necessary for human flourishing and happiness.

Microwaves and Wi-Fi use the same frequency band, around 2.4 GHz. This means that when your microwave is operating, it is producing electromagnetic waves at the same frequency as your Wi-Fi. These waves can interfere with each other and cause problems with your Wi-Fi connection.Imagine two people trying to have a conversation at the same time. They might not be able to hear each other clearly because their voices are competing with each other. It's the same idea with microwaves and Wi-Fi. When the microwave is on, it's producing a lot of electromagnetic waves that can interfere with the Wi-Fi signal, making it harder for the Wi-Fi to work properly.So, when you use your microwave, it can temporarily disrupt your Wi-Fi connection. However, once the microwave is turned off, your Wi-Fi should start working properly again.

Executing prisoners by gunshot to the back of the head, also known as a "firing squad," is not used as a method of execution in most countries because it is considered inhumane and a form of torture. In addition, there is a risk that the person being executed could suffer and experience a great deal of pain before they die.In many countries, the death penalty is considered a controversial and divisive issue. Some people believe that the death penalty is necessary in order to deter crime and protect society, while others believe that it is wrong to take a life, no matter the circumstances.Regardless of one's views on the death penalty, it is generally agreed that the method of execution should be carried out in a way that is as humane as possible and that minimizes the risk of suffering for the person being executed. Using methods such as lethal injection or hanging are considered more humane alternatives to a firing squad.

Inflation is the rate at which the general level of prices for goods and services is rising, and, subsequently, purchasing power is falling. Central banks attempt to limit inflation and avoid deflation in order to keep the economy running smoothly.There are many factors that can cause inflation, including an increase in the money supply, an increase in government spending, and a decrease in the production of goods and services. When there is more money in circulation and not enough goods and services to buy, the prices of those goods and services will rise. This means that, over time, the same amount of money will not be able to buy as much as it used to.Another way to think about it is that, when there is more money chasing the same number of goods, the value of that money goes down. So, if you have a dollar today and you save it for a year, you might find that the things you could buy with that dollar a year from now will cost more than they do today. This is because prices have gone up due to inflation.Inflation is like a tax on money, because it reduces the purchasing power of the money you have. Just like taxes, it is a fact of life and is something that we all have to deal with.

First of all , when you ' steal ' data , you do n't actually ' steal ' it . You replicate it . Unless you work at a highly secured site , the IT professionals are n't likely to track access down to this level . If the Vice President of Marketing wants to download 1.5 TB worth of Game of Thrones scripts , so be it . At most , your standard IT department will track * traffic * to see if there 's unusual activity - but most of the activity they track will be external ( i.e. : over the Internet ) and if you 've penetrated the company deeply enough , they can distribute the load across many accounts . In terms of

' how they do it ' , normally it 's an issue of sneaking malicious code onto machines on the internal network . Most people who use computers professionally do not take particularly good security precautions , on the presumption that their IT department deals with that . IT departments at low - security places like HBO also tend to prioritize convenience over security . So what happens is that a company like Google , Apple or Microsoft is informed / discovers an exploit . They keep this private until they issue a patch to correct it . At which point the exploit is public knowledge but many people will not yet have the patch to protect against it . Since updating an entire company 's worth computers

is a massive nuisance not only to the IT department but also the users of those computers , you 'll often see companies going weeks or months without critical security patches . You also generally ca n't lock the barn door after the cows are gone . Once the malware has gotten in through the exploit , it 's there . Fixing the exploit wo n't remove the malware . Detecting the malware is also a very reactive process . Only once someone has found and submitted malware to a database can most anti - virus programs detect it - at which point it 's almost certainly too late for the people who were initially targeted . There are also more subtle tricks you can use . For

example , a company like HBO almost certainly has regular backups of their servers . There 's a good chance that some element of this backup process electronically submits the information to a remote server . If you 've got malware in the system , you can simply redirect the backup to your own computer and then forward it to their server . This is similar to a man - in - the - middle attack ( although not strictly so , since it involves compromising one end of the communications ) . With such an approach , the internal IT department ca n't even tell from traffic charts what is going on - they expected that large transfer of data . The fundamental issue is that good

A mirror of a video is simply a copy of the video that has been flipped horizontally. This doesn't make it any harder to take down a video for copyright infringement. In fact, it's illegal to upload copyrighted content, whether it's a mirror or not. However, sites like Putlocker often have many mirrors of the same video, which can make it more difficult for authorities to find and remove all copies of the video. It's important to remember that it's illegal to watch or download copyrighted content from these sites, even if it's just a mirror of the original.

No one created it . The Romans conquered southern Britain , but it was n't really " latinized"--the inhabitants were still the native peoples ( celts ) and their language was spoken . When Germanic tribes ( from present day northern Germany , Denmark , and the Netherlands ) , such as the Angels , the Saxons ( Hence " Anglo - Saxon " and " England " ) , and the Jutes conquered England , their language dominated and pushed the Celtic language to the west of the island , to what was to become Wales . This was " Old English , " and was very similar to other West Germanic languages at the time ( such as German , Dutch , and Frisian ) .

gave English thousands of words , distinguishing it from its other West Germanic counterparts . Even today , we can see influences of this prestige . For example , " begin " is of Germanic origin , while " commence " is French . The peasants did the work ( Germanic ) , while the French nobility took the profit . The peasants raised cows and pigs , and the French - speaking upper class ate the meats , beef and pork . TL;DR -- English is a mix of French and languages spoken by Germanic tribes that conquered post - Roman Britain .

Engines wear out eventually , regardless of RPMs , but they wear out much faster if the average RPM is higher . There is also the question of torque and horsepower . Horsepower = torque X RPM . The entirety of an emulator all at once is overwhelming for anyone . You write an emulator via divide - and - conquer : you do lots of small bits , and slowly link them together . The initial way you get the information is through leaked programmer manuals , official instruction set manuals for given processors , and through pain - staking reverse engineering . For instance , if you want to know how the overflow flag is set , but it 's not documented , you perform every possible add operation , log the flag results of each , analyze the output and manipulate your own code until you can match your logged data . You do this through lots and lots of educated guesses .

want to do that , of course . The biggest requirement for writing your first emulator is being willing to spend potentially a few months staring at a blank video output screen . Your only indication of it being alive will be your CPU debugger printing out hundreds of megabytes of text as you step through instructions . Once you have some games running , you then spend the next ten or so years analyzing and fixing bugs , only to cause more bugs in the process . So it 's a nice , decade - long game of whack - a - mole .

The sewer is not a problem . There are many , many modern homes that are not on a sewer system , even in seemingly developed areas . It is called a septic system . Septic systems usually work very well and are relatively easy to maintain . Electricity is a different matter , but still not usually an issue for the rural home owner . You see , living in an isolated area is a lifestyle choice that people make knowing full well the implications . Life is tailored around the fact that you are not connected to the power grid and many rural residents want it that way . Even so- just because a home is not connected to the grid does not mean they have no electricity . There are many options for power that do not involve the grid . One is a private generator that is fired up whenever electricity is truly needed . Some homes have solar cells for minimal electricity . Or even a wind / water turbine . Many rural homes have a large cylindrical tank that is filled with LP gas . This tank of gas provides for many of the energy needs that others use electricity for .

> Everything in the universe with mass exerts gravity . > Compression generates heat . > The force of gravity applies equal pressure from all sides . Now , planet is obviously formed from smaller constituents that coalesced due to the force of gravity . As this mass became larger it experienced more gravity pushing inward from all directions . The pressure / compression that this causes generates a great amount of heat , which basically " melts " any solid object making it easier for gravity to shape the planet spherically . It 's not until much later that things begin to cool and solidify . It takes a planet formation of a significantly large scale to generate this much heat during formation , which is why every rock floating around out there is n't relatively spherical .

Most stocks are not actively trades by lots of people.   When you buy or sell a stock the price is set by the “order book” – that is the other people looking to trade in the given stock at the same time. Without a large number of active traders, it is very likely the pricing system will break down and result in widely changing prices second by second.   Therefore for the market to work well, it need most people to be trading at the same time.

The reason you may look different in photos and videos compared to how you look in the mirror is because of the way that mirrors and cameras capture and display images. When you look in the mirror, you are seeing a reflection of yourself. This means that the image you see is flipped horizontally, so your left side appears on the right side of the mirror and vice versa. This can make your features appear slightly different than they do in photos and videos, which capture a more accurate representation of how you really look. Additionally, the lighting in the room can also affect how you look in the mirror. If the lighting is not even or is too bright or too dim, it can distort the way your features appear and make you look different than you do in photos and videos. So, the main reason you may look different in the mirror compared to photos and videos is because of the way that the images are captured and displayed.

The market's reaction to the announcement will depend on a variety of factors, including the terms of the deal, the perceived value of the company being bought out, and the overall state of the market.

As a general rule , you should never ever give ANY credence to encryption methods that are not open source and fully examinable by you . NSA and other parties have tried to weaken encryption measures precisely by creating partially closed source encryption methods which then would have weaknesses only they would know about , and only they could exploit . Which , even if you 're totally cool with NSA breaking your encryption , would still mean that there is an exploit that may eventually get out because NSA messes up for example , and

some Snowden type leak reveals how to decrypt all your supposedly secure data . Any encryption method consists of essentially two parts : There is method you use . This HAS to be public , everyone HAS to know exactly how it works . Then there is the key . This key is random number sequence , typically it 's about 256 bits long , sometimes even 2048 bits long . That 's computer talk , but basically 256 bits long key means , you choose any number between hundred billion trillion trillion trillion trillion trillion trillion , and trillion trillion trillion trillion trillion trillion . Or basically , number that 's maybe 84 or 83 decimals long . The security comes from the fact that you need

to guess it right ? Trillion trillion trillion trillion guesses every nanosecond is far more than anything we can currently do , and 31 million years is far longer than we can wait to decrypt something . Secure algorithm is such that you do n't have any good shortcuts that are easier for decryption than trying trillion trillion trillion trillion trillion guesses every nanosecond for 31 million years . You do n't know your algorithm is secure if you ca n't see it . Lucid dreaming is the act of being aware that you are dreaming while you are in a dream. Here are some tips for inducing a lucid dream: 1. Keep a dream journal: Write down your dreams as soon as you wake up in the morning. This will help you become more familiar with your own dream patterns and symbols, which can increase your chances of becoming aware that you are dreaming. 2. Reality checks: During the day, periodically ask yourself if you are dreaming or awake. This will help train your brain to question its reality while you are dreaming, which can increase your chances of becoming lucid. 3. Set an intention: Before you go to sleep, tell yourself that you want to have a lucid dream. This can help plant the seed in your subconscious mind and increase the likelihood of a lucid dream. 4. Wake up and go back to sleep: If you wake up in the middle of the night, try to go back to sleep. This is a good time to have a lucid dream because your mind is in a state of transition between wakefulness and sleep. Remember, it can take some time and practice to successfully have a lucid dream. Be patient and keep trying different techniques until you find what works best for you.

However, it's important to note that karma is not a measure of a person's worth or value, and it doesn't have any tangible rewards or benefits. Ultimately, the purpose of karma is to help identify the best content on the site by allowing the community to upvote or downvote it.

Under this thin layer are tightly connected skin cells for several layers making up the majority of the epidermis . Under the epidermis is the dermis , which is mostly made of connective tissue ( regularly organized strands of protein like collagen ) and some immune cells , fat cells , and connective tissue cells . When the skin is injured down to the dermis or even deep into the epidermis , all of the cells in the area try to heal the wound . No, stock prices do not typically drop due to dividends. Dividends are payments that a company makes to its shareholders out of its profits. When a company declares a dividend, the stock price is generally not affected. Instead, the value of the dividend is typically reflected in the stock price before the ex-dividend date, which is the date on which the stock begins trading without the dividend. After the ex-dividend date, the stock price may adjust to reflect the fact that the dividend has been paid and is no longer part of the value of the stock. However, the stock price will not generally drop due solely to the payment of a dividend.It is important to note that there are many factors that can affect the price of a stock, including market conditions, economic trends, and the performance of the company. Dividends are just one of many considerations that investors may take into account when deciding whether to buy or sell a particular stock.

To get a little more into it , if your leg is bouncing while sitting , it is often because you are posed in a position that causes that kind of reaction . When many people are nervous or anxious , they sit with their heel off the ground , with only the ball of their foot on the ground . Sitting in this manner ( heel off the ground ) for many people , will cause their posture to change very slightly , which causes their weight distribution to change . As soon as the weight distribution changes , enough weight is distributed to the legs and suddenly your knee starts bouncing .

US gold coins have a particular value attached to them because they are considered to be legal tender, which means they can be used as a form of payment. The value of a gold coin is not based on the value of the gold it is made of, but rather on the face value of the coin.For example, a $25 gold coin has a face value of $25, which means it can be used to purchase goods or services worth $25. The value of the gold the coin is made of is not taken into account when determining its face value. Instead, the value of the gold is based on the market price of gold, which can vary from day to day.To understand this concept better, consider a paper dollar bill. A dollar bill is worth $1 because it is legal tender, not because it is made of a particular material. The same is true for gold coins. They are worth a certain amount because they are legal tender, not because of the gold they are made of.

To say that a word is "loaded" means that it has a lot of extra meaning or emotion attached to it beyond its basic definition. A hung jury is a situation that occurs during a criminal trial when the jurors are unable to reach a unanimous verdict. This means that the jurors are unable to agree on a verdict of guilt or innocence, and as a result, the trial is not able to reach a conclusion. In such cases, the judge may declare a mistrial, which means that the trial must be held again with a new jury. Hung juries can occur for a variety of reasons, such as conflicting testimony, lack of evidence, or simply because the jurors are unable to come to a consensus.
