Your body has a system in place to make sure you don't go to the bathroom while you're sleeping. This system is called the "bladder control system" and it helps your body hold onto urine and feces until you're ready to go to the bathroom. Here's how it works: When your bladder is full of urine, it sends a message to your brain that it's time to go to the bathroom. Your brain then sends a message to your muscles to relax, so you can let the urine out. At the same time, your brain also sends a message to the muscles around your anus (the opening at the end of your digestive tract) to stay tight, so you don't accidentally poop your pants. When you're awake, you can control these muscles and decide when you want to go to the bathroom. But when you're asleep, your brain is still working to keep these muscles relaxed and tight at the right times, so you don't have any accidents. So, to sum it up, your body has a special system that helps it know when to go to the bathroom and when to hold it, and this system works even when you're asleep.

It's difficult to say exactly how the first language was invented, because it happened a long time ago and we don't have a record of the exact process. However, we do know that humans have been using language for a very long time, and it is an important part of what makes us human.Languages developed over time as people needed to communicate with each other. In the beginning, people probably used gestures and sounds to communicate, just like animals do. As they started to do more complex things and needed to communicate more complex ideas, they needed more sophisticated ways of communicating.So, they started to use words to represent different things, and they put those words together into sentences to communicate more complex ideas. It's likely that the first words were things like "water," "fire," "food," and so on, because these are basic needs that humans have.It's also likely that the first words were invented independently by different groups of people, because different languages have developed in different parts of the world. However, once people started to communicate with each other, they probably learned each other's words and started to use them as well.It's also possible that the first words were invented by one person, and then other people learned those words and started to use them too. However, it's difficult to know for sure, because language has been a part of human culture for so long.

K-Cups are single-serve coffee pods that are used with a Keurig coffee machine. They are small, cylindrical cups made of plastic or aluminum that contain ground coffee, tea, or hot cocoa mix. The cups are sealed and have a filter built into the bottom, so when the Keurig machine punctures the top and bottom of the K-Cup, hot water is able to flow through the coffee and filter, producing a single serving of brewed coffee, tea, or cocoa. K-Cups have become popular because they are convenient and easy to use, allowing people to quickly and easily brew a single serving of their favorite hot beverage without having to measure out ingredients or clean a coffee pot.

This is very easy to understand once you know how insurance works . With health , life , car , or home insurance you pay a " small " premium each month to protect against the risk of a major catastrophic event ( you get cancer or your house burns down ) . If something bad does happen then the insurance company uses it 's pool of collected premiums to cover your high cost event . Therefore insurance is basically a way for a group of people to share the risk of something really bad happening . Everyone pays in a little bit and the few people with bad luck are taken care of . tl;dr ; If no one paid in until they needed it then there would be no money to cover your medical expenses when you do sign up . Note : I 'm ignoring the fact that most health insurance policies cover more than catastrophic events .

AM radio, or Amplitude Modulation radio, is a type of radio transmission that uses the amplitude (or strength) of the radio signal to carry the audio information. FM radio, or Frequency Modulation radio, uses the frequency of the radio signal to carry the audio information.Both AM and FM radio have their own advantages and disadvantages. One advantage of AM radio is that it is better at transmitting signals over long distances, because the signal can be easily received even if it is weaker. This is because the audio information is encoded in the amplitude of the radio signal, and the amplitude can be recovered even if the signal is weak. FM radio, on the other hand, is more sensitive to interference and can be more difficult to receive if the signal is weak.AM radio is also used because it is relatively simple and inexpensive to transmit and receive, compared to FM radio. This is because the equipment needed to transmit and receive AM radio signals is less complex and requires less power. In addition, AM radio is still used for some types of broadcasts, such as talk radio, because the audio quality is good enough for this type of content.Overall, AM radio is still used because it is a reliable and effective way to transmit radio signals over long distances, and it is still useful for certain types of broadcasts.

It used to be you could n't send them charged at all . Think of a charged lithium ion battery like an inflated balloon . At full charge , they are stretching to their limit - ready to burst and leaking out gass . If they are sent via air , the drop in pressure can put even more stress on them and can wear out the stretchiness of this battery - balloon . And worst of all , lots of devices need to sit on shelves for a long time before getting to the consumer . While sitting on the shelf , there is a * self - discharge * rate at which the battery will leak charge . Fully inflated , this will happen faster potentially damaging the cell and wasting that extra power anyway . As lithium+ has gotten better , industry had to change . It 's not trivial to charge a battery as the product is being manufactured . It takes time . It also get used at * end of line * product testing . So keeping a little charge let 's people use the device right away while complying with safety and minimizing the self.discharge and storage risk .

Sure! When someone refers to bullet size, they are usually talking about the diameter of the bullet. The diameter is the width of the bullet, and it is measured in millimeters or inches. So if someone says that a bullet is 55.6 mm in diameter, that means that the width of the bullet is about 55.6 millimeters, or about 2.2 inches. The other number, 44, could be the length of the bullet. Some bullets are longer or shorter than others, depending on their intended use. GPUs are not faster than CPUs . They 're faster at certain specific tasks , mostly ... processing graphics , unsurprisingly . Basically , graphics cards are good at doing a huge number ( hundreds or even thousands ) of simple things all at once . CPUs are good at doing a small number of extremely complex tasks very quickly . The question , really , is whether a task is * parallel * or * sequential * . Can you split the task into a large number of smaller operations that can be performed simultaneously ? Okay , you probably want to use a GPU . Does the task require that you do a lot of things in a specific order ? You want to use a CPU . Most things that a computer needs to do are sequential . Like , the * overwhelming * majority of things . Most of us have multiple - core CPUs , which can do parallel tasks , and most of us barely use the extra cores because most things have to be done sequentially . edit : I should also add that a graphics card is n't really a GPU , either . A graphics card is basically a computer inside your computer that does graphics . It has memory , it has a processor , it has a " motherboard , " all that stuff .

When Voyager 1 took the picture, it used a camera to capture the image and then used its antenna to send the image data back to Earth as a radio signal. The signal traveled through space and was received by antennas on Earth, which were able to turn the radio waves back into the original image data. This is how we were able to see the image that the Voyager spacecraft took, even though it was far away from Earth.

In a communist society, the government owns and controls the means of production, such as factories and farms, and the wealth produced is meant to be shared equally among the people. However, in practice, this often does not happen, and people may still have different wages and levels of wealth.In China, the government does own and control some industries, but it also allows for private businesses to exist. This means that some people may own their own businesses and make more money than others who are working for someone else. Additionally, some jobs may be more highly skilled or require more education, which can lead to higher wages.So while China calls itself a communist country, it is not a pure communist society, and there are still differences in wealth and income among its citizens.

Amazon has a very efficient system for getting items shipped to customers quickly. Here's how it works: 1. When you order something from Amazon, the company uses its computer systems to find the item you want in one of its many warehouses around the world. These warehouses are like giant stores where Amazon keeps all of the items it sells. 2. Once the computer finds the item, it tells a worker to pick it up and put it in a box. 3. The box is then sent to a sorting facility, where it is sorted and sent to a package delivery company like FedEx or UPS. 4. The delivery company then takes the box and brings it to your house. So, Amazon doesn't necessarily have big factories in every state, but it does have a network of warehouses around the world where it keeps a wide variety of items. When you order something from Amazon, the company is able to quickly find the item and get it shipped to you through this system.

Vaccines typically contain a small amount of a weakened or inactivated form of the virus or bacteria that causes a particular disease. When a person is vaccinated, their immune system is exposed to this modified form of the pathogen and mounts a response to it, producing antibodies to fight the infection. The goal of vaccination is to stimulate the immune system to produce immunity to a particular disease, so that if the person is subsequently exposed to the disease, their immune system will recognize it and be able to fight it off before it causes illness.There are several types of components that may be included in a vaccine, including:Antigens: These are the components of the virus or bacteria that stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies. Antigens are

phenol.Stabilizers: These are added to some vaccines to help prevent the breakdown of the vaccine over time. Stabilizers may include sugars, amino acids, or other substances.Inactivating agents: These are added to some vaccines to inactivate the virus or bacteria, making it less harmful or unable to cause disease. Inactivating agents may include chemicals like formaldehyde or alcohol.Overall, the specific components of a vaccine will depend on the specific vaccine and the disease it is intended to prevent.

Computer vision is an interdisciplinary scientific field that deals with how computers can gain high-level understanding from digital images or videos. From the perspective of engineering, it seeks to understand and automate tasks that the human visual system can do.Computer vision tasks include methods for acquiring, processing, analyzing and understanding digital images, and extraction of high-dimensional data from the real world in order to produce numerical or symbolic information, e.g. in the forms of decisions. Understanding in this context means the transformation of visual images (the input of the retina) into descriptions of the world that make sense to thought processes and can elicit appropriate action. This image understanding can be seen as the disentangling of symbolic information from image data using models constructed with the aid of geometry, physics, statistics, and learning theory.The scientific discipline of computer vision is concerned with the theory behind artificial systems that extract information from images. The image data can take many forms, such as video sequences, views from multiple cameras, multi-dimensional data from a 3D scanner, or medical scanning devices. The technological discipline of computer vision seeks to apply its theories and models to the construction of computer vision systems.Sub-domains of computer vision include scene reconstruction, object detection, event detection, video tracking, object recognition, 3D pose estimation, learning, indexing, motion estimation, visual servoing, 3D scene modeling, and image restoration.

It's not uncommon to experience dry skin, bumps, and itchiness in the pubic area after shaving, especially if you shave frequently. There are a few things you can do to help alleviate these symptoms:Avoid shaving too frequently. Shaving can irritate the skin, so giving your skin time to recover between shaving sessions can help reduce irritation and dryness.Use a sharp, clean razor. Using a dull or dirty razor can increase the risk of irritation and ingrown hairs.Use a moisturizing shaving cream or gel. These products can help protect and hydrate the skin, reducing irritation and dryness.Shave in the direction of hair growth. Shaving against the grain can cause irritation and ingrown hairs.Avoid tight clothing. Tight clothing can irritate the skin and increase the risk of infection.Keep the area clean and dry. After shaving, rinse the area with cool water and pat dry with a clean towel. Avoid using hot water, as it can further dry out the skin.If you continue to experience bumps, itching, or other abnormal symptoms despite trying these remedies, it's a good idea to see a healthcare provider. They can help determine the cause of the symptoms and recommend appropriate treatment.

ISIS and TWAIN are two different types of software drivers that are used to connect scanners to computers. ISIS is a software driver developed by Pixel Translations specifically for use with high-speed document scanners. It is designed to improve the performance and reliability of these scanners when they are used with certain types of software. TWAIN is a software standard that is used to connect scanners, cameras, and other types of imaging devices to computers. It is widely supported by a variety of software applications, including image editing and document management programs. Both ISIS and TWAIN drivers are important because they allow scanners to communicate with computers and other devices. Without these drivers, it would be difficult or impossible to use scanners with certain types of software. In general, you want to make sure that any scanner you purchase has ISIS or TWAIN drivers available, as this will make it easier to use the scanner with a variety of software applications. You may also want to consider other factors, such as the speed and quality of the scanner, as well as its compatibility with any specific software or hardware you plan to use it with.

The Rime of the Ancient Mariner (originally The Rime of the Ancyent Marinere) is the longest major poem by the English poet Samuel Taylor Coleridge , written in 1797–98 and published in 1798 in the first edition of Lyrical Ballads .

The Freemasons are a fraternity, or a group of men who come together for fellowship and to work towards personal and collective goals. Freemasonry is a social and charitable organization that traces its roots back to the local fraternities of stonemasons in the Middle Ages. Freemasons use ritual and symbolism drawn from stonemasonry to teach moral lessons and promote self-improvement. Freemasonry is not a religion, but it does have a set of moral values and principles that its members are expected to follow. Freemasons believe in the Fatherhood of God and the brotherhood of all people, and they strive to make a positive difference in their communities through charitable work and other efforts. The Freemasons have a number of lodges, or local chapters, around the world, and they are known for their philanthropy and their contributions to education and other causes. The Freemasons are not the same as the Illuminati, which is a secret society that is said to have existed for hundreds of years and to have a hidden influence on world events. There is no evidence that the Illuminati actually exist, and the Freemasons do not have any connection to them.

A line of credit is a type of loan that allows you to borrow money up to a certain limit, and you can use the funds as needed. It can be a useful financial tool in certain situations, but it's important to understand how it works and when it might be appropriate to use one.Here are a few situations when you might consider opening a line of credit:To cover unexpected expenses: A line of credit can be a good option if you need to pay for a large, unexpected expense, such as a car repair or medical bill. You can borrow the money as needed and repay it over time.To smooth out cash flow: If you have a business, a line of credit can help you manage your cash flow by allowing you to borrow money when you need it and repay it when you have the funds available.To consolidate debt: If you have high-interest credit card debt, you may be able to consolidate it into a line of credit with a lower interest rate. This can help you save money on interest and make it easier to pay off your debt.It's important to remember that a line of credit is a loan, and you will be required to pay back the money you borrow, plus interest. Before you open a line of credit, be sure to carefully consider whether you will be able to make the required payments and whether a line of credit is the best option for your financial situation.

When we are in a dangerous situation, our bodies respond by releasing adrenaline, a hormone that helps us prepare for fight or flight. This can cause a variety of physical and emotional responses, including an increase in heart rate and blood pressure, sweating, and a surge of energy.Swearing or shouting can be a natural response to this adrenaline rush. It might be a way to release some of the tension or fear that we are feeling. It's also possible that shouting can help us to feel more in control of the situation, as if we are taking some kind of action.It's important to remember that our bodies and minds respond differently to stress and danger, and there is no one "right" way to react. Some people might swear or shout, while others might remain calm or try to focus on a specific task. It's okay to do whatever feels natural in the moment, as long as it doesn't put you or others in further danger.

Sure! A satellite stays in orbit around the Earth because it is constantly falling towards the Earth due to gravity, but it is also moving very fast horizontally. This combination of falling and moving horizontally means that the satellite follows a curved path around the Earth. Imagine you are standing on a hill and you roll a ball down the hill. The ball will roll down the hill and then continue rolling across the flat ground. If you give the ball a big enough push, it will keep rolling and rolling without stopping. This is similar to how a satellite stays in orbit around the Earth. The Earth's gravity pulls the satellite down towards the surface, but the satellite's forward motion keeps it from hitting the ground. Instead, it follows a curved path around the Earth. As long as the satellite is moving fast enough, it will stay in orbit and not crash to the ground. I hope that helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

The "two boys" problem is a classic example of a logical puzzle that involves making deductions based on given information. It goes like this: There are two boys, Bill and Ben. One of them is a liar, and the other always tells the truth. You do not know which boy is the liar and which is the truth-teller. You are given the following statements: Bill says, "Ben is the liar." Ben says, "Bill is the truth-teller." Which boy is the liar, and which is the truth-teller?, To solve this problem, you need to think carefully about what each boy is saying. Let's consider each statement in turn: Bill says, "Ben is the liar." This statement could be true or it could be false. If it is true, then

we asked Ben, "Is Bill taller than you?" and he also answered "Yes," then we would know that both boys are telling the truth, because their statements are consistent with each other. Hiccups are the sudden, spasmodic contractions of the diaphragm muscle, which separates the chest from the abdomen. The diaphragm is a large, dome-shaped muscle that helps you breathe by contracting and relaxing. When the diaphragm contracts suddenly and repeatedly, it can cause a person to hiccup.There are many different things that can cause hiccups. For example, eating or drinking too quickly, swallowing too much air, or having an irritation in the esophagus (the tube that connects your mouth to your stomach) can all cause hiccups. Stress and excitement can also cause hiccups.There are a few different techniques that people use to try to stop hiccups. Some people believe that being startled or drinking a glass of water quickly can help stop hiccups. Others believe that holding your breath or swallowing a teaspoon of sugar can help. While these techniques may not work for everyone, they can sometimes help stop hiccups by interrupting the pattern of spasmodic contractions of the diaphragm.It's not exactly clear why these techniques sometimes work, but it is thought that they may help to reset the signals in the brain and nervous system that control the diaphragm muscle. In any case, hiccups are usually not a serious problem and will go away on their own after a short period of time.

Most brain disorders only affect one or a few of these regions , leaving everything else working normally . Often the brain compensates by using another region to do the task of the broken region , but this is a bit like having one person do the work of two people . It 's more hard work

Absurdism takes some of these ideas and moves them a step farther , saying not only is existence inherently free of intrinsic meaning , it is humanly impossible to find meaning in existence . The absurd part of this is the human nature to relentlessly seek the meaning in existence despite our inability to do so . I think * The Myth of Sisyphus * by Albert Camus does a really good job of addressing the Absurd and how to deal with it . Essentially , existentialism says “ life is meaningless , so create your own meaning ” where absurdism says “ life is meaningless , so experience it as meaningless . ” At least that ’s how I understand it .

If you have income - it should appear on your tax return. If you are a non-resident, that would be 1040NR, with the eBay income appearing on line 21. Since this is unrelated to your studies, this income will not be covered by the tax treaties for most countries, and you'll pay full taxes on it. Keep in mind that the IRS may decide that you're actually having a business, in which case you'll be required to attach Schedule C to your tax return and maybe pay additional taxes (mainly self-employment). Also, the USCIS may decide that you're actually having a business, regardless of how the IRS sees it, in which case you may have issues with your green card. For low income from occasional sales, you shouldn't have any issues. But if it is something systematic that you spend significant time on and earn significant amounts of money - you may get into trouble. What's "systematic" and how much is "significant" is up to a lawyer to tell you.

pH stands for "potential of hydrogen" and is a measure of the acidity or basicity (alkalinity) of a solution. The pH scale ranges from 0 to 14, with 7 being neutral. A solution with a pH less than 7 is considered acidic, while a solution with a pH greater than 7 is considered basic or alkaline.The reason why a change in pH by one unit (for example, going from pH 7 to pH 8) is not considered a "simple" increase by one is because the pH scale is logarithmic. This means that each unit on the pH scale represents a tenfold difference in acidity or basicity. For example, a solution with a pH of 4 is ten times more acidic than a solution with a pH of 5, and 100 times more acidic than a solution with a pH of 6. Similarly, a solution with a pH of 9 is ten times more basic than a solution with a pH of 8, and 100 times more basic than a solution with a pH of 7.I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

In ancient times, salt was not easy to come by because it was not as abundant as it is today. People had to mine salt from underground deposits or evaporate seawater to obtain it. This was a slow and labor-intensive process, which is why salt was considered to be very valuable. In fact, salt was often used as a form of currency because it was so rare and valuable. Salt was also very important for preserving food, which made it even more coveted. Because it was so valuable, people would go to great lengths to obtain it and trade it for other goods and services.

Allergies are a type of immune system reaction that occurs when the body mistakes a normally harmless substance as a harmful invader. When a person is allergic to a particular substance, their immune system will overreact to that substance and try to fight it off.There are many factors that can contribute to the development of allergies, including genetics, the environment, and a person's lifestyle. It is likely that a combination of these factors plays a role in the development of allergies.There are several theories as to why allergies seem to be more common than ever before. One theory is that our modern environment and lifestyle may be causing our immune systems to overreact to certain substances. For example, some people believe that the increased use of chemicals and other man-made substances in our environment may be contributing to the development of allergies.Another theory is that the "hygiene hypothesis" may be at play. This theory suggests that our modern, ultra-clean environments may be depriving our bodies of the opportunity to come into contact with a variety of microbes and other substances that help to strengthen the immune system. As a result, our immune systems may be more prone to overreacting to substances that it perceives as harmful.Overall, it is difficult to pinpoint a single cause for the increase in allergies, and more research is needed to fully understand this complex issue.

There are many reasons why a city might be chosen to be a capital. Here are a few:Location: A city might be chosen as a capital because it is located in a central location within a country, making it easier for people from different parts of the country to come together and conduct government business.History: Sometimes, a city might be chosen as a capital because it has a rich history and has played an important role in the development of the country. For example, London was chosen as the capital of England because it was a major trade and cultural center for many centuries.Resources: A city might be chosen as a capital because it has resources that are useful for conducting government business, such as a large port or access to natural resources.Size: A city might be chosen as a capital because it is large and can accommodate a lot of people, including government officials and visitors.There are many other factors that might be considered when choosing a capital city, and the specific requirements for a capital city can vary from country to country.

It is possible for a woman to not know she is pregnant until she is in labor because some women do not experience typical pregnancy symptoms or have very mild symptoms. Pregnancy symptoms can vary greatly from woman to woman and pregnancy to pregnancy. Some women may not have any symptoms at all, or may not notice them because they are mild. The article you provided is about a woman who gave birth to a 10 pound baby, which is considered a very large baby. It is possible that this woman did not experience any unusual weight gain during her pregnancy, which could be one reason why she did not realize she was pregnant. In addition, the uterus is a muscle that expands to accommodate the growing baby. As the uterus expands, it pushes against the woman's bladder, which can cause her to feel like she needs to urinate more frequently. This can be a pregnancy symptom, but it is also a normal part of aging, so a woman may not realize that it is a symptom of pregnancy. It is also possible that a woman may have missed a period or two, but not realized that she was pregnant because she was not trying to conceive or was using a form of birth control. It is important to remember that every pregnancy is different and that it is possible for a woman to have a normal pregnancy without experiencing many, or any, typical pregnancy symptoms.

Before 1970 when the Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act ( RICO Act ) was passed , federal prosecutors could only charge individuals with crimes they themselves had committed . So if Don Corleone ordered Clemenza to kill Paulie Gatto , the Don ca n't be charged with murder because he did n't kill anyone . After RICO , the Don still could n't be charged with murder , but he could be charged with racketeering . To be convicted of racketeering , prosecutors only had to prove that the Don had committed two RICO - type crimes ( murder , drug trafficking , etc ) within a ten year period . Also , conspiracy law was not as developed as it is now . In the heyday of the mafia ( say , 1919 - 1955 ) , to be charged with committing a conspiracy , there had to be an overt act by the Don . Supreme Court rulings since then , like United States v. Shabani , have steered conspiracy away from requiring an overt act . Now all you need to do to be charged with conspiracy is to agree with another person to commit an illegal act . So now as long as prosecutors can prove that the Don and Paulie agreed to murder Paulie , Don Corleone can be charged with murder as if he himself had pulled the trigger .

TL;DR : He was removed from power because his army joined the revolution , and the nation was revolting against WW1 , and the poverty / starvation the war and Russia 's backwardness caused . Longer response : There were actually 2 revolutions in Imperial Russia , the first occurred in March 1917 ( called the February revolution because they used a different calendar ) . This occurred when protests against general hunger and poor living conditions occurring as a result of WW1 ( which Russia was ill equipped to fight as it was not yet industrialised ) led to the mutiny of Petrograd 's ( the capital ) garrison . In response the Tsar abdicated , and was replaced with a provisional government which was tasked with transitioning the nation into a democracy . The provisional government was unpopular , and failed to end the war , eventually leading to a successful Bolshevik ( a communist party ) takeover ( the October Revolution ) . The Bolsheviks hated the Tsar , and also feared that Tsarists would attempt to free him or his family and use him as a figurehead for a counter revolution . of computer technology, because it was neither programmable, nor Turing-complete. Conventionally, the ABC would be considered the first electronic ALU (arithmetic logic unit) –  which is integrated into every modern processor's design. Its unique contribution was to make computing faster by being the first to use vacuum tubes to do the arithmetic calculations. Prior to this, slower electro-mechanical methods were used by Konrad Zuse's Z1, and the simultaneously developed Harvard Mark I. The first electronic, programmable, digital machine, the Colossus computer from 1943 to 1945, used similar tube-based technology as ABC.

In the context of business asset transfer, tax allocation refers to the process of determining how the taxes associated with the transfer of assets will be divided among the parties involved. It is important for all parties to carefully consider the tax implications of the transfer and to consult with a tax professional to ensure that the tax allocation is fair and appropriate.

Attaching a camera to a whale's body could potentially be a way to explore the deep sea and learn more about it. However, there are a few challenges and ethical concerns to consider. First, it can be difficult to safely attach a camera or any other type of equipment to a whale's body. Whales are large, powerful animals, and any equipment that is attached to them needs to be designed and secured in a way that does not harm the whale or interfere with its movement or behavior. Second, there are also ethical concerns about interfering with wild animals, especially when it comes to attaching equipment to their bodies. Scientists and researchers need to be very careful to make sure that any research they do does not cause harm or stress to the animals they are studying. Finally, there are other ways to explore the deep sea that do not involve attaching cameras or other equipment to animals. For example, scientists can use underwater robots or submersibles to study the deep sea, or they can use remotely operated vehicles that are controlled from the surface. These methods allow us to learn more about the deep sea without causing any harm to the animals that live there.

Fear is a natural and normal human emotion that helps us to protect ourselves from danger. Different things can be scary to different people because everyone's experiences and backgrounds are different. Some people might be afraid of clowns because they have seen a movie or heard a story about a clown that was scary, while others might not be afraid of clowns at all. Similarly, some people might be afraid of dolls because they remind them of something that was scary in their past, while others might find dolls to be cute and playful. It's also possible that some people might be afraid of certain things just because they see other people being afraid of them, and they want to fit in. However, it's important to remember that it's okay to be afraid of something, and it's also okay to not be afraid of something that other people might find scary. It's all a matter of personal experience and perspective.

Both are means for your computer to find its way on the Internet . When your computer starts up , it wants to connect to a computer network , usually the Internet but sometimes a corporate network . The reason it wants to connect is so that you can check your mailbox and surf the web . In order to be able to connect to a network , your computer needs a unique address assigned to it . Compare this to sending a Valentine card through the postal system to your sweetheart . The postal system requires you to write the address of your sweetheart on the envelope . In much the same way , every computer that wants to use a computer network needs an address .

For the postal system , an address is a street name , house number , city , state and zip code . For a computer network , an address is a number , called the IP address ( IP is short for Internet Protocol ) . Now , back to your question . When your computer starts up and connects to the network , it needs an IP address . There are several ways of getting one . The most simple one is that your computer already knows what its IP address is ( stored somewhere in a local configuration file ) and it simply uses that . This is called a static IP address and is mostly used for small networks , for instance a home network

. Another way of getting an IP address is to ask the network you are connecting to for an address . This is where DHCP is used . What happens here is that on startup , your computer essentially sends a " Hello ! What is my IP address ? " question to all the computers on the network . However , it does not speak English but DHCP gibberish instead . Most of the other computers on the network are not able to understand DHCP gibberish and will simply ignore the question . However , one or maybe two computers on the network * * do * * speak DHCP gibberish and are able to answer your question : " Your IP address is 192.168.1.101 " (

this is the way IP addresses are written down ) . Your computer understands this answer and will adopt this IP address for as long as you stay connected to the network . If you switch off the computer , it will not be able to remember what its address was the next time you power it up and the whole Q : " Hello ! What is my IP address " A : " Your address is 198.172.1.99 " will be repeated . Notice that the second time , you receive a slightly different address ( ending in 99 instead of 101 ) . This is due to the " dynamic " part of DHCP . When you shut down your computer , the address that it

had ( 192.168.1.101 ) is no longer occupied by your computer . So if someone else comes along and asks for an address , the DHCP computer may decide to recycle your old and now free IP address . Since an IP address must be unique , when your computer starts up again and requests an IP address , the old address will be already given to another computer so you receive another address in response . Now , for DNS . On the Internet , each and every computer must have a unique IP address . This IP address is a number . People in general are not very adept at recalling numbers . For instance , the IP address of the Google computer is 173.194.65.105 .

It is generally not appropriate for the IT department to monitor the specific websites that their coworkers are visiting during work hours unless there is a specific business need for doing so. This is because people have a right to privacy, and monitoring their online activity can be invasive and may infringe upon that right. There are various laws and regulations that protect the privacy of individuals in the workplace, including the Electronic Communications Privacy Act (ECPA) in the United States, which prohibits unauthorized access to electronic communications, such as email and internet activity. However, it is important to note that the IT department may be responsible for ensuring the security and proper functioning of the company's computer systems, which may require them to monitor certain aspects of network activity. For example, they may need to track and block malicious software or identify and resolve network issues. In these cases, the IT department may have access to information about the websites that are being visited on the company's network, but their primary focus should be on maintaining the security and functionality of the systems, rather than monitoring the specific online activities of their coworkers. In general, it is a good idea to be mindful of your online activity while at work and to follow your company's policies and guidelines for internet usage. If you have concerns about your privacy at work, you may want to speak with your supervisor or HR representative to get more information about your company's policies and practices.

In rally racing, the driver is responsible for driving the car as fast as possible through a series of stages, which are usually held on dirt or gravel roads that are not normally open to the public. The passenger, also known as the co-driver, sits in the front seat next to the driver and helps navigate the course. The co-driver's main job is to use a special book called a "road book" to tell the driver which way to go and what to expect on the track. The road book contains detailed instructions and maps of the course, including information about turns, jumps, and other obstacles. The co-driver reads these instructions out loud to the driver and uses hand signals to indicate when the driver should turn or slow down. While the driver is focused on driving the car as fast as possible, the co-driver is responsible for keeping track of the overall route and making sure the team stays on course. This can be especially challenging in rally racing, where the course is not always clearly marked and the conditions can change quickly. So, while the driver knows how to drive the car and can see what's in front of them, the co-driver helps guide them through the course and make sure they stay on track.

We would n't have a concrete frame - rate . We have different components in our eyes , like rods and cones , that all update independently and at different rates . So in one instant , a thousand of your cones might be updating ; the next instant , a hundred cones and a hundred rods might be , and so on . Then we have our brain , which does n't process individual neat frames , but kind of blurs everything together as a constant stream , with the focus of our vision given higher priority than things in our peripheral vision . So not only does the ' frame rate ' differ moment to moment and cell to cell , it differs on different areas of the eye . Compare this to a computer or TV , which updates an exact 50/60/100/120 etc times per second ( depending on model ) every single second , the entire screen at once , and a computer graphics card , which builds one complete frame , sends it , builds the next complete frame , sends it ... It 's not a very fun answer , but we really just ca n't describe our eyes in terms of a framerate .

Delaware claims to be the first state because it was the first colony to ratify the United States Constitution on December 7, 1787. The U.S. Constitution is the supreme law of the United States, and its ratification established the federal government of the United States. Delaware's action in ratifying the Constitution made it the first state to join the new federal Union.Delaware's claim to being the first state is based on this historical fact, and it is recognized by the federal government and by other states. The state of Delaware is referred to as the "First State" in its own official documents and in the official documents of other states, and it is often referred to as such in the media and by the general public.The state motto of Delaware is "Liberty and Independence," which reflects its status as one of the original thirteen colonies and its role in the founding of the United States. The state's history is closely tied to the founding of the nation, and it has played an important role in shaping the nation's history and development.

in programs which make random numbers . Programs run on algorithms which run the same way every time and thus are not random . Usually , programs will use something like the computer 's internal clock to act as an initial seed value then do various mathematical operations on it to generate a chain of numbers . From a human perspective , the numbers usually look random . And for simulations , they are often random enough to be usable . But since the process which generated them can be recreated to produce the exact same string of numbers , the term pseudorandom is used to describe them .

This is my first ELI5 post- It 's long but it 's also easy to follow , I swear ! * * TL;DR : Windows ME was Frankenstein 's monster , made from parts of two different versions of windows that did n't like each other . * * Microsoft had 2 different types of windows before windows XP , and each had it 's own advantage : The original version of windows , the one the average person used , was actually based on the thing they made BEFORE windows , a really ancient system called DOS . They were really good with DOS , so when they added support for new stuff , it was always on this version ( since it was less work for

them ) . The disadvantage was that DOS was limited in how much power it could use of a new computer , and because windows used DOS to talk to the machine , microsoft had to bend the rules a bit to make things work . This is the one we all know as " windows . " The other type was called Windows NT , and it was made for business . Windows NT did n't * use * DOS to talk to a machine , which meant for companies that it was a little more stable , and it could use more raw power since there was no " middle man " software taking up space- for a business like a web host , this was

really important . If DOS was " iron , " than that meant windows 98 was steel and windows NT was supposed to be titanium . But what NT did n't have was the compatibility with all sorts of old and new stuff that the normal windows had- business did n't need to be able to use windows with 300 different types of digital cameras , ' usb ' technology ( still kind of new at the time ) , all this stuff that the normal person would buy and use at home . Businesses did n't need it , it was more work for Microsoft to do , and adding support for some of them may have made NT less stable . Around 2000 , microsoft realized

that new computers were going to be limited by DOS , and that they would have to start making * * everyone 's * * computer run off the NT version at some point . The problem was that they 'd put all this effort into making things work with the normal , DOS - based version and never with NT . ' No problem ' they thought , ' we 'll just take the best bits from each version and make one really good version of windows . We 'll keep DOS in but use it less , and use NT bits more . We 'll call it Windows Millenium Edition , since we 're working on a business based one called Windows 2000 already . '

These vibrations can be felt by your finger, and they can create the sensation of a "purring" feeling.It's similar to when you put your ear up to a speaker and you can feel the bass vibrations, or when you put your hand on a washing machine while it's running and you can feel the vibrations. It's just a way that energy can be transferred from one thing to another.

Unions are organizations that workers can join to advocate for better working conditions, wages, and benefits. Some people believe that unions are important because they help workers have a stronger voice in the workplace and can help improve the lives of workers. Other people believe that unions can be harmful because they can make it harder for companies to do business and can lead to higher prices for goods and services. The controversy surrounding unions in America often stems from differing beliefs about the role of government and business in society. Some people believe that the government should do more to protect the rights of workers and that unions are an important way to do this. Others believe that the government should stay out of business decisions and that unions can get in the way of a company's ability to be competitive and successful. There are also often differing beliefs about the role of unions in the economy. Some people believe that unions help to create a more balanced distribution of wealth and power, while others believe that unions can hurt the economy by making it harder for companies to operate and compete. Overall, the controversy surrounding unions in America is complex and multifaceted, and there are valid arguments on both sides.

The M1 actually originally used a rifled barrel before the A1 upgrade replaced it with a smoothbore system . The British and Indian Main Battle Tanks still retain rifled barrels . Smoothbore barrels do n't wear as fast as rifled barrels , so maintenance is a consideration but it depends largely on the ammunition you want to use . Your choice of munitions will be informed by who you expect to be fighting and what sort of fighting it will be - big open terrain tank battles ( as envisaged taking place in W.Germany during the Cold War ) , or in - town anti - insurgency , anti - personnel fighting where the enemy have no tanks or heavy armour . If you want to use fin - stabilised rounds for accurate long range shooting and some of the newer anti - personnel rounds ( which are basically glorified shotgun cartridges that fire multiple projectiles simultaneously ) then a smoothbore barrel is good . If you want to use traditional spin - stabilised high explosive shells then a rifled barrel is required . The invasion of Iraq and Afghanistan was one of the reasons for the Americans to move to a smooth - bore barrel - the fighting there involved very little anti - tank activity and was mostly anti - personnel and anti - building , which called for munitions better served through a smooth - bore barrel .

Go is a board game that is played on a grid of squares. Each player has a set of round, flat pieces called "stones" that they place on the board to try to capture territory and surround their opponent's stones. To start the game, the board is empty and the players take turns placing their stones on the intersections of the lines on the board. Once all the stones are on the board, the players take turns moving their stones to different intersections on the board. The goal of the game is to surround more territory than your opponent. You can do this by placing your stones in a way that blocks your opponent from expanding their territory and by surrounding their stones with your own. When you surround your opponent's stones, they become "captured" and are removed from the board. The game ends when both players agree that there are no more useful moves to make, or when the board is completely filled up. Then, the player who has the most territory wins the game. It might sound simple, but Go is actually a very complex game that requires a lot of strategy and planning. It can take a long time to become good at it, but with practice and patience, you can improve your skills and become a better player.

The way a body works is to try to maintain what 's called " homeostasis " , which means that all the chemicals in your body are being replaced at the rate they 're being removed . Now , alcohol ( and other drugs ) either mimics chemicals in your body , break down into chemicals that mimic chemicals in your body , or do a job that a different chemical in your body would do . Because of this , your body stops producing those chemicals ( in order to maintain the right levels of them ) when you have the drug in your system . However , it takes some time when you STOP putting the drug in your system for your body to realise this and start making those chemicals again . This is why withdrawal commonly feels exactly the opposite of how the drug feels : when you 're on a drug , you have extra chemical making a good feeling happen , but when you " come off " the drug , you have less of that chemical , so you go in the opposite direction . And , if the delay is too long ( and the chemical in question is super important ) , you can run out completely and die .

The "God particle" is a nickname for the Higgs boson, which is a subatomic particle that was predicted to exist by theoretical physicists in the 1960s. It is important because it is believed to be the key to understanding how particles in the universe have mass.In the early universe, there was a lot of energy everywhere, and particles would zip around at incredibly high speeds. But as the universe cooled down, some particles slowed down and started to clump together to form things like atoms and molecules. These particles gained mass as they slowed down, and the Higgs boson is thought to be the particle that gives other particles mass.Scientists believe that the Higgs boson plays a crucial role in the way the universe works, and finding it was a major scientific achievement. It helps us understand how the universe came to be the way it is today, and it could also help us make new discoveries about the universe in the future.

Data from a brain is not really ( directly ) relatable to a computer at this point . And in order to store data on a computer , we 'd need data that would behave like a computer . 1 : Computers work with on / off switches to store data . We do n't fully understand how brains store data , but it seems like it 's more of a gradient / threshold which controls a frequency of output . Computers would be like a lightbulb that is either on or off , controlled by a simple switch . Neurons ( brains ) would be more like having a dimmer switch for a light bulb ( with dim being low frequency , and bright being higher frequency

up to a certain maximum ) . 2 : Computers have a direct correlation for input to control the data it stores . Brains have a very , very complicated correlation for an input to manipulate it 's data . Staying with the light bulb idea , a ( computer ) switch may have complicated wiring , but it will turn on or off the light bulb with a specific switch . A dimmable bulb ( neuron ) has tens to hundreds to thousands of dimmer controls ( synapses ) wired in , and each one may turn up or down the bulb intensity . This is actually a fairly complicated matter , its clear that our brains think its important , there are number of neurotransmitters , agonists , and agitators that that compel the brain to sleep and cause serious difficulties when you ignore them . It is unclear if these mechanisms serve any other purpose than to make us tired and compel us to sleep . Our memories are also solidified during sleep ( do n't stay up all night cramming for those exams , folks ! ) , although we do n't know why sleep is an necessary for this process . Brain development is also dependent on sleep as well , although yet again we do n't know why . There are a couple theories in evolutionary biology that attempt to answer the question where neurophysiology falls short . Some have suggested that remaining dormant at night allowed organisms ( sleep is not a uniquely human behavior ) to avoid dangers ( such as predators or hazards ) when our senses were impaired using a [ tonic immobility reflex ] ( URL_0 ) . Others suggest that a period of dormancy allow systems to recover from constant use , although it is still unclear on why such down time would require unconsciousness as opposed to simple lethargy . There are a number of other theories , which probably are worth a whole course on their own .

Vomiting during or after intense physical activity is generally not a normal response and can be a sign of something serious, such as heat stroke or overexertion. However, there are a few possible reasons why someone might feel sick or vomit after intense exercise:Dehydration: When you exercise, you sweat and lose fluids. If you don't replace those fluids, you can become dehydrated, which can lead to nausea and vomiting.Eating too much before exercising: If you eat a large meal right before exercising, your body might have a hard time digesting all that food while also trying to perform physical activity. This can lead to nausea and vomiting.Overexertion: If you push yourself too hard during exercise, your body might not be able to keep up. This can lead to nausea and vomiting as a way to try to "cool down" and rest.Other medical conditions: Sometimes, nausea and vomiting during or after exercise can be caused by other medical conditions, such as heat stroke, low blood sugar, or an underlying health problem.In general, it's important to drink plenty of fluids and not overexert yourself during physical activity. If you continue to feel sick or vomit after exercising, it's a good idea to speak with a healthcare professional to determine the cause and get the appropriate treatment.

Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) is a mental health condition that can occur after someone has experienced or witnessed a traumatic event, such as a natural disaster, a car accident, or a war. People with PTSD may have trouble sleeping, feel anxious or angry, and have flashbacks or nightmares about the traumatic event.In the brain, PTSD is thought to be related to changes in the way that the brain processes and stores memories of the traumatic event. When someone experiences a traumatic event, their brain releases stress hormones, which can help them respond to the danger. However, in people with PTSD, these stress hormones may stay at high levels even after the event is over. This can cause changes in the brain's structure and function, including in the areas of the brain that control emotions, memory, and arousal.For example, the amygdala, which is a small structure in the brain that helps to process emotions, may become more active in people with PTSD. This can lead to increased feelings of fear and anxiety. Additionally, the hippocampus, which is a part of the brain that helps with memory and learning, may shrink in size in people with PTSD. This can make it harder for them to remember and process information about the traumatic event, which can contribute to flashbacks and nightmares.Overall, the physical effects of PTSD on the brain can lead to symptoms like difficulty sleeping, changes in mood, and problems with memory and learning. These symptoms can be treated with therapy, medication, and other types of support.

After you donate blood , the number of red blood cells in your blood decreases . Red blood cells are responsible for carrying oxygen and this decreased oxygen in the blood is a stimulus for the kidney to secrete the hormone erythropoietin . This then travels to the bone marrow and stimulates the production of more red blood cells . This is a great example of a negative feedback loop .

You can get an approximation ( estimate , if you prefer ) of the golden ratio from lucas / fibonacci numbers by taking one element from the sequence , then dividing it by the previous element . So , for fibonacci numbers ( 1 , 1 , 2 , 3 , 5 , 8 , 13 , 21 , ... ) , your approximations are 1/1 , 2/1 , 3/2 , 5/3 , 8/5 , 13/8 , ... and for Lucas numbers ( 2 , 1 , 3 , 4 , 7 , 11 , 18 , ... ) they 're 1/2 , 3/1 , 4/3 , 7/4 , 11/7 , 18/11 , ... Because both of these are integer sequences , and the golden ratio is irrational

start weird , with the first term being bigger than the second ) , if you take the same number of steps ( that is , for both sequences dividing the 11th element by the 10th element , or dividing the 28th element by the 27th element , or whatever else ) , then doing that same amount of work using the Lucas numbers gets you an approximation that 's closer to the true value than you 'd get with Fibonacci numbers .

Short answer: google finance's market cap calculation is nonstandard (a.k.a. wrong). The standard way of computing the market capitalization of a firm is to take the price of its common stock and multiply by the number of outstanding common stock shares.  If you do this using the numbers from google's site you get around $13.4B.  This can be verified by going to other sites like yahoo finance and bloomberg, which have the correct market capitalization already computed. The Whole Foods acquisition appears to be very cut-and-dry.  Investors will be compensated with $42 cash per share. Why are google finance's numbers wrong for market cap?  Sometimes people will add other things to "market capitalization," like the value of the firm's debt and other debt-like securities.  My guess is that google has done something like this.  Whole Foods has just over $3B in total liabilities, which is around the size of the discrepancy you have found.

It's a good idea to have tires that are specifically designed for winter driving conditions if you live in an area with cold temperatures and snow or ice. There are two main types of tires that are suitable for winter driving: studded tires and winter tires. Studded tires have small metal studs on the tread that provide extra traction on slippery roads, particularly on ice. However, studded tires can be noisy and may cause damage to the road surface, so they are not legal in all areas. Winter tires, also known as "snow tires," are made from a special rubber compound that remains flexible in cold temperatures. This helps the tires grip the road better in cold weather and on snow and ice. Winter tires also have deeper treads than regular tires, which helps them clear snow and slush from the tread and provides additional traction. In general, winter tires are a better choice for most drivers. They provide good traction on a variety of winter driving surfaces and are legal to use in all areas. Studded tires may be a good option for drivers who frequently drive on very icy roads, but they are not as versatile as winter tires and may not perform as well in other winter driving conditions. So, if you live near Calgary and drive a GMC Sierra RWD, it's a good idea to get winter tires. They will provide the best traction and performance in cold and snowy conditions, and they are legal to use on all roads.

Humans * do n't * live longer than we did back then . * Life expectancy * is longer * on average * now , but that 's not the same thing as saying people can live longer now . Look at it this way . Imagine that most people who live to adulthood die at the age of seventy . It would be fair to say , then , that human beings can live about seventy years . Some longer , some less , but the limit to how long a person lives is * around * seventy years . But what if one person out of two dies in childhood ? In that case , the * average life expectancy * would only be about forty

and better , both individually and in social groups , of not dying young . Basically , the story of a human life is this : If * nothing kills you , * you 'll live to be * about * seventy years , give or take a bit . But if something kills you , you 'll die sooner than that . Over the course of recorded history , the overall trend has been toward * fewer * people being killed young … but the human lifespan is not significantly different from what it 's always been for as far back as people can remember .

ASP.NET is a web application framework developed by Microsoft that allows developers to build dynamic websites, web applications, and web services. It is built on top of the .NET framework, which provides a runtime environment for executing code written in various .NET languages, such as C# and VB.NET.The .NET framework is a general-purpose software development platform that includes a common runtime, a set of libraries, and a set of language compilers. It is designed to be used for building a wide variety of applications, including desktop applications, mobile apps, and web applications.ASP.NET is specifically designed for building web applications, and it includes a number of features and tools that make it easier to build and deploy web applications, such as a built-in web server, a framework for building web pages and web services, and support for integrating with databases and other data sources.In summary, ASP.NET is a framework built on top of the .NET framework that is specifically designed for building web applications. .NET, on the other hand, is a general-purpose software development platform that can be used to build a wide variety of applications.

A conductor is the person who leads an orchestra or choir during a performance. They stand in front of the musicians and use hand gestures and facial expressions to tell the musicians when to start playing, how fast or slow to play, and how loudly or softly to play.The conductor waves their arms in front of the orchestra to give the musicians cues about what to do next. For example, they might wave their arms up and down to indicate the music should get louder or softer, or they might move their arms in a circular motion to indicate the music should get faster or slower.The conductor's gestures are very important because they help the musicians play together as a group. Without a conductor, the musicians might not know when to start or stop playing, or they might play at different speeds or with different dynamics (loudness and softness).So, while the conductor's gestures may look like they are just for show, they are actually an important part of the performance and help the musicians create beautiful music together.

It 's all about population density . In an urban area , having a lot of people around is the norm . This has benefits and disadvantages . It means help in any number of ways is usually nearby ( police , fire , you need a jump from your neighbor , etc ) . It also means that other people 's behavior can adversely affect you because you live in close proximity to them . If your neighbor constantly plays loud music , this can greatly impact your quality of life , so you need to rely on local government and society to regulate that person 's behavior ( noise ordinances ) . In both cases , whether trying to get help or prevent other people from

negatively impacting you , government has the power to make your life a lot better because you and all your fellow city dwellers are concentrated in one place . Compare this to the rural lifestyle . Your nearest neighbor might be 10 minutes away by car . In this case , you would regard a noise ordinance as anything but helpful . Your neighbor could n't buy speakers loud enough to bother you , so of course you 'd take umbrage to some cop hanging around your property line telling you to turn your music down all the time when it hurts no one . Similarly , government benefits are of reduced value to you . The average area that must be covered by the local fire department

cut a check from thousands of miles away to help a farmer grow crops . In these cases , rural areas tend to like government regulation when it benefits them . So what " big govt / small govt " is really about is which population is better able to extract utility from government . This is why Republicans tend to favor government involvement in things like farm aid even though that 's inconsistent with their " small govt " core message .

A mutual fund is a type of investment vehicle that pools together money from many investors and uses that money to buy a diversified portfolio of stocks, bonds, or other securities. The value of a mutual fund is determined by the value of the underlying securities it holds.Mutual funds offer investors several benefits. First, they provide professional management. Rather than trying to select individual stocks or bonds on their own, investors can rely on the expertise of the fund's manager to make investment decisions. This can be especially useful for those who are inexperienced or do not have the time to do their own research.Second, mutual funds offer diversification. By investing in a fund that holds a large number of different securities, investors can spread out their risk, which can help to reduce the impact of any one security's performance on the overall value of the fund.Finally, mutual funds offer liquidity. Investors can buy or sell shares of the fund at any time, usually at the end of the trading day, making it easy to get access to their money when they need it.There are many different types of mutual funds, each with its own investment objective, such as growth, income, or preservation of capital. Investors should carefully consider the fund's investment objective and risks before investing.

Sleeping can cause your breath to smell for a few reasons. One reason is that your mouth tends to get dry when you sleep, and when your mouth is dry, there is less saliva to help rinse away bacteria and other particles that can cause bad breath. Saliva is a natural germ fighter that helps keep your mouth clean, so when there is less of it, bacteria can grow more easily and cause your breath to smell.Another reason why your breath might smell after sleeping is that you are exhaling through your mouth while you sleep, which can cause your breath to be drier and more prone to bad smells. When you exhale through your nose, the moisture in your nose helps to moisten the air and can help to reduce bad smells. But when you exhale through your mouth, the air is not as moist, which can make your breath smell worse.Finally, the position you sleep in can also affect your breath. If you sleep with your mouth open, it can dry out your mouth even more, which can contribute to bad breath.So, to help prevent bad breath while you sleep, you can try to sleep with your mouth closed and try to keep your mouth moist by drinking water before bedtime and using a humidifier in your bedroom.

The IRR is the Discount Rate r* that makes Net Present Value NPV(r*)==0. What this boils down to is two ways of making the same kind of profitability calculation.  You can choose a project with NPV(10%)>0, or you can choose based on IRR>10%, and the idea is you get to the same set of projects.  That's if everything is well behaved mathematically. But that's not the end of this story of finance, math, and alphabet soup. For investments that have multiple positive and negative cash flows, finding that r* becomes solving for the roots of a polynomial in r*, so that there can be multiple roots.  Usually people use the lowest positive root but really it only makes sense for projects where NPV(r)>0 for r<r* and NPV(r)<0 for r>r*.   To try to help with your understanding, you can evaluate a real estate project with r=10%, find the sum future discounted cash flows, which is the NPV, and do the project if NPV>0.   Or, you can take the future cash flows of a project, find the NPV as a function of the rate r, and find r* where NPV(r*)==0. That r* is the IRR.  If IRR=r*>10% and the NPV function is well behaved as above, you can also do the project. When we don't have to worry about multiple roots, the preceding two paragraphs will select the same identical sets of projects as meeting the 10% return requirement.

pressing a bruise wo n’t cause pain . When you get a bruise the “ old fashioned way ” , by trauma , your body gets damaged in that area . Cells become ruptured , breaking open and spilling their contents into the surrounding tissue . Some of those contents act as neurotransmitters , telling the brain to interpret that area as damaged ( pain ) , and causing us to avoid further damage . This is why pressing on a bruise hurts- our body is trying to convince us to leave it alone so it can fix the damage .

Multimodal sentiment analysis is a type of sentiment analysis that involves analyzing multiple modalities or channels of communication to understand the sentiment expressed by a speaker or writer. Modalities can include text, audio, video, and other types of media.In multimodal sentiment analysis, multiple modalities are analyzed in combination to gain a more complete understanding of the sentiment being expressed. For example, a person's tone of voice, facial expressions, and body language may all convey important information about their sentiment that cannot be captured by analyzing just their words. By analyzing multiple modalities, it is possible to more accurately understand the sentiment being expressed and to identify subtle or complex emotions that may not be apparent when analyzing only a single modality.Multimodal sentiment analysis has a wide range of applications, including social media analysis, customer service, market research, and more. It can be used to understand the sentiment of a group of people, to identify trends and patterns in sentiment over time, and to track changes in sentiment in response to events or interventions.

Vitamins are nutrients that your body needs to function properly. They are essential for good health and well-being. Some vitamins can be absorbed better by your body when taken with food, while others may be absorbed better on an empty stomach.One reason that some vitamins are recommended to be taken with food is because they are fat-soluble, which means that they dissolve in fat and can be stored in the body. These vitamins include vitamin A, vitamin D, vitamin E, and vitamin K. When you eat food that contains fat, it helps your body absorb these vitamins more effectively.On the other hand, some vitamins are water-soluble, which means that they dissolve in water and are not stored in the body. These vitamins include vitamin C and the B-vitamins.

As already noted, options contain inherent leverage (a multiplier on the profit or loss). The amount of "leverage" is dictated primarily by both the options strike relative to the current share price and the time remaining to expiration. Options are a far more difficult investment than stocks because they require that you are right on both the direction and the timing of the future price movement. With a stock, you could choose to buy and hold forever (Buffett style), and even if you are wrong for 5 years, your unrealized losses can suddenly become realized profits if the shares finally start to rise 6 years later. But with options, the profits and losses become very final very quickly. As a professional options trader, the single best piece of

advice I can give to investors dabbling in options for the first time is to only purchase significantly ITM (in-the-money) options, for both calls and puts. Do a web search on "in-the-money options" to see what calls or puts qualify.  With ITM options, the leverage is still noticeably better than buying/selling the shares outright, but you have a much less chance of losing all your premium. Also, by being fairly deep in-the-money, you reduce the constant bleed in value as you wait for the expected move to happen (the market moves sideways more than people usually expect). Fairly- to deeply-ITM options are the ones that options market-makers like least to trade in, because they offer neither large nor "easy" premiums. And options market-makers make their living by

It's possible that your partner is experiencing a phenomenon called sleepwalking or somnambulism. This is a type of sleep disorder that causes a person to get up and walk around during the night while they are still asleep. People who sleepwalk may perform a variety of activities, such as walking, talking, eating, or even driving a car, while they are asleep. They may also be able to respond to stimuli, such as being touched or hugged, even though they are not fully awake. Sleepwalking usually occurs during the deep stages of sleep, and people who sleepwalk often do not remember the events that occurred while they were sleepwalking.

So say you want to find * To Kill a Mockingbird * . You start by looking at the very middle book . Is it * To Kill a Mockingbird * ? Nope , it 's * Pride and Prejudice * . you start by applying a binary search to the entire shelf . If you do n't find what you 're looking for , you apply a binary search to one half of the shelf . Credit inquiries occur when someone checks your credit report. This could happen when you apply for a loan, credit card, or even when you check your own credit score. When a lender checks your credit report, it can lower your credit score because it may indicate to the lender that you are trying to take on more debt.Imagine you are a lender and someone comes to you asking for a loan. You want to make sure that person is financially responsible and can pay the loan back. One way to do this is by checking their credit report. If you see that person has a lot of outstanding debt, it might make you worried that they won't be able to pay back the new loan. On the other hand, if you see that person has a good credit score and is paying off their debts on time, it might make you more confident in their ability to pay back the loan.When you check your own credit score, it doesn't necessarily mean you are trying to take on more debt. But the lender might still see it as a potential risk, because it could mean you are considering taking on more debt in the future. That's why checking your own credit score can sometimes lead to a small decrease in your credit score.

Wolves are thought to have been domesticated because they were easier to tame than other animals due to their social nature. This social structure made it easier for humans to establish dominance over wolves and train them to do tasks.Bears and big cats, on the other hand, are generally more solitary animals and do not have the same kind of social structure. This makes them more difficult to tame and train. In addition, bears and big cats are often much larger and stronger than wolves, which can make them more dangerous to work with.Overall, it is likely that wolves were domesticated because they were more social, easier to train, and safer to work with than other large predators.

Green screens are green because the color green is easier to see on camera and is easier to remove from the final product.When a person or object is filmed in front of a green screen, the camera can easily detect the green color and separate it from the rest of the image. This is because the color green is not typically found in skin tones, clothing, or other objects that might be in the frame.After the green color has been detected, a computer program can remove it from the final image and replace it with a different background. This is called chroma keying, and it is often used in movies and television shows to create special effects.So, the reason green screens are green is because it is easier to use a computer to remove the green color from the final image and replace it with something else. Blue and red are not used as often because they are more difficult to remove and can create more problems with the final image.

If someone has made a promise to you and has not fulfilled it, you may have a legal remedy available to you. Depending on the circumstances of the promise and the nature of the breach, you may be able to seek damages or specific performance.Damages refer to monetary compensation that is awarded to compensate you for any losses or harms that you have suffered as a result of the breach of promise. Damages are typically awarded in cases where it is difficult or impossible to make the other party fulfill their promise.Specific performance is a legal remedy that requires the other party to fulfill their promise as originally agreed upon. This remedy is typically only granted in cases where damages are not an adequate remedy, and it is possible for the other party to fulfill their promise.In order to seek either of these remedies, you will generally need to file a lawsuit in court and prove that the other party made a promise to you, that they failed to fulfill the promise, and that you have suffered damages as a result. It is important to note that the availability of these remedies will depend on the specific laws of your jurisdiction and the specifics of your case. It is always advisable to consult with a qualified attorney to determine the best course of action in your specific situation.

Geosynchronous orbits are special types of orbits that allow a satellite to stay in the same position above the Earth's surface. This is possible because the satellite is orbiting the Earth at the same speed that the Earth is spinning. Imagine you are standing on a playground merry-go-round. If you walk around the edge of the merry-go-round at the same speed that it is spinning, you will stay in the same place and not fall off. Similarly, a satellite in a geosynchronous orbit stays in the same place above the Earth because it is moving at the same speed as the Earth's rotation. Even though the satellite is not falling towards the Earth, it is still being pulled towards the Earth by the Earth's gravity. This is what keeps the satellite in orbit around the Earth. The satellite is constantly falling towards the Earth, but it is also constantly moving forward in its orbit, so it never actually hits the ground.
