"Taxation without Representation" is a phrase that refers to the fact that people who live in Washington D.C., which is the capital city of the United States, do not have the same representation in the government as people who live in other states. In the United States, every state gets to send representatives to Congress, which is the group of people who make the laws for the country. These representatives are chosen by the people who live in each state, and they are supposed to represent the interests of the people in their state when they make decisions in Congress. However, Washington D.C. is not a state, so it does not have any representatives in Congress. This means that the people who live in Washington D.C. do not have anyone to represent their interests when laws are being made. Even though they have to pay taxes like everyone else, they do not have any say in how those taxes are used or how the laws that affect them are made. The phrase "Taxation without Representation" is a way of saying that the people in Washington D.C. are being treated unfairly because they have to pay taxes but they do not have any representation in the government. The license plates in Washington D.C. say "Taxation without Representation" to remind people of this issue and to call attention to the fact that the people of Washington D.C. do not have the same rights as people who live in other states.

Most modern monitors have a white backlight , and pixels composed of three smaller * subpixels * for red , blue , and green , which are tinted LCD rectangles that , when combined side - by - side - by - side , form a square . Each LCD subpixel can change its opacity from completely clear ( which makes it the same color as the tint , so pure red , blue , or green ) , to completely opaque ( which makes it black ) , and every shade in between . The subpixels are so close together that you see them all combined as a single color , and a combination of red , blue , and green light can create practically every color our eyes are able to see .

There is no one specific reason why people tend to sleep with their heads farthest from the door. Ultimately, the way that someone sleeps is a matter of personal preference and there is no "right" or "wrong" way to do it.

Down Syndrome is usually caused by inheriting an extra copy of chromosome 21 from either parent . This extra copy causes a lot of problems including infertility . Hah , this was a good test for the " no bias " rule ! Not like I actually expected anyone to present the arguments against the holocaust in a neutral manner , but I was hoping for a little better than 90 % psychological generalizations . I do n't know anything about this , but I just read the [ wikipedia article ] ( URL_0 ) on it , so let me summarize what I 've just learned ( basically , a history of holocaust denial ): 1 . There are a variety of threads in this movement . There are some who outright deny the Holocaust , there are others who think the number killed was an exaggeration , there are some who do n't believe

the gas chambers were used . These claims range from outright crackpot nonsense to intelligently presented theories . 2 . The denial movement was headed by Harry Barnes , a progressive historian who actually started his career as a Germany - hater until after WW1 , where he suddenly went 180 and did a very admirable job of defending Germany 's reputation and fighting the notion that Germany was responsible for the war . He became an isolationist and ended up being sued for libel by some guy he accused of scheming aggression against Germany . This guy had the anti - defamation league behind him and basically had enough money to easily crush Barnes . Barnes seemed to become bitter by this point , because from here

on out he talks about jewish conspiracies and shit in addition to his legitimate research . He claimed that Germany was forced into war by " economic strangulation " and was a victim of a smear campaign . 3 . Following Barnes in the ' 60 's were a host of intellectuals who denied the holocaust . The big guy in America was David Hoggans , a professor who earned his PhD from Harvard . He hung out with Barnes and was very influenced by him , but took the whole thing a lot farther , writing * The Myth of Six Million * which was very influential . He thought all of the evidence for the holocaust was fabricated , and his book was pretty apologist .

This seems to be the direction that holocaust denial headed in . 4 . The big guy in France , Paul Rassinier , I find to be considerably more interesting . The reason is because this guy was actually in German concentration camps and and a resistance fighter against the Nazis . He survived the concentration camps by becoming friends with the block chief who managed to ensure that the food parcels his wife mailed him were n't plundered . He briefly managed to get a job as a servant to some company that managed the guard dogs , so he got to see the workings of the SS up close . He was eventually put on a death train but jumped off and escaped . Years later

, he gets distressed by the picture of the holocaust that was developing and published his own account . He argued that there was no policy of extermination and that many of the brutalities in the camps were actually due to communist prisoners who took over and tried to organize a resistance . Some of his later work is questionable . 5 . The main force behind Holocaust denial these days is the Institute for Historical Review ( IHR ) . It was founded by the former head of the antisemitic organization " Liberty Lobby " . The current head was a member of the National Alliance ( a white supremacist group ) . They focused on distributing the writings of Barnes and Rassinier , and had a

a favorite of conspiracy theorists . I 'll leave it to other posters if anyone wants to get into the details of any of the holocaust denial theories . From my cursory research it seems like the most common thing holocaust deniers target is the gas chambers , because it seems like a very inefficient way to kill people when you could just take em out back and shoot them . However , I do n't know anything about these theories so I wo n't delve into them .

The National Football League (NFL) is a professional American football league consisting of 32 teams, divided equally between the National Football Conference (NFC) and the American Football Conference (AFC). Despite its name, the NFL is not a non-profit organization. Instead, it is a professional sports league that generates revenue from a variety of sources, including ticket sales, merchandise sales, and television contracts. The NFL makes money in several ways. For example, the league sells tickets to its games, and it also sells merchandise such as jerseys, hats, and other items with team logos on them. The league also makes money from television contracts, which give networks the right to broadcast NFL games. The money that the NFL makes is used to pay for various expenses, including player salaries, stadium construction and maintenance, and other expenses related to running the league. Some of the money is also used to fund charitable and community programs. While the NFL is not a non-profit organization, it does have a structure that is similar to a non-profit in some ways. For example, the league is made up of 32 teams, each of which is owned by a group of investors. These investors are responsible for managing their team and making decisions about how to use the team's resources. The NFL also has a Commissioner who is responsible for overseeing the league and making sure that it is run smoothly and fairly.

When you breathe in, your body takes in oxygen from the air and delivers it to your cells. Your cells use the oxygen to break down glucose (a type of sugar) and other nutrients in a process called cellular respiration. During cellular respiration, your cells produce energy and also produce carbon dioxide as a byproduct. The carbon dioxide is then exhaled out of your body when you breathe out.So, to sum it up, the carbon dioxide that you exhale comes from the process of your body breaking down food and producing energy. It is not something that you directly inhale, but is produced by your cells as a byproduct of cellular respiration.

Tonsillectomy (surgical removal of the tonsils) is generally not recommended for the treatment of recurrent tonsillitis unless the tonsillitis is causing severe problems such as difficulty swallowing, sleep apnea, or other significant health issues. In most cases, tonsillitis can be effectively treated with antibiotics and other medical treatments.Before considering tonsillectomy as a treatment option, it is important to discuss the potential risks and benefits with a healthcare provider. Some of the potential risks of tonsillectomy include bleeding, infection, and difficulty swallowing. It is also important to consider whether the tonsillitis is being caused by a specific type of bacteria that might not be effectively treated with antibiotics, in which case tonsillectomy might be a more appropriate treatment option.In general, tonsillectomy is typically reserved for cases where tonsillitis is recurrent and causing severe problems, or when other medical treatments have not been successful in controlling the tonsillitis. It is always a good idea to speak with a healthcare provider to determine the best course of treatment for your daughter's specific case.

Languages are invented for a variety of reasons. One reason is to help people communicate with each other. When people speak the same language, they can understand each other and share their thoughts and ideas.Languages can also be invented to express new ideas or concepts that may not have existed in previous languages. You have to first understand the most basic level of buying stock in a company . What you actually buy is a piece of a company 's future profits . As long as everyone remembers that , you generally do n't have bubbles . If people lose sight of that ( like because of a super - exciting new technology ) , and instead get to thinking " I 'm gon na buy this because someone else will pay more for it next week " , then weird things can happen . Someone buys for $ 1 today figuring they 'll sell for $ 2 tomorrow . Someone pays $ 2 thinking they 'll make $ 3 . Someone buys for $ 3 thinking they 'll make $

4 . So far so good - everyone that has bought and sold the stock has made a dollar , so buying the stock looks like a great idea . When you 're not thinking about how much you 're paying for a chunk of a company 's earnings , and instead worried about flipping it to someone else , there 's no real reason for the party to stop at any particular price . Still , the price eventually gets so far out of whack from reality ( or some bad news gets out ) that some people leave the party and sell the bubble stock . That freaks out more people , who also leave , and soon no one is buying any more . When

everyone is selling and no one is buying , prices drop very hard . Whoever came to the party last ends up losing most ( or all ) of the money they spent on stock . In the case of the dot - com bubble , people realized that they had been throwing this price - rising party around companies that were n't making any money at all , and in fact , seemed to be running out of the money they had . That ( and other things , but keeping this simple for ELI5 ) spooked people enough to end the party . Why is it bad ? If you invested your retirement savings right before the party was over , you 'd be pretty mad

n't invest during the bubble . When the party is over , a lot of the companies involved will have to lay off a bunch of people or will disappear altogether , so a bunch of people will be out of work . No one wants to invest money because they 're not sure what 's going on , and so even " good " companies , ones that could make a bunch of money , ca n't get enough investment money to grow . That means they ca n't hire the people that lost their jobs . Eventually it evens out , but can suck real bad for a lot of people for a really long time .

The term "20/20" is used to describe normal vision, which means that a person is able to see clearly at a distance of 20 feet what should normally be seen at that distance. It is a standard used to measure visual acuity, which is the clarity or sharpness of your vision.The first number in the "20/20" measurement, which is 20 in this case, refers to the distance at which the measurement is taken (in feet). The second number refers to the distance at which a person with normal vision would be able to see clearly what you can see clearly at 20 feet.For example, if your vision is 20/40, it means that you need to be as close as 20 feet to see what a person with normal vision can see clearly at a distance of 40 feet. This means that your vision is not as sharp as someone with 20/20 vision.The same measurement system is used for both nearsightedness and farsightedness. Nearsightedness means that you can see things clearly up close, but things that are farther away appear blurry. Farsightedness means that you can see things clearly from far away, but things that are up close appear blurry.I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

G suits are actually by pilots when they do high G maneuvers , not from breaking the sound barrier . You can pull high G 's at relatively slow speeds . When you are pulling high positive Gs , the forces are pulling blood down from the top of your body to your bottom extremities . This means your head gets less blood and thus less oxygen than it needs to keep you from passing out - you end up experiencing things like tunnel vision , muffled hearing , and then eventually greying out / blacking out and G - LOC ( G - induced Loss of Consciousness ) . G - suits ( actually Anti - G suit ) are worn by pilots . These are essentially wrapped around your abdominals and legs and contain internal pouches . The G - suit has a hose which the pilot connects to a valve in the cockpit . When high Gs are pulled , pressurized bleed air from the engine goes through the hose into the pouches in the suit , inflating them . Think of it like blowing air into a balloon and having it inflate . When the pouches inflate , they push on your abdominals and legs thus creating pressure that helps fight blood flowing down to your legs , making you more resistant to G - forces .

The general idea is to exploit a bug in the target application to cause unintended behaviour . I 'll give some examples of common exploits so you get the idea : * [ Buffer overflow ] ( URL_3 ) A buffer overflow occurs when an application writes more data to a buffer than was allocated to that buffer . This can be exploited to modify the data that was stored after the buffer . On the stack that includes the return address , so this can lead to arbitrary code execution . A related error is to read more data from the buffer than was allocated . This was the exploit found in OpenSSL recently . * [ Code injection ] ( URL_1 ) A code injection exploit

occurs when user input is copied into an executable script without sanitation , and that script is then executed Injection of JavaScript is called XSS , and can occur when user input is displayed on a web page without sanitation . Injection of SQL can occur when string concatenation is used to build an SQL query without escaping special characters . * [ File inclusion ] ( URL_0 ) A file inclusion vulnerability occurs when a web application can be manipulated into fetching a file that it was n't supposed to . A local file inclusion occurs when the file fetched is on the same server as the web page . This can reveal information that was not supposed to be public . A remote file inclusion occurs

logged in users by means of a cookie containing an identifier unique to that session . This cookie is sent when making any request to that site . A CSRF attack occurs when an attacker manipulates the client application into sending a request to the site that the user did not authorize . This can be done by sending an image to the user with the web page as the image location . For this reason , many email programs will not open images from remote locations . These exploits are all very common , but they 're only a small sample of the ways in which an application can be compromised .

The building blocks of every living thing in the world -including us- are molecules . These are lumps of even smaller things , known as atoms . When molecules break apart inside your body , the glue that holds them together can either still be sticky or become very dry . If the glue is dry then the two parts are not going to stick to anything else and that 's absolutely fine , they 'll go somewhere else or maybe you 'll get rid of them ! " Free Radicals " are formed when molecules break apart and one or both of the parts that are left still have sticky glue . The glue means that they want to stick to something nearby ( like when you

peel a sticker off of something , it 's really hard to get off your hand ! ) Unfortunately your body can be quite fragile with respect to free radicals , if they stick to your DNA ( a molecule in you that is like the " blueprint " for your whole body ! ) it can change what the DNA looks like , maybe even break it ! This can mean that the blueprint gets changed and can lead to many diseases . Another problem with free radicals is that they will often split molecules by sticking to them , this means that you can have a huge chain reaction inside you of molecules breaking apart into free radicals ! Antioxidants are the solution to these free

A disaster is a catastrophic event that causes widespread destruction, loss, and suffering. Disasters can take many forms, including natural disasters, such as earthquakes, hurricanes, and floods, and man-made disasters, such as oil spills, nuclear accidents, and cyber attacks. Disasters can have a wide range of impacts, including loss of life, damage to infrastructure, disruption of essential services, and economic hardship. Disasters often require emergency response efforts to address immediate needs, as well as long-term recovery and reconstruction efforts to rebuild affected communities.

Hand, foot, face, and body creams are all types of moisturizers, which are products that are used to hydrate and nourish the skin. They work by providing the skin with the moisture it needs to stay healthy and feel soft and smooth. The main difference between hand, foot, face, and body creams is the specific needs of the skin in those areas. For example, the skin on your hands and feet tends to be thicker and more prone to dryness, so hand and foot creams are usually formulated to be more emollient (moisturizing) and provide more intense hydration. Face creams are usually lighter in consistency and are designed to be easily absorbed by the skin, as the skin on the face is more delicate. Body creams are typically formulated for use on the rest of the body and are generally thicker and more moisturizing than face creams. You can use any type of moisturizer on any part of your body, but using a product that is specifically formulated for the needs of your skin in that area may be more effective. For example, using a lighter face cream on your hands or a thicker body cream on your face may not be as effective as using a product that is formulated specifically for those areas.

First off , hope your hangover gets better . Now , on to the explanation . When you drink alcohol , a good portion of it ( 15 % or more ) is absorbed directly through your stomach wall into your bloodstream and starts to affect you brain . The rest of it hits a few minutes later , when it passes through your small intestine , like carbs or protein or any other nutrient . Alcohol in your blood will affect your brain ( you 'll feel this as being tipsy / drunk ) , but it 's also toxic . It 's not going to kill you immediately , but in high enough quantities it can cause alcohol poisoning , which is why your body wants

to get rid of it . That 's where your liver comes in . It breaks down the alcohol molecules in a few steps into molecules that your body can use for energy ( if you 're curious , it looks like this : alcohol -- > acetaldehyde -- > acetic acid -- > acetyl - CoA ) . That stuff - the acetyl - CoA - can be used for energy , so it then goes to your cells and is used for fuel . That 's what happens to alcohol in your system . Hangovers merit their own explanaition . Hangovers have a few different causes ( and we are n't exactly sure about all of them ) but the number one cause of a hangover

main ones . The number one cure for a hangover is hydration before - and during - alcohol intake . Make sure you 've had plenty of water before you go out , and keep drinking water while you 're drinking . AT LEAST one glass of water every couple drinks . You 'll feel way better in the morning . Also , do n't drink on an empty stomach . Okay , that was pretty long but hopefully you got the idea .

In statistics, the k-nearest neighbors algorithm (k-NN) is a non-parametric supervised learning method first developed by Evelyn Fix and Joseph Hodges in 1951, and later expanded by Thomas Cover. It is used for classification and regression. In both cases, the input consists of the k closest training examples in a data set. The output depends on whether k-NN is used for classification or regression:k-NN is a type of classification where the function is only approximated locally and all computation is deferred until function evaluation. Since this algorithm relies on distance for classification, if the features represent different physical units or come in vastly different scales then normalizing the training data can improve its accuracy dramatically.Both for classification and regression, a useful technique can be to assign weights to the contributions of the neighbors, so that the nearer neighbors contribute more to the average than the more distant ones. For example, a common weighting scheme consists in giving each neighbor a weight of 1/d, where d is the distance to the neighbor.The neighbors are taken from a set of objects for which the class (for k-NN classification) or the object property value (for k-NN regression) is known. This can be thought of as the training set for the algorithm, though no explicit training step is required.A peculiarity of the k-NN algorithm is that it is sensitive to the local structure of the data.

Our sense of smell works by detecting molecules in the air that are released by different substances. When we first walk into a room and smell something strong, our brain is processing that information and sending it to the part of the brain that controls our sense of smell. As we continue to be in the room and breathe in the same molecules over and over again, our brain starts to "tune out" or ignore the smell. This is because our brains are designed to filter out information that doesn't change or that isn't important, so that we can focus on other things. This is why, after a while, the smell seems normal to us and we don't notice it as much. Think of it like this: if you listen to a song on repeat, it might sound really interesting and catchy at first, but after a while, you might start to tune it out and not pay as much attention to it. It's the same with smells. Our brains are constantly trying to figure out what is important and what isn't, and they learn to ignore things that don't change or that aren't important.

If you assume something , you are taking it to be true for the purposes of discussion ( assuming X = 5 solve for Y ; how would an estate be treated assuming it is subject to the Uniform Probate Code ) . There 's no pare of that assumption that posits that it 's actually * true * , just that you 're taking it as true for the moment . To presume something means that you actually suspect it 's true , but that you do n't have confirmation of yet . I presume you 're a human being , and that you 're capable of reading . Presuming is jumping the gun on something you 're pretty sure of , but not certain . Assuming is taking something as true , but without any assertion that it is . If you think about it in classic logic , an assumption is the basis of the syllogism , of deductive reasoning ( assuming all men are mortal and assuming Socrates is a man , Socrates is mortal ) . The syllogism is valid , but you 're not saying that you 've proven that all men are mortal or that Socrates is a man . The presumption is the other side , inductive reasoning , based on experience and probability . I presume my girlfriend will be calling me when she gets off work tomorrow to see if I need anything from the store .

When you delete a file, it is moved to a special folder called the "Recycle Bin" or "Trash" on your computer. This is a temporary storage area for deleted files.If you want to get rid of the file permanently and free up space on your computer, you can empty the Recycle Bin. When you do this, the computer removes the deleted files from the Recycle Bin and permanently removes them from your computer.This means that the computer removes all traces of the deleted files from your hard drive, and it's not possible to recover them. However, it's important to note that emptying the Recycle Bin does not completely erase the deleted files from your computer. It is possible for someone with specialized software to recover deleted files, even after they have been removed from the Recycle Bin.

Things do have a color , but in the end how we " see " it is based on how our human sight has developed . Let me explain . Our sun emits radiation over an entire electromagnetic spectrum . The human eye has evolved to detect a very narrow band of that spectrum called visible light . Light behaves like a wave ( sometimes ) , and the frequency of that wave ( within that narrow visible light band ) determines its color . So why do objects have color ? Well all objects are made of atoms of different elements . The short answer is that the atomic composition of grass absorbs light color bands ( within the visual spectrum ) except green , meaning the green area of the light band reflects off and goes into your eye . The same is true for all objects . So in conclusion , yes everything actually has color , but it is a function of how our human eyes developed to see light and the frequencies of this visible light that bounces off a particular object ( due to its atomic structure ) . Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) is a measure of how much stuff a country produces . It includes goods like food , clothing , electronics and cars as well as service industries like lawyers , doctors and accountants . The more stuff a country produces , the more stuff the country 's citizens can consume . So , if there is more food being produced it means that there is more food for people to eat . If GDP goes down that means that there is less stuff for people to consume and it usually means that more people are going to go hungry or not have the things they need .

Tough spot. I'm guessing the credit cards are a personal line of credit in their name and not the company's (the fact that the business can be liquidated separately from your parents means they did at least set up an LLC or similar business entity). Using personal debt to save a company that could have just been dissolved at little cost to their personal credit and finances was, indeed, a very bad move. The best possible end to this scenario for you and your parents would be if your parents could get the debt transferred to the LLC before dissolving it. At this point, with the company in such a long-standing negative situation, I would doubt that any creditor would give the business a loan (which was probably

why your parents threw their own good money after bad with personal CCs). They might, in the right circumstances, be able to convince a judge to effectively transfer the debt to the corporate entity before liquidating it. That puts the debt where it should have been in the first place, and the CC companies will have to get in line. That means, in turn, that the card issuers will fight any such motion or decision tooth and nail, as long as there's any other option that gives them more hope of recovering their money. Your parents' only prayer for this to happen is if the CCs were used for the sole purpose of business expenses. If they were living off the CCs as well as using them to

pay business debts, a judge, best-case, would only relieve the debts directly related to keeping the business afloat, and they'd be on the hook for what they had been living on. Bankruptcy is definitely an option. They will "re-affirm" their commitment to paying the mortgage and any other debts they can, and under a Chapter 13 the judge will then remand negotiations over what total portion of each card's balance is paid, over what time, and at what rate, to a mediator. Chapter 13 bankruptcy is the less damaging form to your parent's credit; they are at least attempting to make good on the debt.  A Chapter 7 would wipe it away completely, but your parents would have to prove that they cannot pay the debt, by

any means, and have no hope of ever paying the debt by any means. If they have any retirement savings, anything in their name for grandchildren's college funds, etc, the judge and CC issuers will point to it like a bird dog. Apart from that, their house is safe due to Florida's "homestead" laws, but furniture, appliances, clothing, jewelry, cars and other vehicles, pretty much anything of value that your parents cannot defend as being necessary for life, health, or the performance of whatever jobs they end up taking to dig themselves out of this, are all subject to seizure and auction. They may end up just selling the house anyway because it's too big for what they have left (or will ever have again). I do not,

Hiroshima and Nagasaki were both destroyed by nuclear bombs, which released a large amount of radiation into the air. This radiation caused harm to people who were in the immediate area at the time of the explosions, and it also contaminated the environment. However, the bombs were detonated in the air, so the radiation was not concentrated in a specific location like it was at Chernobyl.Chernobyl was a nuclear power plant that experienced a meltdown, which is a type of accident where the nuclear reactor overheats and releases a large amount of radiation. The radiation from the Chernobyl disaster was concentrated in a specific location, and it made the area around the power plant unsafe for people to live in.To understand the difference, think of the radiation from the bombs in Hiroshima and Nagasaki like a spray of water from a hose. The water sprays out in all directions, but it doesn't stay in one place. The radiation from Chernobyl, on the other hand, is like a pool of water that stays in one place and doesn't go away.

Selective breeding (also called artificial selection) is the process by which humans use animal breeding and plant breeding to selectively develop particular phenotypic traits (characteristics) by choosing which typically animal or plant males and females will sexually reproduce and have offspring together. Domesticated animals are known as breeds, normally bred by a professional breeder, while domesticated plants are known as varieties, cultigens, cultivars, or breeds. Two purebred animals of different breeds produce a crossbreed, and crossbred plants are called hybrids. Flowers, vegetables and fruit-trees may be bred by amateurs and commercial or non-commercial professionals: major crops are usually the provenance of the professionals.In animal breeding, techniques such as inbreeding, linebreeding, and outcrossing are utilized. In plant breeding, similar methods are used. Charles Darwin discussed how selective breeding had

biology.Selective breeding can be unintentional, for example, resulting from the process of human cultivation; and it may also produce unintended – desirable or undesirable – results. For example, in some grains, an increase in seed size may have resulted from certain ploughing practices rather than from the intentional selection of larger seeds. Most likely, there has been an interdependence between natural and artificial factors that have resulted in plant domestication.

Injecting air into the body can be dangerous because it can cause an air embolism. An air embolism is a blockage of a blood vessel by an air bubble. If an air bubble gets into the bloodstream and travels to the heart or brain, it can cause a heart attack or stroke, which can be deadly.The heart is a muscle that pumps blood throughout the body. When the heart is working correctly, it pumps blood in a regular and organized way. However, if an air bubble gets into the heart, it can disrupt the normal flow of blood and cause the heart to stop pumping effectively. This is called a cardiac arrest.Injecting air into the body can also cause other problems, such as damage to the blood vessels or tissues. It is important to always be careful when using needles and to only use them as directed by a healthcare professional.

The hardness of the vein in the penis can be caused by various factors. One possible cause is the presence of blood within the vein, which can cause the vein to become more rigid and harder to the touch. This is a normal physiological response that occurs during an erection, as the blood flow to the penis increases and the veins constrict to help maintain the erection.Another possible cause of a hard vein in the penis could be a condition called Peyronie's disease, which is characterized by the formation of scar tissue within the penis. This scar tissue can cause the penis to bend or curve abnormally and can also cause the veins to become more prominent and harder.It's important to note that the presence of a hard vein in the penis alone is not necessarily a cause for concern, and it can be a normal variant in some individuals. However, if you are experiencing ED, lacking morning erections, and weak erections, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider to determine the underlying cause and discuss treatment options. It is also important to practice safe sex and use a condom to reduce the risk of sexually transmitted infections, which can cause ED and other problems with sexual function.

A 401(k) is a type of retirement account that some employers offer to their employees. It's a way for you to save money for when you stop working and are no longer earning a salary.Here's how it works: you can choose to have some of your paycheck automatically put into your 401(k) account each month. This money is then invested in things like stocks and bonds, which can potentially earn more money over time.There are some risks involved with investing, including the possibility that the value of your investments might go down. However, if you invest for a long time and the value of your investments goes up, you could end up with a lot more money in your 401(k) when you retire.It's important to think about how much money you want to save for retirement and to choose the right investments for your 401(k) account. You might want to talk to a financial advisor or do some research to help you make these decisions.

There are currently three different currencies used in Venezuela: the bolívar soberano, the bolívar fuerte, and the US dollar. The bolívar soberano is the official currency of Venezuela, but it has lost significant value due to hyperinflation and economic mismanagement. As a result, many people in Venezuela use the US dollar as an alternative currency, particularly for larger transactions or to save their wealth. The bolívar fuerte, which was introduced in 2008, is no longer in use.The use of multiple currencies in Venezuela is a result of the country's economic crisis, which has been ongoing for several years. The crisis has been fueled by a combination of factors, including low oil prices, mismanagement of the economy, and a lack of access to international credit markets. As a result, the bolívar has lost significant value, and many people have turned to using alternative currencies as a way to protect their wealth.

When you manipulate a big sheet of thin metal, it vibrates and produces sound waves. These sound waves can be low frequency, or "wub wub" sounds. The thin metal sheet acts like a drum skin, and the air surrounding it acts as the drum chamber. When the metal sheet is hit or moved, it vibrates and produces sound waves that travel through the air. The size and shape of the metal sheet, as well as the amount of tension on the sheet, can all affect the pitch and timbre of the sound it produces. So, when you move or manipulate a big sheet of thin metal, it vibrates and produces a "wibbley wobbley" or "wub wub" sound because of the sound waves that it creates.

A Turing machine is * not * in a CPU and it does * not * manipulate binary data . It is important to not start with false assumptions , I think . :-) A Turing machine is more like a rule - based game than a physical toy . Think of it like the game Solitaire . You start with a deck of shuffled cards and lay them out according to the rules of the game . This is one part of the Turing machine , which we call the input . The next part of the Turing machine is the end state --- this describes the conditions when the game has ended . In Solitaire you win by getting all your cards into numerical ordered columns

; and you lose by getting through all your cards without managing to do this , so you have no further options . The third important part of the Turing machine is the rules of the game : at each stage it tells you which moves you can make . In some types of game there are several moves you can make at each step , and it 's a matter of the player to choose . Others there is no choice and the fun of the game comes from having it unfold in front of you even though you ca n't affect the outcome . The Turing machine was invented to make formal the notion of rules and processes . The question that Alan Turing wanted to

answer was about the " end game " . Is it possible to know whether you will win a game of Solitaire without playing the game of Solitaire ? Could you be stuck in an endless loop if there was no way to lose , only to win ? In the process of answering this question he realised that he could write down each of his Turing machines as a grouping of symbols , like { input , rules , end conditions } and that would be a complete definition of that Turing machine . This would be the ultimate formal definition of Solitaire , or whatever . But once you 've got a definition of a Turing machine as a series of symbols , you can feed

Benzene is a colorless, sweet-smelling chemical compound that is used in a variety of industrial and commercial applications. It is a naturally occurring aromatic hydrocarbon that is found in crude oil and is a component of many products, including plastics, resins, synthetic fibers, rubber, dyes, detergents, pharmaceuticals, and pesticides. Benzene is also used as a solvent and as a starting material for the manufacture of a wide range of chemicals.One of the main uses of benzene is as a starting material for the production of a wide range of chemicals, including styrene, which is used to make plastics and rubber; phenol, which is used to make plastics, resins, and fibers; and cumene, which is used to make plastics and resins. Benzene is also used in the production of detergents, pharmaceuticals, and pesticides.In addition to its use as a chemical intermediate, benzene is also used as a solvent in a variety of applications, including the manufacturing of paints, inks, adhesives, and other products. It is also used as a solvent in the laboratory for the extraction of chemicals and in the cleaning of laboratory equipment.Benzene is classified as a human carcinogen by the International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC) and the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS). It has been linked to leukemia and other cancers, and exposure to high levels of benzene can cause serious health problems. It is important to use caution when handling and using benzene and to follow all appropriate safety measures to minimize the risk of exposure.

It 's true that videos can be altered -- but so can audio recordings and paper documents . Even eyewitnesses can commit perjury or misremember the facts . For that reason , it 's the jury 's task to evaluate the merit of any evidence presented to it -- it can decide a witness is lying and disregard that testimony , or that a video is not trustworthy , and use that as a basis for its decision . This is why attorneys make arguments and call witnesses to provide authentication for the evidence . The store owner can testify as to his regular procedure for recording and storing data ; the police officer will testify how it was obtained ; a technical expert may assert the video is genuine . In many circumstances it 's actually required , and the attorney ca n't submit an unauthenticated document .

The fur on our bodies, or hair, serves a number of important functions, including protecting our skin from the sun's harmful ultraviolet (UV) rays and helping to regulate our body temperature. In colder climates, having a thick layer of fur can help keep us warm by trapping heat close to the skin. However, as humans evolved and developed more advanced ways of keeping warm, such as clothing and shelter, the need for thick fur became less important.Additionally, as humans began to engage in activities such as running and hunting, having less fur may have helped us stay cooler by allowing heat to be more easily released from the body. This is because sweating is an important way for the body to regulate its temperature, and sweat can evaporate more easily from bare skin than from fur.Overall, the loss of fur in humans is thought to be the result of a combination of factors, including the development of clothing and shelter, changes in activity levels, and the need to regulate body temperature more effectively.

The second was originally defined as a sixtieth of a minute which was a sixtieth of an hour with was a twenty - fourth of a day , i.e. , a second was one 86400th part of the mean solar day . It was n't until the 1940s that we had clocks ( quartz clocks ) that were more accurate than the spinning earth . The earliest second hands date back to pendulum clocks in the 16th Century . These could be made accurate enough to justify a second hand for short periods of time but they needed frequent correction by astronomical observations to maintain long - term accuracy .

There are several reasons why real-term bond yields may be declining. One possible reason is that the demand for bonds is increasing, which can push down yields. This may be because investors are seeking safe haven assets in times of economic uncertainty or because central banks are buying large amounts of bonds as part of their monetary policy.Another possible reason for declining real-term bond yields is that inflation expectations are falling. When investors expect that prices will rise more slowly in the future, they may be willing to accept lower yields on bonds. This is because the purchasing power of the bond's future cash flows will be worth more in the face of lower inflation.For investors, declining real-term bond yields can have both positive and negative implications. On the one hand, falling yields may lead to capital appreciation for bondholders, as the market value of existing bonds tends to rise when yields fall. On the other hand, declining yields can also reduce the income that investors receive from their bond investments.It's important to note that the direction of bond yields is not necessarily predictable and can be influenced by a wide range of factors, including economic conditions, monetary policy, and investor sentiment. As such, it's important for investors to consider the risks and potential returns of any investment and to diversify their portfolios appropriately.

A warlord is typically a person with no formal rank or title , who personally controls an army and occupies a territory . It 's usually used as a derogatory term . " King " can mean all kinds of different things . Usually they are monarchs who rule over a tribe of people , a city or a piece of land , and whose children will inherit this title . Usually a king is quite powerful , but there are many examples for kings who ruled just a small county or city . The word " emperor " comes from the Romans , who originally called the land they ruled over " imperium " , and hailed successful generals " imperator " . Eventually , the title of imperator became exclusive to the Roman emperors . This is how it became a word for exceptionally powerful kings , and is often applied to monarchs who have nothing to do with Rome .

Your brain does n't process the flow of time in a dream state . Instead the perception of time passing in your dream is directly correlated to the experience you are having . The rules of reality do n't really apply , ill illustrate . If you have a dream where you are watching a baseball game that last ten minutes it will seem much longer . This is because your brain understands how long a baseball game usually takes to play and uses your experiences from real life to simulate the passage of time in your dreams . So the dream is ten minutes but seems to last hours .

Urine is made in the kidneys, which are located near the middle of your back, just below the ribcage. The kidneys filter your blood and remove waste products and extra water, which are turned into urine. The urine is then stored in the bladder, which is a muscular sac located in the pelvis. When the bladder is full, it gets rid of the urine through a tube called the urethra, which is located at the bottom of the bladder and goes out of the body. The kidneys and bladder are not connected to the intestines. The intestines are part of the digestive system and are responsible for breaking down food and absorbing nutrients. The waste products from the digestive system are eliminated through the anus as feces, not through the bladder and urethra. I hope that helps to explain how urination works!

When someone dies, their credit card debt does not just disappear. Instead, it becomes a part of their estate, which is the collection of all their assets and liabilities. If the person had a will, the will may specify who should be responsible for paying off the credit card debt. If there is no will, the debt will be handled according to the laws of the state where the person lived. If the person had assets, such as money in a bank account or property, that are worth more than the amount of their debt, those assets can be used to pay off the debt. If there are not enough assets to pay off the debt, the credit card company may not be able to collect the remaining balance. However, if the person had a co-signer on the credit card or if they had a joint account with someone else, that person may be responsible for paying off the debt. It's important to note that this can vary depending on the state where the person lived and the specifics of the credit card agreement. It's also worth mentioning that if the person had life insurance, the policy may pay off some or all of their outstanding debts. It's a good idea to check the terms of the policy to see what is covered.

And having natural days is just more useful .

First , a slight clarification . Breaking your spine does not necessarily result in paralysis . Damage to the spinal cord results in paralysis . The spinal cord is a dense bundle of nerves that conducts electrical impulses from the brain to all other parts of the body and vice versa . The signals * * from * * the brain are what tells our muscles to move , and the the signals * * to * * the brain are mostly sensory feedback ( what things feel like ) . When the nerves are severed , it disrupts the flow of electrical signals and the brain and muscles can no longer communicate . It can not be fixed because there is currently no way to regenerate nerve cells . Once a nerve cell is severed , the two ends of the " cut " form scar tissue , but there is no way ( as of yet ) to reconnect them and get the current flowing again .

Mucous membranes are layers of cells that line the body's internal surfaces, such as the respiratory and digestive tracts, and secrete mucus. Mucus is a thick, slimy substance that helps to moisten and protect these surfaces. It also helps to trap and remove foreign particles, such as dust and bacteria, that may enter the body through the respiratory or digestive tracts. Mucus is produced by specialized cells called goblet cells, which are found in the mucous membranes. In addition to mucus, mucous membranes may also secrete other substances, such as enzymes, hormones, and antibodies, which help to protect the body against infection and other types of harm.

Aspartame is one of the most studied compounds in the world . It 's been through trial after trial after trial , and we 've still yet to find any good , solid , concrete evidence that it has any negative health consequences for adult humans at the doses we would normally be ingesting them at . However , due to some studies early in the research of aspartame that suggested it was a carcinogen , it got a bad rap early on , and it 's never really shaken it , since it got into the culture so deeply . We do n't find those studies to be particularly credible anymore , but it 's hard to overcome the damage it did to the common " knowledge " .

for a minute or two to remove the raw flour taste.Slowly add broth or stock to the pan, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming. You can use store-bought broth or make your own by simmering bones or vegetables in water.Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer until it thickens to your desired consistency. You can add additional seasonings such as herbs, salt, and pepper to taste.Once the gravy has thickened, you can strain it through a fine-mesh sieve to remove any bits of onion or garlic. The International Space Station (ISS) orbits the Earth in a path that is shaped like a slightly squashed circle, or an oval. This is because the ISS is being pulled towards the Earth by the Earth's gravity, but it is also moving very fast. When an object moves very fast, it is harder for gravity to pull it down, so it follows a curved path instead of falling straight down. To stay in orbit, the ISS has to keep moving at a specific speed and altitude. If it slows down or drops too low, it will fall back to Earth. If it speeds up or climbs too high, it will fly off into space. To maintain its orbit, the ISS uses thrusters, which are small engines that produce a jet of gas to push against. By firing the thrusters, the ISS can adjust its speed and direction to stay in its desired orbit. In the attached image, you can see a diagram of the ISS's orbit around the Earth. The curved line shows the path that the ISS follows as it orbits the Earth. The Earth is at the center of the diagram, and the ISS is shown as a small blue dot moving around it. I hope this helps to explain how the ISS's orbit is curved and how it uses propulsion to stay in orbit. Let me know if you have any other questions!

The price of a flash drive, or any other product, is determined by a variety of factors, including the cost of materials, labor, and manufacturing, as well as the demand for the product and the price that the market will bear. In the case of flash drives, the cost of materials and labor is likely to be similar for a 2 GB drive and an 8 GB drive, since both will require a similar amount of plastic, electronics, and labor to manufacture. However, the 8 GB drive will likely have a higher price because it can store more data and may be more useful to some customers, so it may be in higher demand and therefore command a higher price. In addition, the cost of manufacturing may be higher for the 8 GB drive due to the additional materials and labor required to produce it. When people talk about the central bank providing "cheap money," they usually mean that the central bank is making it easier for banks to borrow money from the central bank at a low interest rate. This is usually done through a process called "quantitative easing," in which the central bank buys government bonds or other securities from banks, thereby increasing the supply of money in the economy.The central bank may do this in order to stimulate economic growth by encouraging banks to lend more money to businesses and individuals, which can lead to increased spending and investment. The central bank may also do this to help stabilize the financial system during times of economic stress, such as a recession.As for the implications for the stock market, cheap money can potentially lead to an increase in stock prices, as it may make it easier for companies to borrow money and invest in their operations. This can lead to increased profits and higher stock prices. However, there are also risks associated with cheap money, such as the potential for asset bubbles and inflation. It's important to keep in mind that the relationship between the central bank, interest rates, and the stock market is complex, and there are many other factors that can influence stock prices.

Bounded rationality is the idea that rationality is limited when individuals make decisions, and under these limitations, rational individuals will select a decision that is satisfactory rather than optimal.Limitations include the difficulty of the problem requiring a decision, the cognitive capability of the mind, and the time available to make the decision. Decision-makers, in this view, act as satisficers, seeking a satisfactory solution, with everything that they have at the moment rather than an optimal solution. Therefore, humans do not undertake a full cost-benefit analysis to determine the optimal decision, but rather, choose an option that fulfils their adequacy criteria. An example of this being within organisations when they must adhere to the operating conditions of their company, this has the opportunity to result in bounded rationality as

optimization", which views decision-making as a fully rational process of finding an optimal choice given the information available. Therefore, bounded rationality can be said to address the discrepancy between the assumed perfect rationality of human behaviour (which is utilised by other economics theories such as the Neoclassical approach), and the reality of human cognition.  In short, bounded rationality revises notions of "perfect" rationality to account for the fact that perfectly rational decisions are often not feasible in practice because of the intractability of natural decision problems and the finite computational resources available for making them. The concept of bounded rationality continues to influence (and be debated in) different disciplines, including political science, economics, psychology, law and cognitive science.

Derealization is a feeling of detachment or disconnection from the world around you. It can make things feel like they're not real, or like you're observing them from a distance. It's not uncommon to experience derealization when you're under a lot of stress or going through a difficult time in your life. It can also be a symptom of certain medical conditions or a side effect of certain medications.It's not fully understood why derealization happens, but it may be related to changes in brain chemistry or the way the brain processes information. Some people may be more prone to derealization than others due to genetics or other factors.If you're experiencing derealization and it's causing you distress, it's important to talk to a doctor or mental health professional. They can help you determine the cause of your derealization and provide treatment to help you feel more connected to the world around you.

Supply chain management is the process of organizing the flow of goods and services from the point of origin to the point of consumption. It involves managing the movement and storage of raw materials, work-in-process inventory, and finished goods from one place to another. In a restaurant, supply chain management would involve ordering ingredients and other supplies, such as dishes and utensils, from suppliers and coordinating their delivery to the restaurant. It would also involve managing the storage of these supplies in the restaurant's pantry, fridge, and freezer, as well as keeping track of inventory levels to ensure there is enough of everything to meet the demand of customers. In a grocery store, supply chain management would involve ordering products from manufacturers and wholesalers and coordinating their delivery

The ex-dividend date is the date on or after which a stock is traded without the dividend being owed to the buyer. It is used to determine which shareholders are entitled to receive a dividend payment.If you purchase a stock on its ex-dividend date or later, you will not be entitled to receive the next dividend payment. Instead, the seller of the stock will receive the dividend.Time zones can be relevant for determining the ex-dividend date because stock markets operate on specific schedules, and the ex-dividend date is typically set based on the market's operating hours. For example, if a stock market is open from 9:30 AM to 4:00 PM Eastern Standard Time (EST), and the ex-dividend date is set for two business days before the record date, the ex-dividend date will be at least two business days before the record date at 4:00 PM EST.It's important to note that the ex-dividend date and the record date may not be the same. The record date is the date on which a company takes a snapshot of its shareholders to determine who is entitled to receive the dividend. If you want to be eligible to receive a dividend, you must be on the company's record as a shareholder on the record date.

Asperger's syndrome is a condition that affects how a person communicates with others and relates to the world around them. It is a type of autism, which is a group of conditions that can cause difficulties with social interaction and communication. People with Asperger's syndrome may have trouble understanding social cues, such as facial expressions or tone of voice, and may have difficulty making friends or engaging in conversations with others. They may also have repetitive behaviors or interests, and may find it hard to understand other people's perspectives or emotions. It is important to note that everyone with Asperger's syndrome is different, and the severity of the condition can vary widely. Some people with Asperger's syndrome may need more support to manage their social and communication difficulties, while others may be able to live independently and lead fulfilling lives. It is important to seek the advice of a medical professional if you have concerns about your brother's development or behavior.

If the real interest rate (the interest rate after accounting for inflation) is negative, it means that the value of money is declining over time. These types of investments have the potential to grow in value over time and may offer a higher return than a traditional savings account.It's important to keep in mind that investing carries risk, and there is no guarantee that you will earn a positive return on your investment. Before investing, it's a good idea to do your research and understand the risks and potential rewards of different investment options.You might also consider using strategies to reduce your expenses and increase your income, such as creating a budget, negotiating for a higher salary or raising prices for your goods or services if you are self-employed. These strategies can help you save money even in an environment with negative real interest rates.

Germany lost the second world war . The country was divided among the victorious nations and France . Part of the country had all Germans driven out and given to countries like Poland , but there remained a smaller region inhabited by Germans an occupied by 4 allies US , UK , France and Russia . There was some initial idea of simply pushing the German people into some sort of nation of farmers and peasants who would never build up an industry of war again , but seeing as the US on one side and the Russians on the other were already eyeing each other up as future enemies in the next war , it was soon decided that having their Germans as allies in such a

war was preferable . The occupying forces build up the parts of the country in their own images , with the US , UK and France eventually uniting their parts into what eventually become West Germany and Russia building up what was left of the part they conquered as East Germany . West Germany was democratic and capitalistic while East Germany was communist . Berlin the former capital of Germany was in the part belonging to the Soviets , but was also symbolically divided among the four allies . So there was a west berlin made up of the US , UK and French parts and an East Berlin belonging to the Russians . The West Berlin was surrounded on all sides by East Germany . an island

of capitalism in a sea of communism . At first there was n't much of a border between the two parts of Germany or the two parts of Berlin . The relatively open and unguarded border led to Germans moving into the parts of Germany that had the ideology they preferred . If you liked the idea of communism you went to the part that was communist and if you liked capitalism you went to the capitalist part . In theory this would make everyone happy . In practice a lot more people liked the promises of capitalism than the ideals of communism . People were leaving the East in large numbers . The East German government of course made this sort of thing illegal , but that

did not actually stop people from fleeing and there is the problem of convincing people that your system is superior if people are fleeing it in large numbers . One East German leader famously announced at a press conference that " nobody had any intention of building a wall " , which was funny because he had not actually been asked anything along those lines . shortly afterwards a wall was built . the entire border was built up to make crossing it illegally harder . In Berlin that building up of the border was quite dramatic as you did not just put up a fence in some field , the border between the two parts of Berlin often went through densely inhabited area . Walls were built

in the middle of what used to be busy roads and in some cases houses had their windows bricked up that opened up to the West . The Berlin Wall went though the heart of what used to be a united city and it was a visible symbol not just for the division of the two parts of the city but also for the division of Germany as a whole and to a degree the division of Europe . This was the state of things for 28 years . As time went on the difference between the two systems became more and more apparent to those living in the East . The west seemed richer and freer to many and a lot of people tried to cross the

border illegally . The East German government went as far as shooting people who tried to escape their country . In the late 80 there were a lot of reforms in the communist block , which made just shooting people who complained less likely . So towards the end people in East Germany went to the streets to protest . at first a few brave people , but week after week there were more . East Germans crossed over into the west via third countries and protests to allow free travel between the two increased . In the end there were too many protestors to simply run them down with tanks like the Chinese had done on the Tienanmen square and there was no guarantee that the police

and army would have complied with such an order if given anyway . The government in East Germany tried to stave of the inevitable with reforms , but the whole thing had already too much momentum for that to work . there were changes in the leadership in the east and people putting their head in the sand as everything started to fall apart . Eventually one spokesperson called Günter Schabowski went before the international press to announce some new reforms intended to satisfy the protesting population . They were the supposed to be the typical sound good but do nothing measures governments all over the world announce when they are in trouble . the Problem was that he had not been fully briefed on the what he

was announcing and made a critical mistake . He said what sounded like the East German government would be allowing free travel for its citizens to the West and when asked told reporters that the whole thing would come into force immediately as far as he knew . Nobody had told the guards manning the border crossing anything of that . So there was a large group of East Germans who had seen their government spokesperson announce in the western television that they could cross the border now and a few guards who suddenly found themselves abandoned by their superiors with no clear orders on what to do . The result were inevitable people crossed the border unopposed and since the border was already open the celebrating people

of the US and NATO and the CIA everyone else had not been able to do much to the communist block for decades , but the people rose up and basically demolished the whole thing from within just like that . It caught a lot of people by surprise even if many were quick to claim that it had been part of their plan all along . Eventually the two parts of Germany reunited into a united Germany that once again had Berlin as a united capital . On a border scale Europe itself United again as the entire Iron curtain came down .

I 'm someone who works in the pension plan field in the U.S. Below is a quick summary about U.S. pension plans . " Pension " is a broad term , but there are generally two kinds of pension plans : defined benefit plan and defined contribution plans . Pensions originally were set up as " defined benefit plans " , where in exchange for mandatory employee contributions , the employer is on the hook for paying out retirement benefits for life under a formula typically related to years of service and salary , no matter what . The main advantage of a DB plan to the employee is that the risk of funding and investing the plan assets is entirely on the employer , providing retirement security

. However , this is also the main disadvantage for employers . If employer revenues and investment returns on plan assets are n't keeping in step with plan liabilities , then the employer can become saddled over time with huge pension liabilities that it ca n't pay . The Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation is a federal " pension insurance " agency that protects retirement benefits for private sector employees to a certain extent should the company go belly - up . In the 1980s , defined contribution plans ( e.g. , 401(k ) , 403(b ) , 457(b ) plans ) began gaining popularity among employers . Instead of having the employer shoulder the burden of funding and investing the plan , the employer lets the employee take

his contributions ( sometimes with an employer match ) and invest it in an investment portfolio . Whatever the account earns over time is what the employee is left with when it comes time to retire . Employers love it because the funding obligations are less onerous ( or non - existent ) and the risk of poor market performance is borne by the employee . The downside for employees is that retirement security is lessened because benefits are directly impacted by market performance , and investment and annuitization fees are a constant drag on return . There are hybrids between DB and DC plans , like money purchase and cash balance plans , which although are technically DB plans , behave like DC plans in that they

Disclaimer : Not a cognitive scientist , just somebody who thinks cognitive science is cool . It 's a really good question and there are a lot of possible answers . The truth is that although our understanding of the brain has increased by leaps and bounds over the past few years , we do n't have a perfect understanding of why / how the brain works . It 's helpful to remember that every mental process is also physical in nature . Memories have to be physically stored in the brain in some way . Current research suggests that memories exist in the brain in the form of interconnected pathways . For example , imagine a smell from your childhood . Maybe your mother 's perfume ,

that memory , your brain needs to access those same pathways . The human brain is highly visual , so many memories are at least partially visual in nature . Frequently the easiest way to access a memory is to remember what that situation * looked like * . Evidence suggests that our brains reconstructs visual input the same way it encodes it , which is a process that typically involves the eyes scanning whatever 's in front of us . Something about the connection between our eyes moving and the brain interpreting / reconstructing a visual image makes it so that it 's easier to do both rather than one or the other .

To adjust a value for inflation each month using rolling 12-monthly inflation figures, you can follow these steps:Collect the inflation data for the past 12 months. You can obtain this data from a government agency or an economic research organization.Calculate the average inflation rate over the past 12 months by adding the inflation rates for each month and dividing the total by 12.Use the average inflation rate to adjust the value for inflation. For example, if the value you want to adjust is $100 and the average inflation rate over the past 12 months was 3%, you can adjust the value by multiplying it by (1 + 3/100), which would give you a new value of $103.Repeat this process each month, using the most recent 12 months of inflation data to calculate the average inflation rate and adjust the value accordingly.It's important to note that the inflation rate can vary significantly from month to month, so using a rolling 12-month average can help to smooth out these fluctuations and give you a more accurate picture of the overall trend in inflation.

It is generally a good idea to keep copies of your bank statements for tax and other official purposes, as they can provide important documentation for a variety of financial transactions. It is not necessary to keep hard copies of your bank statements, as long as you have access to digital copies that are accurate and complete.You can keep digital copies of your bank statements in a variety of ways, such as by saving them to your computer, backing them up to a cloud storage service, or by scanning hard copies and storing the digital versions.If you prefer to keep hard copies, it is important to store them in a safe and secure location. You may also want to consider making additional copies of important documents and keeping them in a separate location in case the original copies are lost or damaged.It is also a good idea to keep track of the retention period for different types of documents, as different types of records need to be kept for different periods of time. For example, tax records generally need to be kept for at least three years, while records related to real estate transactions may need to be kept indefinitely.In summary, it is generally a good idea to keep copies of your bank statements, whether they are in hard copy or digital form, for tax and other official purposes. Tofu, also known as bean curd, is a food made from soybeans. It is made by coagulating soy milk and pressing the resulting curds into blocks. The process for making tofu is similar to the process for making cheese from dairy milk.To make tofu, the first step is to soak soybeans in water for several hours or overnight to soften them. The soaked beans are then ground into a fine paste and mixed with water to create soy milk. The soy milk is then heated and coagulated using a coagulant, such as calcium sulfate or magnesium chloride. The coagulant causes the proteins in the soy milk to curdle and form solid curds, similar to the curds that form when milk is coagulated to make cheese.The curds are then separated from the liquid whey and pressed into blocks to form tofu. The tofu can be further processed and flavored in various ways, such as by marinating it or adding seasonings or spices. Tofu is a staple food in many East Asian cuisines and is also popular in many other parts of the world as a source of protein and a meat alternative. It is a versatile ingredient that can be used in a wide variety of dishes and can be prepared in many different ways, such as grilling, stir-frying, and deep-frying.

In an S corporation, capital gains are treated as ordinary income and are subject to tax at the individual level. This means that if an S corporation realizes a capital gain, it will be taxed as part of the owner's personal income, rather than at the corporate level.The tax rate on capital gains depends on the owner's individual tax bracket. For example, if the owner is in the 22% tax bracket, they will pay 22% tax on their capital gains.It's important to note that capital gains may be subject to different tax rates depending on the type of asset that was sold and the length of time that the asset was held. For example, long-term capital gains (gains on assets held for more than one year) may be taxed at a lower rate than short-term capital gains (gains on assets held for one year or less).It's also worth noting that S corporations may be eligible for certain tax benefits, such as the 20% qualified business income (QBI) deduction, which can potentially reduce the tax burden on capital gains and other business income.If you have further questions about how capital gains are taxed in an S corporation, it's a good idea to consult with a tax professional or refer to IRS guidelines.

The easiest explanation ( imo ) is that factorials represent the number of ways to order a number of objects . 3 ! is how many ways to order 3 objects and 3 ! = 6 ( 123 , 132 , 213 , 231 , 312 , 321 ) . 2 ! = 2 ( 12 and 21 ) . 1 ! is 1 because there is no choice in how we order the single object . Now , does it make sense for us to order NO objects ? Yes . It 's possible to have 0 of an object , so the number of orderings makes sense to exist . How many ways can we order no objects ? Well , we do n't have any choices to make for the ordering , so there 's only 1 ordering . Now , if we were to try to figure out ( -1 ) ! , we first have to ask ourselves " Does it make sense to order -1 objects ? " The answer is no since it 's impossible to have negative objects . While , we might owe someone an object ( like money ) , the owing itself is the object and we do n't have a negative number of objects .

High-frequency trading (HFT) is a type of trading that uses computer algorithms to execute trades at very high speeds, typically in fractions of a second. HFT allows traders to make many trades in a short period of time, which can be useful in certain situations, such as when prices are fluctuating rapidly or when there is a lot of trading activity happening in the market.There are a few reasons why HFT is allowed:Efficiency: HFT can make the markets more efficient by allowing trades to be executed more quickly, which can help to ensure that prices reflect the most up-to-date information and supply and demand conditions.Liquidity: HFT can also help to increase liquidity in the markets by providing more opportunities for buyers and sellers to trade with each other.Price discovery: HFT can also contribute to the process of price discovery, which is the process of determining the fair market value of a security or asset. By making many trades at high speeds, HFT can help to uncover hidden demand or supply imbalances that might not be visible in the market otherwise.Overall, HFT can provide some benefits to the economy by helping to make the markets more efficient, liquid, and transparent. However, HFT can also raise concerns, such as the potential for some traders to gain an unfair advantage over others or for HFT to contribute to market instability. As such, HFT is regulated to ensure that it is conducted in a fair and transparent manner.

Reddit is a website that was founded in 2005 by two college friends, Steve Huffman and Alexis Ohanian. The original intent of Reddit was to create a place where people could share and discuss interesting things they found on the internet.To create the Reddit we know today, there were a few major events and key players. One major event was the creation of "subreddits," which are smaller communities within Reddit that are dedicated to specific topics. This allowed people to find and join communities that were focused on their interests, and it helped Reddit to become a more diverse and welcoming place.Another important event was the addition of features like "upvoting" and "downvoting," which allowed users to vote on the quality of the content being shared on the site. This helped to ensure that the most popular and interesting content would rise to the top, and it encouraged users to share high-quality content.There have been many key players throughout Reddit's history, including the founders and early employees, as well as the community of users who have contributed to the site and helped to shape its culture.Overall, Reddit has evolved over the years from a small website for sharing links into a large and diverse online community where people can discuss and share just about anything.

Space probes are usually very far away from Earth, so it takes time for signals to travel back and forth between the probe and Earth. This means that there is often a delay, or lag, in the communication between the probe and Earth.To guide a space probe, engineers on Earth can send commands to the probe telling it to make small adjustments to its trajectory, or path through space. These adjustments can help the probe reach its destination more accurately.To know its exact location, a space probe uses a variety of sensors and instruments to measure its position and velocity. For example, it might use GPS (global positioning system) to determine its location relative to Earth. It might also use sensors to measure its speed and the direction it is moving.Once the probe has measured its position and velocity, it can send this information back to Earth using radio waves. Engineers on Earth can then use this information to determine the probe's exact location and make any necessary adjustments to its path.Overall, guiding a space probe involves a combination of sending commands from Earth and using sensors and instruments on the probe to measure its position and make adjustments to its trajectory.
