It all comes down to how the loan itself is structured and reported - the exact details of how they run the loan paperwork, and how/if they report the activity on the loan to one of the credit bureaus (and which one they report to).  It can go generally one of three ways: A) The loan company reports the status to a credit reporting agency on behalf of both the initiating borrower and the cosigner. In this scenario, both individuals get a new account on their credit report. Initially this will generally drop related credit scores somewhat (it's a "hard pull", new account with zero history, and increased debt), but over time this can have a positive effect on both people's credit rating. This is the typical

scenario one might logically expect to be the norm, and it effects both parties credit just as if they were a sole signor for the loan. And as always, if the loan is not paid properly it will negatively effect both people's credit, and the owner of the loan can choose to come after either or both parties in whatever order they want. B) The loan company just runs the loan with one person, and only reports to a credit agency on one of you (probably the co-signor), leaving the other as just a backup. If you aren't paying close attention they may even arrange it where the initial party wanting to take the loan isn't even on most of the paperwork. This let the person trying to

run the loan get something accepted that might not have been otherwise, or save some time, or was just an error. In this case it will have no effect on Person A's credit. We've had a number of question like this, and this isn't really a rare occurrence. Never assume people selling you things are necessarily accurate or honest - always verify. C) The loan company just doesn't report the loan at all to a credit agency, or does so incorrectly. They are under no obligation to report to credit agencies, it's strictly up to them. If you don't pay then they can report it as something "in collections". This isn't the typical way of doing business for most places, but some businesses still operate this way, including

some places that advertise how doing business with them (paying them grossly inflated interest rates) will "help build your credit". Most advertising fraud goes unpunished. Note: Under all of the above scenarios, the loan can only effect the credit rating attached to the bureau it is reported to. If the loan is reported to Equifax, it will not help you with a TransUnion or Experian rating at all. Some loans report to multiple credit bureaus, but many don't bother, and credit bureaus don't automatically copy each other. It's important to remember that there isn't so much a thing as a singular "consumer credit rating", as there are "consumer credit ratings" - 3 of them, for most purposes, and they can vary widely depending on your reported histories. Also,

with a carefully researched and well-vetted plan that means that it's very important you build credit in this specific way, you should generally focus on establishing credit in ways that don't actually cost you any money at all. Look for no fee credit cards that you pay in full each month, even if you have to start with credit-building secured card plans, and switch to cash-value no-fee rewards cards for a 1-3% if you operate your financial life in a way that this doesn't end up manipulating your purchasing decisions to cost you money. Words to the wise: "Don't let the credit score tail wag the personal financial dog!"

Options are financial contracts that give you the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell a specific asset at a predetermined price on or before a certain date. There are two types of options: call options and put options. A call option gives you the right to buy an asset at a certain price, called the strike price, on or before a certain date, called the expiration date. For example, if you buy a call option on a stock with a strike price of $50 and the stock is trading at $60, you have the right to buy the stock at $50 any time before the expiration date. A put option gives you the right to sell an asset at a certain price, called the strike price, on or before a certain date, called the expiration date. For example, if you buy a put option on a stock with a strike price of $50 and the stock is trading at $40, you have the right to sell the stock at $50 any time before the expiration date. Options can be risky because the value of the option can go down as well as up, and you could end up losing money if the price doesn't move in the direction you were hoping for. However, they can also be a useful tool for hedging against potential losses or for speculating on price movements.

3G (short for "third generation") is a term used to describe the third generation of mobile phone technology. It is a type of mobile network that allows for faster data transfer rates, higher internet speeds, and more advanced features compared to the previous generation of mobile technology (2G). 3G networks allow for the transmission of data at speeds of up to 2 megabits per second (Mbps), which is fast enough to support most smartphone applications, such as video streaming, web browsing, and voice over IP (VoIP) calls. 3G networks are gradually being replaced by 4G and 5G networks, which offer even faster data transfer rates and more advanced features. However, 3G networks are still in use in many parts of the world, particularly in areas where 4G and 5G coverage is not yet available.

This is an old expression that comes from the Latin language , and it does n't use the word ' prove ' in the way that we generally do today . When we say ' prove ' we mean ' show that something is true ' . But in this saying , ' prove ' can be replaced by ' test ' ( as in ' proving grounds ' ) . So what it really means is an exception that tests or challenges the validity or truthfulness of the rule . So if the ' rule ' is that all lobsters are brown , a blue lobster would be the exception that proves the rule , not because it proves that all lobsters are brown , but because it challenges the validity of the rule . In sports like hockey and baseball, the playoffs are a long tournament where many teams compete to see who is the best. Because it is a long tournament, it is not fair if a team can be eliminated from the playoffs just because they had one bad day. By having the playoffs be a best-of-seven series, it gives each team more chances to show how good they are. If a team has a bad game, they still have the opportunity to come back and win the series. In American football, the playoffs are a shorter tournament and there are fewer teams. Because there are fewer teams, it is possible to have a single-elimination format, where the loser of each game is eliminated from the playoffs. This can make the playoffs more exciting, because every game is a must-win situation and one bad day can end a team's season.

Blank CD's, VHS tapes, and mini discs do not weigh any less when they are filled with data. The weight of a CD, VHS tape, or mini disc is determined by the materials it is made of, such as plastic and metal, and not by the data that is stored on it. Think about it this way: if you have a blank notebook and you start writing in it, the notebook will not weigh any less just because you have written something in it. The weight of the notebook is determined by the paper and cover it is made of, not by the words you have written in it. Similarly, the weight of a CD, VHS tape, or mini disc is determined by the materials it is made of, not by the data that is stored on it.

E85 is a fuel that is made up of 85% ethanol and 15% gasoline. The reason that E85 is made with this specific ratio of ethanol to gasoline is because ethanol is less energy dense than gasoline, meaning that it contains less energy per unit of volume. As a result, using a higher concentration of ethanol in the fuel would result in a fuel that has lower overall energy content, which would not be suitable for use in most modern internal combustion engines.The reason that E85 is not made with a 50/50 blend of ethanol and gasoline is because such a blend would still contain a significant amount of gasoline, which is a fossil fuel that is not renewable and contributes to air pollution and climate change. just sell pure ethanol, it's because pure ethanol is not suitable for use as a fuel in most modern internal combustion engines. Ethanol has a lower octane rating than gasoline, which means that it is less resistant to "knocking" or "pinging" during combustion. As a result, engines that are designed to run on pure ethanol would need to be modified in order to operate properly, and this would not be practical for most consumers.I hope this helps to explain why E85 is made with a specific ratio of ethanol to gasoline, and why pure ethanol is not typically used as a fuel.

It is a generally accepted security precept that " The enemy knows the system . " That is , when you are designing an encryption algorithm ( or any security measure ) that you assume the enemy knows its design . You assume that , eventually , an adversary will get a hold of the algorithm and therefore A ) you can not rely on the secrecy of the algorithm for security ; and B ) your algorithm should be secure despite general awareness of it . The strength of encryption methods lies in the keys ( and , for asymmetric methods , the inherent mathematical difficulty of reversing the encryption process ) . For example , the most secure encryption method , the One Time Pad ( OTP ) has an extremely simplistic algorithm . ALL of the security is invested in how the key is created , used , and kept secret .

" So long as you presume the population of caught and convicted criminals in prison rises faster than the population of uncaught , unconvicted or potential criminals outside prison . And that the definition of " crime " is static . And that the motives people have for committing crimes are not a factor in determining the rate of crime . And ... You get my drift . There is no 1:1 causal relation between locking people up and crime happening or not happening ; that idea is just an oversimplification that helps ignorant people sleep at night . Same goes for arrest quotas --- the police chief announces that more arrests were made this quarter than last quarter , everyone pats each other on the back and people cheer because the streets are safer . Except the number of people arrested only tells you how many people were arrested , not what they were arrested for , whether they deserved it or whether they were convicted of or punished for anything .

Complex organisms, such as animals, generally have two eyes because having two eyes allows them to see in three dimensions, which can be very useful for navigation and hunting. Having more than two eyes might not be advantageous because it could be more difficult for the brain to process all the additional visual information. Additionally, having more than two eyes might not provide a significant advantage in terms of vision because the eyes are already able to see a wide field of view. Finally, having more than two eyes might also be less efficient from an evolutionary standpoint because it would require more resources to develop and maintain additional eyes.

Cancer is a disease that occurs when cells in the body grow and divide in an uncontrolled way. It is true that all multi-celled organisms, including humans, have a risk of developing cancer because their cells can make errors when they divide. However, the risk of developing cancer increases with age, and not all multi-celled organisms live long enough to develop cancer.In addition, the body has a number of mechanisms in place to prevent cells from dividing in an uncontrolled way and to repair errors that do occur. These mechanisms include DNA repair pathways, cell cycle checkpoints, and programmed cell death (also known as apoptosis). When these mechanisms are functioning properly, they help to prevent errors from occurring during cell division and to eliminate cells that have become damaged or abnormal.It's also important to note that there are many factors that can increase the risk of developing cancer, including exposure to certain chemicals and substances, certain types of infections, and certain inherited genetic mutations. By avoiding these risk factors and practicing healthy behaviors, such as not smoking and getting regular screenings, people can reduce their risk of developing cancer.

There are a few reasons why major drug companies have not been producing medical cannabis. First, cannabis is still classified as a Schedule I controlled substance under federal law in the United States, which means it is illegal and considered to have a high potential for abuse. This makes it difficult for major drug companies to produce and sell cannabis products. Second, even in states where medical cannabis is legal, the regulatory environment is complex and can vary greatly from state to state. This can make it difficult for major drug companies to navigate the different regulations and obtain the necessary licenses to produce and sell medical cannabis products. Finally, the market for medical cannabis is still relatively small and is not yet as profitable as other areas of the pharmaceutical industry, so major drug companies may not see it as a worthwhile investment. However, as more and more states legalize medical cannabis and the market grows, it is possible that major drug companies may become more interested in producing and selling these products.

* * In short :* * The compiler does that for you . It translates your words -- which already follow certain rules to be understood by your compiler -- into something the underlying hardware can understand . * * A bit less shorter :* * Your source code usually gets preprocessed into a modified source code . That modified sourcecode already contains a few " machinizations " ( just some simplifications towards the machine and compile process ) . A compiler creates a assembly language code ( so going from a high level language to a assembly language such as x86 ASM ) . On that level you see operations based on registers instead of variables and objects . The assembly language code gets " assembly'd "

into a machine code ( decoded ' readable ' assembly into unreadable sequences of numbers ) . The machine code still needs to be arranged and linked with the libraries you use . That gets done by a linker and loader ( in C # you sometimes you dll 's which basically correspond to that ) . The linker and loader takes care of putting the arrangeable machine code into the proper order for the underlying machine . The end result will be the machine code in the pure machine language consisting of the number sequences which the processor reads from a memory byte by byte ( sometimes two bytes or more but that s a different topic ) . * * A side note :* * I

talked about compiler languages ( quite generally ) here . There also exist pure interpreter languages like Python or some mixed languages like Java . Those work a bit different but the underlying principle uses similar techniques on the machine level . For interpreter languages we have a interpreter which literally interprets your source code line by line and executes system level operations straight away . This requires these operations to be written and complied once to be available on the interpreter language . So the magic is hidden there . Java on the other hand -- in my opinion -- works in the inbetween way with some additional perks . We have our source code which gets compiled from a .java file into a .class file .

This class - File is the java Code compiled into a assembly language like on x86 _ but _ for the Java - Virtual - Machine ( jvm ) . It contains a general set of operations which are available on pretty much any machine . The jvm on the other hand has to be created for every architecture itself . So you have a jvm for x86 , one for ARM , one for amd64 , ... The jvm interpret the Java ASM into machine code instructions straight away for the processor to be interpreted . it boils down to lighting . humans are evolutionarily conditioned to be terrified of the dark . we do n't realize this so much because of all the artificial lighting- but before we had fire , we were TERRIFIED of the dark . you would n't be frightened by a scary movie if you watched it in a well - lit room . when you watch a scary movie ( or any movie , for that matter ) in a darkened theater , you ca n't see what 's going on anywhere else except what 's on the screen- so you 're not distracted . you focus on the screen , and you get a more immersive experience . all your emotions and senses are heightened . if you emerge from the movie theater into a brightly lit area , or into daytime , you can still make sense of the world- you can look around you , you can see what 's coming at you . if you emerge from the movie theater into pitch blackness- then it 's scarier , because you have no idea what 's around you . the lack of context sends you into panic because you do n't know where to run , what to look out for , or if it 's even safe to walk straight .

" Race " is a pretty ambiguous term . Lets use the " black " race as an example . There is a whole lot ( A LOT ! ) of genetic variation in Africa , but African people are all called " black " . And what do you call very dark skinned Indian people ? Their skin is often just as dark as some African people 's . Or Australian Aborigines who can also be quite dark , but often have blonde hair ? And what about mixed people ? What " race " is a person who has dark skin but light skinned parents ? Or light skin , but dark skinned parents ? Grouping people by their phenotype ( which is what race is ) simply does n't work . There is really nothing separating one " race " from another , since we are all the same species . Anthropologists group people by their ethnicity , which is quite different from race .

A condensing boiler is a type of heating system that is more efficient than a traditional boiler. It works by capturing the heat that is normally lost through the flue (exhaust pipe) of a traditional boiler and using it to heat water, which is then used to heat your home.To understand how a condensing boiler works, it helps to know a little bit about how a traditional boiler works. In a traditional boiler, a fuel (like natural gas or oil) is burned to heat water. The heated water is then sent through pipes to radiators or baseboard heaters, which use the heat to warm the air in your home.The problem with traditional boilers is that when the fuel is burned, not all of the heat is used to

the temperature at which the water vapor in the flue gas condenses and turns into a liquid. When this happens, the heat that was previously lost through the flue is captured and used to heat the water, making the boiler more efficient.In summary, a condensing boiler is a type of heating system that is more efficient than a traditional boiler because it captures the heat that would normally be lost and uses it to heat the water. It works best at a certain temperature called the saturation level, which is the temperature at which the water vapor in the flue gas condenses and turns into a liquid.

A semi-colon is a punctuation mark that is used to separate clauses in a sentence. It is similar to a period, but it is used to connect clauses that are closely related in meaning. Here is an example of a sentence with a semi-colon: "I went to the store; I needed to buy some milk." In this sentence, the two clauses are "I went to the store" and "I needed to buy some milk." The semi-colon is used to connect these two clauses because they are closely related in meaning and are both part of the same thought. We use semi-colons to help make our writing more clear and organized. They can be used to connect clauses that are not connected by a conjunction (such as "and" or "but") and to indicate a pause that is longer than a comma but shorter than a period. I hope this helps! Sound is usually measured in decibels (dB). The scale for measuring decibels is logarithmic, which means that a small change in the number of decibels represents a much larger difference in the actual volume of the sound. A difference of just 10 decibels is equal to a tenfold difference in the volume of the sound.The quietest room in the world is a room at Orfield Laboratories in Minnesota, USA, that has an average sound level of -9 decibels. This means that the room is almost completely silent. To put this in perspective, a whisper is about 30 decibels, while a normal conversation is around 60 decibels.Negative decibels are possible because the decibel scale is logarithmic, which means that a small change in the number of decibels represents a much larger difference in the actual volume of the sound. In other words, the difference between -9 decibels and 0 decibels is much greater than the difference between 0 decibels and 9 decibels.So to answer your question, sound can be negative because it is measured on a logarithmic scale, and a small change in the number of decibels can represent a much larger difference in the actual volume of the sound.

Background laughter, also known as a "laugh track," is a recording of a live audience laughing that is added to a television show or movie during post-production. It is often used in comedy shows to help create a sense of atmosphere and to let the viewer know when a joke has been made.One reason that laugh tracks are used is because they can help to create a sense of community and shared experience for the viewer. When you watch a comedy show with a laugh track, it can feel like you are part of a larger group of people all enjoying the same jokes. This can be especially helpful if you are watching the show alone, as it can help to create a sense of social connection.Another reason that laugh tracks are used is because they can help to set the tone for a show and let the viewer know when they are supposed to laugh. In a show like 2 1/2 Men, the laugh track can help to signal to the viewer that a joke has been made and that they should expect to find it funny.Overall, laugh tracks are used in comedy shows to help create a sense of atmosphere and to let the viewer know when a joke has been made. They can also help to create a sense of community and shared experience for the viewer.

Google Search is a web search engine developed by Google. It is the most widely used search engine on the World Wide Web, handling more than three billion searches each day. Google Search allows users to search for information on the Internet by entering keywords, or phrases, into a search field. The search results are then displayed as a list of web pages, with the most relevant pages appearing at the top of the list.Google Search uses complex algorithms to determine the relevance and quality of the web pages it returns in response to a search query. These algorithms consider factors such as the number and quality of links to a page, the relevance of the page's content to the search query, and the presence of certain keywords on the page.In addition to returning web pages, Google Search can also return other types of results, such as images, news articles, and videos. Users can also use advanced search options, such as searching within a specific website or searching for a specific type of file, to refine their search results.

It is currently very difficult, if not impossible, for an AI to prove that it is self-aware. This is because there is no widely accepted scientific or philosophical definition of self-awareness. Some people believe that self-awareness is a unique quality that only humans and certain animals possess, while others believe that it is a more general concept that could potentially be exhibited by any cognitive system, including an AI. One way that an AI might try to demonstrate self-awareness is by passing certain tests or demonstrating certain behaviors that are thought to be indicative of self-awareness in humans. For example, an AI might be able to pass the "mirror test," which is a test used to determine whether an animal is capable of recognizing itself in a mirror.

self-aware in the same way that humans are. Another way that an AI might try to demonstrate self-awareness is by engaging in complex and sophisticated forms of reasoning and decision-making. In short, it is currently very difficult to determine whether an AI is self-aware, and it is not clear that it will ever be possible to definitively prove that an AI is self-aware in the same way that we can prove that humans are self-aware.

First of all , languages are constantly evolving . Your grandchildren will probably grow up thinking that the way you speak is old - fashioned and quaint . There are also changes in cultural attitudes . 100 years ago , it was the educated and those with higher social status who were considered to have authority . As a sign of their status , these people would speak in a dialect as close as possible to an agreed standard , and would also use a more respectful , formal tone . Strong regional accents were usually seen as uneducated . Today , we find that snobbish and elitist , and prefer a more relaxed , informal approach . We dismiss formal registers as " posh " , and are more egalitarian than our grandparents were . Finally , of course , sound quality was less than it is now , and radio and TV signals broadcast over the airwaves was subject to interference , sometimes making it difficult to hear . So people enunciated their words more clearly , pronouncing every consonant distinctly and exaggerating the vowels . The " BBC English " used in the early days of British radio and TV is a very clear example of this , the vowels so exaggerated that it sounds quite alien to us now . It just made it easier to hear what was being said over all the hisses , crackles and whistles .

She passes out . The interior of the LHC 's beam path is a high vacuum

( to prevent particles interacting with air , which decelerates them , destabilizes the beam , increases the number of errant particles that can damage the machine itself by running into it , and increases the amount of radiation produced by operating the machine ) ; your friend would lose consciousness from decompression almost instantly . 2 . Failing that , your friend would be irradiated by extremely intense synchrotron radiation . The protons in the LHC fill RF " buckets "

- these are electromagnetic structures inside the beam path that carry protons . The protons inside a bucket are called a bunch . These bunches move around the entire circumference of the LHC about 100,000 times a second ( ie , at the speed of light ) . Because the protons are charged particles , when they are accelerated by the circular motion of the RF bucket , they throw off photons in a cone ahead of and behind them . This cone is phenomenally intense radiation - visible light , UV and gamma . Assuming full body exposure ( remember , we scaled up the accelerator to the size of your friend ) , she would probably die from exposure . 6 . Failing that , she

would be killed by the intense proton flux . As the bunch of protons passed through her body , they would deposit their energy destroying cells in her body . her small amounts of heavy metals would cluster . It would be interested to see the globs of pure atoms that would separate out - each responding to the electric field in accordance with its inertia . Her atoms would coast along gently , until : 6 . Your friend would be subjected to an accelerating EM wave . She would experience a " kick " akin to being shoved . Her atoms , separated loosely into bunches by mass , would be spread out even further and more clearly into those groups . As she travelled through the accelerator , she would experience periodic " kicks " ( these would be quite violent , there 's nothing ' smooth ' about moving through an accelerator ) .

7 . As she is travelling along , she would come under the influence of huge sector dipoles . These are massive ( meters long ) magnets that gradually use the Lorentz Force to gently bend the path of the particles into a curved path . 8 . She 'd be accelerated again , but this time , because of her relative velocity ( now rapidly approaching the speed of light ) the kick would be even sharper - and she 'd begin to spread out . She 'd notice that atoms close to the center of her body would accelerated very sharply , and those in her extremities ( both radially ( arms and legs ) and along her polar axis ( head and feet ) )

A statistical classifier is a machine learning algorithm that assigns a class label to an input sample based on a trained model. The trained model is developed by training the classifier on a labeled dataset, where the class labels are known. The classifier uses statistical techniques to make predictions about the class labels of new, unseen data.There are many different types of statistical classifiers, including logistic regression, support vector machines, decision trees, and k-nearest neighbors. These classifiers work by finding patterns in the training data and using these patterns to make predictions about the class labels of new data.For example, a classifier might be trained to recognize whether a given email is spam or not spam. To train the classifier, it would be fed a dataset of emails that have been labeled as spam or not spam. The classifier would then learn the patterns that distinguish spam emails from non-spam emails. When given a new, unseen email, the classifier could use these patterns to predict whether the email is spam or not spam.

Natural sugar comes in things like fruit , which also has lots of fiber , which helps your body absorb it slowly , at a rate that it can properly manage . Refined sugars ( which are chemically pretty similar to natural sugars - it 's not like they 're totally different things ) usually get added to our foods in amounts completely out of proportion to the fiber content . They get absorbed very quickly , which causes your body to overreact and overproduce the hormones that control how we use those sugars . That causes all sorts of problems throughout the body . It makes you feel hungry even as you 're actively turning all the excess calories you just ate into fat , it fucks

them with enough fiber . Likewise , even healthy things like apples will cause this problem if you remove the fiber ( leaving just the juice ) . The reason you hear about natural sugars being good is because people commonly confuse the specific type of sugar ( natural 's not really any better ) with the way that it 's consumed ( artificially concentrated and added in high quantities is much , much worse ) .

Your friend is incorrect as are most people in this thread , although this is a common misconception . Smells are caused by specific volatile compounds called [ odorants ] ( URL_0 ) . These molecules bond with your olfactory receptors to create your sense of smell . So when you detect a fart you are n't inhaling " small quantities " of poop , but instead you are inhaling indole and skatole molecules which together your brain recognizes as the smell of feces . Although poop contains skatole and indole , these substances are feces no more than hydrogen sulfide is feces .

Contrary to popular belief , deserts are not " useless land , " unless you 're a real estate developer . Rather , they are complex , fragile ecosystems that play a vital part in the entire environment . But , hey , fuck the desert tortoise , we need juice to charge our phones . There are * priorities , * dammit . So let 's cover a desert in solar panels . What 's the worst that could happen ? Glad you asked . The worst that could happen is that you change the climate , either locally or far away , possibly for the worse . Among the many things that contribute to local climate is albedo , the percentage of sunlight that reflects off

the ground . The albedo determines how hot the ground gets and how much of that heat gets reflected back into the air , and that plays a * huge * role in determining local climate . Local climate , in turn , affects nearby climate . And so on . Solar panels would change not only the albedo , but also the dynamics of the ground heating and cooling , because now you have a bunch of VERY hot panels with very shady areas underneath them . That destroys the desert ecology for sure . Desert cities like Phoenix , Arizona found this out the hard way . Not an economist here , so I ca n't go into great depth , but that 's okay since this is ELI5 . :) Greece is in the middle of a debt crisis . As I 'm sure you know , many European economies are very tied together , through a common currency ( the Euro ) , the European Central Bank ( I do n't know much about it , but I 'm assuming it 's pretty similar in purpose to other centralized banking systems like the American Fed ) , and so on . Greece actually lied for a number of years about their economy , which let them spend more money than they had available , and put them in a pretty deep pit .

Then a recession hit , which meant government revenue went down and the debt got even worse . Europe forced Greece into austerity measures ( meaning the government was n't allowed to spend a lot of money on social programs ) , which helps to balance the budget but is making it even harder to pull out of the recession . So , basically , the Greek economy is tanked and it owes a lot of money . There are a few options at this point . First , it can be bailed out by other European nations . Greece has gotten some aid packages , but it can only go so far ... Greece owes something like _ half a trillion dollars _ , and it 's

pretty understandable that other countries do n't want to pay for Greece 's mistakes . Second , it can default on its loans . This would be bad for the Euro , so other countries in the Eurozone do n't want Greece to do this . Investors would lose confidence . Why invest in something when there 's a risk they wo n't pay you back ? It 's also used this tactic to an extent , through debt restructuring . But debt restructuring is only a partial solution and agani , can only go so far . Third , it can print money . It 's pretty easy to fix debt if you just print out a few hundred billion euros . Of course , other countries

be for other Eurozone nations , but the ripple effect is not good . And then there 's speculation . There are a few other countries with high debt and poor economy ( collectively , the PIGS , Portugal / Italy / Ireland / Greece / Spain ) . With one country off the Euro , a precedent is set . If they want to have more control over their economy , why should n't _ they _ move off the Euro ? Edit : Remember , ELI5 is for learning ! I do n't care if you downvote , but it does n't help anyone . Please explain _ why _ you downvote .

Suppose you wanted to find the length of part of a circle , [ like this ] ( URL_0 ) . How would you do that ? Well , we know the length around the whole circle is ( 2)(pi)(r ) . If we want only a quarter of the arc , the distance is ( 2)(pi)(r)/4 ( for a quarter of the whole thing ) , and so on . Then our formula is arclength = ( theta)(r ) . Simple . If we used degrees , it would be ( theta*)(pi)/(180)(r ) , much uglier ! And for that matter , why choose 360 degrees in a circle ? Why not 270 , or 120 , or 10 , or 60 ? The number of degrees in a circle are so arbitrary ! So math geeks said screw degrees . They 're arbitrary and make things complicated . If we met up with aliens , chances are they would use radians , since they 're intuitive and natural . We like intuitive and natural , not arbitrary and complicated .

Excess demand and excess supply are terms that describe the relationship between the quantity of a good or service that is being demanded by buyers and the quantity that is being supplied by sellers.If there is excess demand for a good or service, it means that there are more buyers who want to purchase it than there are sellers who are willing to sell it at the current price. This can lead to an increase in the price of the good or service as sellers try to take advantage of the high demand.If there is excess supply, it means that there are more sellers who are offering a good or service than there are buyers who want to purchase it at the current price. This can lead to

are not enough of the toys to go around. This might cause the price of the toy to go up as sellers try to take advantage of the high demand.An example of excess supply might be if there is a type of clothing that is no longer in style and there are many sellers who are trying to sell it, but there are not enough buyers who want to purchase it. This might cause the price of the clothing to go down as sellers try to get rid of their inventory by lowering the price.

In general, older games had fewer bugs because they were simpler and had less content than modern games. Modern games are more complex and have more features, which means there are more opportunities for things to go wrong. In addition, older games were not updated as frequently as modern games, so there was less opportunity for bugs to be introduced. Finally, older games were often developed with fewer resources, so there was less time and money available to test and fix bugs.

It 's because it 's very very difficult to test most of the claims in evolutionary psychology . This results in many of the theories being made to fit the evidence rather than the evidence pointing to theories . In other words , this often results in ( for example ) people saying " Men are more competitive than women because it gives them an edge in getting more women and producing more children . " Now , this may be true . Hell , I would say I would n't be surprised if this were true . But is it actually scientifically supported ? How do we know that this is something selected by by evolution in the Stone Age and not something much more recent because

of memetics ? It is very clear that memetics * does * have a large say in how people behave , and memetics change much quicker than genetics . For ( an obvious example ) the reason why women wear skirts and men are discouraged from wearing skirts is very , very unlikely to be because of genetics but instead of just well - ingrained gender roles going back thousands of years . Maybe that 's the case with many of evo psych 's claims ? How do we know that some behavior was genetically selected for hundreds of thousands of years ago , and some behavior was culturally selected for only a few thousand years ago ? And this is especially problematic because many of evo psych

the way it is . The reason why we all fall for the same optical illusions and cognitive biases is evidence that yeah , that is all genetic . But that is n't what evo psych really * is * . Evo psych is about identifying the reasons * why * our brains are the way they using genetics as a reason . Most of the way we think is because of genetics . But also a lot is simply because of culture . And it 's hard to separate the two .

The hydrants , at least , serve a purpose in an emergency .

To interpret financial data for stocks listed on multiple exchanges, you will need to consider the following factors:Exchange rate: If the stock is listed on multiple exchanges in different countries, you will need to take into account the exchange rate between the two currencies. This will affect the price of the stock and any financial metrics that are denominated in the local currency.Market conditions: The market conditions on each exchange will also influence the price of the stock. For example, if one exchange is experiencing a bull market while the other is in a bear market, this could lead to differences in the price of the stock on the two exchanges.Company performance: The financial performance of the company will also affect the price of the stock. Make sure to analyze the company's financial statements and consider any events that may have affected the company's performance, such as changes in management or shifts in the industry.Other factors: There may be other factors that could impact the price of the stock on the different exchanges, such as differences in regulation or investor sentiment.By considering all of these factors, you can get a better understanding of how the stock is performing on the different exchanges and make more informed investment decisions.

and there is no reason to blame their descendants who had nothing to do with it and were not there . But lots of anti - Semites believe in hereditary guilt . And then even more fanciful accusations were made . Since Jews were distrusted to begin with , it then became very convenient when a Christian child was missing for any reason , to assume that the child must have been kidnapped by Jews . To start off , I will say that we do n't really know . One explanation is simply that humans easily forget non - essential things . We tend to only remember important stuff or things that we think about often . You do n't usually remember things while your mind was just wandering or what you were thinking about last week while you were staring across the office . Same thing goes for dreams . Though maybe a dream can be so unusual that you remember . Another explanation revolves around the presence or absence of the neurotransmitter norepinephrine ( NE ) . NE plays a big role in the cerebral cortex which plays a key role in memory . Since NE is one of the main neurotransmitters involves in arousal , it is almost completely absent during REM sleep which is when dreams occur .

A democracy is a form of government in which the power is held by the people. This can be direct democracy, in which people make decisions directly, or it can be representative democracy, in which people elect representatives to make decisions for them.A republic is a form of government in which the power is held by elected representatives. In a republic, the people elect officials to make decisions on their behalf, rather than making decisions directly themselves.The United States is a representative democracy, which means that the people elect representatives to make decisions on their behalf. This is different from a direct democracy, where the people make decisions directly.The perception that the United States is a democracy may come from the fact that "democracy" is a word that is often used to describe any system of government in which the people have a say in how they are governed. However, it is technically a republic, because the power is held by elected representatives rather than the people themselves.

The artery was an air canal while the veins contained digestive liquids . In Greece they realized that the veins contained blood ( but arteries still contained Pneuma , " life 's breath " ) . They also realized that the blood vessels were connected to the heart Later on Galen concluded the artery did n't contain air only , but a mix of blood and air . And that was it for more or less 1500 years , untill the Renaissance and the discovery of blood circulation . Tldr : we knew they existed , just did n't know what was inside .

A stock market crash is a sudden, significant decline in the value of stocks, typically occurring over a short period of time. It can happen for a variety of reasons, such as economic recession, market manipulation, or a sudden shock to the market, like a natural disaster or a major news event. During a stock market crash, the prices of stocks, especially those of large companies, may fall very quickly. This can cause panic among investors, who may decide to sell their stocks to try to minimize their losses. When a lot of people sell their stocks at the same time, it can create a downward spiral, with the value of stocks continuing to drop as more and more people sell. A stock market crash can have serious consequences for the economy, as it can lead to a loss of wealth for investors and a reduction in the value of companies. It can also make it harder for companies to raise money by selling stocks, which can make it more difficult for them to grow and expand. However, it's important to remember that the stock market is usually volatile, meaning that it can go up and down a lot over short periods of time. While a stock market crash can be scary, it's also important to keep a long-term perspective and remember that the market has historically recovered from past crashes and gone on to reach new highs.

An atmosphere is important for life on a planet because it helps to regulate the temperature and protect living things from harmful solar radiation. Without an atmosphere, the surface of a planet would be too hot during the day and too cold at night, which would make it difficult for life to survive. An atmosphere is also important because it provides the air that living things need to breathe. All living things need to exchange gases with their environment in order to survive. For example, humans and other animals need to breathe in oxygen and breathe out carbon dioxide. Plants, on the other hand, use a process called photosynthesis to take in carbon dioxide and produce oxygen. So, while it is possible that life could evolve to survive without an atmosphere or without the need to breathe, it is much more likely that life would evolve to take advantage of the benefits that an atmosphere provides.

So , the lens on my Canon 6D is a EF 24 - 105 f/4.0 L. Let 's break it down : EF : this is the type of mount . It is just a name . 24 - 105 mm : this is the focal length . This is ordinarily the length from the objective lens to the film ( or sensor ) . The longer the focal length , the narrower the field of view . Think of the difference between looking down a toilet paper tube versus a wrapping paper tube . The longer tube gives you a smaller " spot " you can see even if the barrel is the same diameter . However , the longer focal length ALSO gives you greater magnification

. So a long lens brings the action closer to you . Modern multi - element lenses , and smaller , denser sensors have blurred this a bit , as opposed to the old days when all 35 mm cameras gave you the same field of view . But , on a given camera , a 100 mm lens always gives you a narrower view than a 50 mm . When you get a range of numbers like this , it means it is a zoom lens that can cover that range , instead of a " prime " that has a fixed length . f/4.0 - this is the minimum f - stop , or the size of the aperture when open at it 's widest .

Buildings can be built using a variety of shapes and designs, and some buildings are indeed built using hexagonal shapes or a combination of hexagons and other shapes. However, hexagons are not the most common shape used in building construction, and there are several reasons why this is the case.One reason is that hexagons are not as structurally efficient as other shapes, such as triangles or rectangles. Triangles and rectangles are strong shapes that can be used to create stable and rigid structures, while hexagons are not as strong and may require additional support to maintain their shape.Another reason is that hexagons are not as easy to work with as other shapes. It can be more difficult to cut and fit building materials into a hexagonal shape, and it may be more challenging to design and build a structure using hexagons.Overall, while it is possible to build structures using hexagons or a combination of hexagons and other shapes, they are not as common as other shapes due to their structural inefficiency and the challenges associated with working with them.

It 's a mix between intentionality and philosophy . Picasso famously said : > It took me 4 years to paint like Raphael , but a lifetime to paint like a child . This gives you a window into his philosophy . The artist is putting intentional value on a simplified form of drawing . Asking yourself why this might be is the act of art criticism . Picasso was a founding cubist . He was part of a cultural shift between two ways of looking at art . He wanted to emphasize [ different tools :] ( URL_0 ) > The Cubist painters rejected the inherited concept that art should copy nature , or that they should adopt the traditional techniques of perspective , modeling , and

foreshortening . They wanted instead to emphasize the two - dimensionality of the canvas . So they reduced and fractured objects into geometric forms , and then realigned these within a shallow , relieflike space . They also used multiple or contrasting vantage points . If art is about making beauty , Picasso is rewriting the rules with which people usually recognize beauty . This has been pushed even further on march from Modernism ( which started around the age of Van Gogh ) to Post - Modernism ( Pollack and his peers ) . Abstract Expressionism is the genre of art you probably associate with the " I could do that " argument . Pollack is the famous one , where he famously splattered paint on canvas

flat * as possible . In fact , the entire painting is a lesson in ordered chaos . Despite the seemingly haphazard application , Pollack was surprisingly controlled and thoughtful when making the composition . The tension between the chaos and the order come together to the point where you can appreciate the painting for what it is , not an illusion of a hillside or a projection of the psyche , but as an attempt by a man to make something plainly beautiful in a way that has n't been seen before .

ABS releases and reapplies the brakes rapidly to prevent / minimize skidding ( tires work better if not skidding , so it makes you stop shorter ) . Traction control usually does two things . It cuts the throttle when acceleration causes skidding ( again , tires work better when not sliding , so it improves performance ) . It will also typically independently apply brakes to prevent spinning ( if your front tires are sliding you ca n't steer , if you 're sliding sideways the brakes and gas are both unable to point the car forwards ) . Traction control will typically apply brakes on one side or on opposite corners to steer the car while letting off the gas , typically keeping the car pointing when you 're steering , even without if you 're going so fast that the back starts to fishtail away from you .

Grocery stores often have high ceilings for a few reasons. One reason is that high ceilings can make a space feel bigger and more open, which can be more appealing to customers. This is especially important in stores that are crowded or have a lot of merchandise, as it can help to create a sense of space and make the store feel less cluttered. Another reason is that high ceilings can help to improve the lighting in a store. Higher ceilings allow for the use of more and bigger windows, which can bring in more natural light. This can create a brighter, more welcoming atmosphere and make it easier for customers to see and navigate the store. Additionally, high ceilings can also help with air circulation and temperature control. Air can circulate more freely in a space with high ceilings, which can help to keep the store cooler in the summer and warmer in the winter. This can make the store more comfortable for customers and employees, which can be important for customer satisfaction. Overall, while high ceilings may increase initial building costs and heating costs, they can also have many benefits that make them worth it for grocery stores.

A personal computer game, also known as a PC game or computer game, is a type of video game played on a personal computer (PC) rather than a video game console or arcade machine. Its defining characteristics include: more diverse and user-determined gaming hardware and software; and generally greater capacity in input, processing, video and audio output. The uncoordinated nature of the PC game market, and now its lack of physical media, make precisely assessing its size difficult. In 2018, the global PC games market was valued at about $27.7 billion.Home computer games became popular following the video game crash of 1983, leading to the era of the "bedroom coder". In the 1990s, PC games lost mass-market traction to console games, before enjoying a resurgence in the mid-2000s

The cost of a death sentence is generally more expensive than keeping someone in prison for a number of reasons. First, the legal process for a death sentence case is much longer and more complicated than a non-capital case. This means that there are more legal proceedings, more lawyers involved, and more time spent in the courtroom. All of these factors contribute to the higher cost of a death sentence case. In addition to the legal costs, there are also the costs of carrying out the death sentence itself. This includes the cost of the execution, as well as the cost of housing the prisoner on death row. Death row inmates are often kept in isolation, which can be more expensive than housing prisoners in a general population. Finally, there are also the costs of appealing a death sentence. Many death sentence cases are appealed, which adds to the overall cost of the case. Overall, the cost of a death sentence can be several times more expensive than the cost of keeping someone in prison for a long period of time. This is one of the reasons that some people argue that it may be more cost-effective to impose a life sentence without the possibility of parole instead of a death sentence.

Sure! Government bonds are a type of debt securities issued by national governments to finance their expenses and operations. They are a way for governments to borrow money from investors, who lend money to the government in exchange for interest payments and the return of the principal amount when the bond matures.Here's how it works:The government issues a bond with a fixed face value, also known as the principal or par value, which is the amount that the government agrees to pay back to the bondholder when the bond matures.The government also sets an interest rate, also known as the coupon rate, which is the amount of money that the bondholder will receive in interest payments over the life of the bond. Interest payments are typically made on a regular basis, such as every six months or every year.Investors can buy the bond from the government or from other investors in the secondary market, and they can hold the bond until it matures or sell it to other investors before it matures.When the bond matures, the government pays the bondholder the principal amount, as well as any remaining interest payments that are due.Government bonds are generally considered to be a safe investment because they are backed by the credit and stability of the issuing government. However, the value of government bonds can fluctuate depending on changes in interest rates and the financial strength of the issuing government.

Back in the days before this idea , if you and your buddies owned a company , you were totally responsible for it . Something goes wrong and your company 's not making a profit but you still owe your suppliers and your landlord and the water company money ? One of your employees is pulling something shady and your company gets sued ? It 's your ass --- your house , all your money --- on the line to pay the company 's debts . You as the owner were personally responsible . Some people think this could be a pretty good thing , because it made people reluctant to do shady stuff that could get them in trouble , and it makes people care a lot

about making sure the company sticks around and makes money . There are a few examples --- there used to be a lot more even 25 years ago , but there are still a few --- of companies that operate along these lines today , usually in areas where it 's especially important that people not be shady , like law firms and investment banks . ( That 's why they have " partners " instead of " presidents " --- all the partners together own the company themselves and split its profits . ) On the other hand , remember what I said about being personally responsible for losses ? Imagine you have a company and you have a great idea for a new product , but

you 'd need to borrow a lot of money and build a new factory in order to start making it . If everything goes well , then your company will be makin ' bank and you 'll be king of the world . But if anything goes wrong --- there 's a bad batch of product or it takes to long to get the factory going and someone copies your idea or , or , or , or .... then you and your fellow co - owners could go bankrupt and be out on the streets . So , how certain are you that this is a * really * great idea ? That 's basically the bad side of owners being personally responsible for a company 's

business debts --- it makes people too scared of loss to take a risk on making a new thing , and thus lots of awesome new things never get built . That 's where the idea of " The corporation is a person " comes in . You and your buddies ( or the public , in the form of stock ) own the business and get the profit from it . But under the law , the business itself is treated like a person --- it can sign contracts and buy things and make all sorts of promises . If the business owes somebody money , it has to pay ; but if the business is broke , then the people it owes money too are SOL

feel like this makes it a lot more tempting for employees to break the law , especially if doing so is profitable -- the company gets caught , it pays a fine and it 's on its way . This is not to say that a prosecutor ca n't still convict individual employees / owners of wrongdoing and send them to jail ; they can , but they usually have to be able to prove the knew that the shady shit was going on and did n't try to stop it , and that 's a lot tougher than proving " shady shit happened while you were in charge , go directly to jail , do not collect $ 200 . There are a few reasons why we aren't using only wind and solar energy yet. One reason is that wind and solar energy are not always available. For example, the wind might not be blowing all the time, and the sun might not be shining all the time. This means that we need to have other types of energy, like coal or natural gas, that we can use when the wind and sun are not providing enough energy.Another reason is that it can be expensive to build wind and solar energy facilities. It takes a lot of money to build the wind turbines and solar panels, and to connect them to the electricity grid. This means that it can be difficult for some countries or companies to afford to switch to using only wind and solar energy.Finally, wind and solar energy are still being developed and improved, and there are not yet enough of these facilities to meet all of the world's energy needs. This means that we need to continue using other types of energy while we work on building more wind and solar facilities.Overall, while wind and solar energy are important sources of clean and renewable energy, they are not yet able to meet all of our energy needs on their own.

There are several technical analysis indicators that you can use when analyzing mutual fund NAVs (Net Asset Values). Some common technical indicators that are used for mutual funds include:Moving averages: A moving average is a simple technical indicator that shows the average price of a security over a specific time period. There are several types of moving averages, including simple, exponential, and weighted.Trend lines: Trend lines are lines drawn on a chart that connect two or more price points. They can help you identify trends and potential support and resistance levels.Oscillators: Oscillators are technical indicators that oscillate between two values. They can help you identify overbought and oversold conditions. Some common oscillators include the Relative Strength Index (RSI) and the Stochastic oscillator.Volume: The volume of a security can be an important indicator of market activity. Increasing volume can be a sign of increasing interest in a security, while decreasing volume can be a sign of decreasing interest.Candlestick charts: Candlestick charts are a type of chart that uses candlesticks to represent price action. They can be helpful in identifying trends and patterns.It's important to note that technical analysis is just one way to analyze mutual fund NAVs, and it should not be used in isolation. It's always a good idea to consider fundamental analysis and other factors when evaluating mutual funds.

The abbreviation "LB" for pound comes from the Latin word "libra," which means "balance" or "scale." In ancient Rome, the unit of weight known as a pound (libra in Latin) was originally defined as the weight of a specific number of grains of barley that were placed on a scale.Over time, the word "libra" was shortened to "lb," and this abbreviation has been used to represent the pound unit of weight in many different countries and languages. So, instead of "pds," we use "LB" as the abbreviation for pounds because it comes from the Latin word for this unit of weight.

Vaccines are a way to protect people from getting sick from diseases. When a person gets a vaccine, their body is exposed to a small amount of a virus or bacteria, which helps the body learn how to fight off the disease. This way, if the person is exposed to the disease later on, their body will already know how to fight it and they won't get sick.Some people have concerns about vaccines and whether they are safe for children. These concerns can come from a variety of sources, including personal beliefs, misinformation, and a lack of understanding about how vaccines work.The medical community, including doctors and scientists, overwhelmingly agree that vaccines are safe and effective. They have been thoroughly tested and have been used for many years to protect people from serious and sometimes deadly diseases.There can be some side effects from vaccines, just like there can be side effects from any medicine. These side effects are usually mild and go away on their own, but in rare cases, they can be more serious. However, the risks of not getting vaccinated are much greater than the risks of getting vaccinated.In short, vaccines are a safe and effective way to protect people from getting sick. The medical community supports their use, and getting vaccinated is important for both individual and community health.

Sure! The Incas, Mayas, and Aztecs were all ancient civilizations that lived in different parts of the Americas. The green color on the Mexican flag represents hope, joy, and love. It is also a symbol of the independence movement that led to Mexico's independence from Spanish rule. The flag features three vertical bands of equal width, with the green color located on the hoist side (the side nearest the flagpole). The other two bands are white, which represents purity, and red, which represents the blood of the national heroes who fought for independence. Together, the colors of the Mexican flag represent the ideals of the Mexican people and their national identity.

for integrating information from different parts of the visual field and constructing a 3-dimensional representation of the world.The visual cortex receives input from the retina, which is the light-sensitive layer of tissue at the back of the eye. in ink. The needle punctures the skin and deposits the ink into the dermis, which is the layer of skin just below the epidermis. The ink is then absorbed by the cells in the dermis, and it becomes a permanent part of your skin. Because the dermis is not shed like the epidermis, the tattoo remains visible even as the cells in the epidermis are replaced. I hope this helps to explain why tattoos don't disappear, even though every atom in your body is replaced every 5 years.

Plus , we can stack rectangular ( again , cuboid ) buildings closer together and take advantage of large heights ; pyramids loose a great deal of space " above " that a skyscraper could contain . it takes to carve and move stone ; yes , they endure , and may endure longer then our glass - and - steel constructs ( long story ; skyscrapers need maintenance ) , but the time and effort it would take to build one compared to the value we would get out of it makes them less valuable . Lethal autonomous weapons, also known as fully autonomous weapons or killer robots, are weapons that are designed to select and engage targets without human intervention. These weapons are typically equipped with sensors, artificial intelligence, and other advanced technologies that allow them to detect, track, and attack targets on their own.There are various types of lethal autonomous weapons, including drones, ground-based robots, and naval vessels. These weapons may be used in a variety of contexts, including military operations, law enforcement, and border control.There is significant concern and debate surrounding the development and use of lethal autonomous weapons, as they raise ethical, legal, and moral questions about the role of humans in warfare and the potential for misuse or abuse of these systems. Some argue that lethal autonomous weapons could increase the efficiency and effectiveness of military operations, while others worry that they could lead to unintended consequences and a loss of human control.

As far as that vs. which , the general prescriptive guideline is this : If the clause introduced by the word is necessary to the meaning of the sentence , use " that . " If the meaning is not changed , use " which . " For example , " My car , which is red , was stolen , " means I only have one car , it 's red , and it was stolen . " My car that is red was stolen , " means I have more than one car , and that of them , the red one was stolen .

A single payer system is a type of healthcare system where a single public or quasi-public agency organizes healthcare financing, and everyone is automatically enrolled in the program. In a single payer system, the government pays for all healthcare costs for the entire population, rather than individuals paying for their own healthcare or having private insurance companies pay for it.One example of a single payer healthcare system is Medicare, which is a government-run healthcare program for people over 65 years old and some younger people with disabilities. In a single payer system, all residents of a country or region would be eligible for healthcare coverage, and there would be no need for private health insurance. Instead of paying premiums to a private insurance company, people would pay taxes to the government, which would use the money to pay for healthcare services.Single payer systems are often seen as a way to make healthcare more accessible and affordable for everyone. Proponents of single payer systems argue that they can reduce administrative costs, improve healthcare quality, and provide more equitable access to care. Critics of single payer systems argue that they can lead to longer wait times for healthcare services, less innovation in the healthcare industry, and less choice for patients.

In response to your last question , laughter is about establishing your social status in a group . Ever noticed how you laugh more when you watch a comedy show with friends ? That 's because , subconsciously , you want to prove to the friends that you 're with that you understand the funny thing that is going on in the given situation . Whereas when you 're on your own , if you know something is funny , you do n't need to prove it to anybody , so you probably wo n't laugh as much , if at all . It 's often said that one man 's tragedy , is another 's comedy , but as for why , I do n't know . Perhaps it 's a reminder of how we are n't in that particular bad situation , and are doing better . There 's always a tendency among people to find familiarity in the weakness of others ( for example , a ' fall guy ' in a group of friends . Someone that every rips on , not because you hate him per se , but just because it 's funny and no - one really knows why ) and people 's pain , or something like ' Jackass ' is just an extreme version of this .

Emotional intelligence (EI) is the ability to recognize and understand your own emotions and the emotions of others, and to use this awareness to manage your own behavior and relationships effectively. People with high emotional intelligence are able to effectively communicate and empathize with others, and are skilled at building and maintaining relationships. They are also able to effectively manage their own emotions and handle stress in a healthy way.Some specific qualities that are often associated with high emotional intelligence include:Self-awareness: the ability to recognize and understand your own emotionsSelf-regulation: the ability to manage your own emotions and behaviors effectivelyMotivation: the ability to use your emotions to achieve your goalsEmpathy: the ability to understand and respond to the emotions of othersSocial skills: the ability to effectively communicate and build relationships with othersDeveloping emotional intelligence can be beneficial for both personal and professional relationships, as it can help you to build stronger connections with others, resolve conflicts effectively, and navigate challenging situations with grace.

Bradford Gates Rutter (born January 31, 1978) is an American game show contestant, TV host, producer, and actor. With over $5.1 million in winnings, he is currently the 2nd highest-earning American game show contestant of all time, behind Ken Jennings, and still the highest-earning contestant (primarily from special tournament events) on the U.S. syndicated game show Jeopardy! (with over $5 million).Until the Greatest of All Time Tournament in 2020, Rutter had never lost a Jeopardy! match against a human opponent (though he twice trailed at the end of the first game of a two-day tournament match before coming back to win). This streak consisted of his original 5-day run in 2000 (after which he retired undefeated) as well as 17 matches in five tournaments (including one as part of a team)—all of which he won. Rutter finished third in the match—both his first defeat overall and the first time he finished behind a human opponent.

Air is not stationary . Warm air rises , cool air descends . This causes bodies of air with different temperatures to move . When you 're standing on the ground , you experience this as wind . The air is moving along the earth 's surface and since you 're more or less anchored to that surface , you feel the air move past you . Think of turbulence like this : there are all these bodies of air that have varying temperatures and as a result move in different directions . While you remain in a single column of air , you do n't notice much turbulence . Sure the plane might rise a bit if you 're in a column of rising air or descend

towers growing out of it , those towers are cloud vapour rising on warm air currents . Paragliders and sailplane gliders often aim for those hoping to rise higher in the thermals . Ridges in the terrain like hills and mountains can create updrafts where horizontally moving air hits the landscape like a skateboarder going up a ramp . Those often have predictable turbulence . Weather is another good indicator . When warm fronts meet cold fronts the result is predictably a lot of moving air .

Kurt Friedrich Gödel (/ˈɡɜːrdəl/ GUR-dəl, German: [kʊʁt ˈɡøːdl̩] (listen); April 28, 1906 – January 14, 1978) was a  logician, mathematician, and philosopher. Considered along with Aristotle and Gottlob Frege to be one of the most significant logicians in history, Gödel had an immense effect upon scientific and philosophical thinking in the 20th century, a time when others such as Bertrand Russell, Alfred North Whitehead, and David Hilbert were using logic and set theory to investigate the foundations of mathematics, building on earlier work by the likes of Richard Dedekind, Georg Cantor and Frege.Gödel published his first incompleteness theorem in 1931 when he was 25 years old, one year after finishing his doctorate at the University of Vienna. The first incompleteness theorem states that for any ω-consistent recursive axiomatic

the system cannot prove its own consistency.Gödel also showed that neither the axiom of choice nor the continuum hypothesis can be disproved from the accepted Zermelo–Fraenkel set theory, assuming that its axioms are consistent. The former result opened the door for mathematicians to assume the axiom of choice in their proofs. He also made important contributions to proof theory by clarifying the connections between classical logic, intuitionistic logic, and modal logic.

The first step I would do is determine the asset class mixture for your current portfolio and the mixture for your new one. If they are the same and all you are doing is changing the funds that you use to invest in that mixture of asset class then just do the change all at once. In this case there is no market risk as you are just swapping funds (hopefully to ones that you feel will better track the underlying asset classes).  If you are also changing your asset class mixture, then it depends on how large the change is. I would still do the whole change at once. But if you are worried about fluctuations then you could slowly rebalance into your final position by taking a couple of intermediary steps. I would still change all of the fund first but maybe in a mix closer to your current asset mix and then over the next couple of months adjust the ratios to reach your final desired asset mix.

Finding a place to live can be a challenging and exciting process, especially for college graduates who may be moving out on their own for the first time. Here are some important things to consider when looking for a place to live:Renting vs. buying: Renting a place means you are paying someone else to live in their property, while buying a place means you own it and can make changes to it as you see fit. Renting can be a good option if you are not ready to commit to buying a home or if you are not sure where you want to live long-term. Buying a home can be a good option if you have the financial means and are planning to stay in one place for

a while.Mortgages: If you decide to buy a home, you will likely need to get a mortgage, which is a loan from a bank or other financial institution that you use to pay for the home. To get a mortgage, you will need to provide information about your income, debts, and credit history, and you will need to make a down payment (a portion of the total cost of the home that you pay upfront).Leases: If you decide to rent a place, you will sign a lease, which is a legal agreement between you and the property owner or landlord. The lease will outline the terms of your tenancy, including the length of the rental period, the amount of rent you will pay, and any rules or restrictions

rent or buy, and each has its own advantages and disadvantages. Apartments are typically smaller, multi-unit buildings with shared common areas. Townhouses are attached homes that share walls with neighboring units. Condos are similar to apartments, but you own your unit rather than renting it. You may also want to think about the commute to your job or school and whether you need to be near public transportation or other conveniences.

Hashes are one - way functions . They 're designed specifically so that you ca n't " solve for the other side of the equation " and run them in reverse . You can turn a cow into hamburger . You ca n't turn a hamburger into a cow . Also , since the input to any hashing algorithm is infinite and the output is finite , the output of any hashing algorithm has a potentially infinite number of corrosponding inputs . So if you were to reverse the algorithm and run it for some value , you 'd get an infinite number of inputs that could generate that value .

When you burn your tongue, it can feel like there is a rough or papery texture on your tongue because the heat has damaged the surface of your tongue. Your tongue is usually covered in a thin layer of moist tissue called mucosa, which helps to keep it moist and smooth. When the mucosa is damaged by heat, it can become dry and rough, which can give your tongue a papery or sand-like feeling. The roughness you feel on your tongue is the result of the damaged tissue, and it is your body's way of telling you that your tongue has been injured and needs time to heal.
