There are a few possible reasons why someone might leave a useless answer to a question about an Amazon product. Here are a few possibilities:They may not have actually read the question or understood what it was asking.They may be trying to promote a product or service, even if it is not related to the question.They may be trying to get attention or earn rewards for their activity on the site, such as by leaving a large number of comments or reviews.They may simply be trying to be funny or sarcastic, without considering whether their answer is actually helpful.It's important to remember that not all comments and reviews are going to be useful or helpful. It's a good idea to read through a few different answers before making a decision, and to consider the source of the information. If an answer seems unreliable or is not relevant to the question, it may be best to ignore it and look for a more helpful response.

The sounds you hear before an emergency broadcast are called the emergency alert system (EAS) tones. They are used to get your attention and let you know that an important message is about to be broadcast. The EAS tones are usually a series of beeps or tones that are played at a loud volume. They are followed by a voice message that gives important information about an emergency situation, such as a weather warning, a natural disaster, or an Amber Alert for a missing child. The EAS tones and message are meant to alert you to take action to protect yourself and your loved ones, and to stay informed about what is happening in your area.

Viruses can undergo processes called antigenic shift , and antigenic drift . Antigenic drift allows viruses to change their surface proteins ( of themselves or of the cells they infect ) , which are what your immune system uses to identify them . If they can switch up their surface proteins ( and they can , and do , all the time ) , your immune system no longer recognizes them as the same virus anymore , and it takes quite a bit of time for it to catch up , recognize the new face of the virus , and attack it . The antibodies your immune system makes are targeted to attack cells with a certain antigenic , or surface protein , profile . Antigenic drift is

Hey there ! Totally not my field , but I minored in physics in my undergrad years ! Think of electricity as water in a hose . In this analogy , the current ( measured in amperes ) would be analogous to current of the water through the pipe- as in , how much water moves through a given section in a period of time . Voltage would be the speed of the water both in the hose and coming out the end of the hose . How does this help us understand transformers ? Let 's say you want to increase the voltage of the electricity . This can be done without having to raise the power supply at all , using what 's called a transformer

. Put your thumb over the end of the hose- suddenly the water starts shooting out , and you can feel the increase of pressure under your thumb . The amount of water passing through any given section of the hose at any point in time has not changed at all , but by shrinking the opening with your thumb , in order to keep the current constant , the water has to speed up coming out the end , which lets you [ spray your backyard enemies ] ( URL_1 ) with a more effective water laser . How does a transformer actually do this , since there 's no real " hole " to shrink ? Easy ! Take a piece of metal ( your transformer

's " core " ) and wrap your wires around it like [ this . ] ( URL_0 ) ( Please note that the transformer setup in this diagram would do the opposite , and * decrease * the voltage ) All moving electric charges ( in this case , the electrons moving through the wire wrapped around the left side of the core ) create a magnetic field . As you can see , the left side has fewer turns than the right side . The electrons in the wire on the right are influenced by the magnetic field created by the ones on the left , and they begin moving . This creates an " induced " current in the right side . Energy must be

electrons under the influence than you started with ! So the voltage decreases ( or increases ) based on how many turns of wire are wrapped around each side . Unfortunately , there is one discrepancy with the hose analogy- the current in the wire has to increase if the voltage decreases , ( so that energy is conserved across the transformer ) and vise versa . The core plays a pretty important role , too ! It magnifies the electromagnetic effects because it is full of electrons that mimic the ones in the wire . Does that help ? ( It 's been a looong time since undergrad so if I 've bungled it anyone is welcome to correct me )

Credit card issuers often require applicants to have a minimum annual household income because it is one factor that they consider when deciding whether to approve an application for a credit card. Income is a measure of an individual's or household's ability to pay back debts, including credit card balances. Credit card issuers use this information, along with other factors such as credit score and credit history, to assess the risk of extending credit to a particular applicant.The minimum annual household income requirement may vary depending on the credit card issuer and the type of credit card being applied for. Some credit cards may have higher minimum income requirements than others, and some may not have a minimum income requirement at all. For example, a credit card issuer may require a higher minimum income for a card with a higher credit limit or a card with a rewards program, as these cards may carry a higher risk for the issuer.It's important to note that meeting the minimum annual household income requirement does not guarantee that an applicant will be approved for a credit card. Credit card issuers consider a variety of factors when deciding whether to approve an application, and the minimum annual household income requirement is just one of them.

Congratulations!  You own a (very small) slice of Apple. As a stockholder, you have a vote on important decisions that the company makes.  Each year Apple has a stockholder meeting in Cupertino that you are invited to.  If you are unable to attend and vote, you can vote by proxy, which simply means that you register your vote before the meeting.  You just missed this year's meeting, which was held on February 26, 2016.  They elected people to the board of directors, chose an accounting firm, and voted on some other proposals.  Votes are based on the number of shares you own; since you only own one share, your vote is very small compared to some of the other stockholders. Besides voting,

share of stock that you have changes daily.  Today, it is worth about $100.  You can sell this stock whenever you like; however, since you have a paper certificate, in order to sell this stock on the stock market, you would need to give your certificate to a stock broker before they can sell it for you. The broker will charge a fee to sell it for you.  Apple has a website for stockholders at investor.apple.com with some more information about owning Apple stock.  One of the things you'll find here is information on how to update your contact information, which you will want to do if you move, so that Apple can continue to send you your proxy materials and dividend checks.

I have tinitus . * * To my knowledge * * it can be brought on by a single event of ear drum damage or by lengthy period of being around unsafe levels of noise . As a once off event its most likely that some very loud noise was experienced by your ear . Some initial damage was done and then scarring occurs in the ear , which makes your ear drum unable to vibrate in resonance with a frequency ( or basically , you hear that sort of sound ) . Another way is if you were exposed to a certain level of noise for extended periods of your life . Like high pitches such as alarms , or those concrete drills . There is no cure , if this is all of a sudden there 's a chance it will ease off and go away . But if its after a while and you still have it , you have it . S'not that bad , sleep with music or a fan or something . I live in the city so I very rarely experience total silence . Even my breathing is probably loud enough to drown it out .

Sports arenas in the US are often funded by taxpayers, but that does not mean that people do not have to pay to watch games or events in those arenas or on TV. The cost of building and maintaining sports arenas is typically paid for through a combination of public funds and private investment. While taxpayers may contribute to the construction and upkeep of the arenas, they are still operated as businesses, and the teams and organizations that use the arenas generate revenue by charging people to attend games or events and through television contracts. The NFL (National Football League) is a professional sports league in the US that consists of 32 teams. The NFL generates revenue through various sources, including ticket sales, merchandise sales, and television contracts. The NFL Network is a television network that is owned and operated by the NFL, and it broadcasts live NFL games and other programming related to the league. The NFL Network is able to exist because it is able to generate revenue through subscriptions and advertising. While it might seem unfair that people have to pay to watch sports games or events on TV or in person, it is important to remember that professional sports teams and leagues are businesses that need to generate revenue to cover their expenses, including player salaries, arena maintenance and operations, and other costs. Without this revenue, it would not be possible for these organizations to continue operating.

There are several potential negatives to increasing your credit card spending limit:Increased temptation to spend: A higher spending limit can make it easier for you to make larger purchases, which can lead to overspending and increased credit card debt.Higher interest rates: If you carry a balance on your credit card, a higher spending limit may result in higher interest charges, as you will have a larger balance subject to interest.Negative impact on credit score: If you are close to your credit limit on your credit card, an increase in your spending limit may temporarily lower your credit score. This is because your credit utilization (the amount of credit you are using compared to your total credit limit) is a factor in your credit score. If your credit utilization increases after your spending limit is raised, it may have a negative impact on your credit score.Annual fees: Some credit cards come with annual fees, which can be expensive. If you increase your spending limit, you may end up using your credit card more frequently, resulting in higher annual fees.Overall, it is important to be mindful of your spending habits and only increase your credit card spending limit if you are confident that you can use it responsibly and pay off your balance in full each month.

It's not easy to explain the reasons for discrimination against Jews in a way that would be suitable for a five-year-old, but I will try to provide a brief and simplified explanation. Throughout history, Jews have often been the target of discrimination and persecution because of their religious beliefs and cultural practices. In ancient times, the Romans conquered the land where many Jews lived and imposed their own laws and customs on the conquered people. This led to conflict and persecution of the Jews. In Europe, Jews were often discriminated against and ostracized because they were seen as different and were often excluded from certain jobs and opportunities. In some cases, they were even forced to live in separate areas called ghettos. During the 20th century, the Nazi regime in Germany perpetrated the Holocaust, in which millions of Jews were systematically murdered in concentration camps. This was a horrific example of the extreme hate and discrimination that some people can harbor towards Jews and other minority groups. Discrimination and prejudice against Jews and other groups continue to be a problem in some parts of the world today. It's important to remember that all people deserve to be treated with respect and kindness, regardless of their race, religion, or background.

In simple terms : everything , from gases to solids , is made out of particles . Particles attract to each other , they all have a mass , and the bigger the mass ( densityXvolume ) the more gravity the object has . Everything has gravity , even you , only you are too little to notice it . So the gas particles attracted each other , forming groups which were bigger , which therefore attracted more more particles , and therefore their " group " grew . A planet is just a big ball of this stuff . Fun fact : in the beginning , earth was actually all made out of gas too . This gravitational force is what keeps it together ( just like ours is what keeps earth together ) . Space is literally that : space , so the gas was the stuff that was floating about . It is a planet because it is a celestial body orbiting a star .

When two mirrors face each other, the light bounces back and forth between the two mirrors. The light will keep bouncing back and forth between the mirrors until it is absorbed by something, such as a person or an object in the room.There is no limit to how many times the light can bounce back and forth between the mirrors. In fact, you can have an infinite number of reflections between the two mirrors, with each reflection showing a smaller and smaller version of the mirrors and the objects in the room.Imagine throwing a ball back and forth between two people. The ball will keep bouncing back and forth between the two people until one of them stops catching the ball. In the same way, the light will keep bouncing back and forth between the two mirrors until it is absorbed by something in the room.

A Coverdell Education Savings Account (ESA) is a tax-advantaged account that can be used to save for a child's education expenses. The account owner, or the designated beneficiary of the account, can use the funds in the account to pay for qualified education expenses, such as tuition, fees, books, and supplies, at an eligible educational institution. Coverdell ESAs have contribution limits and are subject to income limits for the account owner.If you are asking about the tax liability of a corporate Coverdell ESA, it's important to note that Coverdell ESAs are individual accounts and cannot be owned by a corporation. However, a corporation could potentially contribute to a Coverdell ESA on behalf of an individual as a gift, and the individual would be responsible for any tax liability related to the account.In general, contributions to a Coverdell ESA are not tax-deductible, but the earnings on the account grow tax-free. Withdrawals from the account are tax-free as long as they are used to pay for qualified education expenses. If the funds in the account are not used for qualified education expenses, the earnings portion of the withdrawal may be subject to income tax and an additional 10% tax penalty.It's a good idea to consult with a tax professional or refer to the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) for more information about the tax treatment of Coverdell ESAs and other education savings options.

doesn't really hurt your quality of life (do you really NEED 5 HBO channels?) and it sets everyone up for success down the line. A stable household economy is a tremendous foundation for raising children and can set you up to be more able to deal with the costs of higher ed.

We're trying to figure out what to do next.  In terms of planning, the sunk cost is irrelevant.  But in terms of calculating return, A was a turkey.  And to calculate the return, we would include $X in our costs for B.  And for the second option, we'd subtract $X from $Y (may be negative).   Sunk costs are irrelevant to planning, but they are very relevant to retrospective analysis.  Please don't confuse the two.  When looking back, part

foregone conclusion), but you will lose less money than if you just sold out.   You should also do B if $Y < $X < NPV(B) or $X < $Y < NPV(B).  In general, you should do B any time $Y < NPV(B). Instead, their bodies slow down and they do not need to eat, drink, or use the bathroom for a long time. When they wake up, their muscles are still strong because they have not been used very much. Hibernating animals are able to move when they wake up because their muscles have not gotten weak from not being used.

The two are related , but not identical . Teleportation involves making a " space - like " jump in spacetime , meaning two events occur at two locations separated far enough apart that nothing , not even a photon can travel from the beginning to the end of the teleporter 's journey . Space - like jumps can involve going forward , backward , or neither in time , depending on the observer . There is no definite ordering of events with teleportation ; depending on who is doing the looking , a teleporter can also be a time - traveler . Time travel involves making a " time - like " jump in spacetime . Events are ordered , meaning that cause always precedes effect ( except , possibly , by the time - traveler , who could be going to his own past in a " closed , time - like loop " ) . Because time - like events all come in a specific order , breaking this ordering tends to break a lot of physics . E.g. , the Second Law of Thermodynamics breaks down . Because of this , many believe that the laws of physics will prevent such closed , time - like loops from occurring .

Yes , it takes a bit less fuel to actually get to orbit , but the latitude you launch from usually determines your inclination . Inclination change maneuvers are extremely expensive , so if you can launch into a 0 inclination orbit you can save a lot of fuel . Edit : Just how minor is the rotational effect ? Obsessive - compulsive disorder ( OCD ) is an anxiety disorder , a condition of the brain often characterized by intrusive , anxiety - producing thoughts . These thoughts can express themselves in repetitive or ritualistic behaviors aimed at reducing distress . Obsessions are the thoughts and urges associated with OCD , such as recurrent , anxious thoughts about germs or personal safety . Excessive hand - washing or door - checking are common examples of compulsions ( the behaviors associated with OCD ) . Adding a level of complication to the disorder is the fact that a person with OCD can have obsessions without compulsions , and vice versa . Obsessive - compulsive personality disorder ( OCPD ) is a syndrome that characterizes a person ’s overall

judgmental and withdrawn . It ’s also common for an individual with OCPD to undertake projects with a great deal of initial energy and zeal only to leave them unfinished when obstacles and imperfections arise . The disorder is more common among men than women , and most psychologists agree that it can not be accurately diagnosed until about 18 years of age .

Osteonecrosis of the jaw (ONJ) is a condition in which the bone tissue in the jaw dies due to a lack of blood supply. This can result in the loss of bone tissue, which can lead to pain, difficulty speaking or eating, and other problems. ONJ is often associated with the use of certain medications, such as bisphosphonates, which are used to treat bone conditions such as osteoporosis. ONJ can also be caused by radiation therapy to the head and neck, or by other conditions that affect the blood supply to the jawbone. It is a rare but serious condition that can have significant impacts on a person's quality of life. Treatment of ONJ typically involves a combination of medications, surgery, and other therapies to help manage the condition and prevent further bone loss.

Drinking alcohol can affect your sleep and lead to more vivid dreams. When you drink alcohol, it can disrupt your sleep cycle and cause you to experience deeper, more restorative stages of sleep. These deeper stages of sleep are when most dreaming occurs, so it's possible that you may have more vivid dreams after drinking alcohol because you are spending more time in these stages of sleep. It's also possible that alcohol can affect the chemical balances in your brain, which can influence the content and intensity of your dreams. Finally, drinking alcohol can also lead to a feeling of relaxation and reduced inhibitions, which may make your dreams more vivid and memorable.

The mathematical rule that creates the Mandelbrot set is relatively simple ( at least , if you 're comfortable with complex numbers from a decent algebra class ) . It works like this : Pick a complex number * c * . Let 's say we pick c=1 . Once you 've picked it , start with zero and repeat the following process : square the previous number , than add * c * to it . In this case , we 'd generate the sequence 0 , 1 ( 0 ^ 2 + 1 ) , 2 ( 1 ^ 2 + 1 ) , 5 ( 2 ^ 2 + 1 ) , 26 ( 5 ^ 2 + 1 ) , and so on , and this sequence runs off to infinity . On the other hand , if we picked c=-1 , the sequence would go 0 , -1 ( 0 ^ 2 + -1 ) , 0 ( ( -1)^2 + -1 ) , -1 , 0 , -1 ... , and never runs off to infinity . The Mandelbrot set is the set of all numbers that do * not * run off to infinity this way .

Sound mass is a term used to describe a type of texture in music that is characterized by a dense, homogenous sound created by the layering and combining of multiple voices or instruments. There are many composers who have used sound mass techniques in their compositions, including:Pierre Boulez: Boulez was a French composer and conductor who was known for his use of sound mass techniques in his compositions. He often used these techniques to create a sense of density and complexity in his music.György Ligeti: Ligeti was a Hungarian-Austrian composer who was known for his use of sound mass techniques in his music. His compositions often featured complex, layered textures that were created by the layering and combining of multiple voices or instruments.Karlheinz Stockhausen: Stockhausen was a German composer who was known for his innovative use of sound mass techniques in his music. He often used these techniques to create a sense of density and complexity in his compositions.John Adams: Adams is an American composer who has also used sound mass techniques in his music. His compositions often feature dense, layered textures created by the layering and combining of multiple voices or instruments.Arvo Pärt: Pärt is an Estonian composer who is known for his use of sound mass techniques in his music. His compositions often feature dense, homogenous textures created by the layering and combining of multiple voices or instruments.

Your brain has to keep track of a lot of different things at the same time . Part of the brain deals with this " what 's going on right now " information . It 's way too much information to store long term though . So your brain makes decisions on what gets moved into " I should remember this later " parts of the brain and what just gets thrown away to make room for what 's continuing to happen right now . Alcohol messes with the brains ability to move stuff into longer term memory . You drink enough of it and it pretty much shuts down the process all together , which means by the time you recover from your drunken stupor , you brain did n't save any of that information .

Not all possible stock values are represented, the number of possibilities has to be kept reasonable.  In this case the choices are even units, for an expensive stock they may be spaced even farther apart than this. The top of the chart says it's for June.  It's actually the third Friday in the month, June 15th in this case.  Thus

these are bets on how the stock will move in the next 10 days. While the numbers are per share you can only trade options in lots of 100. The left side of the chart shows calls.  Suppose you sell a call at 19 (the top of the chart)  The last such trade would have gotten you a premium of 9.70 per share (the flip side of this is when the third friday rolls around it will most likely be exercised and they'll be paying you only 19 a share for a stock now trading at something over 26.)  Note the volume, bid and ask columns though--you're not going to get 9.70 for such a call as there is no buyer.  The most anybody

is offering at present is 7.80 a share. Now, lets look farther down in the chart--say, a strike price of 30.  The last trade was only .10--people think it's very unlikely that FB will rise above 30 to make this option worthwhile and thus you get very little for being willing to sell at that price.  If FB stays at 26 the option will expire worthless and go away.  If it's up to 31 when the 15th rolls around they'll exercise the option, take your shares and pay you 30 for them. Westminster Abbey is a Christian church in London, England. It is a royal chapel and serves as the traditional place of coronation and burial site for English and, later, British monarchs. * * P * * and * * NP * * are classes of decision problems and the * * P = NP * * problem asks whether these are the same . A * decision problem * is a yes - no question that depends on some sort of input ; for example " Is this minesweeper board valid ? ( i.e. is there a configuration of mines which is consistent with the board ) " , where the input is a minesweeper board . Note that " deciding " a decision problem means " determining the answer to " . Also note that while most of the discussion here will be about decision problems , questions that are n't yes - no ( e.g. " What

guaranteed correct moves can I make on this minesweeper board ? " ) can often be expressed by asking multiple yes - no questions ( left as an exercise to the reader for this particular example ) . Problems that are in * * P * * are considered * efficiently decidable * , which roughly means we can write a program to definitively answer yes or no which would take a reasonable amount of time on reasonably sized inputs ( Technical note : This is not really true . In this field of computed science , efficient means polynomial time , which could have even tiny problem inputs as taking millennia to solve or longer on current computers ) . An example problem is : " Given

a table of currency conversion rates , can you convert money from a given currency to different currencies and end up with more money than you started with ? " ; a computer would be able to answer this for a table with tens of thousands of currencies . Another example problem here is : " Given a list of numbers , are all the elements unique ? " ; a computer would be able to decide this for a list with billions of numbers . Probably the simplest definition for * * NP * * is that when a problem is in * * NP * * , yes answers can be * efficiently verified * ( i.e. verification of yes answers is in * * P

* * ) . Consider the three earlier examples : - Minesweeper consistency -- if the answer is yes , then there is some configuration of mines that is consistent with the board , and given such a configuration , we can efficiently ( and easily ) verify that the board is valid and thus the answer is yes . - Currency arbitrage -- If the answer is yes , then there is some ordered list of currency conversions which profits , and given such an ordered list , we can efficiently verify that we can profit and thus the answer is yes . - Element uniqueness -- If the answer is no , then there is a number which appears multiple times in the list , and

given such a number , we can efficiently verify that the answer is no . So for the examples here , there is some easily seen notion of " verification " . The first two examples have " yes " answers as easily verifiable ( which means they are in * * NP * * ) , and the third has " no " as easily verifiable ( which means it is in * * co - NP * * ) . We normally call the information used for verification ( configuration of mines , etc . ) a * certificate * . Actually it turns out the third problem is also in * * NP * * . If the answer for a given input is yes

, we can take an empty certificate and still efficiently verify the answer is yes ( since deciding the problem is in * * P * * ) . As a result , every problem in * * P * * is also in * * NP * * ( and * * co - NP * * ) . So when a problem is in * * NP * * , there is an efficient * verifier * for the problem . This verifier takes as input both the original problem 's input and a certificate . For every original input where the answer is yes , there is some certificate that makes the verifier say yes . For every original input where the answer is no

, there is no certificate that makes the verifier say yes . ( Technical note : For the yes case , we requite the certificate be at most polynomially larger than the original input ) . So the * * P = NP * * problem asks if these two classes are equal . This is arguably the biggest open problem in computer science ( we 're still looking for the fastest way to multiply two numbers , but that 's for someone else to talk about ) . Basically all proof techniques in this field of computer science ( e.g. relativisation , algebrization ) have been shown to be useless at attacking this problem . If * * P = NP * * , then given a

of how the * * P = NP * * problem is resolved , it will likely represent a huge advance for theoretical computer science . Any resolution to the problem will probably also help us make headway on other unsolved problems in computational complexity theory ( e.g. NC = P , P = BPP , L = NL , etc . ) .

Turbine engines are actually simpler that conventional piston engines . The first section has blades that spin and compress the air . The air enters a combustion chamber which is constantly adding fuel and burning with the compressed air . The hot gas then goes into a second set of blades that powers the compressor blades . The additional hot gas is expelled for thrust ( fighter jets ) or is used to feed additional blades that can then power propellers ( like a jumbo jet 's turbofan ) or additional blades that power a generator ( like gas power plants ) .

Foreign currency, or cash, can be beneficial for a country in several ways. Here are a few examples:Foreign currency can be used to finance trade and economic development: A country that has a strong reserve of foreign currency can use it to pay for imports, invest in overseas markets, and fund development projects. This can help stimulate economic growth and promote international trade.Foreign currency can act as a buffer against economic shocks: If a country experiences a sudden drop in its own currency's value, it can use its reserves of foreign currency to stabilize its economy and maintain the value of its exports.Foreign currency can increase a country's financial stability: A country with a strong reserve of foreign currency is seen as more financially stable and less risky to invest in. This can attract more foreign investment, which can help stimulate economic growth and create jobs.Foreign currency can be used to fund emergency operations: In times of crisis, such as natural disasters or conflicts, a country with a strong reserve of foreign currency can use it to fund emergency operations and provide assistance to those in need.It's worth noting that while foreign currency can be beneficial in these ways, it's also important for a country to manage its reserves carefully. If a country relies too heavily on foreign currency, it can become vulnerable to exchange rate fluctuations and other economic risks.

The Atari 2600, initially branded as the Atari Video Computer System (Atari VCS) from its release until November 1982, is a home video game console developed and produced by Atari, Inc. Released in September 1977, it popularized microprocessor-based hardware and games stored on swappable ROM cartridges, a format first used with the Fairchild Channel F in 1976. The VCS was bundled with two joystick controllers, a conjoined pair of paddle controllers, and a game cartridge—initially Combat and later Pac-Man.Atari was successful at creating arcade video games, but their development cost and limited lifespan drove CEO Nolan Bushnell to seek a programmable home system. The first inexpensive microprocessors from MOS Technology in late 1975 made this feasible. The console was prototyped as codename Stella by Atari subsidiary Cyan Engineering.

Lacking funding to complete the project, Bushnell sold Atari to Warner Communications in 1976.The Atari VCS launched in 1977 with nine simple, low-resolution games in 2 KB cartridges. The system's first killer app was the home conversion of Taito's arcade game Space Invaders in 1980. The VCS became widely successful, leading to the founding of Activision and other third-party game developers and to competition from console manufacturers Mattel and Coleco. By the end of its primary lifecycle in 1983–84, games for the 2600 were using more than four times the storage size of the launch games with significantly more advanced visuals and gameplay than the system was designed for, such as Activision's Pitfall!.In 1982, the Atari 2600 was the dominant game system in North America. Amid competition from

for the holiday shopping season and was critically panned and a commercial failure. Both games, and a glut of third-party shovelware, were factors in ending Atari's relevance in the console market. Atari's downfall reverberated through the industry resulting in the video game crash of 1983.Warner sold Atari's home division to former Commodore CEO Jack Tramiel in 1984. In 1986, the new Atari Corporation under Tramiel released a lower-cost version of the 2600 and the backward-compatible Atari 7800, but it was Nintendo that led the recovery of the industry with its 1985 launch of the Nintendo Entertainment System. Production of the Atari 2600 ended on January 1, 1992, with an estimated 30 million units sold across its lifetime.

First off , relativity is hard . It screws with everything you know , it makes distances shorter and time longer and things heavier . Basically all Einstein saw was that the speed of light was always the same . Now , that 's pretty weird if you think about it . If I throw a ball at you with 30 km / h , you see it coming with 30 km / h. If I 'm also running towards you at 10 km / h , you see the ball coming with 40 km / h and if I 'm running away from you at 10 km / h , you see the ball coming with 20 km / h. So far , so good . Now

, light is different . If I shine a beam of light at you , you think it has the speed of light . Duh . If I also move towards you at half the speed of light , how fast is the beam to you ? * still the speed of light * . Our universe just works that way . Now , that just ca n't work normally . Einstein said " you know , if this really works that way and physics still applies here ( conservation of energy and other things must still be true ) , then we must probably have the following other effects : " . So it 's just a rigorous derivation based on an observation , namely that light

always travels at the same speed . All these effects concern objects in motion . How he derived these effects ca n't be explained to a five - year old , here 's just an overview : * You ca n't go faster than the speed of light . Ever . You can only get really , really close to it . * The following effects depend on the viewer . That means that something can be heavier to someone and lighter to someone else , and both are still correct . * If you observe something fast , it appears heavier . * If you observe something fast , it appears shorter . * If you observe something fast , time seems to pass slower there .
There 's a million ways to break a car , ranging from baseball bats to sugar in the gas tank . Making a car go faster is n't nearly as easy .

Inbreeding is the breeding of animals or plants that are closely related, such as siblings or parents. When animals or plants are inbred, they are more likely to have genetic defects or abnormalities because they are more likely to have the same harmful genetic traits as their parents. These defects can range from physical abnormalities to problems with the way their bodies function. For example, if two plants with a genetic defect that causes their leaves to turn yellow are bred together, their offspring are more likely to have the same yellow leaves because they inherited the genetic trait from both of their parents. Similarly, if two animals with a genetic defect that affects their eyesight are bred together, their offspring are more likely to have poor eyesight because they inherited the genetic trait from both of their parents. Inbreeding can also lead to a lack of diversity in the gene pool, which can make a population more vulnerable to diseases and other environmental challenges. This is because a diverse gene pool allows for greater variation in traits, which can help a population to adapt and survive in changing conditions. Overall, inbreeding can lead to problems because it can increase the chances of harmful genetic traits being passed down to offspring, and it can reduce the diversity of the gene pool.

Media studies is a discipline and field of study that deals with the content, history, and effects of various media; in particular, the mass media. Media Studies may draw on traditions from both the social sciences and the humanities, but mostly from its core disciplines of mass communication, communication, communication sciences, and communication studies.Researchers may also develop and employ theories and methods from disciplines including cultural studies, rhetoric (including digital rhetoric), philosophy, literary theory, psychology, political science, political economy, economics, sociology, anthropology, social theory, art history and criticism, film theory, and information theory.

Taking into account that you are in Cyprus, a Euro country, you should not invest in USD as the USA and China are starting a currency war that will benefit the Euro. Meaning, if you buy USD today, they will be worth less in a couple of months. As for the way of investing your money. Look at it like a boat race, starting on the 1st of January and ending on the 31st of December each year. There are a lot of boats in the water. Some are small, some are big, some are whole fleets. Your objective is to choose the fastest boat at any time. If you invest all of your money in one small boat, that might sink before the end of the year,

you are putting yourself at risk. Say: Startup Capital. If you invest all of your money in a medium sized boat, you still run the risk of it sinking. Say: Stock market stock. If you invest all of your money in a supertanker, the risk of it sinking is smaller, and the probability of it ending first in the race is also smaller. Say: a stock of a multinational. A fleet is limited by it's slowest boat, but it will surely reach the shore. Say: a fund. Now investing money is time consuming, and you may not have the money to create your own portfolio (your own fleet). So a fund should be your choice. However, there are a lot of funds out there, and not all funds

buy a number of star rated, managed funds. There are a lot of factors to keep into account. Currency is one. Geography, Sector... Don't buy for less than 1.000€ in one fund, and don't buy more than 10 funds. Stay away from Gold, unless you want to speculate (short term). Stay away from the USD (for now). And if you can prevent it, don't put all your eggs in one basket.

Cellular respiration is a metabolic process that occurs in the cells of all living organisms. It is the process by which cells convert energy from nutrients into ATP (adenosine triphosphate), a molecule that cells use to power their various functions.Cellular respiration occurs in the mitochondria, which are small organelles found in the cytoplasm of eukaryotic cells. The mitochondria are the site of aerobic respiration, which is the process by which cells generate ATP using oxygen. In the mitochondria, glucose and other organic molecules are broken down through a series of chemical reactions to release energy, which is then used to synthesize ATP.Cellular respiration can also occur through anaerobic respiration, which is a process that occurs in the absence of oxygen. In this case, ATP is generated through the breakdown of glucose or other organic molecules in the absence of oxygen. This process occurs in the cytoplasm of the cell and is less efficient than aerobic respiration.Overall, cellular respiration is a vital process for all living organisms, as it allows cells to produce the energy they need to carry out their functions and maintain homeostasis.

The ocean is a harder location for us to visit . For one , visibility . In space we can see so much because it 's empty and void . We have the Hubble Telescope that can see lightyears away , because there 's nothing blocking it unless the aim is meant that way . In the ocean we have water , a somewhat dense liquid that obstructs light and vision . This can be viewed when looking into a pool , or a lake . It 's darker , dirtier , and distorts light and vision . Viewing the ocean is a harder task in that submarines can only view so much of it . There 's also pressure . In space it 's usually constant depending on speed and where you are in orbit . In the ocean , the deeper you go the denser it gets , and therefore you need stronger and larger submarines or equipment . At that point you 're looking at some nuclear powered submarine that probably is n't designed to survey the floor . We 've been able to map out the depth of the ocean and all the seismic activity , but it 's difficult to actually be there and grab artifacts and experience it . tldr ; ocean is too pressurized and deep and dirty and you 'd have to have the toughest equipment to view a lot of it .

LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) is a powerful psychoactive drug that can cause hallucinations and changes in perception, thoughts, and emotions. It is a Schedule I controlled substance in the United States, meaning it has a high potential for abuse and is not currently accepted for medical use.Taking LSD can be unpredictable and can lead to a range of experiences, including feelings of euphoria, enhanced senses, and altered thinking. Some people may have positive experiences, while others may have negative or even frightening experiences. The effects of LSD can vary greatly depending on the person, the setting, and the dose.When you are on an LSD trip, you might see, hear, or feel things that are not really there. Your senses might be heightened, so colors might seem brighter, music might sound more intense, and things might feel more touchable or real. You might also have changes in your thoughts and emotions, such as feeling more connected to other people or the world around you, or feeling more anxious or confused.It is important to note that LSD can be dangerous, as it can cause serious changes in your mental state and can lead to accidents or injuries. It is not recommended to use LSD or any other psychoactive drugs, as they can be harmful to your physical and mental health.

Real numbers are the set of numbers that include both the rational numbers (fractions and integers) and the irrational numbers. In other words, real numbers are all the numbers that we can represent on the number line.Rational numbers are numbers that can be expressed as a ratio of two integers, such as 3/4 or -7/2. These numbers can be expressed in decimal form, either as a terminating decimal (such as 0.75 or -3.5) or as a repeating decimal (such as 0.3333... or -0.142857...).Irrational numbers are numbers that cannot be expressed as a ratio of two integers and that cannot be expressed as a finite decimal. These numbers have an infinite number of digits after the decimal point, and they do not repeat in a pattern. Examples of irrational numbers include the square root of 2 (1.41421356...) and the constant pi (3.14159265...).The set of real numbers is denoted by the symbol "R" and is an important concept in mathematics, as it is a foundation for the study of algebra, geometry, and analysis. Real numbers have many applications in science, engineering, and everyday life.

Sure! Refrigerators work by using a coolant liquid that absorbs heat and turns into a gas, and a compressor that pressurizes the gas and pumps it through a series of coils. The coils on the outside of the fridge give off heat as the gas cools and turns back into a liquid, and the cooled liquid is then circulated back into the fridge to absorb more heat.The little tank at the back of the fridge is called the evaporator, and it's where the coolant liquid turns into a gas. The gas absorbs heat from the inside of the fridge and cools the air inside. The compressor then pumps the hot gas through the coils on the outside of the fridge, where it gives off the heat and cools back down into a liquid. This process is repeated over and over again to keep the fridge cool.So basically, the fridge uses a special liquid that can absorb heat and turn into a gas to cool the inside of the fridge. The compressor helps the liquid do its job by pressing it and making it hot, and the coils on the outside of the fridge help the liquid give off the heat and cool back down. Does that make sense?

A flame is made of hot, glowing gases. It is created when a fuel (like wood or gas) is burned with oxygen. The heat of the fire causes the fuel to break down and release molecules into the air. These molecules mix with oxygen in the air to create hot, glowing gases. The heat from the gases is what makes the flame glow. The flame also gives off light, which is why we can see it. To understand how a flame comes to be, think about what happens when you light a candle. The wick of the candle is made of a material that will burn, and when you light it, the heat of the flame causes the wick to start burning. As the wick burns, it releases hot, glowing gases that mix with the oxygen in the air to create the flame. The flame will continue to burn as long as there is a supply of fuel and oxygen.

. So the question is : Do you switch doors or stay with your first choice , or does it matter at all ? * * * * * # # # The Answer You should always switch . There is a 1/3 chance that you picked the winning door at first , and a 2/3 chance that you picked a losing door . If you picked the winning door and switch , you will always lose . If you picked a losing door and switch , you will always win . So if you switch , there is a 2/3 chance that you will win , and a 1/3 chance that you will lose .

Whenever a martial artist is breaking something , it will be set up in such a way that it looks far more difficult than it is . They still need the strength and technique , and even if they do it right it can be painful , but ultimately it 's just physics . You support relatively thin slabs of concrete at the ends and hit it in the middle . Concrete is quite brittle , so as long as you can bend it a little bit , it will snap . You can even go through multiple slabs as long as they 're separated . You 'll never see somebody punching through a solid foot - thick block of concrete , because breaking the slab relies on the leverage of the relatively long , relatively thin dimensions . [ See this video ] ( URL_0 ) for an example of what I 'm talking about . It 's a fair amount of concrete , but the slabs are arranged in such a way that breaking the first one will almost certainly result in a number of others being broken . But if you try and go through a single slab that thick , the only thing breaking will be your arm .

Discovery is the act of detecting something new, or something previously unrecognized as meaningful. With reference to sciences and academic disciplines, discovery is the observation of new phenomena, new actions, or new events and providing new reasoning to explain the knowledge gathered through such observations with previously acquired knowledge from abstract thought and everyday experiences. A discovery may sometimes be based on earlier discoveries, collaborations, or ideas. Some discoveries represent a radical breakthrough in knowledge or technology.New discoveries are acquired through various senses and are usually assimilated, merging with pre-existing knowledge and actions. Questioning is a major form of human thought and interpersonal communication, and plays a key role in discovery. Discoveries are often made due to questions. Some discoveries lead to the invention of objects, processes, or techniques. A discovery may sometimes be based on earlier discoveries, collaborations or ideas, and the process of discovery requires at least the awareness that an existing concept or method can be modified or transformed. However, some discoveries also represent a radical breakthrough in knowledge.

Hedge funds and private equity funds are both types of alternative investments, meaning they are not traditional investments such as stocks, bonds, or mutual funds. Both types of funds are typically only available to accredited investors, meaning they must meet certain financial thresholds in order to invest.Here are some key differences between hedge funds and private equity funds:Investment strategy: Hedge funds use a variety of investment strategies, including long/short equity, market neutral, event-driven, and global macro, to generate returns. Private equity funds, on the other hand, focus on acquiring and managing private companies, with the goal of growing the value of those companies over time.Fee structure: Hedge funds typically charge a management fee and a performance fee. The management fee is a percentage of the assets under management

and is charged to cover the fund's operating expenses. The performance fee is a percentage of the fund's profits and is paid to the fund manager for generating returns. Private equity funds usually charge a management fee and a carried interest fee. The management fee is similar to the management fee charged by hedge funds and is used to cover the fund's operating expenses. The carried interest fee is a percentage of the fund's profits and is paid to the fund manager as a performance incentive.Risk and return: Both hedge funds and private equity funds can be risky investments, but the level of risk can vary depending on the specific fund and its investment strategy. Hedge funds tend to be more liquid than private equity funds, meaning they

register with the SEC, but they must disclose certain information to investors.In summary, hedge funds and private equity funds are both alternative investments that are typically only available to accredited investors. Hedge funds use a variety of investment strategies to generate returns, while private equity funds focus on acquiring and managing private companies. Both types of funds can be risky and charge fees, but hedge funds are subject to less regulation than private equity funds.

Flies do not go into hibernation during the winter. Some species of flies do lay eggs before they die, but not all flies follow this pattern.There are many different species of flies, and each one has its own behavior and habits. Some flies, like houseflies and blowflies, are active during the warmer months and lay eggs that hatch into larvae (also known as maggots). The larvae grow and eventually turn into adult flies.During the colder months, many flies will find a warm place to hide, such as a house or a barn. Some flies, like fruit flies and drain flies, may lay eggs that can survive the winter and hatch into new flies when the weather warms up. Other flies, like houseflies and blowflies, may die off during the winter, but their eggs or larvae may survive in a dormant state until the weather warms up.In summary, not all flies go into hibernation during the winter, and different species of flies have different behaviors and habits. Some flies may lay eggs that can survive the winter, while others may hide in a warm place or die off until the weather warms up again.

A term deposit is a type of deposit account that is held at a financial institution for a fixed period of time, during which the deposited funds earn a fixed rate of interest. At the end of the term, the deposited funds, along with the accumulated interest, are returned to the depositor. Term deposits are also known as time deposits or fixed deposits.On the other hand, SBI Bonds are debt securities issued by the State Bank of India (SBI) to raise funds from the public. SBI bonds are issued in the primary market and can be traded in the secondary market.
